budgets; all tracking systems)Gather requirements for standard reports and analysis.Customize standard reporting based on requirements.Develop new reports and analysis.Identify problem fields, room for improvement, and opportunities for driving revenue, GP, and GC.General data analysis to derive strategic decisions.Supporting management in business modeling and budgetingForecastingProvide the business with periodic forecasts in relation to business development, competitor and customer forecasts.Assist in determining future business opportunities & challenges through data analysis.Periodic reporting of forecasts relating to consumer, market and internal trends.Monitoring forecasted business challenges and reporting on these in a timely manner.Develop reporting and insights on competitor and consumer trends.Ensure effective communication to management on forecast insights.Process, Operational Analysis & Project ManagementConducting and coordinating projects – beginning from process and operational analysis, evaluation, modeling, and documentation.Identification of optimization potential in internal and external processes.Liaise with internal stakeholders and management to develop plan for improvement. Ie. the Sales dashboard & associated reporting.Collecting input and best practices from other internal stakeholders (tech, corp dev, sales, or other operational units).Being a business partner.Requirements0-2 (Junior) or 3-5 years (Business Analyst) of professional experience as a data/business analyst with a familiarity with typical ‘tools of the trade’ in analysis and reporting.SQL knowledge - previous experience using SQL in a professional environment is preferredPython essentials is a major plusPrevious Tableau dashboard building is a plusAdvanced Excel and PowerPoint SkillsAn educational background in a quantitative/statistical field.Ambitious self-starter, able to and enjoys working independently and finding creative solutions to complex problemsVery strong numerical and analytical skills coupled with strong attention to detailAbility to communicate well both with infrastructure and data teams, and business teams or management.Fast learner – ability to learn new technologies and business matters.Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skillsFluent English, both spoken and writtenBenefitsCompetitive salaryHealth and wellness initiativesEmployee Share Scheme, meaning all employees have a financial stake in the businessTechnology allowanceTraining allowanceCompany end of quarter training and events three times a year (one global, two regional)4% dollar for dollar 401K matching planPremium health insurance for your whole family including:a choice of four different Aetna health benefits plans, some of which are fully funded by RoktFlexible Spending Account (FSA)Life Insurance + Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D)Long Term Disability CoverageShort Term Disability CoverageCommuter BenefitsCasual dressGenerous paid time off policyStaff awards programGenerous staff referral programJob-related training in-house and allowance for external training applications/contributionsGlobal network which offers opportunity to transfer to other marketsSnacks, coffee and drinksCellular phone usage allowance

Name: Business Analyst
Description: This role sits within the Global Supplier Relations (GSR) Team that manages relationships with core suppliers across distribution technologies, airlines, hotels and ground transportation suppliers. Within GSR, the Distribution team is responsible for managing our distribution partners, Air/Hotel/Ground content and many other strategic initiatives. Business Development and Financial Analysis is a core part of our organization’s success. the Distribution Business Analyst will play an active part in creating financial models, manage and forecast revenues and developing actionable insights that will drive value for our corporate customers, supplier partners and GBT. This role will play a vital role in supporting our various initiatives and negotiations.  We are looking for a candidate who can bring strong capabilities in forecasting, financial modeling and negotiation support. The Distribution Business Analyst will also have a strong interest in understanding key business processes, commercial implications and a passion for continuous innovation in a fast-changing business environment. Distribution, Airlines, ground, hospitality, travel and tourism background will be a plus.  Primary Responsibilities Include: Manage financial models that will support forecasting and negotiation initiativesWork closely with GBT’s finance organization to ensure robust monthly processes are in place for distribution related suppliersDefine Key Performance Indicators for the business and work in collaboration with key organization stakeholders to develop strategy to maximize value to the organization.Develop and present metrics, financials, forecasts to senior leaders of GBT. This will include analysis, actionable insight and risks and opportunitiesCommunicate with stakeholders across global markets to understand revenue and business performance related questions. Support strategic and operational initiatives with a focus on revenue/financial impact.Work with external suppliers on multiple initiatives that will drive value for GBT and our corporate customers Qualifications Include: Financial/Business Analyst with 1-2 year experience, or graduate with a relevant business/analytical degreeAdvanced MS skills (Excel/Access/VBA/PowerPoint) is essentialAdvanced Financial modeling skillsNegotiation, Deal modeling experienceHigh proficiency with structuring strategic analysis using appropriate statistical modeling, research techniques and visual presentations to support points of viewStrong stakeholder engagement skills including communications, time management and prioritization skills (#LI-CS1) LocationUnited States>New Jersey>Jersey CityIt is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds.  GBT Recruitment Privacy Statement

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe Bureau of Strategic Planning at the Department of Citywide Administrative Services (DCAS), Human Capital Line of Service seeks to appoint a Business Analyst.  The Business Analyst will be responsible for evaluating business needs and making recommendations for automated solutions and business process reengineering through business process review and documentation, fit/gap analysis, system configuration, testing, and training. In addition, the Business Analyst will work with staff from the Human Capital Line of Service to streamline and improve civil service processes, and will work closely with IT and Human Capital subject matter experts to understand and implement changes to current operating procedures.  Duties and Responsibilities Evaluate Human Capital Line of Service business needs and suggest recommendations for automated solutions and business process reengineering through business process review and documentation, fit/gap analysis, system configuration, testing, and training.Collaborate with staff from the Human Capital Line of Service to streamline and improve civil service processes, and work closely with Human Capital subject matter experts to understand and implement changes to current operating procedures.Research, create, plan and implement new and innovative initiatives, policies, strategic plans and goals under administrative direction.Prepare confidential and non-confidential materials for executive management to translate agency policies and create programs that align with the Human Capital Line of Service and DCAS’ strategic goals.Define, coordinate, plan and implement bureau, line of service, and agency-wide initiatives. Set goals and milestones for implementation of assigned projects.Participate in confidential and non-confidential conferences and meetings pertaining to the planning and development of strategic projects. Writes up proposals and timelines.Employs computers to track projects and to perform qualitative and quantitative analysis necessary for recommendations and monitoring project performance. Prepares confidential and non-confidential summary reports comparing performance to stated goals and objectives.Develops and maintains cooperative relationships. NOTE: Only permanent Staff Analyst and candidates reachable on the open competitive civil service list are eligible to apply.Minimum Qual Requirements1. A master’s degree from an accredited college or university, accredited by regional, national, professional or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) in economics, finance, accounting, business or public administration, human resources management, management science, operations research, organizational behavior, industrial psychology, statistics, personnel administration, labor relations, psychology, sociology, human resources development, political science, urban studies or a closely related field; or A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university, accredited by regional, national, professional or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) and two years of satisfactory full-time professional experience working in one or a combination of the following areas: working with the budget of a large public or private concern in budget administration, accounting, economic or financial administration, or fiscal or economic research; or in management or methods analysis, operations research, organizational research or program evaluation; or in personnel or public administration, recruitment, position classification, personnel relations, labor relations, employee benefits, staff development, employment program planning/administration, labor market research, economic planning, social services program planning/evaluation or fiscal management; or in a related area.Special Note: To be eligible for placement in Assignment Level II, individuals must have, after meeting the minimum requirements, one additional year of professional experience as described in "2" above.Preferred SkillsThe qualified candidate should possess excellent analytical, problem solving, and communication skills (verbal and written), should be well organized, and be able to quickly develop a working knowledge of the City’s operations. In addition, intermediate to advanced experience with the Microsoft Office suite of applications is essential, including Excel, PowerPoint, Project, and Visio. Business analysis and systems development life cycle (SDLC) experience working on an enterprise wide, large-scale implementation is strongly preferred. Previous Human Resources and PeopleSoft analytical experience is a plus.To ApplyPlease go to www.nyc.gov/jobs or www.nyc.gov/ess for current NYC employees and search for Job ID 374612.  No phone calls, faxes or personal inquiries permitted. Only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.Residency RequirementNew York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Adstream connects the worlds marketing and advertising ecosystem. We  started small in Australia in 2001, and are now the worlds leading ad  workflow, management, and cross-media distribution provider, with 500  employees and offices in 30 countries worldwide.  Adstream is a single, centralised platform for managing and delivering  global creative content in both traditional and new media formats.  Adstream is a global platform that connects the creative process.  Providing access to all content from anywhere in the world, using a single  login. Built specifically for the marketing and advertising industry,  everything on our platform is searchable, reportable and specific to  agency or brand.  The world's greatest brands, agencies, production, and post-production  houses already trust Adstream because no other platform in the world  connects your content to over 40,000 global destinations in over 116  countries.  Role Overview The Business Analyst role provides an important link between the  Adstream Finance team and departments across the business  (predominantly Central Operations, Sales and Strategy).  The role requires a detailed understanding of Key Performance Indicators  across all departments in order to develop insightful Management  Information for the Executive Team, Heads of Business and Central Cost  Centre owners.  Analysts must be able to critically evaluate information gathered from  multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, drill down into the detail of high-level  ideas and summarize low-level information into concise executive  summaries.  The Business Analyst will often act as a problem solver assessing  processes, identifying issues and designing / implementing solutions  accordingly.  During the first 6 months all analysts are expected to learn the finance  processes and systems that underpin the companys core suite of  products.  The Business Analyst will be expected to work closely with the North  America CEO and General Sales Manager to develop a range of value  add analytics and help drive the North America business from both a  revenue and cost perspective, e.g. optimising cloud IT infrastructure /  monitoring client risk levels.  This is a very commercial role with a direct impact on the companys  bottom line performance.  Talented analysts will find they are swiftly exposed to a wide variety of  projects across the business, which have a direct impact on the  companys performance. It is therefore imperative that all  analysis/reporting produced is accurate, timely and well presented.  The position offers a superb platform for professional advancement with  a proven track record of developing talent into senior roles across the  business.  Key  Relationships  External Internal  N/A  Finance team  Heads of Business  Sales team  Operations team  Strategy team  IT team  Responsibilities  • The Business Analyst role provides an important link between the  Adstream Finance team and departments across the business  (predominantly Central Operations, Sales and Strategy). We  operate in a dynamic business environment with responsibilities  changing on a regular basis, but they will typically include the  following:  • Design, build and continuously develop dynamic KPI dashboards  in line with the needs of the Executive Management team.  • Work closely with the US CEO, General Sales Manager and  Account Managers to develop key metrics to support the business  • Liaise with Salesforce Administrator to create Sales Ops related  metrics this will then be used to drive sales meetings globally  • Forecast and analyse daily, weekly and monthly sales data  across all major product types and assist with the annual global  budgeting process  • Actively engage and drive internal projects focused on  developing/improving the data available for Management  Information (e.g. Product and Client hierarchy projects)  • Work with Finance on month end close and ensure all necessary  reports are completed within the deadlines.  • Produce internal, market and competitive analysis for new  business pitches and consultancy projects  Team Work  • Work proactively, positively and collaboratively with employees  and customers at all levels to ensure constructive team working  and problem solving  • Exhibit strong team membership behaviour - i.e. are collaborative,  ethical, respectful, use effective communication skills, proactively  manage conflict to get the right results, use superior influencing  skills, escalate issues appropriately  • Use initiative to proactively resolve key operational issues. Work  constructively across the business to achieve the right outcomes.  Raise concerns appropriately and in a timely manner  • Willingly and proactively share information and knowledge for the  benefit of the business  • Exhibit a strong, positive culture that promotes respectful  behaviour  Requirements Specialist Knowledge/Experience  • Strong Microsoft Office Skills are essential in particular Excel  (e.g. V lookups, Sum If formulas, Pivot Tables etc.) and  PowerPoint. Previous SQL / Microsoft Access database  management knowledge would be advantageous, although this is  not essential and can be taught  • Strong analytical skills are imperative, including a thorough  understanding of how to interpret business requirements and  translate them into effective solutions  • Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills as  well as the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of  executives, managers and subject matter experts  • Must have strong numerical skills and be comfortable  preparing/analysing large amounts of data  • Must also be able/keen to research and mine information to  deliver robust recommendations to the business  • An eye for detail is essential, as is the ability to spot  trends/anomalies  • Experience of designing Management Information dashboards for  KPI reporting (e.g. Balanced Business Scorecard) would be  advantageous  • Experience of using CRM software is desirable, e.g. Salesforce,  but not essential  • Experience of using SAP accounting software is desirable, but not  essential  • A second language is desirable, but not essential  Values Go the Extra Mile  • We proactively demonstrate initiative, innovation and identify  ways to improve and win  • We demonstrate motivation, drive to meet and exceed  expectations and our own standards  • We work in a sustainable way  Customer Focus  • We are committed to understanding our customers and their  success.  One Company, One Team  • Organisational ownership: We own it, commit to it and deliver it  • Collaboration, Communication, Integrity & Honesty: We are open,  respectful honest and transparent and help others to be the same  • We are seen and act as leaders in everything we do

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Title: Technical Analyst Financial Crime  Location: 400 Jefferson Park, Whippany, NJ  About Us  Barclays is a transatlantic consumer, corporate and investment bank offering products and services across personal, corporate and investment banking, credit cards and wealth management, with a strong presence in our two home markets of the UK and the US. Our goal is to become the bank of choice by providing superior services to customers and clients and supporting our stakeholders via a commercially successful business that generates long-term sustainable returns.  About Barclays in the US  Barclays offers corporate and investment banking and credit card services in the US. Our 10,000 US colleagues are located in offices across the country, with headquarters in New York City. In 2017, Barclays announced plans to create a world-class campus in Whippany, New Jersey, for our Technology, Operations and Functional teams in the US. Other principal locations include Delaware, Nevada, Ohio and Maine.  About COO  The Chief Operating Office is responsible for ensuring a resilient and robust operating environment and improving service delivery to the business units through Transaction Cycles, and driving a more commercial mindset across the Group.  About Wholesale - Onboarding / KYC / Fulfillment / Financial Crime Operations  This Transaction Cycle is responsible for establishing a Group-wide consolidated Client Onboarding, Fulfilment, ‘Know Your Client’ (KYC) and Off boarding capability alongside a Group Shared Service for customer screening, Anti Money Laundering (AML) and court orders.  Overall purpose of role  · Work with Business Stakeholders to document the Business/Technical Requirements  · Work in Agile and/or Waterfall Methodology as per the process in the projects assigned  · Perform BA work in Data Transformation for SAM 8 Implementation for AML for Barclays Corporate, Investment Banking and Card Business  · Perform Business/Technical Analysis and coordinate any Transaction Monitoring Enhancements and Optimization  · Work with the Business Stakeholders on the Rules and Case Management requirements and Implementation  · Work with Run-the-Bank (RTB)team on any production issues and production releases  Your Role  · Gather and document Business/technical requirements  · Work on Data Acquisition from upstream systems performing below  o Data Analysis  o Gap Analysis  o Prepare Data specifications  o Perform feed testing  o Coordinate Dev, QA, UAT and Prod files delivery  · Research and design data enrichment & transformation processes  · Write BRD, FRD and mapping documents for ETL.  · Prepare Requirements document for Data Architects to create data objects in databases  · Perform and Support Testing (QA and Functional)  · Perform analysis and implementation of models migration and Optimization  Stakeholder Management and Leadership  · Build and maintain effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders at peer and senior levels by interacting with colleagues at all levels in a peer-like manner, using both formal and informal communications channels to understand their issues, help identify areas and opportunities for improvement;  · Ability to build strong networks and use established relationships to collect, disseminate and analyze information; establish/communicate direction/strategy and secure buy-in for desired objectives;  · Communicate to all stakeholders (including Senior Management) on a timely basis in a clear way to facilitate, coordinate, and arbitrate cross-functional macro level topics with key stakeholders;  · Global mindset & respect of time zones and other cultures;  · Ability to network with different people and groups and develop solid working relationships across diverse teams and geographies.  Decision-making and Problem Solving  · Identifies the key issues in a complex situation, and comes to the heart of the problem quickly;  · Gathers relevant information before making a decision;  · Considers positive and negative impacts of decisions prior to making them;  · Takes decisions with an eye to the impact on others and on the organization;  · Proposes a course of action or makes a recommendation based on all available information;  · Checks assumptions against facts;  · Determines that the actions proposed will satisfy the expressed and underlying needs for the decision  Basic Qualifications/Skills  · 4 year college degree in Computer Science or related subject.  · 3 years of hands-on experience as Business/Technical Analyst in Anti Money Laundering solutions  · 2 years of experience in Data Mapping and Validations  · 1 years of experience working on Actimize products AIS, SAM and RCM.  · 3 years of experience in Financial Institution.  · 2 years in Compliance and Financial Service Industry  · 2 years of experience in MS Office skills (esp. Visio, Excel, Word) and presentation skills (PowerPoint).  Preferred Qualifications/Skills  · Strong experience and knowledge in gathering Business/Technical requirements and documentation  · Research and design data enrichment & transformation processes  · Ability to work on Complex data mapping issues  · Skills for preparation of BRD, FRD and mapping documents for ETL.  · Preparation of Requirement document for Data Architects to create data objects in databases  · Support walkthrough of FRD to developers, coordination of QA, UAT cycles, coordination of production release and notifications.  · Knowledge of Management Information/reporting IT solutions/software  · Demonstrable ability to communicate and build relationships with members of the business and technology communities.  · Strong written and verbal communication skills  · Quick learner; strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to deal with numerous tasks simultaneously and with frequently changing priorities.  · Must be independent and creative in approach to problems and issues; assertive, tenacious, proactive  · Wide range of proven analytical ability  Risk and Control Objective  All Barclays colleagues have to ensure that all activities and duties are carried out in full compliance with regulatory requirements, Enterprise Wide Risk Management Framework and internal Barclays Policies and Policy Standards.  Your Application  To be considered for this role, click on the apply button now.  Barclays Values & Diversity  Dynamic working gives everyone at Barclays the opportunity to integrate professional and personal lives, if you have a need for flexibility then please discuss this with the hiring manager. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are opposed to discrimination on any grounds. It is the policy of Barclays to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, or citizenship status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job: Business Analyst  Location: New York, NY  Capabilities: Process & BA  Additional Locations:  Travel Requirements:  Job Number: JO-1808-9237  AddThisShare | Facebook LinkedIn Google Bookmark Twitter |Email this job CELEBRATE YOUR PERSONALITY AND TEAM SPIRIT.GROW THROUGH YOUR CHOICES.MAKE YOUR MARK.North Highland has a mantra: Unleash Potential Together. For our clients, it means we challenge thinking and build capabilities, so that after each engagement, they are left stronger and inspired to do more. With our colleagues, it means fostering an environment where bringing, shaping, growing and sharing ideas isn’t just encouraged—it’s expected. And within our communities, it means we give of our skills, time and passion to make them more prosperous.At North Highland, Strategy Consulting helps our clients determine where they should go by designing customized strategies to generate in-year returns and drive innovation, while Management Consulting helps our clients determine how to get there with a focus on process design, change management and project prioritization. Our Delivery Consulting enables our clients to get where they are going by executing on key operational PM, BA, Product and Change Management initiatives.Within our firm we have a growing competency called Delivery Consulting. This is the team that makes the motor run for our clients with an emphasis on execution work focused on implementing the critical work the client needs, not meeting sales targets for the firm. North Highland offers a wide range of Delivery Consulting work from a single role-based opportunity to delivering complex initiatives as part of larger team. We offer a competitive compensation model designed centered around earned-hour pay. The measurement of a Delivery Consultant’s work is based on the efficacy of the work-product they provide – it’s that simple – and they are able to create and grow their skills in the fields that interest them most. Delivery Consultants talk less and do more, using their talents – of ingenuity, divergent thinking and relentless determination – to build products and services that speak for themselves.This is a Business Analyst role with responsibility for leading our clients' efforts in implementing multiple IT project initiatives. Job Functions • Work cross-functionally with key business partners to help establish strategic goals and objectives, project objectives, and set expectations on functional scope • Facilitate meetings with project stakeholders to determine project and application requirements • Analyze the organization's business model and define its policies and market approaches • Elicitation of business and user requirements needed to conduct current state analysis • Review user stories, system requirements, business rules, and scenario documentation to verify they meet business requirements • Design business process to articulate functional specifications and standardize the organization's workflows • Analyze systems and understand business rules required for IT project initiatives • Support development of project plans, project implementation, and post-implementation support • Manage stakeholder needs and expectations, and communicate effectively for ongoing project progress visibility • Attend daily scrums to ensure project roadmap is on track and proper organizational alignment is in place • Determine a prioritization of functional scope and work with delivery teams to set Agile sprint plans and release schedules • Responsible for backlog grooming and reporting, defect management, and risk monitoringQualifications • 3+ years of experience in business analysis, system analysis and design, or infrastructure design/development/support • Proven experience in a lead role with the ability to mentor/coach team • Large, enterprise project experience ranging in size from $1million+ • Agile Delivery - user story development and backlog grooming • Experience working with C-Suite and communicating cross-functionally • Highly motivated and driven with ability to think strategically and take on initiatives • Able to work in fast-pace, changing environment • Attention to detail and proven analytical skills • Ability to collaborate with both internal and external partners • Requirements Gathering • Meeting Facilitation • Process Design • VersionOne, Rally, RTC or Jira experience • Bachelor's degree required • CBAP PreferredNorth Highland is a global management consulting firm known for helping clients solve their most complex challenges related to customer experience, performance improvement, technology and digital, and transformation. We add value and support our clients across the full spectrum of consulting, from strategy through delivery. We bring the big ideas, then we make them real. North Highland is an employee-owned firm, headquartered in Atlanta, GA, with more than 3,000 consultants worldwide and 60+ offices around the globe. The firm is a member of Cordence Worldwide (www.cordenceworldwide.com), a global management consulting alliance. For more information, visit northhighland.com and connect with us on LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook.North Highland is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, genetic data, or other legally protected status.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst to work within the application development technology team and interact with business users and business product owners to understand & document requirements, data flows, process flows and to partner with them to facilitate the design of technology solutions and also process improvements where applicable.The candidate will be required to interact with other technology teams within the company to understand, document and interpret complex requirements and to write system specifications.She/he will have responsibility for gathering and analyzing requirements, writing functional and/or technical specifications, and working closely with senior business users to validate prior to application development. In addition, the role will require involvement in an iterative software development model, requiring agility and flexibility on the part of the business analyst to handle requirements changes.The candidate will be required to work with Quality Assurance (QA) teams to ensure they understand requirements and SLA’s and ensure test scripts are effective and cover all aspects of the system.The successful candidate will have strong analytical and problem solving skills, and above-average presentation and communication skills. Excellent verbal and written communication will be essential for effectiveness in this role.The candidate will be responsible for gathering the client servicing requirements for an entire line of business, and therefore must have a thorough understanding of at least one of the following businesses: Prime Brokerage, Futures & Options, OTC Clearing, Custody and Fund Services, or Global Markets Operations.Strong experience as a business analyst in the financial services industry. Strong written and oral communication skills, with ability to demonstrate analytical thinking and problem solving skills. Able to forge productive working relationships with senior business users and business managers. Ability to analyze complex cross functional business processes and define integrated requirements. Ability to facilitate the design of integrated solutions (process, technical & organizational). Can ensure the end to end solution will deliver the required business results. Drives adoption of the designed processes and solution use with stakeholders. Communicates with business SMEs to ensure expectations are kept in line with project status. Drives the definition, testing, training, and implementation of functional requirements. Upon implementation, drives knowledge transfer to Production Support. Creates/revises/executes the following deliverables using industry standard techniques as necessary, including but not limited to: process maps, data flow diagrams, requirements specifications, functional specifications, use case scenarios, acceptance testing. Our Corporate & Investment Bank relies on innovators like you to build and maintain the technology that helps us safely service the world’s important corporations, governments and institutions. You’ll develop solutions for a bank entrusted with holding $18 trillion of assets and $393 billion in deposits. CIB provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk, and extends liquidity in markets spanning over 100 countries around the world.When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world. At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: We are currently seeking a Business Analyst for Robotics Process Automation in Weehawken, NJ. You'll be working in the central Group Operations Robotics Development team, which has a presence in Nashville and Weehawken, NJ - the team is part of the regional Service Delivery Transformation team for Group Operations Americas. The team is responsible for identifying and implementing Robotics Process Automation solutions to support Americas service delivery teams in executing their day to day business more efficiently. Are you passionate about delivering robust and scalable robotic process automation solutions? Do you have a knack for understanding business processes and how the company can optimize and improve through a combination of process re-engineering and technological changes? Do you have a curious nature, and are always interested in finding ways to innovate? We do it by applying our skills, energy, integrity and understanding of both individual needs and market forces to make the right match for all types of positions, including traditional contract assignments, career-changing direct searches, and freelance gigs. For over 30 years we've helped candidates like you make the right move in a wide array of industries and variety of positions

Name: Business Analyst
Description: The Company Integra Partners (Integra) is a leading, tech-enabled, healthcare benefit management company focused on community-based care. The company has grown into a leading healthcare network manager that connects Durable Medical Equipment (DME) and Orthotic and Prosthetic (O&P) providers with health plans and their patients. Leveraging the Integra network gives payers greater administrative efficiency, while patients receive greater choice in health care providers. Providers benefit from improved working capital through faster collection, as well as access to additional payers. We work with providers and health plans to facilitate care for hundreds of thousands of patients each year. We have experienced rapid growth with no slowdown in sight.  Our leadership team is amazing (www.accessintegra.com) with a focus on what really matters to our business every employee, every experience, and every customer. With the right people, success is unbound. This is a truly unique opportunity to take a position with a great company, surrounded by an awesome team.  In 2015, Integras management and Tufts Health Plan of Massachusetts acquired the business. Tufts Health Plan is one of the countrys leading, 5-star, private health plans providing healthcare to individuals and employer groups. Integra now operates as a separate financial investment and subsidiary of Tufts Health Plan with a separate board of directors and governance structure. Integra is an innovative and exciting company, with an entrepreneurial culture focused on teamwork and everyday excellence. Scope and Responsibility We are, by our DNA and nature of our leadership, an analytically minded organization and look to add a highly skilled analytical team member to help us turbocharge our analytical capabilities and thinking. The Business Analyst role will report to the Data and Analytics Director to support the overall development and growth of Integra, playing a key role in our growth and driving our scalability. This role will provide validation and delivery of algorithms, statistical analysis and reporting tools all focused on improving current business process. The role will help drive projects and bring value through operations, including strategic operations analysis, identifying performance trends, interpreting data, and working cross-functionally with other departments. Additionally, the role will be a key driver in identifying opportunities for revenue growth through Sales Analytics. Over the longer term, the successful candidate will support the Data and Analytics leader in building a successful streamlined data organization including playing a key stakeholder role in development of enterprise wide data warehouse and data extraction and visualization software. The person occupying this position will have an exceptionally broad view of every aspect of Integras business and help drive the insights that allow leadership to make informed, thoughtful business decisions. Personal TraitsActively seeks out and supports collaborative thinking and problem-solving with others in the organizationA dynamic team member who regularly brings and seeks new ideas, insights and knowledge, and drives the organization to implement new programs and solutionsProblem solver with an analytical mindset and excellent organizational skills with an eye for detailCreative and conceptual thinker who can play a critical role in business planning while working with executives to develop plans and influence long-term business strategyComfortable working in a fast moving, entrepreneurial environment combined with an ability to roll up their sleeves and comfortably operate with limited administrative supportExperience with the hypothesis-driven approach; equally able to think top down as well as bottom upFantastic anticipation of questions operational leaders will ask when presented with analyses and insights. A player will answer these questions in advance of being asked, accelerating abilities to make decisionsIntensive focus on scalability of the function and the businessKey Responsibilities and Essential FunctionsDetailed knowledge of health care industry, particularly within the DMEPOS space (or a strong desire to learn)Provide analytical support for business in the following areas: operations analysis, sales analysis, payor analytics and reportingPartner with key stakeholders to translate data into analyses and insights that leaders can use to make business decisionsReview data to determine operational impacts and needed actions based on elevated issues, trends, and areas of growth and improvement opportunitiesExtract, model, and reconcile large amounts of data across multiple system platforms and sourcesCapture, process, analyze, and share data that has been pulled from multiple platformsPerform data extraction, aggregation, and quality checks from multiple sources and tables in support of trend identification and root cause analysisFamiliarity with data extraction and visualization tools, SQL, SAS, R, Tableau and/or other data warehouse analytical toolsRequirementsBachelors degree in math, statistics, computer science, or health-related field, with 1-3 years of relevant experience.Strong analytical background in statistics and mathematical optimization, forecasting and simulation.Ability to interact with business leadership and make dynamic presentations.Energetic, motivated with a strong work ethic, eager to take on challenging tasks.Excellent communication skills including experience speaking to both technical and non-technical audiences; ability to bring actionable insights through effective communication.Demonstrated passion for developing and overseeing strategic solution execution.Demonstrated experience identifying solutions using standard analysis techniques such as business process and information modeling, root cause analysis, etc.Refined project management skills and ability to manage multiple projects involving diverse stakeholders across leadership levels.Ability to independently and quickly ramp up on new business and technical concepts.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business AnalystREF#: 31971CBS BUSINESS UNIT: CBS CorporateJOB TYPE: Full-Time StaffJOB SCHEDULE: Full-TimeJOB LOCATION: New York, NYABOUT US:CBS Corporation (NYSE: CBS.A and CBS) is a mass media company that creates and distributes industry-leading content across a variety of platforms to audiences around the world. The Company has businesses with origins that date back to the dawn of the broadcasting age as well as new ventures that operate on the leading edge of media. CBS owns the most-watched television network in the U.S. and one of the worlds largest libraries of entertainment content, making its brand - "the Eye" - one of the most recognized in business. The Companys operations span virtually every field of media and entertainment, including cable, publishing, local TV, film, outdoor advertising, and interactive and socially responsible media. CBSs businesses include CBS Television Network, The CW (a joint venture between CBS Corporation and Warner Bros. Entertainment), Showtime Networks, CBS Sports Network, TVGN (a joint venture between CBS Corporation and Lionsgate), Smithsonian Networks, Simon & Schuster, CBS Television Stations, CBS Television Studios, CBS Global Distribution Group (CBS Studios International and CBS Television Distribution), CBS Interactive, CBS Consumer Products, CBS Home Entertainment, CBS Films and CBS EcoMedia.DESCRIPTION:The Business Analyst will be responsible for defining, analyzing and documenting, user requirements, procedures, problems and leading joint design efforts to offer a new solution or value proposition to customers, automate processing or to improve existing business processes and associated information systems. The Business Analyst will also be responsible for defining the appropriate methodologies and best practices for performing business analysis and design in the support of core organizational functions and business processes.Responsibilities: Solicits client requirements through interviews, workshops and/or existing systems documentation or procedures. Evaluates business requirements for applications and systems integration and service activation, while delivering new or modified software systems enhancements and/or integration solutions. Conducts reviews of and analyzes business and information technology processes and prepares essential groundwork for the development of systems. Participates in the definition, testing, training, implementation and support of system requirements. Identifies customer requirements, develops test schedules, reviews testing plans, tracks and documents the development and results of these plans. Alerts manager to potential risks and issues of importance. Uncovers client requirements via industry standard analysis techniques such as Data Flow and Object Modeling, Case Analysis, Workflow Analysis, and Functional Decomposition Analysis Ensures requirements are understood, agreed to and signed off at the appropriate early stages in a project. Provides analysis of processes and workflows with suggestions for improvement. Identifies areas where technology can lead to increased efficiency and productivity. Understands the functions supported by the current systems. Understand and accommodate the requirement constraints imposed by the current systems. Provides detailed analysis resulting in clear, concise and unambiguous system requirements. Requirements analysis will undergo multiple iterations and refinements. Documents detailed use cases that cover all alternate and exception flows. Supplements use cases with real world scenarios. Provides UI mock-ups. Leads design discussions and identifies design options. Provides user documentation and training for the system. Must be available for on call support nights and weekends. Interacts with others in the business and IT organization. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Telaria (NYSE: TLRA), (formerly Tremor Video), is the leading independent data-driven software platform built to monetize and manage premium video inventory with the greatest speed, control, and transparency, wherever and however audiences are watching.  Telaria is actively seeking a Business Analyst who will use their analytical and business knowledge to ensure all necessary data is shared effectively so that key stakeholders can drive overall spend.  Based in New York City and reporting to the Director, SSP Business Intelligence, the Business Analyst is part of a team delivering actionable information to business stakeholders such as Senior Management, and Sales and Customer Success teams. What You'll be DoingUse analytical and business skills to design dashboards and display actionable insights to stakeholders based on their business needs and requests (Tableau).Interpret data to recognize patterns and analyze trends, drawing business inferences and clearly articulating findings to a target audience.Identify and develop new approaches to business problems.Support a data-driven, fact based approach to Business Intelligence.Develop and maintain effective relationships with business partners.Qualifications1 to 4 years of work experience: prior experience in reporting and data visualization solutions, consulting or business analysis.Expertise in business analysis, data modeling and creative problem-solving skills.Extensive knowledge of Excel and/or Tableau is required.Demonstrated ability to produce high-quality, product-focused, scalable analysis on tight timelines.Knowledge of analytical programming (e.g. SQL, R, Python, VBA) is a plus.Understanding of ad tech and programmatic platforms (SSP business) as well as financial implications to the bottom line is a plus.Master's Degree in Economics, Mathematics, Business or a related field is a plus. At Telaria we place an emphasis and importance on ensuring our total rewards are competitive, aligned with industry and to help you create a productive work/life balance. Benefits are highly subsidized and include medical, company paid dental, vision, employer contributed Health Savings Account, 401k matching, corporate gym discounts, pre-tax health and commuter savings, life insurance, 5 and 10-year Sabbatical programs, Discretionary Time Off (a.k.a. open vacation policy!), Paid Parental Leave, an Employee Referral Program, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), and much more! All this is within a collaborative work environment you can personalize and topped with engaging programs like Micro-Mentorship, and Team Sports.  Telaria values diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: About UsWe are a strategy and innovation consultancy that helps organizations thrive in the face of change. Thorny problems are our strong suit. Were a team of consultants who are energized by big, messy problems. We are strategists, analysts, designers, and editors who bring agility and flexibility to projects focused on stemming chronic disease, closing the skills gap, rethinking the future of work, supporting digital transformations, using data to make smart cities safer, developing sustainable business models, and making moonshot investments.We help companies thrive in the face of change. Our clients are innovation mavericks leaders inside global corporations, nonprofits, and federal agencies who are tasked with helping their organizations adapt to the technological, economic, political, and social norms of the 21st century. Were the strategy and innovation consultants they call when theres no playbook for the problem theyre trying to solve. We have an equal appreciation for strategy and execution. We offer our clients the upfront thinking that goes into careful strategy development, and can become partners in execution to ensure those strategies are implemented. Join us.Be part of a high-performing team and still have a life. Career choices are not binary; you can have a challenging and rewarding career while also living your life. Our clients appreciate that we bring the highest level of excellence to everything we do, and our team appreciates that we are extraordinarily efficient so that you arent expected to be online later.About YouYou are known for quickly ramping up on any subject and for synthesizing large amounts of information to tell a story. You enjoy solving problems, large and small, and think both critically and expansively in doing so. Having worked in or for large organizations, you partner well, knowing the conditions for success to advance decisions. You have experience super-flexing across a range of activities, sometimes outside of your comfort zone. You are passionate about technology and the opportunities it presents to clients.You care about the impact your work has on the world and have been looking for a career path that is both high-performance and high-impact.People love to have you on their team. You love to be part of a team.Role and ResponsibilitiesRealize Client Objectives. Earn the respect and trust of our clients by delivering on their day-to-day needs. Support your team in all client management and deliverables, and help anticipate whats needed next. Maintain client connectivity by supporting proactive and responsive communications required for each project.Own Workstreams. Serve as the lead project manager, owning the workplan and executing critical workstreams.Support Insight Development. Conduct research and analysis to identify connective patterns in people, companies and industries, and develop and share insight and recommendations based on said patterns.Interpret the Data. Build financial models for products, services, and emerging businesses, and conduct quantitative analysis for measuring performance outcomes.Tell the Story. Help develop flawless presentations based on your research and analysis and contribute to the creation of materials for innovation exercises and ideation workshops.Drive Business Growth. Support the development of new business proposals and pitches and deepen value with existing clients. Support company growth by participating in the ongoing recruitment of talent.Desired Skills and Experience2-4 years of experience; client services experience a huge plusDemonstrated work and/or educational experience in synthesizing data, drawing meaningful insights, and providing actionable strategiesExceptional attention to detail - quick to catch internal inconsistencies in documents and strong ability to recall key insights and decisions that impact project thinkingStellar communication skills and a high EQ, with an ability to strike the right tone with clients in e-mails and verbal communicationsPassionate about technology, and the opportunities it presents to our clientsGood technological literacy and ability to quickly learn and navigate the full functionality of tools like Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Dropbox, and Google DocsQuick learner who is eager to absorb feedbackEnjoy solving complex problems using analytic and creative methodsAbility to structure thinking in an easy to follow manorHave a strong record as a high performer in academic, volunteer, or work activities, with noted leadership accomplishmentsStrong numeracy; Excel skills a plusEntrepreneurial mindset, but experience working with corporate clientsAre super-flexible, adaptable, realistic, practical, and agileThrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environmentDoes this sound like you?Please submit your resume and cover letter. In your cover letter, show us three examples of ideas, companies, or teams that you consider to be at the forefront of innovation. Let us know your availability for employment. If available, also send us examples of your own work or thinking online (blog posts, Slideshare examples). Candidates must be authorized to work in the US. No agencies please.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Position Summary In today’s complex business environment, an organization’s adaptability, agility, and ability to manage constant change through innovation can be keys to success. Traditional methods may no longer lead to reaching objectives as economic conditions and the business environment are constantly evolving.  The Business Analyst is a hands-on, detail oriented professional who applies strong analytical skills to support analysis and reporting for marketing, sales and operational performance and trends. You will review and analyze business data and evaluate business systems, processes and user needs. Based upon your analysis you will document marketing, sales and operations requirements, define project scope and objectives and formulate reporting dashboards, tools and systems to advance overall business strategies for IT development.  To be successful you must understand the business requirements, and through a structured process of modeling and analysis, translate your findings into actionable learning.  In this position you must be able to roll up your sleeves and work with large quantities of data. You must have the ability to understand what matters most and prioritize while having the comfort with ambiguity, frequent context-switching in a fast-paced environment. Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal are required as you translate complex concepts into layman’s terms and influence both peers and senior leadership.QualificationsKey ResponsibilitiesDetermine sales, marketing and operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formatsDefine reporting and alerting requirements to advance business strategyValidate resource requirements and develop cost estimate modelsConduct and coordinate marketing, financial, product, operational and related research to support strategic and business planning within the various departments and programsInterpret, evaluate and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-makingPlan and coordinate the development of primary and secondary market research studies in support of strategic planning and specific marketing initiatives, as required and present findings of studies to managementConduct meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings. Effectively communicate your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and managementPrioritize initiatives based on business needs and requirementsSuggest changes to senior management using analytics to support your recommendations. Actively participate in the implementation of approved changesCreate informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvementConduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time sales, marketing and operational issuesMonitor deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projectsRequirements:A bachelor’s degree in business or related field or an MBAA minimum of 5 years’ experience in business analysis or a related fieldExperience working with senior decision makersExceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skillsThe ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutionsCompetency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and OutlookExcellent documentation skillsExperience creating detailed reports and giving presentationsExcellent planning, organizational, and time management skillsA history of leading and supporting successful projectsAbility to impact operations and effect change without being confrontationalDetail oriented and inquisitiveAbility to work independently and with othersExperience with IRI and/or Nielsen data helpful but not requiredCore Skills & Proficiencies:The ability to conduct cost/benefit analysisBusiness case developmentModeling techniques and methodsStrong communication/interpersonal skillsProcess ImprovementBig Picture ThinkingWork Well Under PressureProblem SolvingCritical ThinkingExtremely organized with strong time-management skills

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst Details: Ability to review data from disparate sources, identify commonalities and pull together a single reportable data source for reporting. Then present the summary of this information in a meaningful way via a PowerPoint presentation. Works independently across all IT functions to create, socialize and execute processes to manage data bases to ensure IT management visibility and appropriate analysis is available. Identifies exceptions and highlights impact on decisions. Knows overall IT purpose and how data supports management's needs and decision making. Leverages tools available and creates templates where needed.  BS/BA degree in IT/Management or equivalent work experience.  The resource should have strong written and communication skills. PowerPoint, Excel and Microsoft Word are critical tools for the resource to be an expert in. Data visualization tools such as PowerBi, Tableau, and PivotCharts are a plus.  The individual will be creating communications and working with various C level & IT leaders on messaging for the group. Additionally the resource will be a go to contact for first level support on the configuration and processes around the tools and processes that the group supports.  Experience with Project Management, Agile and related best practices. Knowledge of EA, ITSM, IT Benchmarking, Project Portfolio Management and/or Application Portfolio Management are a plus.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: As a member of the VMO (Vendor Management Office) team, the Business Analyst responsibilities will include driving insights and strategy to support Procurement’s negotiations with Vendor Partners. Tasks include the creation of monthly Vendor scorecards tracking costs, sales, dead net profit, return on space, and creating materials for bi-weekly VMO meetings. Annually, he/she will generate vendor strategy playbooks, evaluate negotiated vendor offers, create funding forecasts, track vendor funding and performance requirements to ensure actuals meet forecasts. The Business Analyst will also develop and maintain a centralized commodity database as well as monitor commodity cost changes and impact. To be considered a candidate an Associate must meet the minimum qualifications of the posting:Bachelor’s degree in Accounting/Finance, Business, Economics, Mathematics or equivalent.Demonstrated analytical, quantitative, and qualitative analysis skills required.Strong statistical and mathematical aptitude, including an understanding of the components of financial analysis and the ability to work accurately with numbers.Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) to manipulate large data set and draw insightsExceptional collaboration, communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills.Solid organizational skills with an above average attention to detail and accuracy.At least 1 year of retail experience, preferably in Merchandising or ProcurementMust have a strong understanding of Retail Pricing, Item Costing, Warehouse Markup, Gross Profit Rate, Gross Profit Dollars, understanding of Vendor funding preferredExperience with Wakefern Procurement systems including Rapid, Ad Management, Microstrategy, Nielsen, Price Plus Insights and Vendor Contract System desirableHighly analytical thinker with the ability to derive insights beyond the “obvious”Ability to produce and present succinct analyses to provide decision support to all levels of ProcurementExperience with development of business requirements for system and report development and design a plusExcellent technical skills in Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint with the ability to rapidly learn new software system required,Demonstrated ability to independently develop new Excel models, charts and graphs as necessary, experience with predictive analytics desiredAbility to multi-task while being flexible and reacting quickly to change.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: This role sits within the Global Supplier Relations (GSR) Team that manages relationships with core suppliers across distribution technologies, airlines, hotels and ground transportation suppliers. Within GSR, the Distribution team is responsible for managing our distribution partners, Air/Hotel/Ground content and many other strategic initiatives. Business Development and Financial Analysis is a core part of our organization’s success. the Distribution Business Analyst will play an active part in creating financial models, manage and forecast revenues and developing actionable insights that will drive value for our corporate customers, supplier partners and GBT. This role will play a vital role in supporting our various initiatives and negotiations.  We are looking for a candidate who can bring strong capabilities in forecasting, financial modeling and negotiation support. The Distribution Business Analyst will also have a strong interest in understanding key business processes, commercial implications and a passion for continuous innovation in a fast-changing business environment. Distribution, Airlines, ground, hospitality, travel and tourism background will be a plus.  Primary Responsibilities Include: Manage financial models that will support forecasting and negotiation initiativesWork closely with GBT’s finance organization to ensure robust monthly processes are in place for distribution related suppliersDefine Key Performance Indicators for the business and work in collaboration with key organization stakeholders to develop strategy to maximize value to the organization.Develop and present metrics, financials, forecasts to senior leaders of GBT. This will include analysis, actionable insight and risks and opportunitiesCommunicate with stakeholders across global markets to understand revenue and business performance related questions. Support strategic and operational initiatives with a focus on revenue/financial impact.Work with external suppliers on multiple initiatives that will drive value for GBT and our corporate customers Qualifications Include: Financial/Business Analyst with 1-2 year experience, or graduate with a relevant business/analytical degreeAdvanced MS skills (Excel/Access/VBA/PowerPoint) is essentialAdvanced Financial modeling skillsNegotiation, Deal modeling experienceHigh proficiency with structuring strategic analysis using appropriate statistical modeling, research techniques and visual presentations to support points of viewStrong stakeholder engagement skills including communications, time management and prioritization skills (#LI-CS1) LocationUnited States>New Jersey>Jersey CityIt is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds. Name: Data Analyst
Description: Company Overview Opus is a global risk and compliance SaaS and data solution provider founded on a simple premise: that faster, better decisions in compliance and risk management give businesses an extraordinary advantage in the marketplace.  Today, the worlds most respected global corporations rely on Opus to free their business from the complexity and uncertainty of managing customer, supplier and third-party risks. By combining the most innovative SaaS platforms with unparalleled data solutions, Opus turns information into action so businesses thrive.  For more information about Opus, please visit www.opus.com. Job Summary As one of the worlds largest aggregators of premium content, Opus helps our clients navigate large sets of vendor and customer data on an ongoing basis. We are looking for an entry level Data Analyst to join our NY based team. This position will manage our offshore resources and is responsible for good communication and data flow between NY and Chennai, IN. Includes travel to IN 1-2 times per year. This position will work under an interim offshore manager during the transition to full-time manager which we anticipate will take 4-6 weeks. Additional duties include detailed level data management tasks, customer service for our data products and data quality assurance. This is an excellent opportunity for an energetic recent graduate. ResponsibilitiesManage offshore BPO operation and assure appropriate resource allocation, QA and documentation/direction for tasks. Includes in person visits.Managing and enhancing Opuss quality assurance processes and providing transparency on data quality and metrics.Developing expertise in entity research by region, entity type and other business segments.Combining detailed level research with data process management to provide the most efficient and cost-effective data collection and data management processes.Responsible for detailed documentation of research methods used by offshore team.Requirements4-year degreeStrong communication & interpersonal skills.*Driven, motivated person* that seeks out additional responsibility and is passionate about productivity improvements.SQL and excel skills a plus - must be willing to learn SQL.Benefits and Perks We have outstanding benefits to include medical/dental/vision along with company-paid life insurance, disability coverage, 401(k) with match, and much more, including a generous PTO schedule! Opus is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job: Business Analyst  Location: New York, NY  Capabilities: Process & BA  Additional Locations:  Travel Requirements:  Job Number: JO-1808-9237  AddThisShare | Facebook LinkedIn Google Bookmark Twitter |Email this job CELEBRATE YOUR PERSONALITY AND TEAM SPIRIT.GROW THROUGH YOUR CHOICES.MAKE YOUR MARK.North Highland has a mantra: Unleash Potential Together. For our clients, it means we challenge thinking and build capabilities, so that after each engagement, they are left stronger and inspired to do more. With our colleagues, it means fostering an environment where bringing, shaping, growing and sharing ideas isn’t just encouraged—it’s expected. And within our communities, it means we give of our skills, time and passion to make them more prosperous.At North Highland, Strategy Consulting helps our clients determine where they should go by designing customized strategies to generate in-year returns and drive innovation, while Management Consulting helps our clients determine how to get there with a focus on process design, change management and project prioritization. Our Delivery Consulting enables our clients to get where they are going by executing on key operational PM, BA, Product and Change Management initiatives.Within our firm we have a growing competency called Delivery Consulting. This is the team that makes the motor run for our clients with an emphasis on execution work focused on implementing the critical work the client needs, not meeting sales targets for the firm. North Highland offers a wide range of Delivery Consulting work from a single role-based opportunity to delivering complex initiatives as part of larger team. We offer a competitive compensation model designed centered around earned-hour pay. The measurement of a Delivery Consultant’s work is based on the efficacy of the work-product they provide – it’s that simple – and they are able to create and grow their skills in the fields that interest them most. Delivery Consultants talk less and do more, using their talents – of ingenuity, divergent thinking and relentless determination – to build products and services that speak for themselves.This is a Business Analyst role with responsibility for leading our clients' efforts in implementing multiple IT project initiatives. Job Functions • Work cross-functionally with key business partners to help establish strategic goals and objectives, project objectives, and set expectations on functional scope • Facilitate meetings with project stakeholders to determine project and application requirements • Analyze the organization's business model and define its policies and market approaches • Elicitation of business and user requirements needed to conduct current state analysis • Review user stories, system requirements, business rules, and scenario documentation to verify they meet business requirements • Design business process to articulate functional specifications and standardize the organization's workflows • Analyze systems and understand business rules required for IT project initiatives • Support development of project plans, project implementation, and post-implementation support • Manage stakeholder needs and expectations, and communicate effectively for ongoing project progress visibility • Attend daily scrums to ensure project roadmap is on track and proper organizational alignment is in place • Determine a prioritization of functional scope and work with delivery teams to set Agile sprint plans and release schedules • Responsible for backlog grooming and reporting, defect management, and risk monitoringQualifications • 3+ years of experience in business analysis, system analysis and design, or infrastructure design/development/support • Proven experience in a lead role with the ability to mentor/coach team • Large, enterprise project experience ranging in size from $1million+ • Agile Delivery - user story development and backlog grooming • Experience working with C-Suite and communicating cross-functionally • Highly motivated and driven with ability to think strategically and take on initiatives • Able to work in fast-pace, changing environment • Attention to detail and proven analytical skills • Ability to collaborate with both internal and external partners • Requirements Gathering • Meeting Facilitation • Process Design • VersionOne, Rally, RTC or Jira experience • Bachelor's degree required • CBAP PreferredNorth Highland is a global management consulting firm known for helping clients solve their most complex challenges related to customer experience, performance improvement, technology and digital, and transformation. We add value and support our clients across the full spectrum of consulting, from strategy through delivery. We bring the big ideas, then we make them real. North Highland is an employee-owned firm, headquartered in Atlanta, GA, with more than 3,000 consultants worldwide and 60+ offices around the globe. The firm is a member of Cordence Worldwide (www.cordenceworldwide.com), a global management consulting alliance. For more information, visit northhighland.com and connect with us on LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook.North Highland is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, genetic data, or other legally protected status.

The high-level responsibilities will be: Building Business Cases, System Requirements, creating Return on Investment proposals and identifying areas of opportunity for efficiency in systems and processes. This requires the ability to take business requirements and turn them into high-level technical requirements.Performing all aspects of User Acceptance Testing (UAT), such as developing test cases, completing User Acceptance Testing, tracking results and working with the IT teams to ensure any defects are addressed before implementation.Clear and timely communication with the management team, business partners and the development or support team members is critical.Development of training material and communication for the end-user.Assisting the end-users during implementation with questions related to new systems or enhancements to the system.Review possible system performance issues to determine if the issue is a training opportunity or a true system issue.Work on projects as assigned by the leadership team.Experience Required:Bachelor’s Degree preferredMust demonstrate the ability to communicate highly complex information clearly for all audiencesMinimum of 3 years’ experience as a business analyst or performing similar functions.Must have strong writing skillsMust be detailed oriented and highly organizedProficient with Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPointPrevious experience with Phone Systems ( Avaya or Seranova), Workforce Management, IVR, Chat, Email, Knowledge Management, Point of Sale, social media and Mobile Applications is a plus. We hire only the best people. Here are the benefits to being top-notch: The opportunity to work with some of the best innovators in the industryGenerous healthcare coverage.401(K) with company match.Paid Time OffPaid parental leaveTuition reimbursementAnnual wellness allowanceProfit Sharing

Name: Business Analyst
