Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionOur client is looking for a Business Analyst to join their New York office. Responsibilities:Complete project life-cycle management launching new PM Teams into productionDesign PM research and trading solutions that adhere to firm standardsEducate PM Teams on the company's operating procedures and technology integrationLead new strategy roll-out projects internally with Technology, Operations, Legal, Compliance and Risk groups, and, externally with Brokers, Exchanges and VendorsProvide day-to-day support for various operational procedures such as broker data management, compliance monitoring, trading, and business continuityRequirements:This is a selective position. The ideal candidates will have a combination of software development and communication skills with some experience working in a financial services organization, specifically with futures and FX.2 years of relevant work experience is a plus.Must have the ability to assist veteran specialists while simultaneously managing multiple long-term and short-term projects independently under very tight project deadlines.Ability to communicate via producing documentation at all levels.Working experience of one of the Linux/Unix scripts. Perl, bash, and etc.Working experience with Linux/Windows Operating Systems and distributed storage solutions preferred. Familiarity with industry standards of server and storage hardware preferred.Working experience with Python.Working experience of either C++, C#, or Java programming.Working experience with SQL. Additional experience with database design is a plus.The trading focuses on systematic trading in liquid instruments (to wit: global equities, futures and FX). Candidates with specific work experience and knowledge of market regulations in these areas will be strongly preferred but not required.Education:A BS in finance, statistics, math, and engineering or computer science is strongly preferred If you would like to be considered for the position of Business Analyst or wish to discuss the role further then please leave your details below. Your resume will be held in confidence until you connect with a member of our team

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Responsibilities  · Closely work with Product Manager for product development  · Take product feature ownership and manage full life cycle of the requirement  · Produce and maintain product backlog and participate in or drive sprint planning where appropriate  · Produce business and use cases where necessary to support product requirements  · Produce high quality business analysis artifacts in a timely manner, including user story, software requirement specification, functional specification  · Collaborate with UX & Visual designers for wireframe and visual assets  · Driving grooming meetings with implementation teams, and play an active role to clarify requirements and decision making to ensure implementation  · Communicate with customer/support and provide customer support where necessary  Requirements  · Must have strong analytical skills and problem solving skills  · Must possess excellent written and interpersonal communication skills and be able to effectively communicate across all levels of the organization  · Experience in requirement management, including requirements gathering, analysis, and specification documentation  · Ability to assume intellectual ownership and possess strong attention to details and commitment to delivering quality product  · Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and synthesize cross-functional input in a team/collaborative environment  · Experience in agile software development and web product design is preferred

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst  We are actively searching for an experienced Business Analyst with a solid background in the Medical/Healthcare Industry. This position will be based out of our offices in Fishkill NY and yes we do offer relocation assistance if needed.  Are you highly skilled at multitasking with a high attention to detail? Successful in being the primary point of contact for Software Development and Product Releases? Capable of presenting information in a highly professional manner even in highly stressful situations? Please make sure that we have your most current resume as well take a couple minutes to complete the skills self assessment. Acts as primary liaison and facilitates communication between vendors, and clients regarding Direct implementations and operations.Monitors the development process for new releases. Tracks development, QA, customer testing, and production progress.Effectively and accurately communicates relevant information to the clients, vendors and technical team. Presents information in a professional and non-threatening manner, especially in high stress situations.Partners with Subject Matter Experts and stakeholders to revise technical records requirements to ensure alignment with specifications.Continuously monitors data quality, integrity and compatibility.Identifies areas for improvement and documents updated workflow and processes.Conducts technical systems analysis to ensure all requirements are being met. Develops and applies auditing procedures. What You Need for this PositionMedical/Healthcare industry experience (familiarity with PHI or HIPAA)Experience with Direct Messaging, HISP, HIE, and EHRTargeted 5 years' experience in health information technology.Two to three years progressively more responsible related work experience necessary in order to gain understanding of application data systems, operations, quality assurance processes and business analysis skillsExperience with client/server architectures and the basic function and process of computers, software applications, and computer technologyMust have experience with application administration and well versed with SDLC.Flexibility and willingness to take on new tasks and challengesMust possess excellent time management and organizational skillsMinimum three years of experience as an IT business analyst.Ability to learn internal business process and translate that information for the development teamsExcellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact effectively with a broad range of internal and external stakeholdersResearch skills to keep current on related technologies and their impact on standards, codes and educational content.Self-motivated with the ability to effectively manage multiple priorities with aggressive timelinesAbility to analyze complex data, interpret results, and write validation reportsExperience working as a team with clients, providing technical expertise and support through compiling documentationProficiency with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio, Project Management Software, and Atlassian (JIRA, and Confluence) What's In It for YouVacation/PTOMedicalDentalVisionRelocation401k So, if you are a Business Analyst with 3+ years of experience, please apply today!Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Name: Business Analyst

Prior BA experience is desired but not must  Call us at 7737706037  Work directly with client customers to provide world-class Application baseload and non-baseload support for multiple utility company applications. Name: Business Analyst
Description: As a member of the VMO (Vendor Management Office) team, the Business Analyst responsibilities will include driving insights and strategy to support Procurement’s negotiations with Vendor Partners. Tasks include the creation of monthly Vendor scorecards tracking costs, sales, dead net profit, return on space, and creating materials for bi-weekly VMO meetings. Annually, he/she will generate vendor strategy playbooks, evaluate negotiated vendor offers, create funding forecasts, track vendor funding and performance requirements to ensure actuals meet forecasts. The Business Analyst will also develop and maintain a centralized commodity database as well as monitor commodity cost changes and impact. To be considered a candidate an Associate must meet the minimum qualifications of the posting:Bachelor’s degree in Accounting/Finance, Business, Economics, Mathematics or equivalent.Demonstrated analytical, quantitative, and qualitative analysis skills required.Strong statistical and mathematical aptitude, including an understanding of the components of financial analysis and the ability to work accurately with numbers.Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) to manipulate large data set and draw insightsExceptional collaboration, communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills.Solid organizational skills with an above average attention to detail and accuracy.At least 1 year of retail experience, preferably in Merchandising or ProcurementMust have a strong understanding of Retail Pricing, Item Costing, Warehouse Markup, Gross Profit Rate, Gross Profit Dollars, understanding of Vendor funding preferredExperience with Wakefern Procurement systems including Rapid, Ad Management, Microstrategy, Nielsen, Price Plus Insights and Vendor Contract System desirableHighly analytical thinker with the ability to derive insights beyond the “obvious”Ability to produce and present succinct analyses to provide decision support to all levels of ProcurementExperience with development of business requirements for system and report development and design a plusExcellent technical skills in Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint with the ability to rapidly learn new software system required,Demonstrated ability to independently develop new Excel models, charts and graphs as necessary, experience with predictive analytics desiredAbility to multi-task while being flexible and reacting quickly to change.

Name: Strategic Business Analyst
Description: Job Description:Our office in New York City is looking for a driven, analytical and ambitious individual with the ability and willingness to learn and implement Bankers Healthcare Group’s business process strategies. You will experience working in a high‐energy environment while continuing to gain extensive knowledge of the financial lending industry. This person will be integral in maintaining the company’s current decision strategies while also identifying areas for improvement in structure and new company initiatives. The ideal candidate brings a strong desire to learn and grow professionally, as well as a willingness to adapt to change and get involved in a number of different areas. It will take strong organizational, communication, and problem solving skills to be successful in this position.Primary Responsibilities: Work closely with business end-users, analytics, operations, and managers to identify and document business requirements for changes to existing and new business initiativesResponsible for creating and maintaining technical documents detailing the company’s workflow and strategyCollect, organize, synthesize, and analyze data; summarize findings; develop conclusions and provide recommendations to improve current business strategiesDesign, build, and implement changes to strategies in company’s decision engineMonitor reports to insure system and strategy accuracyFunction as liaison between information systems group, vendors and other departments, as neededResponsible for active involvement with Quality Assurance teams; defining the QA strategy, test plans and use cases for QA activitiesRequirements:B.S. degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Finance, Economics, Business Administration or another similar quantitative field1 to 2 years of experience in a business analyst or similar roleDemonstrated proficiency in writing and analyzing Business processes & proceduresMust possess a highly logical and analytical mindsetExcellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills; ability to interpret requests and give quality results in a timely mannerProficient in Microsoft Excel (experience in MS SQL Server preferred)A firm understanding of AGILE/SCRUM MethodologyProject Coordination/Management experience is a plus

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Celebrating our legacy of modern fashion, creativity, individuality, and intrigue by providing every guest with an unparalleled customer experience, Barneys is currently seeking a Business Analyst based in our New York, NY corporate office. Responsibilities: • Digital Commerce Business Analyst that will understand our company’s process and effectively communicate with internal business partners.  • Be the Oracle Commerce (ATG) functional expert on 1-2 small to medium eCommerce projects  • Work with our business partners to understand the business requirements and map them into technical functionalities.  • Responsible for gathering, documenting and managing product requirements  • Lead business requirement discussions.  • Gather, evaluate and document business needs and requirements and translate these into functional specifications, user stories, or wireframes  • Ability to communicate complex eCommerce constraints and opportunities to non-technical decision makers  • Participate in the evaluation, recommendation, and selection of software solutions  • Work closely with Project Manager and Engineering Lead on estimating, scheduling, and monitoring user stories in Jira  • Highly developed problem-solving skills, tenacity, drive, proactive, creative, sound planning, and organizational abilities  • Participates in change control processes by providing appropriate documentation.  • Knowledge sharing with the project team to support requirement management efforts.  • Experience with full life-cycle projects from initial scoping through delivery.  • Support the QA process Requirements: • Bachelor’s degree  • 3+ successful years of experience as a Business Analyst or Business consultant for mid-size to large technology implementations.  • Experience with eCommerce platforms; SAP Hybris, Demandware, Magento, Oracle Commerce, IBM commerce, or any comparable commerce platforms  • Excellent presentation skills and ability to engage and manage senior-level client relationships.  • Strong understanding of Agile and Scrum methodologies.  • Interest in digital commerce technology and willing to learn about new technologies, best practices, and 3rd party tools.  Barneys New York offers competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits and a generous discount. Only candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted. Barneys New York is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Business Analyst - Product Team
Description: Business Analyst, Product Management MediaRadar is a cloud-based ad sales information service. We help websites, magazines, television networks, newspapers and agencies dramatically improve ad sales and client management. MediaRadar provides its clients with detailed brand analysis and prospecting reports on over 3 million brands, culling advertising and editorial insights from thousands of media properties. We help to give our more than 1,600 clients a competitive edge by empowering their sales teams to enhance and streamline their sales processes using our unique SaaS platform service.  We are looking for a strong Business Analyst to join our Product team. You’ll be a critical part of our team and the development process, working on the new product features and major initiatives that will help us continue to grow! What You’ll Do:Collaborate on new feature requirements, working with MediaRadar’s product managers and user experience designer, and then translate those business requirements into detailed technical requirements.Conduct quantitative analysis to validate those requirements, and map out the steps required to implement and monitor any new processes.Work directly with developers, our QA team and the product managers during the development and testing process.Help prepare the documentation that we need to effectively train our sales and service teams before features launch.Monitor site performance, including inbound bugs reported by customer-facing teams.RequirementsWho You Are:You have a BA/BS degreeYou have 3+ years of experience as a business analyst, or in a customer-facing role where analysis and/or process improvement is a big part of your job.You're a proactive self-starter who takes initiative and ownership of the projects you work on, and will do what it takes to make them a success.You’re technically savvy and detail oriented. The ideal candidate would have experience building requirements in a data-driven product environment.You have strong problem-solving skills. You’re a whiz with Excel and have enough SQL experience that you could validate and help test data-driven features. You can draw conclusions from your analysis, not just present data.You don’t need to have direct experience in the media or advertising space, but that would be a plus!You’re eager to grow professionally and learn every dayBenefits At MediaRadar, employees are encouraged to have fun and develop strong relationships with their peers. Employees love to spend their free time playing ping-pong and socializing with co-workers in and out of the office, whether at happy hours or volunteer events. Team members also strengthen their bonds at holiday functions and monthly office parties, and they enjoy great perks like Bagel Wednesdays and early release on Fridays during the summer. We also offer fantastic career progression, training and development, and a great benefits package that includes a competitive salary, first-rate health insurance, 401K, and transit discounts. Check out what it's like to work with our awesome team here: http://muse.cm/1Mt0NCg

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst  Power Enterprise is currently looking for 2 senior consultants, prefer c2c or w-2. Need highly professional Senior Business Analyst consultants with experience on business processes supporting product sales for a project with our end client in NJ.  The Business Analyst will be responsible for eliciting and documenting Business, Functional and Non-Functional requirements for the Order to Cash ERP system for a Knowledge & Learning function. These requirements will be used by the technology team to complete systems solution design. The BA will review, analyze and evaluate business user needs and align them with the ERP systems capabilities to identify gaps. Position Summary: Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats  Facilitate requirements discovery sessions  Create Business Requirements Documents  Create Functional and Non-Functional Requirements documents  Construct workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications  Improve systems by studying current practices; designing modifications  Recommend efficiencies by identifying problems; writing improved procedures  Interpret, evaluate and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making Experience/Requirements/Qualifications: BA must have solid communication skills. Interview key stakeholders, Develop use cases, develop documentation to be used for blueprinting.  Candidate must have 10-15 years of experience as a BA  Familiarity with Operations Processes including: Product Management, Pricing, Price Quoting, Order Processing, Inventory Management, Physical and Digital Fulfillment, Receivables, Reporting and Revenue Recognition A PLUS.  Plus to have: Any backoffice system for Quote to Cash (SAP, Oracle, NetSuite, Workday, etc)  Please send resume to cp@powerenterprise.com In subject line please include BA/Your Name/Daytime contact number. Confidential inquires may call direct at 732-409-6700 Ext 206. We will contact qualified candidates immediately.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Who we are At Justworks, you'll enjoy a welcoming and casual environment, great benefits, Diversity + Inclusion and wellness program offerings, company retreats, and the ability to interact with and learn from leaders in the startup community. We work hard and care about our most prized asset - our people.  We're helping businesses get off the ground by enabling them to focus on running their business. We solve HR issues. We're data driven and never stop iterating. If you'd like to work in a supportive, entrepreneurial environment, are interested in building something meaningful and having fun while doing it, we'd love to hear from you. The job Justworks is seeking a seasoned analyst with a passion for numbers and a demonstrated proficiency in manipulating large data sets to join the Business Intelligence (BI) team. This analyst will work closely with the Director of Business Intelligence to dig into the weeds on all the data we collect to build reports and provide actionable insights. This position requires the ability and willingness to work cross functionally with all the other departments (Leadership, Sales, Marketing, Customer Experience, Operations, Product, and Engineering) to improve overall understanding of the business and help solve complex problems as we continue to evolve.What you'll doPerform both regular and ad hoc analyses around key business questionsBuild and maintain reports, models, and dashboards around these key metrics to monitor and improve performanceTranslate complicated analyses into actionable insights across the organizationStrategize data needs of the organization together with the other members of the BI teamProvide analytical support to other departments as neededWho you are2 - 3 years of experience working with SQL and translating complex data questions into meaningful insights for non-technical stakeholdersStrong working knowledge of Excel or another tool for data manipulationComfort with predictive modeling techniquesKnowledge of at least one statistical programming language preferred, with willingness to learn R, Python or RubyBachelor's or Master's degree in quantitative field preferred (eg. Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Economics, Physics)Experience building dashboards in Tableau is a plus Visa sponsorship for this role is currently not available. Diversity at Justworks Justworks' vision is for all identities, backgrounds and expressions to be represented in the workplace. We're building the foundation for long-term success and intend to cultivate a safe, collaborative and inclusive space and company culture.  We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer open to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, Veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

Name: Business Analyst Intern
Description: Common Energy is a leading clean energy provider based in New York. Our team has installed more than 30MW of solar energy across the United States, powering more than 5,000 homes, saving homeowners over $40MM, and preventing more than a billion pounds of carbon emissions. We have developed a new solution that enables anyone to go solar through their utility, without in-home installation. We are looking for talented individuals to join our team!The Role: Business Analyst Intern As a Business Analyst Intern, you will analyze aspects of the solar energy industry that support our business including: Analyzing roofs to determine suitability for solar; Building business and financial models related to solar energy production and economics; Structuring free-from data in a manner that enables efficient analysis and business insights; and Summarizing and presenting your results and conclusions. As such, you will be a key contributor to our companys and clients business decisions.How do I know if this internship is right for me? You are pursuing your bachelors degree in science, business, finance, or renewable energy studies Youre great with data, excel, and have excellent attention to detail You have had at least one relevant previous internship You have permanent authorization to work for any employer in the U.S. without sponsorship You dont mind some Throwback Thursday playlists or fútbol games playing in the officeIf our hiring manager could dream up the perfect Business Analyst Intern he or she would: Be analytically minded Be proficient with Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables, vlookup, etc. Have great communications skills Have some prior programming experience (a plus, not required) Come to work each day ready to make a difference and have fun with our team!Compensation and other good stuff All intern positions are paid Learn from the best! Our tight-knit team has expertise across the solar energy sector You will interact with everyone on the team, including the CEO Opportunity for full-time positions in the summer and/or after graduation Free snacks and meals every day to keep you hummin

Name: Business Analyst

The role will be to identify and solve critical issues the business encounters as it scales through analytical horsepower, communication skills, leadership, and business judgment. You will be working alongside a team of ex-bankers and consultants from top-tier firms such as McKinsey, J.P.Morgan, Credit-Suisse and PWC, and will gain hands-on experience in the different areas of the e-commerce business. This position is also a unique opportunity to work directly with senior executives, some of the most experienced leaders in the industry. Strong performers can expect to be in a managerial position within 12 months, and leading a department within 2-3 years. Your package will include a competitive basic salary for the tech start-up scene. Not to mention a fun team, great working environment, amazing career prospects… and all the big concerts and football games you will be attending!ResponsibilitiesStrategy and analytics:Lead the implementations of solutions to complex problems in order to fuel growthProvide analytical support in evaluating different strategic opportunities and initiatives across supply, logistics and customer careDevelop forecasting models of supply and demand to support business decisions and resource allocationOperations:Proactively identify and implement solutions to improve the efficiency of the internal processesBuild the main business metrics and dashboards to track and assess the performance of different areas across the businessSkills and Attributes:Organized and reliable with attention to detailStrategic thinking and problem-solving skillsOutstanding written and oral communication, including strong “executive presence” and ability to work effectively with senior management and excel modelling and data analysis using SQLEntrepreneurial mind-set with a strong bias towards actionA degree in an analytical field such as Engineering, Economics or Mathematics from an accredited top-tier College or Business SchoolA minimum of an internship (maximum 2 years' experience) in consulting or investment bankingAbout Usviagogo is a global online platform for live sport, music and every country in the world access tickets to their favorite events in the language, currency and on the device of their choice.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: JOB DESCRIPTIONThe Mid-Level BA will be responsible for supporting mid to large projects from initiation to implementation. Under the supervision and partnership of a Senior BA, the primary responsibilities will include: eliciting business requirements from business users and subject matter experts, define and document requirements, write functional specifications, and perform business process design in conjunction with operations teams. Serve as liaison between the internal/external business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs. Lead requirements validation and traceability analysis, manage scope and requirements throughout the project lifecycle, Lead development of common standards and tools, Assist in operational rollout and support, and Translates business requirements into functional specifications for the IT organization. Additional responsibilities will include: Partnering with the stakeholders in defining and documenting the project scope. Gather requirements from the business line users for various systems/processes. Fully document all requirements and solutions. Liaise with internal and external technology partners. Work closely with project management, technology, and operations partners. Support releases, as needed. Support/organize user acceptance testing. Contribute to project status reports for Senior Management. QUALIFICATIONSExperience: The qualified candidate will possess a minimum of 8 years related work experience. Education: Bachelor’s Degree PreferredSkills: Use strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with particular emphasis on the production of clear and detailed written Business Requirements and Functional Specifications. Ability to work independently (self-motivated) and with a distributed team (i.e., physically located in other regions). Must build and maintain strong relationships with business and technology partners Understand and analyze business processes & workflows.Requires understanding of the Financial Services industry and an interest to further develop this knowledge.   THE INTEPROS DIFFERENCE ​​IntePros is a certified woman-owned results-oriented recruiting solutions and staffing company. We are the representative of choice for top professionals because we understand what motivates great people. We take an active role in your career and our concerns are long-term. We have an extensive support system and make the commitment to making the right match between you and a company. We are proud of our retention rate: over 90% of our consultants choose to work again with IntePros.IntePros is founded on the core values of accountability, family, passion, trust and value. IntePros offers all consultants comprehensive medical, dental and vision programs. We also offer direct deposit and a $1,500/year education and professional certification fund. Only qualified individuals being considered will be contacted

Description: Job Role: Jr. Business AnalystLocation: Newark, NJ 07102Duration: 12 Months Contract to permanentOverview:The Business Analyst will work with systems and business personnel to develop business specifications based off of business needs. The business analyst may also develop test plans and test decks.The Junior/Intermediate Analyst in Financial Application Support—Business Integration is a team member in the area within Enterprise Services & Systems responsible for business analysis and project management for financial systems interfaces and extracts. The Business Integration team develops strategies and implements solutions to link the company's business systems to the Corporate financial systems. In addition to developing a functional financial systems expertise, the Associate will participate in projects that develop their understanding of a company's key international and domestic businesses.The ideal candidate would have strong written and oral communication skills, well-developed analytic reasoning and curiosity, and an established track record working in a team-based environment.You will be responsible for supporting business analysis and project management activities as a member of a project team. Experience with process and Actuarial system automation a plusQualifications:1-4 years experience in a business and/or systems analyst roleCollege degree in Accounting, Finance, Business or Management Information Systems preferred but not required – other majors are acceptableExcellent analytical skillsStrong verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work both independently and as part of a teamProficiency with Microsoft desktop ApplicationsAt a minimum, the candidate should have experience with Microsoft Office Word and ExcelExperience with Insurance Industry and/or Actuarial systems and processes is a plusExperience with the Poly Suite of Actuarial Applications is a plus - provided by Dice  Business analyst, Actuarial

Name: Business Analyst / Project Manager
Description: Job Description: The successful candidate will be a member of the Portfolio Sales and Trading business analysis team. Primarily this team is responsible for the High Touch and Portfolio Trading Order and Execution Management platforms globally.  The successful candidate will be responsible for projects within these initiatives throughout the whole project life cycle, including analysis, requirements, design, and delivery of these projects.  The Candidates responsibilities include: Business and System Knowledge: Understand the portfolio trading product with regards to its business processes as well as regulatory requirements (FIX order management, allocation, booking, regulatory requirements, etc). Project Life Cycle Management: Manage the front to back project life cycle, including the following Requirements gathering and documentationRequest management and prioritizationUse Case developmentRelease packaging and schedulingOversight of development and QA progress to deadlines setUser and production support training and release documentationPost-release assistanceGather requirements and develop use cases: Meet with traders, sales traders, compliance and operations to gather and document requirements and use cases. Provide clearly written, concise and meaningful business requirements to the development and QA teams. Production Support Assistance: Assist production support teams with questions and training on a post-release basis. Develop tools for providing value-add information to our users in outage scenarios. User Training: Prepare training materials for various user groups. Set up reviews with users throughout the project life cycle to ensure users are trained on any new functionality.  Required skill sets include: Highly detail oriented and organized: Candidate can perform functions quickly and accurately, with little supervision required. Candidate must be extremely organized and must be able to manage his/her time to meet project deadlines.Strong written communication skills: Candidate must be able to provide the development and QA Teams with clear, concise written business requirements.Ability to understand new business flows and products quickly: Candidate can grasp new products and flows quickly.Ability to prioritize and manage multiple processes: Candidate can manage time sensitive issues, prioritize multiple processes and projects and articulate thought process for decision-making.Analytical and problem-solving capabilities: Candidate should be comfortable digging through logs, databases, and performing hands on testing to understand the application.Technical capabilities: Candidate must be versed in technical concepts be able to understand implementation details, including working knowledge of relational databases.Ability to work with little supervision, yet be part of a team environment: Candidate can progress overall group objectives and deliverables, while still meeting their personal deliverable deadlines. Candidate must be proactive in working with global team members to achieve goals.Communicate effectively with internal clients: Candidate can discuss and resolve issues with both internal and external counterparties using the clients language.Hands on technical supportFIX messaging knowledgeStrong knowledge of front office institutional equity trading from an application standpoint and knowledge of the business flow for post-trade processingAn awareness of the need for standards and quality Preferred but not required skill sets: Market Data experience.Shift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Overview  The Madison Square Garden Company (MSG) is a world leader in live sports and entertainment experiences. The company presents or hosts a broad array of premier events in its diverse collection of iconic venues: New York's Madison Square Garden, The Theater at Madison Square Garden, Radio City Music Hall and Beacon Theatre; the Forum in Inglewood, CA; The Chicago Theatre; and the Wang Theatre in Boston. Other MSG properties include legendary sports franchises: the New York Knicks (NBA), the New York Rangers (NHL) and the New York Liberty (WNBA); two development league teams -- the Westchester Knicks (NBAGL) and the Hartford Wolf Pack (AHL); and one of the leading North American esports organizations, Counter Logic Gaming. In addition, the Company features popular original entertainment productions -- the Christmas Spectacular and New York Spectacular both starring the Radio City Rockettes, and through Boston Calling Events, produces outdoor festivals, including New England's preeminent Boston Calling Music Festival. Also under the MSG umbrella is TAO Group, a world-class hospitality group with globally-recognized entertainment dining and nightlife brands: Tao, Marquee, Lavo, Avenue, The Stanton Social, Beauty & Essex and Vandal. More information is available at www.themadisonsquaregardencompany.com  Role SummaryThe Business Analyst Business Systems works with the Vice President of Business Systems, Director of Development, Project Managers and other IT staff delivering functional business analysis, requirements-gathering and application troubleshooting support services. The Business Analyst Business Systems is responsible for the development of documentation for existing and proposed business processes and functional specifications, as well as the facilitation of joint application design sessions with users and IT staff. The Business Analyst Business Systems will participate in custom software development and integration projects by documenting requirements, creating functional specifications, documenting test plans and managing the software deployment process. The Business Analyst Business Systems is also responsible for troubleshooting moderate to complex system issues and communicating with all levels of application users. Typically, the Business Analyst Business Systems is assigned to one or more business units of small to medium size and the project assignments are small to medium scale, moderately complex, and/or moderately to highly visible. The Business Analyst Business Systems will focus on key functional business areas including document management, media systems, entertainment applications, advertising sales and ticketing. Specific Functions/Activities Summary Prepares business and functional requirements for new systems and for updates to existing systemsResearches and collaborates with other project teams tasked with identifying current and future business needsPerforms business process workflow, analysis and reengineering.Leads and applies department's methodologies to assignmentsDefines processing logic and translates high level business requirements into detailed functional design documentsDevelops and maintains user documentation and instructions for all systems for which he or she is responsibleWorks throughout the development process to ensure that results conform to defined requirementsWorks closely with end users to develop required test dataPerforms system testing of rapidly developed software (front-end and back-end)Development of regression and feature test casesVerifies test results for accuracyCoordinates and facilitates cross application meetings to define business processes and functional requirementsDocuments meeting outcomes through meeting notes and other documents as appropriateAn understanding of Agile project managementMaintains a detailed understanding of assigned business process area(s)Demonstrates ability to understand customer need and perform sound business analysis workDemonstrates good communication skills both written and verbalProvides training on new systems and/or processesApplication support and troubleshooting decisionsVendor management of work and issue resolutionIdentification of appropriate resources and skillsets needed to resolve an issueQualifications3 or more years of experience as a Business Analyst or equivalent experience2 or more years of full life cycle experience with both custom development and packaged application deployment, including experience working within a formal development methodologyExperience supporting revenue and/or financial systems is required.Experience supporting document management systems is requiredExperience supporting consumer facing e-commerce web sites is required.Experience with the software development life cycle is required, preferably Agile and Waterfall methodologiesAbility to Name: Business Systems Analyst 3
Description: Job Description Summary:We are helping rethink how we use data at PayPal to fulfill the needs of our customers (both internal and external). We drive creation of delightful, frictionless and complaint payment experiences while maximizing the value of our data. Join the Data Transformation team at PayPal. In this role you will get an opportunity to define, orchestrate, and enable critical data initiatives across multiple business partners all over PayPal delivering value through the power of data and data driven insights.  We work closely with partners, across numerous business domains, including compliance. Given the high-profile nature of Data Transformation, this role offers regular visibility to senior management and the opportunity to materially impact PayPal’s business. It will also give you broad exposure across PayPal, you will develop a deep understanding of the business from end to end.Job Description:  Work with large, complex data sets. Solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods as needed. Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations.  Build and prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale. Develop comprehensive understanding of PayPal’s data structures and metrics, advocating for changes where needed for both products development and sales activity.  Interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of people and teams. Work closely with engineers to identify opportunities for, design, and assess improvements to google products.  Make business recommendations (e.g. cost-benefit, forecasting, experiment analysis) with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative information.  Subsidiary:PayPalTravel Percent:0Primary Location:New York, New York, United States of AmericaAdditional Locations: We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.Paypal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Description Job Description Under the direction of the Contracts Entity Manager with support as needed, the candidate will serve as a business analyst in the Financial System Group. The Business Analyst will support the Accounting, Budget, and Procurement systems which are under the umbrella of the city's Financial Management System (FMS). The FMS Business Analyst will perform the following activities:  " Analyze and document business requirements  " Author functional specifications. Review functional specifications with business owners for approval. Review functional specifications with technical staff during transition to technical design and coding phases of the project.  " Author technical specifications for interface and conversion software. Review technical specifications with staff during transition to technical design and coding phases of the project.  " Construct additional reports as requested to supplement the pre-defined reporting capabilities of FMS. As needed, work with client report development staff to package and deploy supplemental reports into catalog available to authorized end users.  " Investigate and resolve software issues and defects reported by business users and others. Work with technical analysts to research problems and find and implement solutions.  " Supplement the activities of the client Integrated System Test team as necessary. The analyst will be expected to author test cases, execute tests, and document results.  " Supplement the activities of the end users by coordinating end user acceptance test activities or performing user acceptance testing on their behalf, or both.  " Run simulations of business event processing to ensure that software modifications have not introduced errors into the processes.  " Design, development and deployment of end user materials and application documentation using Captivate  Required Skills: " Expertise using the Captivate product to build embedded Help / usage videos into web based applications  " Deep knowledge of CGI Advantage Vendor Self Service product  " Experience working with Advantage 2.x application (FMS/2 application)  " One or more years of experience serving as a business analyst supporting a major Financial Management ERP application. Education: BA in MIS, Computer Science, or related field from a recognized college or university or equivalent work experience

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionATTENTION: APPLIED MATHEMATICS AND PHYSICS MAJORS We are seeking a Technical Analyst to become an integral part of our team. You will analyze, design, build, maintain and continuously improve the company's core applications and databases. Responsibilities:Perform complex data migration and data interchangeProvide reporting and analysisPromote best practices in data analysis and reportingCollaborate with cross-functional teamsQualifications:MS or above in Applied Mathematics or PhysicsStrong problem solving and critical thinking skillsStrong attention to detail Company DescriptionApplied Underwriters specializes in casualty coverages and innovative business services for employers nationwide. We have the reach and resources to underwrite any insurance risk nationally, no matter how small, large, or complex. Founded in 1994, we have a 20+ year proven record of financial success. Applied Underwriters has consistently produced financial results far superior to any of its competitors. We are a subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway Inc. (NYSE: BRK). Berkshire, through its consolidated operations, has an S&P rating of AA. All of the insurance companies within Applied Underwriters are rated A+ (Superior) by A. M. Best. In fact, Applied Underwriters is the only A+ rated mono-line workers’ compensation writer in existence.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Scope of Work:The Junior/Intermediate Analyst in Financial Application Support-Business Integration is a team member in the area within Enterprise Services & Systems responsible for business analysis and project management for financial systems interfaces and extracts.The Business Integration team develops strategies and implements solutions to link the Company's business systems to the Corporate financial systems.In addition to developing a functional financial systems expertise, the Associate will participate in projects that develop their understanding of key international and domestic businesses.You will have strong written and oral communication skills, well-developed analytic reasoning and curiosity, and an established track record working in a team-based environment.At a minimum, the candidate should have experience with Microsoft Office Word and Excel.ResponsibilitiesYou will be responsible for supporting business analysis and project management activities as a member of a project team.You will learn the methodologies and tools required to assess and document business requirements, write functional specifications for systems development, and design and conduct testing of the technical solutions.The key project that you will expect to support involves Actuarial systems process and run automation for Long Term Care business.Experience with process and Actuarial system automation a plus.Qualifications1-4 years' experience in a business and/or systems analyst roleCollege degree in Accounting, Finance, Business or Management Information Systems preferred but not required - other majors are acceptableExperience with Insurance Industry and/or Actuarial systems and processes is a plusExperience with the Poly Suite of Actuarial Applications is a plusProficiency with writing SQL Queries to perform analysis is a plusExcellent analytical skillsStrong verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work both independently and as part of a teamProficiency with Microsoft desktop ApplicationsPlease submit your resume for consideration. Once submitted, feel free to contact Sanka at 646-856-8903for additional information.Approx. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob Description: This individual will have responsibility for the analysis and support of the University’s implementation of a new student information system (SIS), Workday Student. The Business Analyst will play a key role in Stevens’ planned implementation of Workday Student to replace its current legacy student information system, which will include process analysis, planning, re-engineering, validation and testing as well as assistance with data-related tasks. The Business Analyst will provide technical and analytical skills in recommending the most effective business processes in the implementation of Workday Student for the Division of Enrollment Management and Student Affairs. The Business Analyst will also be responsible for managing the daily operations of the implementation working closely with the Functional Leads in the Offices of Financial Aid and Student Accounts, Information Technology, key functional stakeholders in Academics, Registrar’s Office, Student Accounts and Financial Aid, and the vendor, Workday, on the successful implementation of this project. This individual will be expected to work collaboratively with these constituencies and others throughout the university to analyze processes and functional requirements for the new system as well as managing key tasks to ensure the project stays on track. This role will be 100% dedicated to the new SIS system implementation and will provide functional back-up support on legacy SIS operations. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Performing analyses to identify functional requirements of Workday Student as it relates to current business processesIdentifying issues as they relate to the integration, management, and interoperability of administrative systemsAnalyzing user requirements and procedures to support automated processing and to improve existing business flowsSupporting studies and analyses pertaining to the development of new processes to meet current and projected needs of the universityDocumenting processes and procedures, utilizing both process diagrams and flow charts, as well as user-oriented diagramsCreating and documenting data specifications to assist with data cleansing, validation, migration, and warehousing effortsContributing to the definition of changes in methodologies, system functionalities, reporting capabilities, and practices and organization that would improve the operationsWorking with users, other IT staff members, and vendors to coordinate and schedule application changes; develop impact statements of proposed application system changesDeveloping and supporting functional test procedures for systems implementations and upgradesProviding training for end users prior to go-live as well as continuous training support and communication of new functionality when implemented.Other responsibilities as assigned.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree with a major in Business Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems or other major directly related to the responsibilities of the position requiredPrior experience in higher education strongly preferred, with strong understanding of higher education systems and business processes, specifically student financial aid and student account services.Preferred experience with systems implementations and business and functional requirement documentationsAbility to recognize and implement new opportunities for optimal system utilization and operational efficienciesExcellent interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively with both highly technical and non-technical audiencesStrong self-initiation and the ability to work independently when necessary, while simultaneously being a strong team player and highly collaborativeStrong organizational, prioritization, and time management skillsDemonstrated strong analytical, systems thinking, and problem-solving skillsAbility to flourish in a highly dynamic and fast-paced environment with multiple priorities.DepartmentFinancial AidGeneral Submission Guidelines: In order to be considered a candidate for any job at Stevens, you must submit an online application. Please attach a cover letter and resume with each application. Other requirements for consideration may depend on the job. Still Have Questions? If you have any questions regarding your application, please contact Jobs@Stevens.edu EEO Statement: Stevens Institute of Technology is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Accordingly, Stevens adheres to an employment policy that prohibits discriminatory practices or harassment against candidates or employees based on legally impermissible factor(s) including, but not necessarily limited to, race, color, religion, creed, sex, national origin, nationality, citizenship status, age, ancestry, marital or domestic partnership or civil union status, familial status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, atypical cellular or blood trait, genetic information, pregnancy or pregnancy-related medical conditions, disability, or any protected military or veteran status.  Stevens is building a diverse faculty, staff and student body and strongly encourages applications from female and minority candidates as well as veterans and individuals with disabilities. Stevens is a federal contractor under the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA) and the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as well as other federal statutes. Jeanne Clery Disclosure: In accordance with the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act (Clery Act), the Department of Public Safety is required to publish an annual security report which includes statistics mandated by the Clery Act. You can obtain a copy of this report by accessing the following web site: http://www.stevens.edu/sit/police

padding-right: 15px } }  Fund Investor Login HomeAbout Oz Our Business Careers News Public Investors  New Search  Login Page  Position Description  Global Trade Operations Analyst  Location  New York  Group  Operations  Apply Now Role:The Swap analyst role is responsible for the reconciliation of derivative trading accounts on a daily basis, overseeing all aspects of the accounting and month end operations. The candidate should have a working knowledge of the lifecycles of derivative products. The products include total return swaps, credit default swaps, interest rate swaps, vanilla & exotic options, forwards and futures. This role reports to the Financial Controls Manager in the derivatives group.Responsibilities: Work closely with broker (s) to resolve any trade related breaks across all derivative products.Responsible for covering all settlements for Derivatives for a specific broker (s). This includes but not limited to equity swap unwinds, resets, premiums, coupons, novations, write downs and corporate actions.Responsible for reconciling positions and cash on a daily basis for multiple brokers.Daily interaction with traders, prime brokers, trading desk, confirms, fund accounting and IT to resolve issues.Monitor dividend and corporate action bookings and settlements with broker(s).Provide monthly back up for position reconciliation for audit purposes.Confirm economic details for Options, Variance Swaps, Volatility swaps and IRS products.Maintaining up to date accounts by monitoring swap maturity, strategy transfers, missing terms and any outstanding items.Confirming cash flows with the broker, setting up cash receipts and payables and ensuring timely settlement.Work closely with other team members to improve the efficiency of the group as a wholeQualifications3 - 5 years of related experienceAbility to communicate clearly and effectively with Trading and ManagementPossesses product knowledge with all listed and foreign equity, fixed income products, credit default swaps, equity swaps, interest rate swaps, and OTC securitiesSolid understanding Domestic and International Equity, Fixed Income, Futures, OTC and Derivative Settlement CyclesExperience with Traiana, Advent Geneva, Microsoft Office (excel), Bloomberg,Knowledge of SWIFT, Repo and Bank Debt is a plusDesirable TraitsTeam player with strong problem solving and communication skillsAble to work and prioritize responsibilities in a fast paced environmentDetail oriented Back Share  Apply Now  .footer-careers a, .footer-careers div,.footer-careers h1,.footer-careers img, .footer-careers li, .footer-careers nav, .footer-careers small, .footer-careers span, .footer-careers ul { border: 0 none; Name: Business Analyst
Description: Position Summary The Information Technology (IT) Business Analyst (BA) provides direct support to our client’s IT initiatives by supporting the Project Manager in the development of materials in support of the planning and execution of IT projects. With the guidance of a Project Manager the Business Analyst will actively support all aspects of the ITSM /ITOM Transformation project from start to finish with a particular emphasis on requirements development and participation in project quality activities. The BA will also provide support to Workstream Owners and other key individuals during the project initiation / process design activities. Essential ResponsibilitiesActively support The ITSM / ITOM project from start to finish in accordance with our client’s IT policies and processes, produce clear, detailed project scoping and design documentation to be used by technical specialists to build appropriate solutionsElicit and develop clear, traceable requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and/or workflow analysisCritically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needsDrive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plansCollaborate with developers, architects, subject matter experts, and other IT team members to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needsAttend workshops and document outcomes with regard to process design, workflow creation, documentation requirements, comms plans etc.Assist in the development of business cases, considering financial, resource, and technological constraints; develops cost estimates with consideration to business impacts and risksEnsure that approved requirements are developed in sufficient scope and detail to result in the delivery of a solution that meets customer needs as they perceive them;Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal employees and Business Partners to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts: Functional Requirements; Technical Requirements, include architecture, interfaces, security and business continuity; process maps and other documentation as required.Other duties as assignedMinimum Experience and QualificationsBachelor’s Degree in related field OR High School Diploma/General Education Development (GED) Diploma with (1) one year supporting projects with business user and IT componentsOne (1) year experience providing BA support to projects with business user and IT componentsStrong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, including Outlook, Excel, Word and VisioExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to interact professionally with diverse stakeholders at all levels of the organizationAbility to review, consolidate, communicate and reverse-engineer complex technical and systems documentationExperience in statistical and other quantitative and qualitative analytical methodologies;Must pass a ten (10) year background check and pre-employment drug testMust be legally eligible to work in the country in which the position is locatedPreferred Experience and QualificationsWorking knowledge of industry standards in project management and development methodologies (PMBOK, MSF, SEI, Agile Methods, RUP, etc.)Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP)Working knowledge of ITIL (ITIL V3 foundation an advantage)Knowledge of the ServiceNow platformWorking knowledge of risk management and quality assurance standards and methodologiesExperience in the commercial aviation industries with exposure to supporting IT systems and technologiesDemonstrated analytical and basic project management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirementsStrong interpersonal and demonstrated facilitation skills including the ability to motivate and influence others, and able to foster and contribute to a positive, upbeat team environment;Strong customer service ethic and an understanding of how IT is ultimately delivered to the Customer;High tolerance for working in a dynamic and shifting environment and able to readily embrace and participate in change initiatives;Knowledge of technology fundamentals and concepts including Microsoft technologies Ability to work well with others and complete tasks with minimal supervision;Effective time management and prioritization skills;Equipment:Computer and other office equipment - provided by Dice  Knowledge of the ServiceNow platform, Working knowledge of ITIL (ITIL V3 foundation an advantage)

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Title: Business Analyst  Location: NYC  Minimum 5+ years of business analysis and overall 10 + years experience in IT domain.  Ability to manage and contribute during all phases of requirements engineering process.  Understand the business issues and data challenges of client's organization and ability to propose solution.  Good understanding of business process (re) engineering and decomposition.  Analyze data to develop key insights on business trends and performance and develop ad-hoc analysis and reports based on specific insights and stakeholders input.  Exposures to Mid-market ERP, CRM, eCMS, accounting, work flow applications etc. Expertise in at least one of them is mandatory  Involved in at least one full cycle implementation  Good exposure to various SDLC methodologies like waterfall, agile etc. for application development.  Must be able to work independently and enjoy working at a fast paced environment.  Documentation  Develop RTM based on project charter/ feature list/scope document.  Prepare JAD session agenda and interview questionnaire  Evaluate requirements gathered from multiple sources and to write business requirement and functional specification document.  Document non-functional requirement like expected performance, critical process timeline, and usability, security need.  Review Critical Test Cases and provide feedback to QA team  Strong Requirements Scope Management  Maintain RTM throughout analysis  Manage client expectation for requirement scope  Collaborate with Project Manager for scope creep  Involved in Pre UAT to verify requirement scope before application handover to client for UAT  Client Management  Conduct JAD sessions and interviews  Excellent communication skills should be a go-getter and a team player.  Organized communication and deliverables  Develop relationship with power users  Convince client to use collaboration tool  Identify training needs for adoption of application and work with PM to facilitate training.  Nice To Have  Experience to work with distributed team in different time zone  Understanding of Data Modeling and OOAD  Experience of analysis to migrate legacy application is big plus

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Software Guidance & Assistance, Inc., (SGA), is searching for a Business Analyst for a contract assignment with one of our premier financial services clients in New York, NY. We are looking for a Business Analyst to assist our current project team. Responsibilities : Your main tasks will include performing detailed requirements analysis, documenting processes, and performing some user acceptance testing. Work together with developers to develop wire-frames, user interactions, and user flows Collaborate with development and business/QA teams to test and implement new corrections and improvements Develop customer-focused documentation for software solutions Assess, review, and update business, technical, and functional requirements Proven ability in developing requirements and product specifications for new or existing applications Experience with usability and application performance considerations Required Skills : To succeed in this role you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users. This role will require a fairly solid understanding of technology and the software development lifecycle as well as a basic understanding of support. Preferred Skills : ITIL experience is a plus. SGA is a Certified Women's Business Enterprise (WBE) celebrating over thirty years of service to our national client base for both permanent placement and consulting opportunities. For consulting positions, we offer a variety of benefit options including but not limited to health & dental insurance, paid vacation, timely payment via direct deposit. SGA accepts transfers of H1 sponsorship for most contracting roles. We are unable to sponsor for Right-to-Hire, Fulltime, or Government roles. All parties authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply for all roles. Only those authorized to work for government entities will be considered for government roles. Please inquire about our referral program if you would like to submit a candidate for any of our open or future job opportunities. SGA is an EEO employer. We encourage Veterans to apply. To view all of our available job postings and/or to learn more about SGA please visit us online at www.sgainc.com . - provided by DiceAnalysis, Analyst, Business Analyst, Consulting, Development, HTTP, Inquire, Lifecycle, Project, QA, Testing

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Technical Business Analyst in Secaucus, NJ 07094Interview Logistics: phone then face to face Required Skills Set:Years of Experience: • 8+ years of experience in IT and business/industry work experience Education Required: Bachelors Degree or Equivalent Work Experience Expert understanding of current and emerging information technologies and systemsDemonstrated mastery of requirements gathering in an agile delivery modelProficient in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Project, and VisioExcellent analytical and problem solving skillsEffective verbal and written communication skillsStrong interpersonal, leadership, and negotiation skillsProven ability to gather and manage requirements for large projectsWorking knowledge of JIRA & ConfluenceAdditional Preferred Skills:Knowledge of e-commerce and/or retail systems preferredPrior exposure to highly technical systems as an engineer or systems analystProject Description:Need technical knowledge that enables them to influence technical requirements and decisionsstrong performers who want to be a part of driving the future success of companyHighly retail focused and technical business analyst who can help drive the next generation of management services and the accompanying IT Pro experiences. Ideal candidates will have deep experience building large scalable systems where performance is criticalHelp define annual digital program which includes defined digital quarterly release with a balance of business enhancements and technical upgradesMaintain up to date requirements documentswork with the Technical Team on development work for production issues, enhancements, upgrades, and system implementationsPhysical Environment and Working Conditions: onsite in Secaucus, NJ 5 days a week

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst What You’ ll Do:Define agile requirements, user stories, and scenarios for our development team to move our products forward Take ownership of a selection of products, working with our business and technical leads to manage new features and opportunities Assist QA with the definition of acceptance tests and quality checks Skills You’ ll Need:3 - 5 years of experience developing epics, user stories, and requirements in an agile environment 3 - 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Business Systems Analyst Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously while collaborating with business and technical teams to drive decisions Problem Solver mentality – ability to identify existing/potential issues and provide solutions Results Driven – prioritizing, taking initiative, and taking ownership Technically savvy – understanding of various development languages and databases Excellent written and verbal communication skills Bachelor' s Degree in Business, Computer Science, or Finance Experience with the listed equity financial markets or options is a plus What We Offer:Startup-feel at an established company A collaborative environment where everyone' s input makes a difference Paid time off: Vacation, Personal, Sick days, and Holidays Pre-tax commuter benefits (NJT, MTA, etc.) and 401k plan offered Full medical insurance coverage for employee  #RecruitPS - provided by Dice  Agile, Analyst, Business Analyst, Development, QA
