Name: Business Analyst
Description: Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today's most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It's also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it's no wonder we're consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you're as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.  KPMG is currently seeking a Business Analyst to join our Finance & Accounting organization. Responsibilities:Liaise with Sr. Business Analysts, Business Process Owners, Technology members and third party vendors to identify and document business requirements and processes that contribute to the implementation of technology solutionsCommunicate requirements to technical teams and manage changes and clarifications to the requirementsIdentify and document potential technology solution deficienciesPrepare documentation, presentations, charts, tables and diagramsConduct reviews for scope, business justification, and business requirements including use cases, design documents, prototypes and business rulesQualifications:Minimum of three years of business analysis experience; preferably in a professional services environmentBachelor's degree from an accredited college or university or equivalent work experienceStrong quantitative and analytical, writing and communication skillsAbility to work independently and as part of a teamVisio or Audit experience is a plusUS Citizenship required KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. The attached link contains further information regarding the firm's compliance with federal, state and local recruitment and hiring laws. No phone calls or agencies please.

Name: Technical Consultant
Description: Technical ConsultantUS18001New York, USThe Professional Services division is recruiting a consultant to join its successful and growing organization.  The opportunity affords successful candidates the opportunity to work with SmartStream’s latest products in a client-facing role, and deliver industry-leading solutions to a broad range of clients.  The successful candidate will be responsible for the design, installation, configuration and training necessary to deliver client solutions. As such, the role will involve regular domestic and international travel to be on-site at client locations. Job ResponsibilitiesWork directly with clients to help implement Smartstream SoftwareCustomize dashboards and views based on client business needsDocument client processes and workflows in order to easily migrate existing business processes to SmartStream solutionsKey SkillsExperience in the financial services industry with a focus on reconciliations, middle and back office (trade process management), exception management, fails management and reference data management for broker/dealers, custodians or investment managersBackground of working in both SDLC and Agile environmentsExcellent verbal and written EnglishAbility to present and interact with senior management at client locationsDesirable SkillsThe ability to speak, read and write in Spanish to a fluent level would be considered advantageousQualifications and ExperienceBSc GraduateMinimum 7 years of IT experience3+ years of experience in architecture and designBenefitsCompetitive salaryCompany pension scheme matching up to 5% of salaryPrivate medical insuranceDental and vision coverageLife assuranceShort-term and long-term disability coverageApply Now!

Name: Technology Business Management Analyst
Description: The Technology  Business Analyst role is an exciting opportunity for an applicant with a strong  foundation in financial analysis and reporting to move into an influential  position where they will gain exposure to  and work in, an operational and financial role serving the Hearst  Corporation’s Technology Division.  Reporting to  the Director of Technology Business Management, this role is central to the  division’s financial governance and provides a platform in which to partner  with the technology department heads and the broader Hearst businesses.  The Technology Business Analyst will support day-to-day business activities  that complement and enhance the business strategy, goals and objectives of  Hearst Technology. Duties will include:Configure  and maintain the IT financial management platform (Apptio) to support the TBM office processes:IT service  chargeback for Hearst business units and Hearst Technology senior management  (monthly report)Internal  service recovery for Hearst Technology senior management (quarterly report)Work closely  with technology, finance, and business teams to identify and facilitate ongoing  cost model maintenance and data quality improvementSupport  administrative set-up and management of the Apptio platformPerform data  loads and exportsDesign and maintain  cost models and TBM reportsServe as a single  point of contact and product owner for the Apptio platform:Utilize  available insights for analysisDemonstrate knowledge  of the underlying data, where it comes from, and the ability to reconcile and  check data quality, including financial and consumption recordsInteract,  respond and reconcile service charges with the broader Hearst businesses’  Technology and Finance LeadsPrepare  monthly variance analyses of actual results for Hearst Technology senior  management including budgeting, forecasting, and recommendations for  remediation where neededWork with  the Asset Management team to validate and reconcile differences in Hearst’s asset  reporting platform and technology consumption dataCollect  requirements around cost modeling and reporting with business and technology  partners and execute changes in the Apptio platformDrive  discussions with data owners and technology partners for data quality  improvement and data load automationAdditional responsibilities  include:Apply  industry standards from the Technology Business Management Council around IT  cost analysis, modeling, and reporting at HearstPerform ROI  analysis and present business cases on technology projects and related Hearst ventures  (including acquisitions and divestments) where technology is involvedWork closely  with Department Heads to understand business needs and requirements and assist  in the development of new services and pricing modelsSupport the  preparation of Global Technology’s monthly performance metrics, and presentation  materials for the Global Technology Leadership TeamDesired  Skills and ExperienceMinimum of a  Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Technology or other closely related  business discipline.Proven  experience administrating Apptio or similar IT Financial Management platform –  Apptio certification is a plus but can be provided as part of the onboarding  processKnowledge of  overall business strategy and operations including business processes, cost  components and drivers of these measures, cost modeling as well as an understanding  of accounting principlesExperience  and demonstrated success serving as an effective business partner in a client  service oriented environment dealing with a wide range of business units and departmentsAbility to  anticipate risks, make adjustments and inform appropriatelyExcellent  listening and communication skills, ability to deliver clear well-organized  presentations and written correspondenceExcellent  personal time management to coordinate several projects simultaneouslyWorking  knowledge of Cognos, Oracle ERP, CloudHealth, ServiceNow and Hyperion, a plusAbout Hearst Hearst is  one of the nation’s largest diversified media, information and services  companies with more than 360 businesses. Its major interests include ownership  in cable television networks such as A&E, HISTORY, Lifetime and ESPN;  majority ownership of global ratings agency Fitch Group; Hearst Health, a group  of medical information and services businesses; 30 television stations such as  WCVB-TV in Boston and KCRA-TV in Sacramento, Calif., which reach a combined 19  percent of U.S. viewers; newspapers such as the Houston Chronicle, San  Francisco Chronicle and Albany Times Union; more than 300 magazines around the  world including Cosmopolitan, ELLE, Harper’s BAZAAR and Car and Driver; digital  services businesses such as iCrossing and KUBRA; and investments in emerging  digital and video companies such as Complex, BuzzFeed, VICE and AwesomenessTV.  Follow us on Twitter @HearstCorp and subscribe to Hearstlink. About Hearst  Technology Hearst Technology, Inc. is a shared services technology provider for Hearst,  operating within the TBM (Technology Business Management) framework and  principles. We work to develop platforms  and solutions to power the next phase of Hearst’s digital growth, technology  product development, and to solidify it as a leader in the industry. Hearst Technology  continues to push the boundaries of how technology can propel the company  forward. Lead by Hearst CTO Phil Wiser, the Hearst Technology team ideates  daily on groundbreaking ways to expand the connection between Hearst’s 300-plus  companies and the growing audiences and clients they serve. Hearst Technology’s  team is leading the digital media industry with the following initiatives:  Hearst Audience Platform - Building a holistic audience approach across all of  Hearst's digital properties and audience of 220M monthly unique visitors;  Enterprise Technology - Implementing high-performing, cloud-based IT solutions;  Video - Getting to 1B annual video views; Native & Emerging Technology Team Accelerating high-growth, multi-screen digital media offerings; Hearst Data Warehouse - Leveraging Hearst's Big Data brain; and Hearst Machine Learning –  developing new product offerings in the area of Artificial Intelligence. Follow us on Twitter @HearstTech.

Name: BI (Business Intelligence) Analyst
Description: At GoReadyMade, we are building the next Food Tech unicorn. We're offering a career kick-start for entrepreneurial minded, data driven Business Intelligence professionals.  Backed by a major global food tech company, we’re a fast growing startup based in NY. GoReadyMade offers ready to cook, fresh & healthy meals in a convenient weekly subscription model. We ship directly from our production kitchen in NJ to our customers’ homes. What will you do?Manage, control and process all kinds of dataFurnish data and reports to management and all teams in the company, ensuring consistency and accuracyAutomate data transfer between different tools and databases, DWHBe proactive in constantly proposing innovation in data gathering, processing and presentationPlay a leading role in evangelizing a data-driven culture in the companyRequirementsWhat you will have?5+ years of experience in BI, data analyticsStrong knowledge of SQL, Tableau, PythonExperience with AWS (lambda) a plusAttention to detail is keyAble to work under time constraints and changing targetsBenefits We offer Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k), Paid Time Off (PTO) and Holiday Pay. Our team is diverse, high-performing and international, helping us to create a truly inspiring, entrepreneurial work environment in which you can thrive!  It is the policy of GoReadyMade not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because he or she is a protected veteran.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Analyzing advertising sales data to produce insights that support the sales teams efforts  Monitoring the performance of the network portfolio and developing performance metrics  Creating and maintaining dashboards to visualize sales data  Conducting revenue impact assessments to support client decision making  Managing and validating large data sets of sales information  Preparing complex reports and gathering data to make informed conclusions on business practices  Working to improve operational inefficiencies and streamline the operations process  Special projects as needed  Background: Statistics, Economics, Accounting, Mathematics, and/or Finance  Recommended: Salesforce CRM, Tableau, and SQL  Proficiency using Excel (VLOOKUPs, indexing, pivot tables, aggregation worksheet and data sorting functions) and ETL tools  Job Type: Full-time

Name: Commercial Loan Portfolio Analyst
Description: The Commercial Loan Portfolio Analyst willanalyze financial information and credit reports to evaluate degree of risk for business loans and line to prepare recommendations for the Business Loan Committee. This individual will be well-versed, and possess extensive knowledge of analyzing credit data and financial statements of individuals or firms to determine the degree of risk involved in extending credit or lending money. A strong understanding of loan processing including sales/origination, processing, underwriting, pre-closing, and post-closing procedures will increase effectiveness. The incumbent must demonstrate solid industry knowledge, and familiarity with state and federal regulations to ensure regulatory compliance. While possessing knowledge relative to the entire operation, the Analyst will be expected to continually work with and coordinate the efforts of the Commercial Loan Underwriters, Business Services Specialist Business Loan Closer and Servicer and Business Loan Officers to develop their skillsets, and proficiency to ensure they deliver outstanding member service. He/She will be expected to introduce operational innovations and efficiencies, andprepare reports with credit information for use in decision making for the commercial pipeline on an ongoing basis. The individual should be able to make sound credit decisions using experience and judgment and an acquired knowledge of commercial lending and NCUA small business guidelines. These decisions should not create financial hardship for NEFCU. JOB DESCRIPTION: Conducts site visits to each borrower at least once a year.  Maintains borrower contact via site visits, telephone& email to ensure high level of rapport and personal  involvement with each borrower.  Performs written annual reviews of borrower performance. JOB SPECIFICATIONS: College degree preferred with a minimum of four (4) years of experience in banking, 2 of which have been in a related credit position. Individual must function with minimum supervision, have a positive attitude, and impart a team player mentality. Have excellent organizational and time management skills and excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must be able to handle multiple projects and tasks and meet deadlines. The incumbent should be detail oriented, have an aptitude for figures and function with minimum supervision. A pipeline as well as marketplace contacts and COI’s are desired. Individual must have reliable method of transportation in order to perform sites visits to all businesses.Proficient in math and calculations related to lending. Well versed in Microsoft Word and Excel. Detail oriented, excellent analytical skills, aptitude for figures, excellent communication skills (verbal and written) and computer/Internet savvy. Appraisal experience a plus.

Name: Transfer Pricing Analyst
Description: Transfer Pricing Analyst responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Work with transfer pricing team performing detailed accounting, financial, and economic analyses showing an understanding of transfer pricing concepts and method application to cases.Work on full-cycle client engagements from the planning to executing, and completing transfer pricing assignments.Evaluate intercompany transfers of tangible goods, intangible property, services, and loans and conduct financial and economic analyses of multinational and domestic corporations, industry and market research, economic valuations, comparative financial benchmarking, and report documentationQualifications:BA Degree – Accounting, Finance, Business, Economics or related fieldKnowledge in several of the following areas: valuations,strategy evaluation,quantitative and competitive analysis,statistical sampling and econometrics,financial statement analysis, and/oroperational performance analysisStrong analytical and accounting skills.Foreign language skills a plusCompensation:$90K - $100K (commensurate with experience and skills)Benefits package

Name: Analyst/Associate, Corporate Development
Description: Loews Corporation Loews Corporation is one of the largest diversified companies in the United States, with businesses in the insurance, energy, hospitality and packaging industries. Our subsidiaries are: CNA Financial (NYSE: CNA), Diamond Offshore (NYSE: DO), Boardwalk Pipeline, Loews Hotels and Consolidated Container. Loews is focused on long-term value creation for its shareholders, and conservative financial management. Corporate Development As a Corporate Development Analyst/Associate you will work closely with senior management across the enterprise on projects relating to corporate strategy, corporate finance, acquisitions & divestitures, and other special projects. You’ll work within a close-knit team to develop growth strategies, support acquisitions, evaluate capital projects, analyze financial performance, and working on equity and debt financings.  Additionally, you will be involved in: External corporate developmentSupporting senior management in sourcing and evaluating new acquisition opportunities for LoewsPerforming strategic and quantitative analyses, conduct due diligence and determine appropriate company and/or project valuationIndependently executing primary and secondary research on markets, industries and companiesExecuting transactionsInternal corporate developmentMonitoring and analyzing operating performance of subsidiariesWorking with subsidiary management to support M&A and financing activitiesWorking with subsidiary management on major strategic decisionsStrategic & financial planningProviding financial planning & analysis support to the CFOParticipating in budgeting and forecasting process for Loews and each of its subsidiariesSupporting annual strategic review processSupporting other special projects for senior management, such as enterprise risk management, rating agency presentations, etc. To be considered, you’ll need: Undergraduate degree from top-tier university1-3 years of transactional experience at an investment bank/private equity firm/hedge fund Additionally, you should have practical experience with a track record that demonstrates: Excellent quantitative and analytical problem-solving skills; financial modeling expertiseOutstanding presentation skills with the ability to translate complex concepts to easily understandable presentationsAbility to take initiative, support strategic priorities, take ownership of assigned projects and independently drive for resultsExperience in developing relationships; ability to develop credibility and respect with individuals at all organizational levelsFinancial markets experience is a plus Loews Corporation is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse work culture. M/F/D/V

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: The Business Systems Analyst (BSA) team within Digital Technology plays a pivotal role in the success of the organization, bridging the gap between the development, design and product management teams. The Business Systems Analyst (BSA) is the face of the BSA team, working closely with our business and technology partners to produce meaningful stories for our development teams to execute. The BSA is a relationship builder, negotiator and a problem solver.The BSA typically (but is not limited to) performs the following:Translates requirements into meaningful stories that the scrum team(s) can deliver against.Work with developers, user experience designers, subject matter experts, legal and compliance teams to obtain a well-rounded understanding of what is being asked for and our ability to deliver it within the constraints of our banking environment.Assesses potential impacts and changes to our core UI, middleware services and frameworks.Maintain a living evergreen repository so that we always have an understanding of our current state.Juggle multiple projects and initiatives at any given time, all with aggressive delivery expectations.QualificationsStrong hands-on experience as a Business Systems Analyst, Systems Analyst, Technical Analyst or a related discipline with an emphasis on delivering cutting edge technology within finance.Proven strong analytical and problem solving skills.Superior verbal and written communication and negotiation skills with the ability to forge lasting relationships at all levels of seniority.Experience working in an Agile environment.SOAP, XML, JSON and other similar web service protocols/technologies.Bachelor’s Degree within a technical field.Preferred Knowledge and ExperienceRetail/Consumer banking and investment products.Web service and database technologies.Appreciation of responsive web design.Appreciation of web service design.Behavioral Driven Development (BDD).Experience of working with JIRA.Experience of working with Requirements gathering tools, like Blueprint.Our Consumer & Community Banking Group depends on innovators like you to serve nearly 66 million consumers and over 4 million small businesses, municipalities and non-profits. You’ll support the delivery of award winning tools and services that cover everything from personal and small business banking as well as lending, mortgages, credit cards, payments, auto finance and investment advice. This group is also focused on developing and delivering cutting edged mobile applications, digital experiences and next generation banking technology solutions to better serve our clients and customers.When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Company, you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.At JPMorgan Chase & Company we value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you're looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies around the world, we want to meet you.

Name: Web Analytics Analyst
Description: WHAT WE DO MATTERS: Here at XO Group, we truly believe in doing work that matters. Through our family of brandsThe Knot, The Nest, The Bump, GigMasters, and How He Askedwe inspire, inform, and cheer on our community as they move through life's most amazing milestones. From the proposal, to creating a home and starting a family together, we're there for every step of the journey. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we. ABOUT THE WEB ANALYTICS ANALYST ROLE AND OUR TEAM: We are looking for a Web Analytics Analyst to help us plan more personalized and fun weddings in less timeas well as reimagine how people propose, navigate a pregnancy and raise healthy babies. The Analyst will identify insights and trends in our data, enabling us to build products that better address a couple's needs during life's most important moments. Given the unique perspective of working across products and brands, this role is positioned to influence decision making by providing thoughtful analytical insights.  This position in the Business Intelligence & Digital Analytics department sits at the intersection of User Experience, Product Analytics and Data Intelligence. The Analyst is closely aligned to the Product organization, contributing to the practice of analytics-based decision making, driving the selection and adoption of new tools, and educating the Product and Design teams on their use. The position also works in close collaboration with the Data Intelligence team to identify and cleanly capture the data required for our algorithms.  The Web Analytics Analyst will have the opportunity to expand his/her understanding of product development through participation in XO Group's Product School and by working alongside our prestigious product community. It is a great chance to grow as an analytics professional. RESPONSIBILITIES:Supporting the production and distribution of web analytics including:Automated dashboards & reportsAd hoc analysis as necessary to aid the Product organization in the analysis of web-based productsMaintaining the digital tracking infrastructure, including compiling and reviewing data requirements for the collection of web analytics and event data, and evaluating the product analytics landscape for new tools as they emergeEducating and training the Product organization in the practice of Product Analytics and the accompanying toolsetProactively identifying notable changes in patterns and trends across all products and brandsHelping to "clean up" and centralize data for consumption by multiple stakeholdersTOOLS & TECHNOLOGIES:Google Analytics, Google Tag ManagerA/B testingExperience collecting and leveraging user event data for analysis (e.g. Segment, keen.io, MixPanel)Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Birst, Mode, Tableau, chart.io, d3)Basic SQL querying skillsANALYTICAL SKILLS:Must have excellent problem-solving skills with a knack for recognizing trends/patterns in large data setsMust be comfortable drawing key insights from data and communicating/presenting these findings to stakeholders and decision makersMust have excellent troubleshooting skillsMust be able to identify and communicate effectively with product and engineering teamsAbility to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment juggling multiple projects and responding quickly to changing prioritiesAbility to manage multiple projects concurrently with a sense of urgency regarding completion of assignmentsStrong attention to detail and deadlinesSelf-motivated, creative, innovative, highly organized, able to multi-task, and keen to work in a collaborative environmentWHAT WE LOVE ABOUT YOU:You love our users. You deeply understand our users and put them at the center of everything you do. You aim to serve and delight them every day.You do the right thing. You are respectful and act with the highest integrity. If you see something that isn't right, you say something.You debate it. You ask questions to understand a perspective and are comfortable respectfully challenging assumptions. You are not turned off by constructive conflict to get to the right answer.You own your outcomes. You set clear ambitious goals. You anticipate obstacles, persevere, and are accountable for your commitments.You make fast decisions. You are an effective and timely communicator. You understand how to collaborate, compromise, and escalate when needed.You get better every day. You welcome the gift of feedback. You never settle in your quest to grow and develop. By being here, you make our company stronger.WHAT YOU LOVE ABOUT US: You'll hear a lot about culture and perks from other companies, but we like to think of it as the XO way of life. From unlimited vacation and generous parental leave benefits, to free snacks and Thirsty Thursdays, we believe in happiness above all elsein and out of the office.

Name: Junior Business Analyst
Description: Key responsibilities may include:Identifying business/functional requirements by working with key client personnel or end-usersEvaluating software applications/IT environments, analyzing gaps between current/desired statesDesigning and executing use & test cases for custom application development projectsDiscovering and documenting business and IT processes, workflows and requirementsInterfacing with other functional and technical groups within the organizationPreferred SkillsStrong knowledge in the area of requirements definition and software development lifecycle methodologySignificant experience with Word, Excel, MS Project, PowerPoint, SQL and VisioStrong writing, problem solving, communication and client-facing skillsMaster's Degree related to Information Technology

Name: Business Analyst/Project Manager
Description: Required Skills: -Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written -Self- motivated individual that will dig deep to uncover facts and not rely on assumptions or hearsay -Ability to manage requirements and definition of the overall platform, keeping focus on technical requirements for users to be able to successfully use and navigate through the platform on their day to day activities. -Liaison between Business Users and Technical team in analysis & design -Well defined and structured individual who can document, track and work on Functional, Data requirements seamlessly with minimum supervision -Identifies opportunities for improving business processes through information systems -Plans, organizes and conduct walk through with Business Units and Technical team for common understanding across teams of requirements and sign off -Provides technical assistance to peers, mentoring where ever applicable -Participates in User Acceptance Testing and Deployment Furthermore, this position will work with the PMs and business/data analysts in the team and work with other platform teams, driving issue analysis & resolution, educating peers, and drive the project throughout the SDLC process until execution. This job can also call for the position to be able to lead the team (as PM) on situations where project management is required and heeds the flexibility of the person to operate on dual role capacity.The candidate should be flexible, highly adaptable and excellent team player. The candidate should expect to work in a global virtual team along with NY and India team members, sometimes across multiple time zones. The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated team player committed to delivering on time and should be able to work under minimal supervision.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: ESSENTIAL POSITION RESULTS •Prepares materials for supplier planning meetings by aggregating and reviewing Focus Marketing data, internal sales data, spend data, important demographic and socioeconomic developments and pricing and category trends. Attends and contributes to meetings as appropriate by providing any commentary on analyses or pulling relevant data during the meeting as necessary. •Evaluates the potential impact of pricing modifications or prospective programming elements by reviewing pertinent sales data, research and comparable examples to forecast sales. •Uncovers market and brand opportunities by developing an understanding of category, customer and market dynamics and using this knowledge to assess brand performance. •Measures risk to sales plan (gap analysis) by comparing the plan to historical sales data, current trend information and marketplace developments; reports potential shortfalls to management. •Develops sales templates; collaborates with Business Managers, Division Manager or General Sales Manager to identify business needs and designs appropriate, replicable reports. Trains administrative staff on process to recreate/run templates. •Package data for sales materials by working with Business Manager/Marketing Director to ascertain needed information and converting data into concise facts and visuals that can be easily incorporated into sell sheets, concept sells or presentations. •Uncovers drivers for important changes in sales performance by reviewing appropriate competitive and internal data.  •Measures ROI on selected programming by working with Business Managers and Marketing Director to determine evaluation criteria. •Develops business review content by working with the Supplier, Business Manager and Sales Management to analyze sales performance, develop business case, and incorporate data into templates. •Completes all necessary training programs by attending, participating, and passing all required tests as defined by management. (e.g. FOCUS MARKETING, ANALYTICAL TRAINING). •Maintains customer and supplier confidence by keeping appropriate information confidential.  •Maintains a safe and clean working environment by complying with procedures, rules and regulations. •Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSEducation, Certifications and /or licenses: High School diploma or equivalent required. •Bachelor’s degree preferred and/or equivalent training and work experience •Ability to hold a Solicitor’s Permit where required. •Valid driver’s license and ability to operate a motor vehicle preferred.Experience: •Financial, marketing or business analysis experience; consumer packaged goods or data provider (e.g. IRI, Nielsen) background a plus. Knowledge/Skills: •Highly fluent in Excel and relational database programs. Strong knowledge of Power Point. •Must be a results oriented professional with excellent verbal/written communication skills using diplomacy and discretion as well as strong customer service skills.  •Ability to multi-task, work independently and/or within a team, pay attention to detail and meet deadlines.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Job Description:Job Title: Innovations – Tax Business Analyst Employer: Blackstone Firm Profile: Blackstone is one of the world’s leading investment firms. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our asset management businesses, with over $450 billion in assets under management, include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow Blackstone on Twitter @Blackstone. Business Unit: Blackstone Innovations (BXi) Blackstone Innovations Overview: Blackstone Innovations (BXi) is the technology team at the core of each of Blackstone’s businesses and new growth initiatives. Serving both internal and external clients, we work to build the next generation of systems that manage risk, create efficiency and improve transparency within the firm and across our broad community of investors and portfolio companies.  BXi is nimble and entrepreneurial – our open, iterative design processes and rapid pace of development mean that everyone on the team has the opportunity to make an impact from day one. We are problem solvers who can take projects from idea to implementation. We believe in active mentoring and developing excellence. We collaborate to find the best answers for our customers and for Blackstone. We are critical to the firm maintaining its competitive edge. Job Title: Business Analyst – Tax Job Description: As a member of the technology innovation team at Blackstone, you will work with a group of talented individuals in a highly team-oriented environment to create the next generation of innovative solutions for Blackstone and the financial community at large.  Specifically, we are seeking an experienced Business Analyst that demonstrates proven extensive knowledge of, and/or a proven record of success performing in roles leveraging, a broad tax background. You will serve as a key stakeholder and problem solver, who can consult widely, synthesize information from multiple sources, formulate options and drive complex problems to a solution. In order to be successful, you will leverage your strong tax knowledge and experience with related systems.  Key Responsibilities include: Working with internal clients to understand overall operational, data, and information requirements for tax processes including documenting tax processes and organization, analyzing tax data/calculations/reports, and understanding technology environment and interfacesDesigning and specifying user interfaces and information architecture using participatory and iterative design techniques including customer interviews, usability testing, and other forms of requirements discovery.Effectively communicating research findings, conceptual ideas and detailed design rationale both verbally and visually.Leading the interactive design process, driving decisions, tracking issues, and assisting in estimating and managing release schedules.Discussing, presenting and documenting designs and design decisions effectively to varied audiences.Working with cross-functional teams (client working groups, business owners, engineering, QA, etc.) to manage the entire lifecycle from concept to completion.Qualifications: We are currently seeking a Business Analyst to focus on our Tax Technology Projects. This individual must be entrepreneurial and have a passion to innovate and help build a world class technical ecosystem for this new entity. Core Requirements:3+ years of tax industry experience preferredKnowledge and experience handling a broad range of corporate and private equity tax matters, with focus on tax reporting and complianceProject management experience; custom software development engagements/experience a plusDemonstrates proven experience identifying and addressing internal client needs; build solid relationships across the firm; demonstrate flexibility in prioritizing and completing tasks.A desire to be a part of and help grow a great team and organizationThe passion to learn, grow, and help us to improve our businessBachelor's degree or higherAbility to quickly adapt to new technologiesCapacity to work within complex business processes, systems and large data sets All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, national origin or any other category protected by law.  If you need a reasonable accommodation to complete your application, please contact Human Resources at 212-583-5000 (US), +44 (0)20 7451 4000 (EMEA) or +852 3656 8600 (APAC).  The Blackstone Group and its affiliates provide equal employment opportunity to all qualified employees and applicants for employment regardless of race, color, creed, religion, sex, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, marital or partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, genetic predisposition, veteran or military status, status as a victim of domestic violence, a sex offense or stalking, or any other classification prohibited by applicable law.  To submit your application please complete the form below. Fields marked with a red asterisk * are required in order to enter into a possible employment contract (although some can be answered \"prefer not to say\"). Failure to provide this information may compromise the follow-up of your application. When you have finished click Submit at the bottom of this form.

Name: Business Analyst - Reserving, Global Risk Solutions
Description: Advance your career at Liberty Mutual - A Fortune 100 Company!Global Risk Solutions Actuarial, Home Office reserving is seeking a Business Analyst on the Home Office Reserving team. GRS Actuarial HO Reserving is responsible for maintaining balance sheet integrity by ensuring reserves are adequate. The team conducts regular reserve reviews; ensures adequate tools and methodologies are in place; provides internal/external audits support as well as reporting support under multiple regularly bases; and keeps management informed. In return for your service, its our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/BenefitsOverview:At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.Were dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.Job: Analytics Primary Location: United States-New York-New York Schedule: Full-time Salary: $75,000-$90,000 Education Level: Bachelor's Degree (±16 years) Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time

Name: Lead Business Analyst - Regulatory Delivery
Description: Your RoleDo you have a keen interest in understanding and solving business problems? The UBS Asset Management Regulatory Delivery team is looking for an experienced business analyst to work with stakeholders across the organization to understand the impact of legislation on business processes, capture business requirements, define the solutions, and ensure that required changes are integrated into the day to day organization. The role will require active interaction across Asset Management, including product management, client coverage, and investments functions as well as legal, compliance, and IT. The successful candidate will have a track record of outstanding teamwork and a high level of communication skills. Primary Responsibilities:• Lead the business analysis for programs/projects, managing the BA team and SMEs conducting analysis activities.• Ensure that BA deliverables are of a high standard and promote ongoing improvements and excellence.• Partner with program/project managers in the development of business cases.• Analysis of regulation and understanding the impact from a business process, controls, data and systems perspective• Elicit and capture business requirements, analyzing, simplifying, and challenging where required to ensure that the true business need is captured• Ensure business process and controls are designed in line with the principles set down by the Design Authority.• Support the Design Authority in defining and implementing key design principles.• Contribute to functional and data requirements.• Track the development of requirements over time, ensuring traceability from inception through implementation and control• Communicate the requirements to a broad set of stakeholders, adapting the message as required to meet the needs of senior managers, subject matter experts, and impacted staff• Drive the design or review of test cases, process change requests, and support the organization through acceptance, installation and deployment• Development of test scenarios and test cases; and where necessary performing test execution and support.• Develop and deliver user training and communications.• Contribute to the design of solutions and processes that are fit for purpose and within the long-term strategic vision of UBS AM• Take ownership of solutions delivery from start to finishYour teamUBS AM Regulatory Delivery is a team dedicated to the execution of business change required by the regulation. It consists of project/program managers, business analysts, and PMO resources and works from Zurich, London, and New York.Your expertise8+ years of business analysis experience , preferably in asset management or another area of financial services• A good understanding of the core financial instruments in equities, fixed income, forex and managed accounts• Experience creating business requirements specifications and target operating models, using tools such as SIPOCs, process flows, use cases and context diagrams• Strong data analysis background with excellent skills in Excel• Experience in the software development lifecycle, particularly in developing test cases and managing user acceptance testing• Strong written and verbal communication skills, the ability to direct the efforts of diverse groups of stakeholders to build a common understanding and come to a consensus• Excellent English language skills, German a plusYou are:• Comfortable navigating between the technical and business areas of asset management. Able to translate business needs into both business and technical solutions.• Hands-on solution driven attitude, with ability to balance tactical needs against strategic considerations• Stress-resilient*LI-UBSWhat we offerTogether. That’s how we do things. We offer people around the world a supportive, challenging and diverse working environment. We value your passion and commitment, and reward your performance.Keen to achieve the work-life agility that you desire? We're open to discussing how this could work for you (and us).Take the next stepAre you truly collaborative? Succeeding at UBS means respecting, understanding and trusting colleagues and clients. Challenging others and being challenged in return. Being passionate about what you do. Driving yourself forward, always wanting to do things the right way. Does that sound like you? Then you have the right stuff to join us. Apply now.Disclaimer / Policy StatementsUBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Name: Business Analyst - FinTech Company
Description: Position Description: We are seeking an extremely driven and detailed-orientated business analyst to play an active role in driving our continued innovation within the small business lending environment. In this role, you will be at the intersection of Fundation’s technology and strategic partnerships teams, helping to implement groundbreaking partnerships and drive our innovation agenda aimed at delivering a best-in-class experience for small businesses, institutions we partner with and our internal users. The role will involve regular collaboration with various stakeholders (both internal and external) to define business and functional requirements to support the continued improvement and innovation of Fundation’s product offering. We hope, and expect, that our business analysts also want to serve in a product management capacity, helping to define functionality that will drive the business forward. Our Company Fundation is a high growth, private equity backed, digital solutions provider, dedicated to enhancing the borrowing process for small business owners across the United States. We are changing the landscape of lending to small and medium sized businesses nationwide through a streamlined, data-driven, digital lending process. We deliver our credit products through a network of partners, offering the equivalent of a bank loan but through a technology-enabled process that can deliver capital in as little as 2 business days. Our partners include banks and other financial institutions, business advisors, vendors of supplies, equipment, and services; online service providers, software providers and professional service firms. Key Responsibilities:Collaborate with various stakeholders (both internal and external) to define business requirements.Translate conceptual user requirements into detailed functional requirements in a clean and concise manner that are easily comprehensible to developers.Develop expertise in both our business processes and technology solutions. You should evolve into a Subject Matter Expert in your area of accountability.“Connect the dots” and demonstrate critical thinking. With minimal guidance, be able to propose creative and insightful solutions.Preform project management activities on assigned tasks (as needed) to ensure projects stay on track and to guide our software development team during the development process.Continuously look to improve our Products by staying aware of emerging trends and technologies.RequirementsWe are open to candidates at all levels, but are looking for a minimum of 2 years of prior experience in a Business Analyst or Product Management roleExcellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present ideas to a diverse audienceProven ability to think criticallyHighly organized with extreme attention to detailDriven. A proven “self-starter” that has a thirst for knowledge and is proactivePrior Financial Services (ideally lending) or FinTech experience a big plus or experience in a high growth start-up environment.Benefits Fundation is private equity backed, fintech market leader that creates integrated partnerships to serve the financial needs of small business customers. Having commenced lending operations in 2013, the company is now experiencing a period of rapid growth. Our corporate values include “do the right thing for customers, partners and colleagues”; “ask why and why not”; and “grow professionally”. We have built a flat, collaborative and highly diverse team and culture. Our benefits include: Competitive compensation packageOutstanding medical benefits package including health, dental, vision and insurance401K with generous company match and vesting scheduleCompetitive PTO and a unique ½ day with work from home option before major federal holidays such as Memorial Day, Labor Day, Day before Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve and New Year's Eve.Opportunity to work with a veteran team of leaders building a great brandFundation provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Fundation complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Name: Business Manager & Financial Analyst
Description: Req ID: 35488     At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.     NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Business Manager & Financial Analyst to join our team in New York City, New York (US-NY), United States (US).        This role fully supports the global organization. The role will provide comprehensive analytical support for the execution of financial management and reporting duties as well as for monitoring and implementation of sound business processes to facilitate the technical objectives of EDC:  * Business Management & Financial Analysis  * Financial and spend analysis for new and existing capital projects  * Provide finance support to new capital projects in process from submission through to approval  * Budget and Forecast data collection and P&L variance analysis  * Data Centre Modeling  * Total Cost of Ownership Analysis  * Data Centre strategy financial modeling  * New build / Major project financial management  * Administer applicable allocation methodologies (chargeback rationale)  * Assisting with the collation and formatting of the Quarterly Business Report  * FTE headcount & contingency labor administration & approval - monthly tracking & reporting  * Validate and approve new hires, transfers and terminations of all resource types  * Maintain the resource run rate data and ensure that it is reflective of the forward looking resource profile  * Follow up with hiring managers for planned new hires  * Active participation in office space planning & management  * Co-ordination of monthly service and quarterly operating reports  * Collaboration with IT Finance for production of monthly BU financial reports with supporting qualitative commentary on technology initiatives for the benefit of business unit stakeholders  * Provide support to silo managers for communication of technology agenda and departmental strategy Special Projects from time to time, the Business Management team will also be required to participate in special projects as requested by EDC Management, including:  * Production of adhoc presentations, analysis and proposal documents  * New project support  * Silo manager support  * General business management initiatives     Skills Required:  * Finance / Accounting knowledge, 3-5 years post accounting qualified preferable  * Data Centre knowledge, preferable  * Strong financial modeling skills  * Ability to formulate & deliver senior management level presentations  * Strong communication / interpersonal skills to be able to interact at all levels  * Knowledge of MS Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint     Skills Desired:  * Investment Banking background  * Self-starter able to complete role with minimal supervision, paying close attention to detail  * Pro-active: identifies other value-add areas. Identifies areas for improvement and suggests solutions  * Excellent organizational skills  * Good use of initiative, judgment and decision making  * Flexible and adaptive to change  * Excellent team member    BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: -3+ Years Investment Banking Experience  -3+ Years of Project Management & Business Analyst Experience  -Excellent Organizational Skills  -3+ Years of FInancial Services Experience          This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.About NTT DATA Services    NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.     NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.     NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result.

Name: R&D Technical Business Analyst
Description: Description This role as R&D Technical Business Analyst will require strategic design and mapping of business requirements and solutions to system/technical requirements. The Technical Business Analyst will be responsible for writing functional and technical specifications based on interactions with architecture and product management teams. These specifications will need to be precise and clear as the Technical Business Analyst will delegate some work to fellow team members such as developers, quality assurance, product support and documentation. Name: Business Analyst - Risk
Description: You’ll work in teams of typically 3 – 5 consultants, playing an active role in all aspects of client engagement.You will assist client teams in understanding and quantifying risk exposures, evaluating risk strategies, and building and maintaining risk models by being staffed full-time on one engagement or providing ad-hoc assistance to several engagements.This includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations. You’ll also have the opportunity to present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members. You will be expected to contribute to knowledge development by helping define and expand distinctive risk-based methodologies to support top management-level strategic decisions.You’ll gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. Business Analysts receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues on their teams. This support includes a Partner from your local office or practice assigned to you to help guide your career as well as several weeks of formal training in your first two years as a Business Analyst.Additionally, you’ll receive guidance and support from your local office or practice in the selection of client projects, helping you to develop your skills and build your network.
