At PayPal you will be immersed in an amazing community with a vibrant culture that thrives on innovation, collaboration, inclusion and wellness.Job Description:The position will part of a global analytics organization with many options for future career growth at PayPal. We're looking for analysts that go above and beyond simply providing reports and analyses to consulting on product design and customer experience. This person will generate insights by conducting extensive analyses of PayPal’s rich data. In the process, this person will develop a deep understanding of the payments businesses, our site functionality, further strengthen their analytic, leadership, and presentation skills, and gain exposure to a wide variety of functional teams within PayPal.Qualified candidates will graduate with their Master's degree between December 2017 and August 2018.Basic Requirements:Master's degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, or related field from an accredited college or university4+ years Java experienceExpertise required in object-oriented design methodology and application development in Java.Excellent understanding of computer science fundamentals, data structures, and algorithms.Excellent problem solving skills.Solid data mining and machine learning expertise required, DB/data warehouse expertise desired.Familiarity with search/recommendation/classification applications and domains preferred.Information Retrieval (search/recommendation/classification) experience or Human Judgment/User Interface experience.Position Location: VariesSubsidiary:Travel Percent:0Primary Location:San JoseAdditional Locations:Austin, Boston, New York, Scottsdale, Timonium

Name: Intern opportunities for undergraduate students: Finance Analyst Intern
Description: Are you looking forward to a career in finance? Microsoft's undergraduate finance internship opportunity has the training you need to get your career in finance underway. This program has a 15-year track record of producing some of Microsoft's top full-time finance professionals. For 12 weeks, you'll put classroom theory to the test by working on real business issues embedded on one of our top finance teams at the world's leading software company.  Microsoft would like to invite you to come join us as you are, where you can find more than just a job.? Read on to learn more about opportunities and apply online!??  Applications to these opportunities are considered for all available finance intern roles including the ones described below, depending on education level and/or location. To be considered for an internship position, you need to be enrolled as a student with at least one semester/quarter remaining after the internship.  As a Financial analyst intern, you'll learn how to perform financial analysis from full-time professionals at Microsoft. This unique opportunity will get you involved in the dynamic high-tech space solving problems using best-in-class financial tools. You'll also be able to explore one of many areas of Microsoft Finance: Financial Planning and Analysis, Treasury, Capital Markets, Sales and Marketing, Finance, Accounting, or any one of the many product groups such as Office, Xbox or many others.  Interns will interact?directly with Finance rotation program Analysts, who serve as dedicated?coaches for Finance interns. Coaches ensure you have the resources and encouragement needed to succeed in your internship and they take care to?explain your future career opportunities if you return full time. You will participate?in social events held by the Microsoft internship and Finance Rotation programs. These events allow you to socialize with interns from across the company as well as those who are in similar internships. Past events have included hikes at Mount Rainier, sailing along Lake Washington, and Mariners baseball games. *Responsibilities** You will become a valued and integral member within your finance area. You will work on a variety of projects that directly impact the business, such as building?models, forecasting, market research, or creating internal tools or databases. Your manager will work with you to make sure your projects are?meaningful and relevant based on your interests and development needs. Additionally, you will receive finance-specific training and have access to all company-wide training resources to help you succeed in your role. *Qualifications** + Pursuing a bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, economics, or business with a graduation date between Nov. 2019 and July 2020.  + One or years of classroom or work experience in financial risk analysis preferred.  + Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills.  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form at https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/accommodationrequest .  Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Name: Analyst
Description: Company Description:Quartet is a pioneering technology company connecting physical and mental care to improve peoples health and quality of life. We are building a collaborative technology platform that brings together physicians, mental health providers, and insurance companies to effectively improve patient outcomes and drive down healthcare costs. Our data-driven platform identifies high-need patients and facilitates access to personalized care. Backed by $92MM in venture funding from top investors like GV (formerly Google Ventures) and Oak HC/FT, Quartet is headquartered in NYC and is currently operating in several markets across the US -- Pennsylvania, Massachusetts, Louisiana, Washington, Northern California, and New Jersey.About the team: The Business Development team is responsible for new Health Plan and Health System relationships across markets. Our team is accountable to deliver revenue generating partnerships with these enterprise customers. Customers to date include some of the leading Blues plans (e.g., Highmark, Premera, Horizon) and Health Systems (e.g., Sutter) in the country. Business development for Quartet is much more than sales. We are joined at the hip with our partners across the organization to help with product development, marketing, and importantly, Customer Success. Because of the depth of our partnerships, together with Customer Success, we dont just leave after a contract is signed, but rather help to mutually define goals and objectives of our enterprise partnerships and ensure we support the GTM develop against those expectations.Role Description: The Business Development Associate will play a critical role in Quartet's business development efforts. This individual will support Business Development Managers, Directors, and VPs with the delivery of revenue objectives with prospective health plan and health system clients, as well as conduct analyses in order to effectively determine and convey Quartets value proposition. The Business Development Analyst will support large enterprise deal customer campaigns through quantitative and qualitative analysis, orchestrate internal collaboration efforts, and work directly with the Business Development leadership to drive our extensive go-to-market reach. This person must be highly versatile and possess the combination of IQ and EQ to represent Quartet internally across the organization as well as in the market. We expect and will commit to supporting this persons development over time into a great Business Development leaderAccountable for: Identify compelling trends and opportunities for prospective launches or expansion opportunities to help identify and capture value for our campaigns.Example: Be able to go from 30,000 to 3 feet off the ground by analyzing market data to identify trends/opportunities within a national health plan campaign Develop and support the delivery against large deal campaigns with prospective health plan, health system, and employer clients end-to-end: initial relationship development, business case building, deal negotiation, closing, and ongoing partnership management. Example: Initial relationship development: Accountable to create a compelling market analysis presentation to scope GTM and prioritization of potential market launches with a national health planExample: Initial relationship development: Experience with multi-layered stakeholder analysis to support appropriate buyer mapping organizationUnderstand and articulate value creation storylines via qualitative and quantitative means.Example: Produce excel based ROI models to evaluate the economic opportunity set for clients across savings (e.g., cost of care reduction) for multiple different member typesExample: Produce a powerpoint based story board that showcases the strategic value creation opportunities (e.g., cost of care, provider support)Create collateral and conduct analyses related to client ROI, pricing, and quality improvement opportunity to support the development of market/product marketing programsWork with Business Development leaders to drive campaign progression, brand elevation, value proposition articulation, and thought leadership Gain a strong understanding of the product offering; be able to clearly articulate the value proposition and the Quartet story to the market at large QualificationsBachelors degree required; 2+ years relevant work experience in consulting, business development, finance (e.g. investment banking)Excellent analytical skills and the ability to approach complex problems with a quantitative, value-driven mindset. Proficient in excel and powerpoint to articulate those points.Ideally 1-2 years healthcare experience. Strong understanding of health IT space and the shift toward value-based careTenacity, grit, and extraordinary interpersonal abilities to build relationships internally (e.g., cross organization collaboration) and later on externally (e.g., join for C-suite meetings)Passion for improving lives by unifying physical and mental healthcare deliveryDeep alignment with Quartet Healths core valuesEmployee Benefits for Quartet include: Unlimited vacation, volunteer opportunities, catered lunches, snacks, team events and outings, full medical, dental + vision coverage, generous parental leave, commuter benefits, 15 free therapy sessions + unlimited copay reimbursements for mental healthcare, 401K, ESPP, gym benefits. Want to know what Quartet life is like? Click here to meet our team. Quartet is committed to building a diverse team and fostering an inclusive culture, and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We embrace and encourage our employees' differences in race, religion, color, national origin, gender, family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran status, disability, pregnancy, medical conditions, and other characteristics. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Quartet does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Quartet will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Quartet. Please note: Quartet interview requests and job offers only originate from quartethealth.com email addresses (e.g. jsmith@quartethealth.com). Quartet will also never ask for bank information (e.g. account and routing number), social security numbers, passwords, or other sensitive information to be delivered via email. If you receive a scam email or wish to report a security issue involving Quartet, please notify us at: security@quartethealth.com.Have someone to refer? Email talent@quartethealth.com to submit their details to us.

Name: Analyst
Description: Here at 1stdibs one of our core values is 'Say It With Data' and we are looking for an Analyst to join our Analytics team. In this role you will work cross-functionally and partner with key stakeholders to measure and quantify marketing/product initiatives here at 1stdibs.  Your goal is to lead and manage conversations that steer our audience acquisition/retention and user experience optimization strategy through the identification of significant trends and application of advanced insights. You will provide thought-leadership on how to effectively leverage data to inform decision-making across the organization.  In this role, you will have the opportunity to learn and develop expertise around how a luxury e-commerce marketplace leverages web analytics to drive decisions. You will be a self-starter who can jump in without being asked, see the big picture but pay close attention to detail, and demonstrate strong verbal and written communication skills. You will be diligent in your work and have a passion for process. You will be passionate about using data to drive business decisions and have experience working with various stakeholders and cross-functional teams. To be successful you will have a deep knowledge of SQL, a natural flair for interpreting data and an all around passion for numbers!  We have a startup culture that is constantly evolving so comfort with ambiguity is very important. In exchange, you'll be given the opportunity to work with and learn from some of the most passionate, driven and creative people assembled under one roof. What you'll doDefine, analyze and validate key metrics to inform decision-making and measure product and marketing success from a business and user perspectiveWork with business owners to leverage data to identify growth opportunities and user pain points, evaluate new features and recommend changesCommunicate and present data and insights clearly, distilling complexity down to its essenceDesign, monitor, analyze and create reporting for A/B experimentsPerform and regularly monitor cohort and conversion funnel analyses to identify key user behavior trendsGather requirements and build data visualizations and interactive dashboardsWhat you'll bringBachelor's in a quantitative field, data science or business analytics; Master's preferred2-4 years of experience in marketing|digital|business analyticsStrong SQL skillsFamiliarity with web analytics tools, such as Google AnalyticsFamiliarity with business intelligence solutions that translate insights into simple and concise visuals (e.g. Chartio, Looker, Tableau, etc.)Possess strong verbal, written and visual presentation skills, with an emphasis on storytellingAbility to think critically about problems through multiple perspectives and assert demonstrable hypothesesComfort working in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment, delivering flawless execution

Name: Innovations - Business Analyst - 2019 Analyst
Description: Job Description:­­Job Title: 2019 Analyst – Innovations and Infrastructure Business AnalystEmployer: BlackstoneFirm Profile: Blackstone is one of the world’s leading investment firms. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our asset management businesses, with $450 billion in assets under management, include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow Blackstone on Twitter @Blackstone.Business Unit: Blackstone Innovations and Infrastructure (BXii)Blackstone BXii Overview:Blackstone Innovations is the technology team providing Blackstone with the fuel (information and tools) the firm needs to grow. Serving internal and external clients, we build cutting-edge yet easy to use systems to create efficiencies and transparency into Blackstone and our broader community of investors, portfolio companies, etc.Every member of the team participates throughout the life-cycle of projects. There are no silos or other walls preventing you from learning and growing to meet your career goals. We actively mentor our team to be the people who get it, the people who stand up and challenge the status quo and work together to come up with the best answers.Job Title:Business AnalystJob Description:As a member of the technology innovation team at Blackstone, you will work with a group of talented individuals in a highly team-oriented environment to create the next generation of innovative solutions for Blackstone and the financial community at large.Our technical Business Analysts are involved in the full development lifecycle and will work closely with all stakeholders during the conceptual, design, development, and production stages of each project. The business analyst serves as the “glue” between business owners, clients, quality assurance and the engineers that build the designs, so they need to be able to discuss, manage and document their work and design decisions effectively to varied audiences. Key Responsibilities Include:Build a deep understanding of user motivations, market opportunities and competition through research and design exploration.Design and specify user interfaces and information architecture using participatory and iterative design techniques including customer interviews, usability testing, and other forms of requirements discovery.Iterate on designs based on user feedback, user research, technology constraints and market dynamics.Effectively communicate research findings, conceptual ideas and detailed design rationale both verbally and visually.Lead the interactive design process, drive decisions, track issues, and assist in estimating and managing release schedules.Ability to discuss, present and document designs and design decisions effectively to varied audiences.Work with cross-functional teams (client working groups, business owners, engineering, QA, etc.) to manage the entire lifecycle from concept to completion.Qualifications:Blackstone seeks to hire individuals who are highly motivated, intelligent and have demonstrated excellence in prior endeavors. You will need:A self-starting, entrepreneurial attitude, willing to work through all obstacles to accomplish tasks.The ability to juggle multiple projects on tight deadlines without compromising quality.Outstanding communication (written and verbal), presentation, documentation, and interpersonal skills; detail- oriented.Experience working collaboratively with multiple groups in a variety of settings and strong communication skills with the ability to listen, articulate positions, and advocate designs.Good project management and implementation skills.A basic understanding of the financial services industry.To be considered for the 2019 Analyst Program, applicants must meet the following criteria:Currently enrolled as an undergraduate studentAnticipated graduation date: Fall 2018 – Spring 2019Resume must include expected graduation month/year and GPAResume must be in PDF formatIf you need a reasonable accommodation to complete your application, please contact Human Resources at 212-583-5000 (US), +44 (0)20 7451 4000 (EMEA) or +852 3656 8600 (APAC).The Blackstone Group and its affiliates provide equal employment opportunity to all qualified employees and applicants for employment regardless of race, color, creed, religion, sex, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, marital or partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, genetic predisposition, veteran or military status, status as a victim of domestic violence, a sex offense or stalking, or any other classification prohibited by applicable law.To submit your application please complete the form below. Fields marked with a red asterisk * are required in order to enter into a possible employment contract (although some can be answered \"prefer not to say\"). Failure to provide this information may compromise the follow-up of your application. When you have finished click Submit at the bottom of this form.

Name: Freelance Business Analyst - Two Year Contract
Description: Position Freelance Business Analyst - Two Year ContractLocation ManhattanStarts Within the WeekDuration Open endedStatus FreelanceRate DOE Our client, a well-known government agency located in is seeking a Business Analyst to join their team for a two year contract position.  In this role, the Business Analyst will be taking a defining role in the gathering & documentation of requirements, in the analysis of existing business process and in the identification of process issues and improvements. Services to be performed may include, but not be limited to the following: capture, consolidate, and communicate the information from the client back to the development team. Qualifications & Position Responsibilities:2+ years professional experienceCandidates should be quickly able to understand the business users' requirement about the data points, features, and functions.Candidates should facilitate and bridge the gap between the techno- functional team and client, if any, during the development phase. The BA will play a critical link between the client, providing the business requirements and the development team trying to formulate the solution.You should have a strong background in business and data analysis, project tracking / coordination and testing/ reviewing for validating the fulfilment of the user requirements.You must be experienced in UI/UX design and well versed with BA artifacts such as BRD, SRD/FRD, Mockups/Wireframes, use cases, test cases, user stories, flow diagramsHave basic details about the system architecture and databases.Ability to analyze, test and document, ability in using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems.

We offer a dynamic entrepreneurial environment that fosters creativity and provides unlimited opportunities for personal and professional growth. The primary role of the Business Analyst is to collect and analyze data for ongoing evaluation regarding impact on program/department activities. He/she provides strategic and operation insights to managers to aid in program operational and field decision making processes. Name: Financial Data Analyst
Description: DescriptionThe primary role of the Financial Data Analyst will be to be able to create datasets in SAS/SQL and convert them into XML format. Another main responsibility is to manage the DWH integration process to load XML files to GL. The incumbent will also assist in the mapping of Data Warehouse structures and dataflow into the General Ledger (GL). The candidate will also assist in the data migration from the SAS environment into AWS cloud platform. Work with the EMR (Excess Medical Revenue) and GL teams to ensure that all of the approved entries are loaded into General Ledger.Maintain the GL integration process for both financial journals and statisticsConduct GL/EMR data reconciliation.Assist in maintenance and improvement of automated Data Warehouse processes.Additional duties as assigned.Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.Work experience with data analytics.Experience in creating, maintaining and running complex queries using SQL.Work experience with large volumes of data in Excel utilizing advanced functions such as VLookups, Pivot Tables, formulas, model building.Working knowledge of a Data Warehouse structure.Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Finance, Math, Statistics or Computer Science from an accredited institution.Basis Knowledge in SAS.Analytical experience in a healthcare environment (such as a managed care organization, commercial health insurance plan, hospital system, etc.)Ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization, including technical staff, internal non-technical staff, and business stakeholders.Ability to effectively and efficiently adapt in a dynamic environment.Ability to challenge the status quo and drive lean implementation.Ability to quickly develop an understanding of systems and technology.WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. Applicants and employees are considered for positions and are evaluated without regard to mental or physical disability, race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status or any other protected Federal, State/Province or Local status unrelated to the performance of the work involved. Name: Business Analyst

The analyst is ultimately responsible for leveraging analytical thinking and delivering clear documentation to ensure successful systems development and implementation. The ideal candidate will possess demonstrated ability to gather important company data and translate business needs formal technical requirements, have a firm knowledge of BABOK principals, and excellent verbal & written communication skills. In addition, candidate will have experience in healthcare, pharmacy operations and/or pharmacy benefit management with a proven track record in improving business processes, and building / delivering solid technology solutions. Location of position: Overland Park, KS or Paramus, NJ with remote considerations for the right candidate.Summary:The IT Business Analyst works under general direction and with oversight from the VP of IT Software Development to independently conduct business interviews, analyze business processes & data flows, and translate business needs into formal technical requirements/documentation.Education:BS Degree in Computer Science, IT, MIS or equivalent disciplineCertification of Competency in Business Analysis (CCBA) or Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) a plusExperience:Balanced Self-Starter and takes direction well. flow and process modeling performing and systems analysis for systems that cross multiple components and impact multiple systems2+ years of experience in developing lifecycle documents, including translating Use Cases, Detailed Functional Requirements, Detailed Design Specifications, and Test CasesExperience with systems validationExperience with Data WarehousingExperience working with Agile methodologyIn depth knowledge of the Systems Development Lifecycle (SDLC)Experience in conducting user acceptance testing (UAT) and regression testingStrong analytical skillsSQL a plus (T-SQL Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst Location: Parsippany, NJReports To:Director of MarketingRole:SalariedSCOPE OF POSITION Work collaboratively with Business Managers to ensure the efficient operations of the business thorough analytical insights. Provide price analysis support for the assigned Marketing group ensuring all pricing is up to date. Develop bidding process and implement improvement over current process. RESPONSIBILITIESProvide ad hoc analytical support to Business Managers and Business Director.Maintain data integrity of pricing database and use data to enhance analysis.Ensure optimal sourcing decisions are made, considering freight economics, product quality, plant requirements, and supply capabilities.Responsible for obtaining all bid results and documenting those in appropriate computer software/systems (SAP).Serve as the link between the Business and functional support to get new customers setup and product is supplied on-time.Manage data integrity of pricing and bid database.Prepare periodic reports for business area evaluation or for customers.Provide price/competitive analysis for Business Managers as required.Manage day to day operations for assigned buy/resale product line.Support bid group.Automate analytics and reporting processes in Excel.Conduct ongoing research to monitor relevant industry data and market indices.Other duties as assigned.REQUIREMENTSPost-Secondary completed in Business.Minimum 3-5 years of experience in an analytical or analyst role.Ability analyze and generate reports via excel.Working knowledge of plant chemical processes (preferred), as well as safety and environmental regulations.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, etc.).Strong interpersonal and communication skills.Ability to meet tight deadlines.Ability to effectively multitask.Excellent problem solving and strong presentation skills are also required.COMPANY OVERVIEW People First!  By joining our team, you will have the chance to be part of a vibrant and growing company. We offer an exciting work atmosphere and opportunities for professional development. At Chemtrade, we take pride in rewarding our employees for their commitment, performance and hard work by offering a variety of programs and services. We offer a comprehensive and very competitive health and wellness program, including medical, dental, paid vacation and a fitness activity subsidy. Our unique culture enables employees to thrive in a supportive and engaging workplace. Employee engagement is not just something we talk about at Chemtrade, but fulfilled through exciting programs like Employee Recognition and Rewards (CHEers!), and Chemtrade University.  Our friendly work environment fosters positive interaction amongst employees within and throughout different departments and locations. We treat our employees with fairness and equity. We value diversity, recognize the benefits of an inclusive work environment and pride ourselves on our commitment to the Health and Safety of our employees and the communities we work in through Responsible Care®. Chemtrade is an Equal Opportunity EmployerChemtrade is committed to fair and accessible employment practices and will, where possible, provide accommodations for persons with disabilities.#Chemtrade123 #ZR

Name: Lead Business Analyst - Regulatory Delivery
Description: Your RoleDo you have a keen interest in understanding and solving business problems? The UBS Asset Management Regulatory Delivery team is looking for an experienced business analyst to work with stakeholders across the organization to understand the impact of legislation on business processes, capture business requirements, define the solutions, and ensure that required changes are integrated into the day to day organization. The role will require active interaction across Asset Management, including product management, client coverage, and investments functions as well as legal, compliance, and IT. The successful candidate will have a track record of outstanding teamwork and a high level of communication skills. Primary Responsibilities:• Lead the business analysis for programs/projects, managing the BA team and SMEs conducting analysis activities.• Ensure that BA deliverables are of a high standard and promote ongoing improvements and excellence.• Partner with program/project managers in the development of business cases.• Analysis of regulation and understanding the impact from a business process, controls, data and systems perspective• Elicit and capture business requirements, analyzing, simplifying, and challenging where required to ensure that the true business need is captured• Ensure business process and controls are designed in line with the principles set down by the Design Authority.• Support the Design Authority in defining and implementing key design principles.• Contribute to functional and data requirements.• Track the development of requirements over time, ensuring traceability from inception through implementation and control• Communicate the requirements to a broad set of stakeholders, adapting the message as required to meet the needs of senior managers, subject matter experts, and impacted staff• Drive the design or review of test cases, process change requests, and support the organization through acceptance, installation and deployment• Development of test scenarios and test cases; and where necessary performing test execution and support.• Develop and deliver user training and communications.• Contribute to the design of solutions and processes that are fit for purpose and within the long-term strategic vision of UBS AM• Take ownership of solutions delivery from start to finishYour teamUBS AM Regulatory Delivery is a team dedicated to the execution of business change required by the regulation. Name: Business Data Analyst/Scientist
Description: BrainPOP, a leading creator of digital educational content including animated movies, learning games, interactive quizzes, and activities like concept mapping, seeks a dedicated Business Data Analyst/Scientist to join our growing Data team.  As the Business Data Analyst/Scientist, you will focus on the translation of data into expert recommendations, visualizations and BI tools that help shape the direction of our business efforts. You’ll work alongside an energetic and passionate group in a fast-paced and collaborative environment. In this role, you will:Analyze large-scale data setsInvestigate root causes of patterns using data-driven approachesDefine needs of sales, marketing, finance and business development team members and solve those needs with data analyses, models, and/or visualizationsGrow and foster a data-driven company cultureOn your resume:2-4 years experience working in a business-data-focused role at a SAAS or Education focused company/organization (a Masters degree does not substitute for on the job experience)Proficiency with R (or an equivalent statistical programming language)Proficiency with SQLYou must have:Experience leading new data initiatives and processesA passion for improving educationA multi-faceted skillsetA BA in economics, an MBA, or a Master’s in data scienceThe ability to work in a team and independentlyExcellent data communication skillsYou might also have:Experience working with a BI toolExperience with a data warehouse and ETL processesWeb, database, or software programming experienceLife at BrainPOP: Our commitment to supporting and empowering teachers and students is reflected in our dedication to enhancing the lives of our employees—in and out of the office.  Besides offering a comprehensive benefits package and putting an emphasis on work-life balance, we make it a point to integrate fun and play into the workplace.  Our team is made up of educators, data scientists, published authors, programmers, artists, bakers, film buffs, cyclists, dual-citizens, and so much more. We value collaboration and learning from multiple perspectives.  What we do today directly impacts how teachers teach and how students learn. We continue to be inspired because we can see the difference we’re making, and we’re proud to be a creative, collaborative, always-teaching and always-learning community. To Apply: Please apply through LinkedIn. We believe that a diverse organization is a more effective organization. BrainPOP is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

Name: Programmatic Revenue Analyst
Description: Programmatic Revenue AnalystWriting Tools | New York City, NYcomparable market-based titlesYield Operations SpecialistDigital Advertising Specialist  Revenue SpecialistGoal: To improve the efficiencies and effectiveness of our digital advertising operations in an effort to supply students with the best online education tools free. Organization: Writing Tools Chegg is already a leader in physical and digital textbook rentals, learning services, and online educational assistance. Chegg wants to continue to help students save time, save money and get smarter by growing its excellent Writing Tools platform. Currently composed of four of the largest student citation services in the world - EasyBib.com, CitationMachine.net, Bibme.org, and CiteThisForMe.com, the team reaches over 30 million students from all over the world. In addition, the Writing Tools team is building next-generation writing tools to help students with other aspects of their writing process, including grammar and plagiarism checking. Team: StudyBreak Media: StudyBreak Media is a reference, education and student lifestyle platform that helps digital advertisers connect with students. We’re also an ad tech-savvy, creative and driven group of professionals working on cutting-edge optimization strategies and having fun doing it. Our team works hard but we work together, learning and depending on each other.  We oversee the largest 100% student audience online, representing websites reaching 65+ million unique users and serve 7+ billion ad impressions per year, representing over 90% of the students in the U.S.  We focus on innovative solutions, expanding our in-house technologies and maximizing evolving ad tech trends to generate advertising revenue for our collection of websites. Role: Programmatic Revenue Analyst StudyBreak Media is looking for a highly intelligent individual to learn and support our programmatic advertising efforts. You will be part of a recognized and passionate team that is focused on advanced monetization strategies to bring our amazing web products to students free of charge.  You will work in concert with the yield and engineering teams to support our goals and initiatives. While prior experience in digital advertising isn’t required, you should have a general understanding of programmatic advertising and a passion for big data, understanding and spotting trends in data and creative thinking applied to technical solutions.  If you’re interested in working with a great team while learning the skills required to become an elite programmatic mind and providing students with tools to write and learn more effectively, this role is for you. What you’ll be working on:Supporting the efforts of the yield and engineering team in order to accomplish business goalsLeveraging various data sources to analyze and optimize the main revenue streams in our business modelBuilding out a setup at the vanguard of the ad tech industryHelping to design and analyze A/B tests impacting real-time revenue coming from internet propertiesSupporting quality assurance efforts in our ad solutionRequirements:1-2 years of programmatic advertising experience preferredA conceptual understanding of programmatic ad tech and deep curiosity for learningA passion for understanding and spotting trends in large data setsGoal oriented and motivated by contributing to improving performanceBackground in statistical analysis preferredExcellent written and verbal communication skillsExperience with Excel (Lookups, Array Formula, Conditional Logic)Experience with SQL preferredExperienced (or eager to gain experience) in solving challenges related to programmatic advertisingAbout Chegg: As the leading student-first connected learning platform, Chegg's Student Hub makes higher education more affordable and more accessible, all while improving student outcomes. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, California and trades on the NYSE under the symbol CHGG and has 900+ employees with offices in Santa Clara, San Francisco, Portland, New York, Provo, Atlanta, Israel, and Ukraine and trades on the NYSE under the symbol CHGG. Chegg Student Hub Services Include Chegg Study, Chegg Tutoring, Careers Search, Internship Admissions, and College Admissions. Life at Chegg:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YYHnkwiD7OoChegg Benefits:http://www.chegg.com/jobs/benefitsChegg for Good:http://blog.chegg.com/category/chegg-for-good/Glassdoor Best Places to Work 2015:http://bit.ly/GDBPTWChegg UX Design Page:http://www.cheggux.com/ For more information, visit www.chegg.comChegg is an equal opportunity employer  #LI-VP

Name: Sr Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description: SheKnows Media is a top womens lifestyle digital media company that averages 60 million unique visitors per month (comScore) and reaches more than 300 million social media fans and followers. The company operates a family of leading media properties that include SheKnows.com, BlogHer.com, STYLECASTER.com and HelloFlo.com. The Job: This position will be a key resource in the companys growing Business Intelligence & Analytics team. This role will own and lead the building, updating, and maintaining of key weekly/monthly reports and dashboards supporting the CEO, CFO, and various executive stakeholders. The role will work closely with Business Intelligence team members and other internal stakeholders to collect, validate, and visualize data from various sources. The candidate is expected to be highly proficient in Excel, able to quickly cut and dice data, and comfortable learning how new data sets relate to business concepts and objectives. As a Reporting Analyst, your role requires great attention to detail and great comfort level working with large and complex quantitative datasets. The expectation is to produce accurate and meaningful metrics to deliver high quality and actionable insights to the business. The Work:Develop, reconcile, and distribute weekly, monthly, and ad hoc reports ensuring complete accuracy.Data extraction and transposition from web-based systems (e.g. web analytics, DFP, ad server, order management, CRM, Looker, Redshift, and various other internal and external tracking and reporting UI systems) to Microsoft Excel.Visualize and report on data in accessible and meaningful ways to internal business units.Take initiative to lead prototyping and testing of automated reports from SQL data warehouse.Stay on top of new features/developments for additional data gathering opportunities.Data mining and analysis. Drawing actionable and meaning business insights from large datasets.The Fine Print:BS/BA in a quantitative or analytical field3-5 years working with data in a similar business intelligence, reporting, or analytical role.Outstanding Excel skills required.Basic knowledge of relational database concepts, SQL, and financial statements is preferred.Prior experience with some of the following tools preferred: Tableau, Looker (or other dashboarding tools), Google or Adobe Analytics, SalesForce (or other CRM platform), DFP/OAS (or other ad servers), DSM or Operative, comScore/Nielsen/Quantcast, NetSuite or other accounting softwareAble to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities and deadlines.Strong structured problem solving, attention to detail and organizational skills.Tech savvy and able to research and recommend tools and technologies to solve problems.Ability to quickly learn new tools, concepts and reporting processes is extremely important.About Us With a mission of women inspiring women, SheKnows Media is revolutionizing the publishing industry by forging a new kind of model that seamlessly integrates users, editors and content creators onto a single platform designed to empower all women to discover, share and create. Whether its parenting or pop culture, fashion or food, DIY or décor, our award-winning editorial team, Experts, bloggers and social media influencers produce authentic and on-trend content every day. We dig deep to learn what makes our audience tick, revealing unexpected insights on women and digital media. Our robust, end-to-end suite of premium branded content and influencer marketing solutions generate nearly 1 billion ad impressions per month (sources: DFP), allowing brands to distribute authentic content and integrated advertising at scale.  SheKnows Media offers a competitive compensation and benefits package with an exciting, fresh and engaging work environment. Join us, and love where you work!

Name: Senior Compensation Analyst
Description: Sterling National Bank is an organization committed to strong growth. Our significant accomplishments are a direct result of continuous hard work by our solid team of dedicated professionals. As we continue to grow and expand across all business sectors we seek talented individuals who can meet our demands for success.  Our competitive advantage is our people who tirelessly work to exceed expectations.  We have something special here at Sterling. We not only offer competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits we are also characterized by an unwavering commitment to high achievement, we offer a diverse environment hosting a multitude of dedicated, talented and driven individuals who value honesty, integrity and go above and beyond for their clients.  It’s an exciting time to work for Sterling National Bank. If you are looking for a unique employment experience and are driven to achieve in a dynamic growth-minded environment you have come to the right place. What you will do: Sterling National Bank is looking for someone to provide guidance and analysis in support of our compensation function, including stock plan administration, and market survey participation. In this position, you will be conducting analyses of jobs, hourly wages, salaries, and incentives in order to evaluate internal equity, external competitiveness, and legal compliance of the organization’s pay practices. You will also prepare the annual salary expense budget project and other cost variance analyses as well as other compensation related projects. Consult with HR Business Partners and line managers to determine compensation related solutions; actively works to ensure compensation practices are understood and supported.Review proposed salary adjustments for conformity to established guidelines, policies, and practices.Audit job descriptions for content and updates/prepares job descriptions to reflect rapidly changing lines of business.Assists in administration of annual compensation review process, including short and long term incentive calculations.Complete and submit salary surveys and prepares analysis of results to determine company’s competitive position.Prepares annual base salary expense budget and other cost variance analyses.Creates and maintains job codes and other relative compensation data.Partners with HR Business Partner, Payroll, and Talent Acquisition team as needed.Conducts studies, performs research and prepares reports as needed.Ensure compliance with all regulations, policies, and procedures. **Position locations - Manhattan, Long Island or Yonkers.**  #LI-Post  #HumanResourcesRequired Skills For this position, you must have at least 3 years of experience as a compensation professional with knowledge of current compensation practices and trends including market analysis.Experience in financial services/banking industry preferred.Experience working with Oracle HCM/WorkDay/PeopleSoft preferred.Candidates with advanced degrees (Associates, Bachelor’s, and/or Master’s) preferred, yet a High School diploma or GED is required. Candidates with some combination of coursework and experience, or else extensive related professional experience, are eligible for considerationCCP preferred.Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to analyze data, draw conclusions and create presentable, understandable reports that will be used for executive decision-makingStrong agility with numbers and highly detail-orientedAbility to take direction but also assertively exercise independent thought and judgmentAbility to perform multiple tasks within a fast-paced, team-oriented and lean environmentLocal travel is required, approximately 25%.Required Experience Job Location  New York, US-NY

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Company: VISITING NURSE SERVICE OF NEW YORK
Description: Overview Visiting Nurse Service of New York (VNSNY) is the nations largest not-for-profit community-based health system. VNSNY provides a comprehensive array of home- and community-based programs, including health plans, tailored to the needs of high-risk, vulnerable New Yorkers, improving their quality of life. Each day,more than 18,000 VNSNY employees including nurses, rehabilitation therapists, social workers, dieticians, other allied professionals, and paraprofessionals deliver compassionate care, unparalleled medical expertise, and 24/7 solutions and resources tomore than35,000 patients, helping them to live the best lives possible. Responsibilities Performs general accounting functions, including the review of financial reports, statistical analysis and budgeting. Designs and delivers management indicator reports and analyzes utilization trends at product and payor levels. Works independently and as part of a Finance team, reporting to the Finance Manager, VNSNY CHOICE. Works under general supervision. Reviews and analyzes monthly financial transactions, ensuring accuracy and completeness of journal entries, makes necessary adjustments as needed, prepares reports of findings and disseminate financial reports to management for review. Interacts with Corporate bank representative along with VNSNY Treasury Specialist to develop new banking process and procedures with third parties and prepares monthly bank reconciliations. Designs and distributes performance indicator reports based on analyses of monthly financial reports and service utilization. Creates new reporting processes as needed to accommodate changes in product distributions, regional expansion, improved accounting applications, etc. Performs specialized case mix variance analysis that incorporates the restatement of non-controllable budgeted statistics (e.g. census by product) to their actual levels. Computes and prepares variance reports for management on a regular basis and consolidates reports with monthly financials to ensure the controls of costs, as required. Utilizes database applications Access and Excel and collaborates with Health Economics to obtain data for various analyses. Prepares annual staffing budget, annual OTPS budget and capital budget. Provides summary analysis and recommendation as appropriate. Acts as an HR liaison for management with regional program directors to prepare monthly staffing ratio reports, FTEs reports, NC capacity reports, and FTE variance reports. Licensure: Certified Public Account (CPA) strongly preferred. Education: Bachelors Degree in Accounting/Finance required. Masters Degree in Business Administration or other related discipline preferred. Experience: Minimum of five years accounting/finance experience in a Managed Care or related organization (for candidates with Masters degree in stated discipline, three years of experience will be considered) required. Knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) required. Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (Access, Excel, PowerPoint, Word) required. Strong quantitative and qualitative analytical skills required. Knowledge of People Soft and Oracle preferred. Experience in a lead or supervisory capacity preferred. CA2018

Name: Asset Management Business Analyst
Description: Asset Management Business Analyst Two Sigma is a financial technology company in SoHo that explores the fascinating intersection of big data, artificial intelligence and finance. We currently manage approximately $57 billion AUM with 1500+ staff spanning New York, London, Houston, Hong Kong, and Tokyo. We apply the scientific method to investment management and are not your typical investment manager. We follow principles of technology and innovation with equal regard to principles of investment management. Fields like machine learning and distributed computing guide us. Since 2001, we have searched for ways that these kinds of technologies can make us better at what we do.  We are looking for a business analyst to build and manage the operating platform of the future for our Asset Management business. Asset Management at Two Sigma leverages the firm’s research, data, and technology-driven approach to provide investment and technology solutions to leading institutional investors globally. This function’s responsibilities will involve both enhancing the current operation of the business as well as designing and implementing a more robust operational foundation for the business to grow upon. Working in conjunction with the Asset Management leadership team, clients, Two Sigma Corporate, Engineering, and Modeling leadership, and service providers on all aspects of the business, s/he will contribute to the development and management of a high quality infrastructure that will scale with a rapidly growing business.  S/he will be responsible for a broad range of management, financial and operations efforts, including the following: Based on the overall growth strategy for the business, support the design and implementation of a long-term operating model (processes, infrastructure, and capabilities) to achieve the required scalability and flexibility in research, portfolio management, trading, portfolio operations and support, and legal / compliance among othersSupport financial planning, budgeting, and performance reporting for Asset Management, which includes presentation of profitability of various business efforts, expense management, performance metrics, resource planning, and long-term forecasting. This effort will require both build-out of business-specific infrastructure as well as coordination with firm wide Financial Planning, Corporate Accounting, HR and Tax functions among othersDevelop and maintain reporting platform to capture both financial and non-financial performance metrics across all research, engineering, and business related functions within Asset Management. This platform will serve as a key tool for strategic decision-making and monitoring progress on critical business initiativesCollaborate with Asset Management leadership on strategic planning and report on progress relative to key business objectivesPartner with internal partners in Corporate for business oversight and support for control functionsQualifications and SkillsBachelor's degree with a strong academic record, preferably in finance, accounting, economics, mathematics, engineering, or related discipline2-5 years of professional growth through positions of increasing responsibility, with operating experience in a highly demanding environment; ideally, but not necessarily, finance or technologyPreferable background of Financial Planning & Analysis, or a Financial Reporting oriented function, with experience in budgeting, p&l reporting, expense & resource management a plusExperience presenting to and creating content for senior managementStrong analytical and conceptual problem solving skills with an ability to translate medium- and long-term business objectives into a robust operating strategy and framework for growing a businessGood business acumen with an ability to see beyond the numbers and identify drivers of performanceExcellent written and verbal communication skills and a collaborative working styleStrong work ethic (takes ownership), self-starter and quick-study mentality; ability to work independently and within a team framework

Name: Data Analyst Intern to Full Time Hire
Description: Type: Paid Intern (in a farm team) Function: Data Analyst Education: BS/BA; MBA or advanced degree in statistics/mathematics preferred Experience: Some exposure to marketing analytics and/or 1:1 marketing Background: Customer analytics, digital analytics, data analysis, business intelligence (BI) reporting, customer segmentation, statistical analysis, modeling, data modeling Company Information: BuyerGenomics is a fully automated customer and prospect management system, enabling robust usage of data in everyday marketing operation ensuring significant growth in business for retailers. It includes, in a fully automated fashion, all data-related marketing functions users can imagine; seamless data ingestion and consolidation, customer-centric database featuring true 360-degree customer view, comprehensive reporting, intuitive segmentation and targeting, as well as user-friendly email campaign functions. BuyerGenomics packs so many features which have been available only to big-time spenders; now small and medium size retailers may get the full benefit of advanced database marketing at a fraction of the cost.  Here at BuyerGenomics, our mission statement is simple: “Make Success Inevitable”. BuyerGenomics accomplishes that mission through data-driven and result-oriented culture that aggressively rewards problem-solving, client relationship building, and thought-leadership. We are looking for “smart creative” minds who can solve problems, synthesize data, and continuously learn new ways to help clients market smarter. Position Description: Going through rapid growth as a startup company, we are currently searching for data analyst interns who can help our clients with reporting and analytics, and gain valuable industry knowledge along the way. While BG offers comprehensive set of reports on all levels, some clients may require further assistance in deriving business insights from them, and from time to time, developing ad hoc reports and solutions to their unique set of challenges.  A successful candidate will have basic knowledge in analytical toolsets and methodologies, working knowledge in various types of data visualization software, excellent verbal and written communication skill, and most importantly, positive attitude and desire to learn new things.  In an intimate startup setting, this position will report to Chief Product Officer, who will also be a primary trainer and a guide. The data analyst will work in our main office in New York City on a daily basis. RequirementsObtain knowledge in client business model, their long and short-term business goals, and unique set of challenges in the context of online and offline 1:1 marketing (some direct interaction with clients may be necessary).Participate in solutioning sessions led by senior members of the company.Assist in procurement of data from various sources and perform data audits.Produce standard and ad hoc reports, in graph or report formats, as required.Help creating client presentations, providing key metrics and backup reports·Interpret analytical results and provide insights; present key findings in a concise manner.Continuously seek for domain and industry best practices and make suggestions.Audit deliverables ensuring accuracy by critically examining the data and reports against requirements.Collaborate with Account Managers and the product development team for product improvements and new features development.Benefits This is a paid internship with potential to possibly become Full Time with benefits for the right candidate.

Name: Business Analyst Associate
Description: TheRole: Business Analyst Associate The Location: London, New York or Denver The Team: With over 20,000 employees working across 95 offices all around the world, the diverse and vibrant community at S&P Global is unlike one youll find anywhere else. This is an opportunity to join the Technology Product Management Team working closely with business stakeholders to define and deliver IT solutions to a variety of business problems in a highly collaborative, agile environment. The Impact: We are in search of a highly motivated Business Analyst who is ready to take their career to the next level in a fast-growing company. Do you love leading technical projects as well as getting in the trenches and working with the team to get the work done? Do you like working with state of the art technology? You will contribute to large complex interdependent project streams, taking a hands-on leadership role within a specific scrum team. You will lead continuous development and improvement of standardized processes within the Agile construct. Coaching, mentoring and leading both IT and business stakeholders on these delivery methods. Whats in it for you: You will be the most senior member of an Agile Scrum team leading them delivering high quality software to internal and external customers. The chance to dig in to complicated technical details surrounding product requirements and specifications. Work with and guide our Product Owners, Software Architects and others to fill in technical gaps in requirements. Contribute to the full project lifecycle from concept through build, to adoption and digital engagement. Build and improve your skills by working with new technologies whilst driving lean and agile processes. Responsibilities:Drive discussions with Champion, Technology Product Owner and Technology Leads to design solutions. Support Product Owner working with multiple Scrum teams to define MVP for delivery within the time constraints provided.Build deep subject matter expertise of products, services, or technologies and content and methodologies offered by S&P Ratings.Lead Agile activities that help drive strategy. Coaching, mentoring and supervising team members on Agile best practices. Utilizing agile metrics data and the ability to provide insight and guidance. Conduct all Scrum activities with the established framework of Agile. Work with multiple teams and promote self-organization.Manages the identification and escalation of risks for Scrum Teams to stakeholders. Facilitates and drives effective Scrum team risk mitigation using formal problem-solving techniques. Manages the effects and impacts of requested changes to established projects, systems and applications.Tailor presentations/communications to varied audiences (i.e. business vs. technical and working group), negotiate and/or build consensus with partners/support organizations.Supports the establishment of new projects by facilitating visioning sessions with business users and producing associated Vision documents. Works with project leadership to support establishment of success metrics for quantifying associated business value for assigned projects. Review final results and recommendations, providing input as needed.Manage roll out and adoption of technical products to internal and external consumers, contribute to the continuous improvement of those processes and artifacts. Manage execution of digital engagement strategies. Provide white glove customer facing support. Support the measurement of user sentiment, and value realization data and KPI's to feed into product roadmaps and backlogs.Act as a regional subject matter expert and advocate analyzing regional jurisdiction business and control differences to ensure solutions designs meet our global user base. Build and develop a regional stakeholder network at all levels, be recognized as a figure head for regional representation on IT matters.What Were Looking For: Candidate should have familiarity and foundational understanding of the below concepts: Use Judgment based on practice and precedence to accurately define problems by trying to understand underlying factors/causes.Proposing, implementing, and evaluating technical solutions to business problemsStrong writing, conceptualization, and analytic skillsStrong interpersonal skills Well developed communication and diplomacy skills to exchange complex informationAbility to form questions and hypothesis about long-term strategy of business and follow through with technical solutionsManaging the Scrum processAgile story writingData Analysis / Basic SQLIt is beneficial is the candidate has experience with the below:Workflow/BPMCommercial customer facing productsBig Data, Data Science, Data Governance, Content ManagementRisk & RegulatoryChange ManagementDigital customer engagement and outreachDigital Training Development/DesignBasic Qualifications:BA/BS degree in a related area such as finance, economics, information technology, or businessRequired 3+ years of related professional experience (BA, QA or management consulting)Preferred Qualifications:Preferred 3+ years experience in a financial industry/financial servicesScrum Master or Agile certificationLean Management / Six Sigma CertificationStrong understanding of the following:  Equity and Corporate Credit Analysis; Structured Finance; Ratings Process; Finance/AccountingAbout S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the worlds leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide.  S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings  S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.  If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.  The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.

Name: Business Development Analyst
Description: About Aaptiv  Aaptiv is the fastest growing mobile fitness product on the market with a community of nearly 200,000 members and is backed by leading venture capital firms and top companies, including the Amazon Alexa Fund and Disney.  With a mission to empower everyone to live a healthier life, Aaptiv has transformed the way people exercise and train through its innovative audio fitness classes. Every Aaptiv class combines the guiding voice of an expert Aaptiv trainer with motivating music by top artists in every genre. Aaptiv members have unlimited, on-demand access to over 2,500 classes and structured programs across every type of exercise and a wide variety of activities, including running, strength-training, yoga, indoor cycling, meditation, and more.  Want to join Team Aaptiv? We're looking for team members who are passionate about building a world-class fitness experience. There are over 80 million Americans who value fitness - and we believe every one of them should be an Aaptiv user. About the Role Aaptiv is seeking a Business Development Associate to work closely with the company's Business Development leadership across the entire strategic partnership deal funnel. This role will work very closely with the CEO, SVP of Corporate Development and the VP of Business Development on strategic partnerships and with the General Counsel on music licensing negotiations. The candidate will be tasked with fielding partnership pitches, structuring deal terms, executing partnership P&L models, developing pitch and proposal materials, reviewing and synthesizing agreements, and supporting the deal process to completion. The role will begin with a strong focus on deal flow project management, and the successful candidate will gradually grow into sourcing and managing his or her own deals. The candidate should have both strong analytical skills and comfort building and managing financial models and spreadsheets, as well as strong creative problem-solving skills -- specifically around innovating new partnership models, and adjusting levers to make deal structures work for both sides. He or she should have strong written and verbal communication skills, and be able to both draft high quality presentations and make verbal arguments that successfully persuade senior executives. Familiarity with and a strong passion for digital content businesses, digital marketing and partnerships are required, and direct experience in such fields is a strong plus.  What You'll Do Responsible for fielding partner pitches and developing deal proposalsEnsure that the strategic partnership deal pipeline moves forward expeditiously, and supports that process by developing the necessary proposal and negotiation materialsAnalyze expected economic benefit of potential partnerships and run analysis and build models to inform negotiation and deal economicsSupport the SVP of Corporate Development and the General Counsel on Aaptiv's music licensing efforts -- specifically in developing and running deal economics analysesParticipate with Business Development leadership on target and channel brainstormingAs available, initiate outreach and partnership prospect developmentWork in a project leadership capacity across marketing, creative, audio, growth, product, finance and engineering to deliver partner programsSupport account management to track and evaluate performance for each partnership Who You Are Bachelor's DegreeAdvanced degree (i.e., JD, MBA) a plus, but not required2+ years experience in finance and/or strategy consultingExtreme fluency in excel and powerpoint / keynoteOutstanding interpersonal and communication skills, particularly in building relationships and influencing internal and external stakeholdersAbility to manage diverse personalities and difficult situations with graceExceptional ability to structure ambiguous and elusive problems and solve them systematicallyStrong analytical and creative problem-solving skillsA strong passion for and understanding of digital content / media businesses and consumer partnershipsFamiliarity with mobile consumer tech, consumer marketing businesses, digital subscription businesses and customer acquisition strategyKnowledge of and passion for the fitness and wellness industries a plus It is the policy of Aaptiv to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Aaptiv will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: At Fareportal, we create the technology that is driving innovation in the travel industry - one of the worlds fastest-growing sectors. Our employees are the core of our organization and together were revolutionizing the way people book travel.  Our portfolio of brands including CheapOair and OneTravel receive over 100 million visitors annually and drive over $4 billion in annual revenue.  In addition to competitive pay and benefits, generous time off, and frequent company-wide social events, Fareportal provides employees with an environment that nurtures diversity, creativity, and success. Our open and Agile workspace gives our employees the time and space for collaboration, brainstorming, and research and development. At Fareportal, youll be challenged, rewarded, and motivated to work effectively day in and day out. Position Description We are seeking a Business Intelligence Analystto analyze trends in our business and empower the company with data to drive opportunities and growth. As part of the Business Intelligence team, the analyst will have the opportunity to work with diverse areas of the business along with many types of data. This role requires a candidate with a proven history of proactively addressing unasked questions through data and presenting recommendations to improve the business, systems, and processes. The role also requires the ability to work well with stakeholders such as product owners or marketers to interpret business cases and translate them to data analysis. Responsibilities: Generally, the analyst will be responsible for providing analysis support to internal stakeholders to drive strategic objectives. The role will leverage multiple databases, analyze the data, and create finished products in the form of dashboard visualizations and recommendations. Key responsibilities include:Analyze data from a variety of sources using database querying toolsVisualize and automate data to generate insights and to help improve the businessSupport a wide variety of departments and product teamsMinimum Requirements: 3 to 5years of work experience with business intelligence or other data analysis rolesBachelors degree in Computer Science or Information TechnologyStrong experience with relational databases and querying such as Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, or MySQLExperience working with business stakeholders as well as data analystsVisualization tools such as Power BI or TableauMS ExcelGoogle Analytics or similar website analysis toolsExperience in digital or e-commerce industriesCritical thinking and problem solvingPreferred But Not Required:Data modeling, validation, and statistical analysisPython or RGoogle BigQuery
