Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Senior Business Analyst REF#: 32584 CBS BUSINESS UNIT: CBS Corporate JOB TYPE: Full-Time Staff JOB SCHEDULE: Full-Time JOB LOCATION: New York, NY ABOUT US: CBS was established in 1928, when founder William Paley purchased 16 independent radio stations and christened them the Columbia Broadcast System. Today, with more than 200 television stations and affiliates reaching virtually every home in the United States, CBS's total network lineup was watched by more than 110 million people a week during the 2017/2018 season. CBS has been the #1 network in primetime for 10 consecutive seasons. The network has the #1 comedy/scripted program, THE BIG BANG THEORY; #1 newsmagazine, 60 MINUTES; #l late night program, THE LATE SHOW WITH STEPHEN COLBERT and #1 daytime drama, THE YOUNG AND THE RESTLESS. Its programming arms include CBS Entertainment, CBS News and CBS Sports. DESCRIPTION: The Sr. Business Analyst will be responsible for defining, analyzing and documenting, user requirements, procedures, problems and leading joint design efforts to offer a new solution or value proposition to customers, automate processing or to improve existing business processes and associated information systems. The Sr. Business Analyst will also be responsible for defining the appropriate methodologies and best practices for performing business analysis and design in the support of core organizational functions and business processes. Responsibilities: Solicits client requirements through interviews, workshops and/or existing systems documentation or procedures. Evaluates business requirements for applications and systems integration and service activation, while delivering new or modified software systems enhancements and/or integration solutions. Conducts reviews of and analyzes business and information technology processes and prepares essential groundwork for the development of systems. Participates in the definition, testing, training, implementation and support of system requirements. Identifies customer requirements, develops test schedules, reviews testing plans, tracks and documents the development and results of these plans. Alerts manager to potential risks and issues of importance. Uncovers client requirements via industry standard analysis techniques such as Data Flow and Object Modeling, Case Analysis, Workflow Analysis, and Functional Decomposition Analysis Ensures requirements are understood, agreed to and signed off at the appropriate early stages in a project. Provides analysis of processes and workflows with suggestions for improvement. Identifies areas where technology can lead to increased efficiency and productivity. Understands the functions supported by the current systems. Understand and accommodate the requirement constraints imposed by the current systems. Provides detailed analysis resulting in clear, concise and unambiguous system requirements. Requirements analysis will undergo multiple iterations and refinements. Documents detailed use cases that cover all alternate and exception flows. Supplements use cases with real world scenarios. Provides UI mock-ups. Leads design discussions and identifies design options. Provides user documentation and training for the system. Must be available for on call support nights and weekends. Interacts with others in the business and IT organization. Works with providers of software and hardware products as well as consulting vendor service providers Prioritize assignments in a high visibility mission critical system Establish and oversee the customer's initial adoption, training and development of best practices to build a strong foundation before and during initial roll outs Troubleshoot issues quickly and appropriately by identifying immediate remediation, determining root cause, and coordinating long term solution. QUALIFICATIONS: Required: A minimum of five years of business analysis experience with previous supervision or project management experience a strong plus Demonstrated track record of defining systems that lead to increased efficiency and productivity through the use of technology Documented experience with SDLC methodology and process related to Business Analysis Excellent analytical, communication (both verbal and written), facilitation/organizational skills Strategic, innovative thinking and vision Strong persuasion skills Strong business acumen Excellent analytical and communication (both verbal and written) skills Solid understanding of technology Comfortable learning, using and explaining new technology Strong organization and time management skills  Experience with BOX, Slack and Salesforce required #DICE #LI-PS1 Preferred: EEO STATEMENT: Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled - provided by DiceAnalysis, Analyst, Business Analyst, Business Requirements, CASE, Consulting, Development, Foundation, Hardware, HTML, Manager, Management, Modeling, Programming, Project, Project Management, SalesForce, SDLC, Supervision, Testing, UPS

Name: ITS Business Analyst
Description: Position summaryDeloitte Services LP includes internal support areas such as Marketing and Communications, Human Resources/Talent, Information Technology, Facilities Management, and Financial Support Services.ITS Business AnalystAre you passionate about technology and interested in joining a community of collaborative colleagues who respectfully and courageously seek to challenge the status quo? If so, read on to learn more about an exciting opportunity with Deloitte’s Information Technology Services (ITS). We are insatiably curious and life-long learners focused on technology and innovation.Work you’ll doIn this interesting and diverse role, you’ll support the development of technology priorities and strategy and the creation of strategic reporting, dashboards, and presentations across the Technology and Infrastructure organization, where you will:Develop executive level communications and presentations to display and communicate strategic ideas and plans from initial storyboarding to logical structuringPerform Executive level administrative tasks, such as preparing strategic meeting agendas, taking meeting minutes, tracking action items, etc.Perform research and analysis and provide subject matter expertise on technology trends for key capabilities, such as infrastructure, security, DevOps, cost modelsCoordinate and facilitate strategy discussions with senior leadersDevelop cost strategies and identify opportunities for optimization and cost savingsWork directly with senior organization leaders to drive successful completion of effortsIndependently analyze and craft execution plans to delegated problems, issues and escalationsThe teamInformation Technology Services (ITS) helps power Deloitte’s success. ITS is the engine that helps to drive Deloitte, which serves many of the world’s largest organizations. We develop and deploy cutting-edge internal and go-to-market solutions that help Deloitte operate effectively and lead in the market. Our reputation is built on a tradition of delivering with excellence.The ~2,200 professionals in ITS deliver services internally including:Cyber securityTechnology supportTechnology & InfrastructureApplication development and managementRelationship management groupStrategyDeploymentPMOFinancialsCommunicationsFor more information on ITS, you can visit our dedicated recruitment page at https://usrecruiting.deloitte.com/-its-recruiting-for-experienced-hires.Technology & InfrastructureThe Technology and Infrastructure Organization works together to transform how ITS deploys technologies and services to meet the dynamic needs of Deloitte professionals and help increase their productivity.QualificationsRequired:Bachelor’s Degree or higher in a business or technology related fieldMinimum 1-3 years of experience in technology strategy, technology operating models, technology organization design, budget analysisWell versed within technology strategy in a global organization, with a focus on cloud strategyKnowledge and/or experience with core technology and infrastructure capabilities (Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), hosting services (IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS), DevOps, security, application development and management, and innovation)Strong business communication skills (written and verbal), including ability to effectively present issues, ideas, and solutions, in a logical and articulate mannerAdvanced PowerPoint and Excel skillsAbility to communicate complex technology concepts to a business audienceAbility to take a project from inception (idea stage), and organize a plan to deliver the final working solution. Leads and manages all aspects of the projectBroad understanding of current business trends and industry practicesAbility to work in a fast-paced environment, manage several deliverables simultaneously with different stakeholders. Proactive and results-oriented is a mustTravel is limited and typically 10% – 20%Preferred:Knowledge and/or experience with Agile project deliveryExperience with graphic design tools, such as Adobe IllustratorFinance/Accounting degree or trainingHow you’ll growAt Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.BenefitsAt Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.Deloitte’s cultureOur positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.Corporate citizenshipDeloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.Recruiter tipsWe want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.As used in this posting, “Deloitte” means Deloitte Services LP, a subsidiary of Deloitte LLP. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.  Deloitte will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws. See notices of various ban-the-box laws where available. https://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/careers/articles/ban-the-box-notices.html Requisition code: E19NATSASCLJ058-ITL4

Name: Technical Business Systems Analyst
Description: As a Technical Business Systems Analyst, you will analyze business requirements and review/produce documented and approved specifications for any new/change to technology applications. You will analyze the impact of proposed solutions holistically, develop use cases to explain business requirements to Development teams, and contribute a business or process perspective during design reviews.  In addition, you will analyze data of our third party partners to find patterns and trends, then work with Development, Product, and Support teams to create stories for additional functionality, advanced reporting, and enhanced monitoring.  Finally, you will assist the Quality Management Team to ensure that documented requirements and corresponding use cases / process flows can be easily translated into test plans and test cases, and ensure that the testing process covers all identified scenarios and use cases. You will triage defects and bugs related to assigned projects in a timely manner considering project timelines. Key Responsibilities: ? Analyze business requirements to understand the business needs and to determine how systems and applications can best functionally fulfill those needs  ? Combine business and systems knowledge to create a functional design and write user stories for a given application  ? Analyze data lake Production logs for trends, patterns, and anomalies  ? Use machine learning to automate detection of new behavior of our third party partners  ? Conduct in-depth research to determine if solutions to business requirements currently exist within or outside the business unit, and if not, whether new effective solutions are feasible  ? Analyze impact of proposed solution to develop use cases to demonstrate the business requirements to the Development team and Quality Assurance team Qualifications: ? BS/BA degree or equivalent experience  ? 2-5 years of experience as a Technical Business Systems Analyst on enterprise wide projects  ? Understanding of business modelling concepts and business application development  ? Strong experience in Agile SDLC, and TDD and BDD environment  ? Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including the ability to write clear and concise functional and technical specifications and detailed user stories  ? Strong ability to multi-task effectively, working on several projects simultaneously  ? Excellent analytical skills with ability to analyze complex system requirements and present findings to both internal and external stakeholders  ? Experience with data analytics Preferred Skills: ? Knowledge / experience using JIRA and Blueprint  ? Good understanding of the defect management and resolution process using defect management tools like HP ALM  ? Experience with Splunk or Kibana  ? Knowledge of machine learning and data mining  ? Ability to easily assimilate information and learn new applications and processes  ? Experience in financial / banking industry  Our Consumer & Community Banking Group depends on innovators like you to serve nearly 66 million consumers and over 4 million small businesses, municipalities and non-profits. You?ll support the delivery of award winning tools and services that cover everything from personal and small business banking as well as lending, mortgages, credit cards, payments, auto finance and investment advice. This group is also focused on developing and delivering cutting edged mobile applications, digital experiences and next generation banking technology solutions to better serve our clients and customers  When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you?re not just working at a global financial institution. You?re an integral part of one of the world?s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.  At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we?re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you?re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.  JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.

Name: Business Analyst - Reference Data

The Business Analysts will conduct data lineage tests and construct a centralized data hierarchy. A key component of the data lineage project is to validate front to back traceability for in-scope attributes with real data across multiple departments.  GM/IHC CDO Ref Data team is looking to hire a Project Manager for end-to-end project managing Product/Instrument Reference Data focused deliverables within Reference Data Workstream. Project delivery will be focused on changes to existing business processes, controls & governance enhancements, data and infrastructure enhancements in support of overall IHC Data Strategy. Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Sr. Business Analyst, Saggezza — New York, NYWhat’s the role? Saggezza is a technology consulting organization that helps that helps companies embrace cutting-edge solutions and improvements. As consultants, developers, and analyst we help our clients adapt and transform the way in which they do business.  Saggezza is seeking experienced Business Analyst to join our team and work with one of our investment banking clients in New York, NY. Every project will be different, but you’ll always be responsible for:Formulating, define systems scope and objectives based on user needs and a thorough understanding of business, systems and industry requirementsSolid understanding of payments systems and payments market infrastructure specially for FedWirePartnering with product owners and development teams to understand solution design, related deliverables and definition of “done”Documenting business requirements to ensure applicability to business areas, ensuring that requirements/user stories are in a consumable stateWhat you’ll definitely need:Minimum 7 years of relevant industry experience as a business analyst on payment platformsStrong understanding and knowledge of FedWire systemsExperience with leading Agile development projects, with experience being active participant through all phases in an Agile development environmentUnderstanding of US and International wire payment/transfer systems including, ACH, SWIFT, CHAPS, SEPA, etc.Knowledge of financial services industryIn depth knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) with understanding of various phases such as requirements, analysis/design and developmentExperience in Financial Services or FintechProficiency in standard office software, such as MS Office, Visio, MS Access, etc.Knowledge of the business goals, objectives and business operations for the group or line of businessWhat we’d love you to have:Excellent analytical, decision-making, problem-solving, interpersonal, team, customer service, negotiation, conflict management and time management skillsOutstanding oral and written communication skills with ability to present complex information to effectively educate and influence othersEnergetic, self-directed and self-motivated Don’t check all the boxes? Don’t worry about it: we still want to hear from you if you think you’re the right person for the job. Why join our team?Work on major software projects for FTSE 500 companiesWork directly with our clients’ C-level executives from day oneWe’re growing — fast. Come on board for the chance to grow with usEnjoy an agile and collaborative culture as part of a team of likeminded individualsWe have offices across North America, Europe, and India, which means global opportunities for career advancementTravel and work on-site with some of the world’s biggest companies Have you found us through our Saggezza Careers site? If not, take a look to find out more about life at Saggezza in each of our locations. Saggezza is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer: We believe in treating each employee and applicant for employment fairly and with dignity. We base our employment decisions on merit, experience, and potential, without regard to race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, religion, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic prohibited by federal, state or local law.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: Tech Valley Talent, a woman-owned business located in upstate NY, is looking for a Sr. Business Analyst for a long term contract position with our client in NYC. Work week is 37.5 hours. No 3rd parties please. Phone interviews will be followed up by face to face interviews in NYC. Jo b Summary Our client is undergoing a major modernization of their business applications and is seeking a Senior Business Analyst (SBA) within their Information Technology department to play a key role in this effort, which will include the implementation of ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) and other COTS (Commercial off-the-shelf) solutions, as well as, custom systems. The SBA must have extensive experience in the areas of process design and systems analysis. The SBA will work closely with project managers, IT staff, program staff and other stakeholders to define and develop requirements for new business processes and existing information technology systems. The SBA will apply a range of specialized skills and tools to complete the following specific duties and responsibilities: The SBA will use their extensive knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and business analysis best practices to facilitate requirements sessions and communicate clearly and effectively with end-users, applications developers, senior business managers and other team members. The SBA will be accountable for providing coordination to ensure the appropriate collection of data; documentation of information; and presentation of findings. The SBA will provide documentation and flow-charts of the organization's work flow, as well as ad-hoc query support and report creation. The SBA must have strong technical knowledge and understanding of IT systems and applications as well as the ability to plan and track business analyses activities as part of a project. The SBA also must have good listening skills and interviewing skills to talk with individuals and groups about their needs and ask the right questions to surface essential requirements information. The ideal candidate will also possess good writing skills to ensure effective communicate of information to customers, marketing, managers, and technical staff. Responsibilities Include (but not limited to): Conduct research and elicit business requirements from key stakeholders by using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, storyboards, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, event lists, business analysis, competitive product analysis, task and workflow analysis, and/or viewpoints. Analyze business and user needs, document requirements, and revise existing system logic as necessary under direction of Project Managers. Represent requirements using alternative views, such as analysis models (diagrams), prototypes, use case analysis or scenarios, where appropriate. Develop or modify procedures to solve complex problems within information systems. Work with Project Manager to monitor and document post-implementation problems and revision requests to ensure it meets end user needs; in addition to, providing project management without a dedicated PM, when needed. Create and revise flow charts, process models, and technical specifications. Assist with the business planning and writing business cases. Research and evaluate packaged software and online services to determine their appropriateness for Agency use. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree; MBA or relevant technical degree preferred. A strong background in technology, analysis and critically evaluating information gathered from multiple sources. Experience decomposing high-level information into details, distinguishing user requests from the underlying true needs, and developing solution ideas from requirements. Strong experience writing business requirements documentation (BRDs) and functional requirements documentation (FRDs). Proven experience successfully working in a team setting and ability to reconcile conflicts. Minimum seven 7-10 years of experience in related professional business/project analyst capacity. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Experience in the housing and financial sector is preferred and a major plus, especially around accounting, bonds, mortgages, underwriting, loans origination and servicing; in addition to, experience around grants, tax credits, property/buildings asset management and compliance reporting. Experience with ProLink HFA 3 rd party affordable housing software is a plus. Experience with COTS (Commercial off-the-shelf)/ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning), e.g. PeopleSoft, SAP or Microsoft Dynamics is a plus. Excellent experience with MS Office 2013/2016 and above as well as design tools and flowcharting tools, e.g. Visio. Knowledge of SQL as well as familiarity of .NET and web technologies is a plus. It is Tech Valley Talent's policy to provide for and promote equal employment opportunity in employment compensation and other terms and conditions of employment without discrimination based on age, race, creed, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, Vietnam Era Veteran status, genetic predisposition, pregnancy-related conditions or carrier status. - provided by DiceSr. Business Analyst

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: At Fareportal, we create the technology that is driving innovation in the travel industry - one of the worlds fastest-growing sectors. Our employees are the core of our organization and together were revolutionizing the way people book travel.  Our portfolio of brands including CheapOair and OneTravel receive over 100 million visitors annually and drive over $4 billion in annual revenue.  In addition to competitive pay and benefits, generous time off, and frequent company-wide social events, Fareportal provides employees with an environment that nurtures diversity, creativity, and success. Our open and Agile workspace gives our employees the time and space for collaboration, brainstorming, and research and development. At Fareportal, youll be challenged, rewarded, and motivated to work effectively day in and day out.  Fareportal is looking for a Sr. Business Analyst to help lead analysis on expansion opportunities, customer behavior, competitive positioning, etc. to help develop a long-term corporate strategy for the firm. This person will report through the CEO squad, giving them unique access to learning from the executive team. If you are high performing, driven, willing to learn and excited about travel, this is the perfect opportunity for you to be groomed into a senior leader at this firm. [At this time we are unable to sponsor for this role]Responsibilities:Work collaboratively across functions to identify areas of potential growth (e.g., within core businesses, organic expansions into adjacencies, strategic acquisitions)Perform analysis of highest growth opportunity areas to determine where to play (e.g., analyses around market growth, competitor positioning, customer behavior, etc.)Support key leaders in strategic planning around growth area to determine how to win (e.g., defining strategic choices, financial forecasting/modeling, etc.)Identify/prioritize areas of highest potential and help to scope out the work required to execute on those opportunitiesClearly communicate areas of opportunity, key priorities, and work plan to executives so we can align them to actionSupport execute leaders in mobilizing and execution of expansion plans (e.g., program management, setting/tracking metrics, developing roadmaps, defining RACIs, creating process maps, etc.)Help executive leaders stitch together the expansion opportunities into a holistic longer-term corporate strategyMaintain a clear understanding of the changing competitive landscape and customer behavior to support executive team in shifting strategies as requiredSupport in ad hoc strategic analyses and projects for key functions/executives on an as needed basisSupport the CEO in tracking performance against key performance indicators (KPIs) across the organizationAssist in creating and rolling out training programs, communication cascade plans, and change management plansMust become a jack of all trades, maintaining flexibility to plug in wherever the need arises across the firmRequirements:Undergraduate degree, preferably in finance, business administration discipline, STEM, or similar fieldMBA preferred4+ years of experience working as a business analysis or business consultant.Results-oriented, self-driven individual with the ability to manage complex projects that require cross-functional buy-inStrong analytical skills, financial acumen, and nose for business valueAdvanced Excel skills required; Experience with SQL, Python, R, Power BI preferredExcellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to create an effective executive level presentation to drive actionDetail-oriented individualBasic understanding of agile methodologyWhat we offer:Unique opportunity to work with and learn from senior executivesOpportunity to move vertically and horizontally across the organization depending on business need a performanceFlexible work hoursMedical, dental and vision benefitsFlexible spending accountsTravel benefitsTeam outingsCorporate discountsBreakfast bar

Name: Business Analyst - Senior
Description: TheRole: Business Analyst - Senior The Location: London, New York or Denver The Team: With over 20,000 employees working across 95 offices all around the world, the diverse and vibrant community at S&P Global is unlike one youll find anywhere else. This is an opportunity to join the Technology Product Management Team working closely with business stakeholders to define and deliver IT solutions to a variety of business problems in a highly collaborative, agile environment. The Impact: We are in search of a highly motivated individual who is ready to take their career to the next level in a fast-growing company. Do you love defining solutions to complex business problems as well as getting in the trenches and working with the team to get the work done? Do you like working with state of the art technology? Whats in it for you: You will be a leading member of an Agile Scrum team accountable for delivering high quality software to internal and external customers. The chance to dig in to complicated technical details surrounding product requirements and specifications. Work with and guide our Product Owners, Software Architects and others to fill in technical gaps in requirements. Contribute to the full project lifecycle from concept through build to adoption and digital engagement. Build and improve your skills by working with new technologies whilst driving lean and agile processes. Responsibilities:Work with Champion, Technology Product Owner and Technology Leads to propose solutions and work with their Scrum team to define MVP for delivery within the time constraints provided.Build knowledge and expertise of products, services, or technologies and content and methodologies offered by S&P Ratings.Work independently with little or no supervision on Agile activities. Monitoring team members on Agile best practices. Conduct all Scrum activities with the established framework of Agile.Build knowledge of business requirements, data models, user interfaces and navigation specifications that bridge business need with systems design/deliverables.Tailor presentations/communications to varied audiences (i.e. business vs. technical and working group), negotiate and/or build consensus with partners/support organizations.Play the role of Scrum Master for their Scrum team, drive creation of backlog of scope in alignment to overall project goals, facilitate Scrum activities, driving towards highly optimized collaboration by promoting self-organization.Lead solution design and estimation activities as a SME representative of the scrum team.Manage roll out and adoption of technical products to internal and external consumers, contribute to the continuous improvement of those processes and artifacts. Manage execution of digital engagement strategies. Provide white glove customer facing support. Support the measurement of user sentiment, and value realization data and KPI's to feed into product roadmaps and backlogs.Act as a regional subject matter expert analyzing regional jurisdiction business and control differences to ensure solutions designs meet our global user base.What Were Looking For: Candidate should have familiarity and foundational understanding of the below concepts: Use Judgment based on practice and precedence to accurately define problems by trying to understand underlying factors/causes.Proposing, implementing, and evaluating technical solutions to business problemsStrong writing, conceptualization, and analytic skillsStrong interpersonal skills Well developed communication and diplomacy skills to exchange complex informationAbility to form questions and hypothesis about long-term strategy of business and follow through with technical solutionsManaging the Scrum processAgile story writingData Analysis / Basic SQLIt is beneficial is the candidate has experience with the below:Workflow/BPMCommercial customer facing productsBig Data, Data Science, Data Governance, Content ManagementRisk & RegulatoryChange ManagementDigital customer engagement and outreachDigital Training Development/DesignBasic Qualifications:BA/BS degree in a related area such as finance, economics, information technology, or businessRequired 3+ years of related professional experience (BA, QA or management consulting)Preferred Qualifications:Preferred 3+ years experience in a financial industry/financial servicesScrum Master or Agile certificationLean Management / Six Sigma CertificationDemonstrated understanding of the following: Equity and Corporate Credit Analysis; Structured Finance; Ratings Process; Finance/AccountingAbout S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the worlds leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide.  S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings  S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.  If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.  The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.

Name: Business Analyst/ Project Manager
Description: Job DescriptionJob Title: Business Analyst/ Project Manager  Brokerage is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Brokerage can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.Department ProfileThe Business Entitlements Program was established in 2017 to provide governance and support to improve the quality of access management controls. Business Entitlements are a fundamental control which helps protect the Firm against fraud as well as cyber-attacks. Due to the complexity of the environment and increasing risk associated with system access, the Firm needs to ensure business controls continue to evolve in line with technology. Business unit participation and ownership is critical to enhancing and enforcing the controls. The Business Entitlements Program Office is responsible for driving business unit engagement and accountability in strengthening the access management controls.The Program is sponsoring a number of new initiatives which will require a culture change across the Firm. Historically, access management was seen as the purview of the IT security organization and the IT development teams which build and support the systems. There is growing recognition that business teams need to play a greater role in managing entitlements.  Background on the Team  The Business Entitlements program team works closely with Access Management Technology and Operations within Tech and Info Risk. The Business and Data Analyst will report to the Business Entitlements Program Office Lead. Primary Responsibilities:Evaluate processes associated with access management controls to define business and control requirements and identify areas for improvementDesign and document new processesPerform process and control gap analysis and develop plans to close gapsDefine and document requirements for data analytics and reporting platformPerform complex data analytics on access patterns, usage and rightsConduct meetings and workshops with key stakeholder from business and risk officer communities to understand business needsWork with internal clients to review data analysis and determine next steps to remediate access-related risksManage small projects Skills required (essential) Possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills, ability to communicate at all levels and between technology and the businessProcess designStrong project managementAbility to derive insights from large data setsStrong presentation skills, including materials development and face-to-face deliveryExcellent organizational and planning skillsUnderstanding of IT risk and controls domainAdvanced MS Excel skillsSelf-directedSkills desired:Understanding of access management controls a plus

Name: Business Analyst, Reporting
Description: Job DescriptionGENERAL PURPOSE: As a member of the Business Information team, the Business Analyst will play an important business facing role. In this role, he/she will work directly with our business partners gathering data/reporting requirements, working with our IT partners in determining the best solution and supporting the testing and delivery process. The Business Analyst will also support the full BI Request Management process and will follow the requests from submission to delivery. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Information Management Gain a solid understanding of the business reports and tools.  Develop an understanding of the strengths/limitations of the various tools and technologies available. Suggest alternate methods of data presentation.  Gather and document business requirements for report and data requests.  Leverage the available reporting tools; confirm the data integrity via thorough testing.  Lead creation and review of all test-related deliverables including test approach, test scenarios, test cases/conditions, scripts and results.  Routinely manage user acceptance testing for moderately complex projects and obtain sign-off from the business.  Develop training materials and job aides to support reporting rollouts.  Identify and mitigate any project related risks. Experience with VAT configuration and functionality across all modules.- Develop and deploy new processes and configuration to meet business needs- Provide support, implement fixes and additional functionality-Analyze data and processes to identify/troubleshoot problems, and recommend preventive action- Proactively provide status on all activities to appropriate stakeholders- Follow applicable standards, procedures, guidelines, and methodologies in the support and/or maintenance of systems- Continually strive to enhance or improve business systems processes that drive efficiency through use of best practices- Develop procedures, processes and guidelines that are efficient and focused on the quality of the process or end state deliverable- Develop functional design specifications in support of existing and new application requirements- Collaborate with various teams to evaluate design alternatives, optimize design solution and minimize impact to performance- Develop and execute functional unit test cases in support of new application requirements- Work with cross functional teams to perform test activities (e.g. integration, performance, user acceptance)- Ability to coordinate with offshore teams and manage handoffs with an onsite / offshore model What You Need for this Position Qualifications:- 8+ years of hands on experience with SAP AP, FA, AR, Projects and GL systems.- Proven ability to work directly with business leads to define business processes- Excellent Finance, Accounting reporting and planning experience.- Ability to coordinate with offshore teams and manage handoffs with an onsite / offshore model- Recent experience of working in a support organization in a leadership capacity.- Thorough understanding of the integration across SAP modules.- Demonstrated understanding of all aspects of a full life cycle implementation and production support- Excellent written and oral communications skills; ability to lead discussions, present ideas to audiences of all sizes, and interact with all levels of the organization- Strong solution skills with demonstrated ability to analyze and provide effective problem solving, assessing whether standard functionality can be used and identifying reasonable custom solutions where needed- Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to relate well and cooperate with others to effectively coordinate activities and accomplish goals- Experience leading and managing project team members and deliverables- Proficiency with the Microsoft Office SuiteEducation / Licenses / Certificates:- Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or related field- CPA a plus.More Than 5 Years of experience and knowledge of:- SAP S/4 Hana- FI/CO- VAT configuration- Financial Systems- AP FA AR GL- Application Requirements- Leadership- functional unit test- ABAP- PO/PI What's In It for You -Work within a small brilliant team-Competitive base salary -Bonus plan-Comprehensive Benefits programWork is mentally stimulating and will work within a small team at our stable and prestigious company in NYC!  So, if you are a Lead / SAP Senior Systems Business Analyst with finance experience, please apply today!  - Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Name: Claims Reporting Analyst, (CHOICE)
Company: VISITING NURSE SERVICE OF NEW YORK
Description: Overview Visiting Nurse Service of New York (VNSNY) is the nations largest not-for-profit community-based health system. VNSNY provides a comprehensive array of home- and community-based programs, including health plans, tailored to the needs of high-risk, vulnerable New Yorkers, improving their quality of life. Each day,more than 18,000 VNSNY employees including nurses, rehabilitation therapists, social workers, dieticians, other allied professionals, and paraprofessionals deliver compassionate care, unparalleled medical expertise, and 24/7 solutions and resources tomore than35,000 patients, helping them to live the best lives possible. Created in 1998, VNSNY CHOICE is the managed care affiliate of the Visiting Nurse Service of New York and shares its mission of compassion and care for the poor, the chronically ill and elderly. Our guiding principle is to help the most vulnerable among us live safely and independently for as long as possible in their own homes and communities. VNSNY CHOICE has 700 employees, including 227 care management staff. On any given day, VNSNY CHOICE coordinates care for more than 40,000 members through its array of Medicare and Medicaid health plans, including Medicaid Long Term Care, Medicare Advantage, and a HIV/Special Needs Plan. With offices in Manhattan, Brooklyn and upstate New York, VNSNY CHOICE health plans are available in the New York City metropolitan area as well as on a plan basis in selected counties throughout New York State. Responsibilities Supports claims analytical reporting, dashboard creation and automation of processes for the Service Operations department. Assists department management with tracking implementation and monitoring effectiveness of organizational changes, including designing analytical approaches, data collection and analysis, report writing, tracking project tasks, and helping to ensure the overall success of the department. Works under direct supervision. Key responsibilities: Develops and distributes regular management reports and any requests for special, ad hoc reporting or claims data. Develops positive working relationships with VNSNY CHOICE leadership. Develops an understanding of VNSNY CHOICE strategic business objectives and business unit operations, along a particular health plan value stream. Articulates business issues and designs data collection methodologies. Provides data collection and analytical support to team and monitors projects led by Service Operations team.Summarizes, creates, and distributes reports as needed. Education: Bachelors Degree in Business or related discipline or the equivalent work experience required. Bachelors Degree in Business Administration, Public Administration or related field preferred. Experience: Minimum one year work experience in consulting, operations or financial analysis, Claims analytics or related discipline required. Proficient with personal computers, including Microsoft Windows Excel, Word, Access, Power Point, Facets and (Altruista) Guiding care required. Demonstrated understanding of NYS, CMS and Medicaid reimbursement guidelines. APG, APC, DRG required. Experience with SQL preferred. CA2018

Name: Senior Consultant, Mergers and Acquisitions (IT)
Description: Senior Consultant, Mergers and Acquisitions (IT)  1700 Broadway, Suite 1400  New York, New York, 10019  United States West Monroe isn't a start-up consulting firm, but we act like one.  From day one, our people have the opportunity to make a definitive personal impact for their clients and their careers. What does this mean? It means we seek out the best of the best, and then we challenge them to make us better. Think you're up to the challenge? Our Mergers and Acquisitions Practice (M&A) is seeking a Senior Consultant to join our rapidly growing team. In this dynamic role, you will work with our national M&A practice servicing both corporate and private equity clients, which includes leading operational and technology assessments during the due diligence phase, planning as part of the carve-out or merger integration transactions, and post-close execution management (e.g. IMO).  Senior Consultants in our Mergers & Acquisitions practice have these primary responsibilities:  · Participate on teams serving clients across industries (with specific capabilities in mergers & acquisitions), while demonstrating executive presence with C-level client counterparts  · Facilitate due diligence site visits focused on identifying operational and technology strategy, organizational structures, and current state business processes and supporting technology  · Assess operational and technology investment strategies and compare respective operating models and organizational structures against leading practices and industry benchmarks  · Lead engagement teams on transaction advisory, guiding the team to prepare focused request lists and agenda, facilitating on-site reviews, and providing leadership over deliverables  · Work with engagement leadership to implement operational processes and technology that support value creation and process efficiency across functions  · Manage project economics including: track project budgets, create and deliver invoices, and manage collection process  · Drive the development/enhancement of WMP's M&A methodologies (diligence, planning, carve-out, etc.) and approaches to client delivery  · Coach and manage other consultants and actively participate in the performance review process  · Understand client strategy and investment priorities and turn those goals into concrete engagements and detailed proposals.  · Create work plans, pricing estimates, and risk assessments for prospects Qualifications: · Big 4 or similar consulting background  · Bachelor's degree in related discipline (e.g. Operations Management, Management Information Systems, Information Technology)  · Consulting "athlete" (i.e. diversity in project experience, comfortable with new subject matter/industries)  · Strong knowledge of business process / operational consulting in Healthcare, Manufacturing & Distribution, and technology/tech-enabled companies  · ERP or supply chain applications implementation experience; functional expertise in IT and supporting front/back office operations preferred  · Knowledge and experience working with private equity buyout and/or strategic mergers and acquisitions focused in software/hi-tech, healthcare, and manufacturing & distribution is preferred.  · Deal execution management and leadership including carve-outs and merger integrations.  · Experience managing or analyzing P&L statements, and financial modeling skills to build and manage complex synergy and cash flow models related to M&A transactions  · Direct operational and technology experience in software/hi-tech, healthcare, and/or manufacturing & distribution organizations, as well as IT carve-out and merger integration leadership experience.  · 3-5 years participating on business consulting and IT project based work / teams  · Minimum of 1-2 years of managing complex operational and/or IT projects / people  · Minimum of 1-2 years of consulting experience with a specific industry domain expertise in one or more of the following: manufacturing & distribution, software, or healthcare  · Strong project management methodology background, including schedule, scope, issue and risk management experience, change management, strategic planning and analysis  · Candidates must be eligible to work permanently in the United States without sponsorship  · Ability to travel 50%  We celebrate driven professionals who thrive in a collaborative environment. Our consultants work on front lines - partnering with clients to deliver game changing solutions in the most dynamic industries. Sound interesting? Then West Monroe Partners just might be the place for you. Interested in learning more about our M&A practice?http://www.westmonroepartners.com/Services/BusinessSolutions/Mergers-and-Acquisitionshttp://blog.westmonroepartners.com/the-best-of-both-worlds/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6zUqLBZd3Tghttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hFIIQLzslk4. West Monroe Partners is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer -  We believe in treating each employee and applicant for employment fairly and with dignity. We base our employment decisions on merit, experience, and potential, without regard to race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, religion, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic prohibited by federal, state or local law.

Name: Business Data Analyst/Scientist
Description: BrainPOP, a leading creator of digital educational content including animated movies, learning games, interactive quizzes, and activities like concept mapping, seeks a dedicated Business Data Analyst/Scientist to join our growing Data team.  As the Business Data Analyst/Scientist, you will focus on the translation of data into expert recommendations, visualizations and BI tools that help shape the direction of our business efforts. You’ll work alongside an energetic and passionate group in a fast-paced and collaborative environment. In this role, you will:Analyze large-scale data setsInvestigate root causes of patterns using data-driven approachesDefine needs of sales, marketing, finance and business development team members and solve those needs with data analyses, models, and/or visualizationsGrow and foster a data-driven company cultureOn your resume:2-4 years experience working in a business-data-focused role at a SAAS or Education focused company/organization (a Masters degree does not substitute for on the job experience)Proficiency with R (or an equivalent statistical programming language)Proficiency with SQLYou must have:Experience leading new data initiatives and processesA passion for improving educationA multi-faceted skillsetA BA in economics, an MBA, or a Master’s in data scienceThe ability to work in a team and independentlyExcellent data communication skillsYou might also have:Experience working with a BI toolExperience with a data warehouse and ETL processesWeb, database, or software programming experienceLife at BrainPOP: Our commitment to supporting and empowering teachers and students is reflected in our dedication to enhancing the lives of our employees—in and out of the office.  Besides offering a comprehensive benefits package and putting an emphasis on work-life balance, we make it a point to integrate fun and play into the workplace.  Our team is made up of educators, data scientists, published authors, programmers, artists, bakers, film buffs, cyclists, dual-citizens, and so much more. We value collaboration and learning from multiple perspectives.  What we do today directly impacts how teachers teach and how students learn. We continue to be inspired because we can see the difference we’re making, and we’re proud to be a creative, collaborative, always-teaching and always-learning community. To Apply: Please apply through LinkedIn. We believe that a diverse organization is a more effective organization. BrainPOP is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

Name: Analytics & Insights Analyst
Description: About Handy At Handy, we're on a mission to change the way the world buys home services. Every day, we connect thousands of customers with great home service professionals in a fast, convenient and reliable way - at the tap of a button. Started in 2012 by Oisin Hanrahan & Umang Dua while at Harvard Business School, Handy has scaled to offer cleaning, installation, and assembly services across the entire US and has processed over 3 million transactions. We have raised over $110M in funding from Fidelity, TPG, Revolution Capital, General Catalyst, and Highland Capital. We are a collaborative team of about 100 people across marketing, ops, customer support, product, data, finance and engineering, and our headquarters is located in the Flatiron District. About the roleHandys Analytics team is responsible for delivering value-added data insights and business-critical reporting that meet the most important business needs. Some of the analytics challenges we work on include: How to improve booking flow conversion across various channels and devices in order to accelerate new user acquisition? How best to personalize the customer experience in order to increase customer retention and lifetime value? How to maximize conversions of leads who do not convert in their first session on the site? How to better utilize professional schedules to maximize bookings and earnings? How to measure the impact of our offline marketing efforts? How to automate resolution of customer support inquiries, while maintaining high satisfaction? How to empower and enable professionals to deliver an amazing in-home service experience? As a Analytics & Insights Analyst, you will be a key member of Handys Analytics team, responsible for arming the organization with high quality data, metrics and analytics to ensure data-backed decisions. What you'll do Partner with business owners to identify opportunities to use data-driven insights to answer critical business questions Structure analyses around these questions and use findings to inform recommendations and testing plans focused on impacting key business metrics Proactively monitor key business metrics, analyze trends and determine underlying drivers impacting our business Work with business owners to define new metrics and set up tracking and reporting for new features and initiatives Provide analytical support for A/B testing including experiment design, timing / sample size, and analysis of results Identify high-impact analytics tooling for the analytics team and data consumers throughout the company Monitor and maintain automated executive-level reports and dashboards; evolve our dataset to meet the changing needs of the business What we're looking for 2+ years management consulting experience at a top firm Analytics experience at a consumer tech company is a plus BA/BS in an analytical field such as economics, math, stats, computer science Expert in Excel Expert in SQL (or a capacity and willingness to learn since this will be your main tool) Strong communication skills, both oral and written Creative problem solver with the ability to translate data analytics and insights into actionable recommendations for the business Willingness to get hands dirty and do whatever it takes to ensure success A passion for marketplaces, the sharing economy, and/or the on-demand services space Willingness to adapt to a fast-paced work environment; hack, test and learn mentality; team playerBonus points for: Knowledge of Python Knowledge of A/B testing frameworks Knowledge of common dashboarding tools like Looker, Tableau Compensation & Benefits Competitive salary and equity commensurate with experience and performance Full medical, dental, vision package to fit your needs Monthly Handy credits Unlimited vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it A fun office in the heart of Manhattan, always stocked with coffee, snacks and drinks; catered lunch and dinner, foosball, office events and team outings Ground floor opportunity with the team The rare opportunity to work with sharp, motivated teammates solving some of the most unique challenges and changing the world

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: The Madison Square Garden Company (MSG) is a world leader in live sports and entertainment experiences. The company presents or hosts a broad array of premier events in its diverse collection of iconic venues: New York’s Madison Square Garden, The Theater at Madison Square Garden, Radio City Music Hall and Beacon Theatre; the Forum in Inglewood, CA; The Chicago Theatre; and the Wang Theatre in Boston. Other MSG properties include legendary sports franchises: the New York Knicks (NBA), the New York Rangers (NHL) and the New York Liberty (WNBA); two development league teams -- the Westchester Knicks (NBAGL) and the Hartford Wolf Pack (AHL); and one of the leading North American esports organizations, Counter Logic Gaming. In addition, the Company features popular original entertainment productions -- the Christmas Spectacular and New York Spectacular – both starring the Radio City Rockettes, and through Boston Calling Events, produces outdoor festivals, including New England’s preeminent Boston Calling Music Festival. Also under the MSG umbrella is TAO Group, a world-class hospitality group with globally-recognized entertainment dining and nightlife brands: Tao, Marquee, Lavo, Avenue, The Stanton Social, Beauty & Essex and Vandal. More information is available at www.themadisonsquaregardencompany.com Summary - The Business Intelligence Analyst will report to the Director, Data Operations and will be part of a team responsible for design and development of an enterprise wide business intelligence solution, Tableau. BI team provides analytical services and solutions to the organization's decision-making process, corporate performance management, and clients. This position will meet frequently with management to discuss needs or requirements and translate into intuitive information dashboards and visualization. The analyst will consult with business users regarding the use and management of data as well as work in design, maintenance, and completion of highly visible organizational projects creating efficient solutions.  This is an opportunity to work closely with a team that has a diverse set of data-oriented skills, to develop visualization solutions with data that spans all of MSG’s business units and includes metrics for the Knicks, Rangers, Rockettes, and concerts held in MSG venues.  The ideal candidate will be passionate about the field of analytics and well versed in all aspects of an enterprise-wide analytics architecture including data integration, data modeling, and master data management. Responsibilities:Partner with business stakeholders to define their business intelligence needs and develop solutions for delivering against themDesign, build, maintain, and optimize data visualizations and other self-service tools to provide actionable insights that enhance business decision makingSet up tools and processes for effective data management.Shape best practices in visualization to deliver an excellent end user experienceLeverage full range of Tableau platform technologies to design and implement production ready solutions and create advanced BI visualizations.Partner with enterprise data architects to define data requirements of business intelligence visualizations and toolsDevelop and provides documentation, training, and support for clients.Champion utilization of business intelligence technology across functional roles throughout the organizationManage portfolio of business intelligence projects to ensure deliveryPerform data analysis and identify business trends that can be turned into actionable insightsQualifications:3+ years business intelligence experienceBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field3+ years working with Tableau Software; Name: Business/Data Analyst
Description: The Business Data Analyst in Business Intelligence department will be responsible for ensuring data is processed accurately per business requirements. If issues are identified, root cause analysis and data remediation need to be performed. A primary focus of this role will be to analyze Connected Vehicle Marketing data to understand end-to-end data flow, analyze data anomalies and determine the root cause for the job failures, provide control requirements to control developers and work closely with development teams to avoid future failures.  Will be dealing with all aspects of our end to end data processing. The emphasis is on data completeness, validity, consistency, timeliness, accuracy and intra-system and inter-system data flow controls. He/She will participate in investigation, root cause identification and remediation of affected data/processes in BI. He/She must have the ability to handle several task simultaneously. Duties and Responsibilities:Work closely with development teams to get better understanding of existing and new CV OEM campaigns migration.Understand end-to-end data flow for CV Data Mart from the operation support perspective.Research data anomalies in complex business systems, develop audit reports, provide reports and recommendations for correction of data, and develop business and technical processes to ensure data integrity.Provide data quality assurance through routine check-ups of pre-existing data fixes and audit reports.Identify control points and provide controls requirement to Infogix team.Provide Tier2 support for all Marketing BI jobs.Present concise status to senior management.Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or equivalent education and experience5+ years' experience in supporting a high-performance, cross-functional IT Data Operations team in multiple locations and time zonesRequirements and General Skills:Analytical and structured thinking, with a keen interest in how things workSuperior writing and communication skillsAbility to work independently and in a team environmentCommitment to "internal client" and customer service principlesAbility to handle multiple tasks in a fast paced environmentStrong organizational skills and attention to detailsExcellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multi-task, and work under shifting deadlines in a fast paced environmentMust have legal right to work in the U.S.Technical Skills:Strong knowledge of Teradata, Informatica and UNIX is mustMust have prior data analyst and control based data operations experienceExcellent query writing skills and debugging failed Informatica workflows.Experience in Media & Entertainment industry a plus.Thorough knowledge of MS-Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access).

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: For over 40 years, the New York State Department of Financial Services (NYS DFS) has provided consumers and insurance carriers with the opportunity for the conciliation or arbitration of disputed claims in certain automobile insurance programs, and the American Arbitration Association (AAA) has administered the arbitration of such disputed claims in partnership with the NYS DFS.  As a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst, the successful candidate will be a contributing member of a highly collaborative team in our New York State Insurance Case Management Center. Reporting to the Assistant Vice President, the BI Analyst will primarily design, implement, and maintain the BI tools including: Data warehouse, Tableau and Predictive Analytics; Works closely with users, the BI Director, and all levels of the business to gather and analyze data to identify opportunities for efficiency and trends. Provides data analysis and explains its business relevance; Verifies accuracy of data and builds confidence in the analysis.  We offer a competitive salary and the opportunity to have a rewarding career in a fast-paced, results-driven environment. Our comprehensive benefits program includes the following: health and Rx, dental and orthodontia, vision, discounted pet insurance, disability insurance, basic and supplemental life insurance, 403(b) and Roth 403(b) retirement plans w/company match, a discounted corporate FitBit program, and generous paid time-off benefits. Advocates for the benefits of BI analytics and sound data management.Works closely with users to define their needs; translates business needs into meaningful and accurate data analysis.Trains end-user community on how to understand and interpret data analysis, including predictive analysis.Disseminates information regarding tools, reports, and metadata enhancements.Creates ad-hoc reports and analysis using various tools such as Tableau, Access, Excel, and SQL.Synthesizes current business intelligence and trend data to support recommendations for action.Provides technical assistance and support to end users on business intelligence tools, databases, dashboards, and systems; maintains a library of model documents, templates, and other reusable knowledge assets.Provides technical support for existing reports, dashboards, and other tools.Manages timely flow of information to users.Identifies and analyzes industry or geographic trends with business strategy implications; prepares and presents statistical reports to end users.Studies underlying data, recommends analysis to improve management effectiveness, and validates data sources and analysis.Education & Experience: Bachelor’s degree in business or related discipline; 2-4 years prior work experience involving data analysis; or an equivalent combination of education and work experience. Communications Abilities: (Verbal) Expresses oneself clearly in conversations and interactions with others; tailors speech to the level and experience of the audience; uses appropriate grammar and choice of words; expresses ideas in a concise, organized manner; maintains eye contact when speaking with others; (Written) Expresses oneself clearly and concisely in writing; tailors written communications to effectively reach an audience; uses graphics and other aids to clarify complex or technical information; spells correctly; writes using concrete, specific language; uses punctuation correctly; writes grammatically. Computer Skills: Either already possess knowledge of SQL and Tableau, or have strong analytic abilities to quickly learn these skills. Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel; working knowledge of web-based case management systems preferred. Mathematical Skills: Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals; ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs; and ability to understand and interpret statistical reports, data charts and graphs. Travel: Ability to travel periodically (10%) to customers, training events, and other AAA offices and conferences.

Name: Asset Management Business Analyst
Description: Asset Management Business Analyst Two Sigma is a financial technology company in SoHo that explores the fascinating intersection of big data, artificial intelligence and finance. We currently manage approximately $57 billion AUM with 1500+ staff spanning New York, London, Houston, Hong Kong, and Tokyo. We apply the scientific method to investment management and are not your typical investment manager. We follow principles of technology and innovation with equal regard to principles of investment management. Fields like machine learning and distributed computing guide us. Since 2001, we have searched for ways that these kinds of technologies can make us better at what we do.  We are looking for a business analyst to build and manage the operating platform of the future for our Asset Management business. Asset Management at Two Sigma leverages the firm’s research, data, and technology-driven approach to provide investment and technology solutions to leading institutional investors globally. This function’s responsibilities will involve both enhancing the current operation of the business as well as designing and implementing a more robust operational foundation for the business to grow upon. Working in conjunction with the Asset Management leadership team, clients, Two Sigma Corporate, Engineering, and Modeling leadership, and service providers on all aspects of the business, s/he will contribute to the development and management of a high quality infrastructure that will scale with a rapidly growing business.  S/he will be responsible for a broad range of management, financial and operations efforts, including the following: Based on the overall growth strategy for the business, support the design and implementation of a long-term operating model (processes, infrastructure, and capabilities) to achieve the required scalability and flexibility in research, portfolio management, trading, portfolio operations and support, and legal / compliance among othersSupport financial planning, budgeting, and performance reporting for Asset Management, which includes presentation of profitability of various business efforts, expense management, performance metrics, resource planning, and long-term forecasting. This effort will require both build-out of business-specific infrastructure as well as coordination with firm wide Financial Planning, Corporate Accounting, HR and Tax functions among othersDevelop and maintain reporting platform to capture both financial and non-financial performance metrics across all research, engineering, and business related functions within Asset Management. This platform will serve as a key tool for strategic decision-making and monitoring progress on critical business initiativesCollaborate with Asset Management leadership on strategic planning and report on progress relative to key business objectivesPartner with internal partners in Corporate for business oversight and support for control functionsQualifications and SkillsBachelor's degree with a strong academic record, preferably in finance, accounting, economics, mathematics, engineering, or related discipline2-5 years of professional growth through positions of increasing responsibility, with operating experience in a highly demanding environment; ideally, but not necessarily, finance or technologyPreferable background of Financial Planning & Analysis, or a Financial Reporting oriented function, with experience in budgeting, p&l reporting, expense & resource management a plusExperience presenting to and creating content for senior managementStrong analytical and conceptual problem solving skills with an ability to translate medium- and long-term business objectives into a robust operating strategy and framework for growing a businessGood business acumen with an ability to see beyond the numbers and identify drivers of performanceExcellent written and verbal communication skills and a collaborative working styleStrong work ethic (takes ownership), self-starter and quick-study mentality; ability to work independently and within a team framework

Name: Business Analyst Contract
Description: Job Purpose The successful candidate will join the New Jersey DEC ETD Clearing US IT team, in charge of Daily Operations Functional support and Business analyst projects. Key Account abilities– Manage analysis, validation and support for DEC business applications.  – Analyse regulations requirements coming from regulators and clearing markets  – Assist Operations to continuously provide a high quality service to our Clients and rapidly integrate increasing volumes and new products.  – Act as a liaison between Business users, IT Application Support teams (Montreal, London, Paris, Chennai, Mumbai and Lisbon), Client Service teams and the Service Providers.  – Guarantee the escalation of problems to the adequate BNP Paribas branches to ensure on-time resolution; manage priorities depending on the criticality of the requests and production failures.  – Participate in the technical tests, internal meetings and regular reviews with the external Service Providers.  – Participate in local projects and client on-boarding.  – Contribute to the quality of technical and user testing phases.  – Analyse requirements and feasibility with all other departments involved  – Coordinate implementation of the validated solution  – Establish procedures Person Specification – BA/BS level required  – Minimum 5 years financial industry experience especially in clearing – regulatory environment  – Good knowledge of listed derivatives instruments, Clearing markets and regulations  – Experience on listed derivatives Back Office and Middle office tools. Knowledge of Sungard / FIS Back Office systems (UBIX / GMI) is a plus.  – Organised and delivery-focused, with attention to detail  – Articulate in their verbal and written communication with all types of project stakeholders: colleagues, users, management, etc.  – Be accountable, i.e. taking full ownership of their allocated tasks  – Pro-active in general, taking own initiatives to prevent risks/issues  – Ability to work well under pressure  – Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  – Solid work ethic and high levels of motivation  – Fluent in English, both written and spoken  – Basic knowledge of SQL language is a plus

The Senior Business Analyst will work with stakeholders to understand the spectrum of needs and capabilities, and then elaborate with the wider cross-disciplinary project team to support the development of solutions that meet the stakeholder requirements. Apply now.Disclaimer / Policy StatementsUBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
