Name: Business Analyst - OTC Derivatives Analyst
Description: Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firmproviding a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment managementand wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwideincluding corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200offices in 43 countries.  As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people iscritical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted inintegrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide asuperior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people tolearn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles,perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.  Technology  Technology works as a strategic partner with Morgan Stanleybusiness units and the world's leading technology companies to redefine how wedo business in ever more global, complex, and dynamic financial markets. MorganStanley's sizeable investment in technology results in quantitative tradingsystems, cutting-edge modeling and simulation software, comprehensive risk andsecurity systems, and robust client-relationship capabilities, plus theworldwide infrastructure that forms the backbone of these systems and tools.Our insights, our applications and infrastructure give a competitive edge toclients' businessesand to our own.  The Global Transaction Reporting team is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join the growing team in NY (a key strategic location). You will be part of a global team, which also has presence in London, Mumbai, and Glasgow. You will be part of a dynamic team building systems that are critical to the business and solving problems to meet the ever changing regulatory environment. You should be dynamic, a self-starter and have experience working in an agile environment coupled with excellent, development, communication, and organizational skills.The role will require working with stakeholders globally and across divisions and knowledge of broad spectrum of assets classes.You will be required to analyse business process flows and impact on technology flows.You will be required to translate regulatory requirements into functional technical requirementsYou will write users stories in an iterative fashion, liaising with the developers, product owners and other business analysts within the scrum team.Required Qualifications:Knowledge of OTC, listed and cash productsKnowledge of Corporate Actions, Repo Buy/Sell and Stock Loans productsRegulatory reporting experience (SFTR, MAS/ASIC etc.)Ability to collaborate with business and technology teams to understand requirements and share with the technical team.Experience of agile and scrum methodologies.Experience of writing user stories containing clearly articulated needs, features and acceptance tests.Experience in banking with trade life cycle and trade flow knowledge.BA certification from either IIBA, PMI or BCS.Strong data analysis skills and experience ? able to use tools such as Excel to analyse large volumes of data to find correlations, variations and anomalies.Exhibit good leadership and communication skills to help the scrum team clearly understand the requirements.Ability to support the product owner to ensure that their priorities and needs are met.Ability to be pro-active and clearly escalate when risks or issues arise.Good documentation skills with the ability to articulate complex topics in a concise and articulate manner

Name: Data Analyst
Description: LiveIntent is looking for a Data Analyst to join our tightly knit Analytics team. The analytics team is responsible for all analytics, experimentation, and reporting within the organization. The primary focus of the team is on communicating business insights intra-company and assisting with business and product strategy development.  You will be working closely with stakeholders across the organization to help them align their product direction against measurable KPIs and assist them in communicating those results back to the entire company. This position will contain exposure to all levels of the business and the ability to manipulate true "big data" at all stages of our data pipeline. What You'll Do:Continually work with various teams to develop relevant KPIs and dashboards for them to monitor and explore relevant metrics.Utilize SQL and possibly Python to analyze data from our various DBs and sources. This includes Redshift, BigQuery, and Athena, along with others.Interact daily with clean and raw datasets on the scale of KBs to TBs.Perform ad-hoc analyses and data requests as relates to our European offices.Who You Are:You have 2+ years experience in product or business analytics or relevant degree.You possess a strong analytical foundation with intermediate to advanced knowledge of SQL. Exposure to Python (pandas, PySpark) a plus.You are comfortable communicating a business perspective to a technical environment and, inversely, translating technical requirements into terms business stakeholders can understand.You prefer working independently and are comfortable with loosely defined problems.You enjoy communicating and presenting findings to stakeholders at all levels.You are familiar with Looker and Tableau.You are comfortable working in English.What We Bring:Exposure to cutting-edge analytics techniques and technologies.An adaptive team structure with room to grow your responsibilities.We support employee health and wellness by providing:Comprehensive medical, dental and vision coverageHealthy daily snacks and beverages on tapFamily-friendly environment with work/life balanceSummer Fridays (head out early to enjoy the great weather!)Weekly in-office Yoga and Pilates classesSubsidized gym membershipLiveIntent sports teams (softball, flag football, soccer etc)Paid Maternity and Paternity leaveWe support diversity and growth within the company with programs and initiatives such as:Bi-annual performance and compensation review processMonthly "Women with Intent" meetingsBook Club focused on reading and discussing career development-focused contentLunch and Learns with diverse speakersOpportunities to attend industry conferencesAccess to professional development courses through LinkedIn Learning and CourseraAnnual global offsite week focused on team-building, training and employee recognitionBoard games and Play Station for after-hours funWho We Are: LiveIntent is changing the way people and businesses connect on the Internet. We use big data, predictive algorithms, and machine-learning to solve complex problems and deliver proprietary business value to our customers. To help propel our explosive growth, we are looking for sharp minds who can translate ideas into action and help drive innovation. As the only company bringing innovative, customer-focused solutions to email, this is your chance to help shape an industry while honing your skills with leading-edge technology.  LiveIntent delivers people-based marketing programs that empower brands to be present wherever their most essential customers are paying attention, at every point in the customer journey, irrespective of channel, device, or platform. With the anonymized email address at the center of its platform, LiveIntent and its Identity Graph provide incremental reach to brands. LiveIntent is now one of the largest people-based marketing platforms in the world: reaching over 160MM logged-in people across the LiveIntent platform, 170mm across the web, and 100mm in app. LiveIntent was recognized for the past three years as one of NYC's fastest growing companies (by Crain's) and as one of America's Most Promising Companies (Forbes 2015.) LiveIntent is headquartered in NYC, with offices in London, Berlin, Copenhagen, Dallas, Austin and Los Angeles. For more information, visit www.liveintent.com.  #LI-BL1

Name: Business Transformation Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client in search of a Business Transformation Analyst in New York, NY.  Summary:  The Business Transformation Analyst is a strong generalist that performs cross-functional responsibilities across the technology, business, and program levels of the transformation program office. This role contributes to the overall strategy and execution of the company's transformation journey.  Duties Include:  Lead development of change strategy, planning and delivery activities that support large change initiatives, including change sustainability, ensuring alignment of Project and Program activities to corporate and organization strategic direction Serve as a coach for senior leaders and executives in helping them fulfill the role of change sponsor Establish leadership alignment to build sponsorship for change initiatives Manage complex, cross-functional, stakeholder alignment and issue resolution using sophisticated executive influence skills Build partnerships and ambassador networks across the organization Facilitate large and diverse cross-functional team meetings in a global environment Manage cross-functional stakeholder identification (analysis) impacts, issues, and resolution/mitigation plans Define stakeholder value propositions and success metrics Work in a self-directed environment Stakeholder transparency:  Assist with synthesizing the current state of the program to keep stakeholders informed, updating master artifacts as necessary Facilitate information collection and distribution across the program Objective & key results analysis:  Analyze connectivity between transformation and business objectives Assist with the evaluation of progress using key results, creating new processes as necessary Identify customer journey-based prioritization opportunities through analysis of the company and transformation portfoliosREQUIREMENTS: Typically, 10+ years of relevant consulting and/or industry and functional experience To be considered for this position, candidates must have experience in a similar role or they must possess significant knowledge, experience, and abilities to successfully perform the responsibilities listed Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Global Adoption Business Analyst
Description: Our client, a Leading Wealth Management Institution, is seeking a Global Adoption Business Analyst in their downtown Manhattan location.Required Skills:• 5+ years of relevant experiences as Business Analyst in the Finance department of an investment bank / financial services company. • Project Management working experience on Finance type projects • Finance/Accounting/Regulatory Experience - A good understanding of the finance function and processes of a financial service organization, examples: General Ledger, accounting/finance processes, US GAAP/IFRS, regulatory reporting. Client reporting experience is a plus. • Strong data analysis and problem solving skills are required to perform data quality gap analysis, root cause issue analysis, and data reconciliations. • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal. • Excellent soft skills with experience working across groups • Exposure to SAP GL or other GL applications a plus Responsibilities: 1) Initiation phase 2) Requirement & analysis phase 3) Design and build phase 4) Testing phase 5) Implementation phase The Global Adoption Business Anlayst would be responsible for the successful completion of the following tasks: • Documentation of the current state processes, business requirements including the target state processes • Performing data quality gap analysis • Planning and executing the testing phase with all stakeholders (testing approach, test plan, cases, testing metrics) • Facilitating the transition to Business As Usual (BAU) processes to Finance • Meeting preparation with the stakeholders raising appropriate status, risks, and issuesWhy Work With Linium?Why Consider a Contract/Temp Role?· Find jobs with companies that may rely only on Firms for hiring· Get a foot in the door with an amazing company, while earning a paycheck· Use your assignment to evaluate your future employer and make sure it is a good fit for you· Use the positions to fill in the "gap while you're looking for a permanent role· Develop new skills, experiences & references build your resume· Linium's services are FREE to all job seekers!Visit us online at: www.liniumrecruiting.comWhat to expect once you've applied:Once your resume has been received, The Linium team will review your credentials to match your qualifications against all of the open positions, including the one you applied for. If you are qualified for any of the current job openings, a member of the Linium team will contact you. We Care!We understand job searching is stressful! We know that finding a better job to advance your career and your income is important. We will be there every step of the way helping you navigate through the complexities of job searching in today's economy.As an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer, by choice, Linium will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant's race, color, creed, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, citizenship, physical and mental disability, criminal record, genetic information, predisposition or carrier status, status with respect to receiving public assistance, domestic violence victim status, a disabled, special, recently separated, active duty wartime, campaign badge, Armed Forces service medal veteran, or any other characteristics protected under applicable law.

Name: Sr Business Analyst
Description: Optima Global Solutions Inc is an innovative Information Technology Consulting firm that provides superior IT solutions to our clients while offering a rewarding and challenging work experience for our consultants. We have currently Business Analyst positions with our Direct client, a large fortune 500 company based in NYC, NY. Business Analyst NYC, NY Long Term 6+ years of IT experience as a Business Analysis in an agile setting required Extensive Knowledge of Software methodologies and strategies with in depth understanding of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). Knowledgeable of Agile Methodologies, Scrums, Sprints. Adept in creating BRD, FRS, User Stories + Acceptance criteria, Use cases and workflow diagrams based on the user requirements and to support development team. Must be able to demonstrate experience documenting business processes, issues, metrics, and capabilities for various applications. Strong Experience in Documenting and Executing Test cases for UAT Adept in ensuring proper business compliance by working closely with Technical Architects, Scrum Masters, and Developers to understand requirements and business processes for the SDLC Experience with facilitating regular walkthroughs of business requirements, functional specifications and participate in sprint planning and requirement analysis sessions. Practical experience in test strategy design for Functional testing, Smoke testing. Experience in Graphical User Interface (GUI) Testing as well as functional and smoke testing on Mobile Applications including iPhone and Android apps. Some experience using SQL Queries to ensure that data was entered properly in the right tables, when the data was entered from front end screen. Strong Experience of Application, System, End to End and Regression Testing Strong Analytical and Problem-Solving skills with Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Strong team player with good interpersonal skills and have demonstrated ability to self-motivate and be flexible within a fast-paced environment. Experience with creating Test Plans, writing and executing Test Cases both using Manual Testing. Strong Understanding of CI / CD process Solid experience with industry standard tools for project management (JIRA), defect tracking, test management, and continuous integration (Jenkins/Hudson). Regards, Junaid Mohammed Talent Acquisition Specialist Optima Global Solutions, Inc. W: 1-609-586-8811 Ext. 26 Email: junaid@optimags.com | Web: www.optimags.com - provided by DiceAgile, Scrum, UAT

Name: Lead Business Analyst - IT Business Analysts Group
Description: Business Area: Information Technology Department: IT Business Analysts Group Salary Range: $67,000 - $128,000 POSITION DESCRIPTION: The Business Analysis group is responsible for establishing & adhering to an established process framework for capturing & detailing business requirements/functional specs related to IT projects. The group will consist of a pool of business analysts who will have requisite analysis skillsets and business processing SME needed to effectively document clear,concise and complete functional requirements related to IT projects. The analysts will be contracted to work on IT projects on an as-needed basis and function as the liaison between the business and the IT designers/developers.The overall goals of Business Analysts Group is to ensure that business line needs are well understood & that IT solutions are specified in a manner that ensures that all parties involved in a given project have the same understanding of what the problems are & what solutions need to be implemented ( from a functional perspective) to improve our environment. Traceability for testing and requirements verification will be key to our success.This group will be challenged to think outside the box and devise innovative and cost-saving solutions which utilize state of the art technology ( as needed) to resolve business problems. The analysts will utilize requisite business analysis techniques ( ex: use cases, process maps, etc), tools and common templates to ensure consistency and adherence to standards. The key responsibilities that need to be performed include: -Working with business users and IT technologists to thoroughly document current state business problems/opportunities -Completion of Business Requirements and functional specifications documentation/artifacts which are managed and stored in relevant repositories -Evaluate relevant options for providing an improved future state with special focus on streamlining operational workflows, improving business product reducing company costs and making appropriate use of technology in the solution set -Becoming a subject matter expert in the various aspects of annuity and life insurance business processing -Being able to interact with varied working teams within AXA in a professional and even-keeled manner -Being an exceptional analyst; always questioning to get to root understanding. Must be willing to look under the rocks and persistent in getting to the correct answer to questions -Being able to document analysis results using state of the art techniques (ex: use cases, process maps, context diagrams, etc..) Related responsibilities include the following: -Ability to Outline a roadmap of activities that need to be conducted to achieve analysis goals( via toolkit like MS Project) -Conducting/leading the elicitation sessions with business groups to understand current business problems and requirements for resolvement -Making effective use of business analysis documentation skills to accurately document requirements in a manner that is clear to business sponsors and IT developers -Conducting vendor product evaluations including the development of RFP and subsequent vendor ratings in terms of meeting our requirements -Ensuring adherence to the SDLC as it pertains to the BR phased to help ensure projects meet a CMM level 2/3 (for large-scale projects). -Build strong partnership with your business constituents and IT counterparts to make projects successful and to ensure that expectations are met or surpassed -Ensuring a roadmap for traceability of test cases to functional requirements POSITION REQUIREMENTS: Attributes Absolutely Necessary: -5+ years actual hands-on business analysis work in financial arena -2+ years actual IT development (designing , coding, testing) -Knowledgeable in Business Analysis methodologies for completing Business Requirements/Functional Specifications -Knowledgeable in actions/steps needed for CMM Level 2/3 certification for app development -Experienced in using state of the art techniques for capturing business requirements (ex: use cases, UML, RUP, ERD s DFD s Context Diagrams, Process Maps, etc) -Excellent interpersonal, communications skills and influencing skills -Must be a self-starter and proactive in going about tasks -Must be highly organized and structured in carrying out day to day work -Strong documentation skills and relevant use of MS Office tools -Experienced in understanding and conducting various testing scenarios ( ex: unit test, integration test, functionality test, regression test, etc) -Experienced in conducting business analysis for buy as well as build solutions -Utilized some type of third part tools for capturing requirements ( ex: Rational Requisite Pro) -Collaboration/Leadership/Influencing - Influences both technology and business staff in promoting change or protecting the firms assets -Knowledgeable in Life Insurance & Annuity processing Our offers will be contingent upon favorable results of a background and reference check, criminal conviction check, credit history, and drug screen. We are proud to be an EEO employer M/F/D/V.

Name: Senior Consultant - DevOps
Description: Job Description The DevOps operating model is the combination of cultural philosophies, practices, and tools that helps organizations deliver end-to-end applications and infrastructure solutions safely and at high velocity. The Senior DevOps Consultant is a leader with significant automation and programming experience throughout the SDLC. The Consultant will lead our enterprise customers through large organizational and SDLC transformations. A successful DevOps practitioner has technical depth across the Full DevOps Spectrum along with leading and evangelizing transformations, and driving innovations.  Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants may be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.Basic Qualifications8+ years of experience as a technical specialist.Familiarity with administrative tasks within popular operating systems.Hands-on experience with architecting and automated provisioning (IaC), configuration management for infrastructure and applications.Hands-on experience with envisioning, designing, building and managing release systems, code merging and promotion, and CI/CD workflows and tools.Strong hands-on experience with mainline programming and scripting languages such as Shell, Python, Ruby, Perl, Java, .Net, or C++.Experience establishing, implementing, and delivering using Agile practices.Bachelor Degree or equivalent experience.Ability to travel to client locations to deliver professional services as needed.Preferred QualificationsExperience with CloudFormation, Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible in production environments.Knowledge of IP networking, VPN's, DNS, load balancing and firewall.Experience with monitoring and log aggregating frameworks like CloudWatch, Datadog, Splunk, Opentracing, AWS X-Ray, and APM tools.Experience with development and automated testing.Understanding of microservices and distributed application architecture.Experience building enterprise security strategy for cloud adoption or driving the program's evolution to meet new requirements.Experience leading the certification or accreditation of cloud workload(s) to meet industry standards such as PCI DSS, ISO 27001, HIPAA, and NIST/DoD frameworks.Strong verbal and written communications skills and ability to lead effectively across organizations and engagements. Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer-Minority/Female/Disability/VetApply Now at Amazon

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob #: 907143  Senior Business Analyst NYC (Financial District) Full-time Role Apex Systems is partnering with a Major Financial Services client in downtown Manhattan to join their growing team. Please see the job description below and apply if you feel you could be a great addition to the team! The desired candidate will work as a business and systems analyst, supporting the Treasury Cash Management and Liquidity areas. The team supports the front to back management and operation of the Financial client's fixed income and securities finance portfolio, which comprise a significant portion of the firms overall balance sheet. The candidate will liaise with various business groups including corporate treasury front, middle and back office teams as well as various risk and enterprise technology systems. The platform consists of major vendor applications for trading and analytics, and for accounting. There are several home grown applications for managing straight through processing, regulatory and management reporting, and other critical functions and workflows. Responsibilities include:Coordinate with the various teams to drive several key projects for critical business and regulatory initiatives in Corporate TreasuryDocument all user stories, artifacts and workflow diagrams to communicate efficient and elegant technical designs and solutionsDocument detail and clear data mapping sources and calculations to communicate and obtain agreements from the business and technology groupsAnalyze complex data issues and work with developers to create a design utilizing the latest technologiesLead, execute, and coordinate the development of multiple critical tasks, often in parallel, and work directly with all stakeholders The candidate will have the following experience, knowledge, and skills (7 10 years): Computer Science degree or equivalent experienceExperience supporting a fixed income trading deskExperience in managing small enhancements and projectsExperience in current and future state workflow diagramsExperience in data analysis across multiple systemsExperience with various Agile and SDLC processes and methodologies as well as authoring the SDLC artifactsUnderstanding of C#, .Net, SSRS and SQL skills EEO Employer Apex is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at 844-463-6178* Document detail and clear data mapping sources and calculations to communicate and obtain agreements from the business and technology groups * Analyze complex data issues and work with developers to create a design utilizing the latest technologies * Lead, execute, and coordinate the development of multiple critical tasks, often in parallel, and work directly with all stakeholders The candidate will have the following experience, knowledge, and skills (7 - 10 years): * Computer Science degree or equivalent experience * Experience supporting a fixed income trading desk * Experience in managing small enhancements and projects * Experience in current and future state workflow diagrams * Experience in data analysis across multiple systems * Experience with various Agile and SDLC processes and methodologies as well as authoring the SDLC artifacts * Understanding of C#, .Net, SSRS and SQL skills

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Company Description:Quartet is a pioneering technology company connecting physical and mental care to improve peoples health and quality of life. We are building a collaborative technology platform that brings together physicians, mental health providers, and insurance companies to effectively improve patient outcomes and drive down healthcare costs. Our data-driven platform identifies high-need patients and facilitates access to personalized care. Backed by $92MM in venture funding from top investors like GV (formerly Google Ventures) and Oak HC/FT, Quartet is headquartered in NYC and is currently operating in several markets across the US -- Pennsylvania, Massachusetts, Louisiana, Washington, Northern California, and New Jersey.About the team:Quartet is looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst who is excited to dive head-first into our data ecosystem to help solve problems across the business. This position requires outstanding analytic and communication skills, the ability to collaborate with a wide variety of colleagues, experience prioritizing work in a fast-paced environment, and the tenacity to execute against deliverables in a timely, high-quality fashion.This role will work largely in Looker, our BI tool, to provide data-driven insights to teams across Quartet. The BI Analyst will develop a deep knowledge of our internal data systems and an understanding of how to use them to operate Quartet efficiently. This could mean identifying opportunities to improve care to patients, analyzing usage patterns on our web products, measuring effectiveness of new initiatives, or exposing company-wide insights to our leadership team. Work products will most often be "Looks" (specific metrics / measurements) or "Dashboards" (coherent and comprehensive views of a problem or topic). There will also be contributions to our underlying data infrastructure, writing some SQL to support more complex analysis or new measurements as needed. BI Analysts will work alongside other BI Analysts, and report to the Manager of Business Analytics. Some of the BI group's biggest stakeholders at Quartet are Business Development, Patient and Provider Success, and Operations. BI Analysts work with representatives from these teams to ensure we are delivering the valuable, actionable data insights that Quartet needs. BI Analysts often work closely with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to ensure an adequate technical foundation exists to perform analysis on.Accountabilities Evaluate and understand information gathered from multiple sources (healthcare claims, operational tools, web application, and third party data)Own relationships with teams and projects across the company on behalf of the BI team to ensure alignment with Quartets business goalsExtend and maintain our reporting infrastructure in Looker, including SQL transformations to the underlying data models, which feed reports and dashboardsBuild additional technical skills to support ongoing data science projectsOwn deliverables end to end, including data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentationMinimum QualificationsBachelors degree2+ years of experience working with non-technical users to understand business problems and map abstract problems to data that can be used to solve them2+ years of experience in SQLUnderstanding of schema designPreferred Qualifications Experience generating customer-facing reports (specifically, using Looker)Familiarity with claims or EHR dataExperience with statistical inference and interpreting mathematical models helpfulExperience in other programming languages (R, Python, etc.) helpfulEmployee Benefits for Quartet include: Unlimited vacation, volunteer opportunities, catered lunches, snacks, team events and outings, full medical, dental + vision coverage, generous parental leave, commuter benefits, 15 free therapy sessions + unlimited copay reimbursements for mental healthcare, 401K, ESPP, gym benefits. Want to know what Quartet life is like? Click here to meet our team. Quartet is committed to building a diverse team and fostering an inclusive culture, and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We embrace and encourage our employees' differences in race, religion, color, national origin, gender, family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran status, disability, pregnancy, medical conditions, and other characteristics. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Quartet does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Quartet will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Quartet. Please note: Quartet interview requests and job offers only originate from quartethealth.com email addresses (e.g. jsmith@quartethealth.com). Quartet will also never ask for bank information (e.g. account and routing number), social security numbers, passwords, or other sensitive information to be delivered via email. If you receive a scam email or wish to report a security issue involving Quartet, please notify us at: security@quartethealth.com.Have someone to refer? Email talent@quartethealth.com to submit their details to us.

Name: Analyst
Description: The CompanyRIMES is a global managed data service provider. We’re passionate about solving the data challenges faced by our clients–300+ investment managers, hedge funds, wealth managers, private banks, custodian banks, insurance companies and pension funds in 40 countries across the globe–including 60 of the 100 largest global asset managers by TAUM and 9 of the 10 largest asset servicers in the world. We are:Pioneers in the provision of cloud-based managed data servicesA multiple award-winning enterprise: we have been voted ‘Best Data Provider to the Buy-side’ by waterstechnology.com for the last 11 consecutive yearsA secure, well-established organization–we just celebrated our 20th anniversary—with over 200 team members at 10 locations across the globeCreative, intelligent, versatile and inventive, and committed to providing an atmosphere that encourages these qualities The Role and Job Responsibilities:We are looking for dynamic and self-motivated graduates with excellent analytical and communication skills to join our Client Services team.  Your career with RIMES begins with a varied training program, where you will gain comprehensive knowledge of the inner-workings of a leading Financial Technology company, whilst undergoing intensive financial markets and product training.  As a member of the Client Services team, your primary responsibility is to support the suite of RIMES products and services while providing customers with key information and analytical solutions. Our clients rely on our ongoing support for a variety of functions including performance attribution analysis, risk management and compliance, and portfolio management. By assisting our clients with their needs, you will develop the foundations needed and the knowledge, skills and understanding to progress within the organization. You need:Strong communication, interpersonal and organizational skillsHigh proficiency with MS Excel®Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously under tight deadlinesAbility to work within a team as well as independentlyDesire to learn new technology and grow in an ever-changing environmentCandidates must be of Graduate calibre, preferably in finance or a related fieldAlso useful:Experience working with, querying, and manipulating large datasetsSound working knowledge of financial spreadsheets and financial databases and applicationsKnowledge and understanding of equity and fixed income indicesFluency in more than one language is beneficial to a career at RIMES If this sounds like the sort of job you’d like to take on, email your CV to jobs@rimes.com and put “RTUS – ANALYST – NY” in the subject line.  Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States or Canada respectively. RIMES is an Equal Opportunity Employer RIMES is committed to promote the values of diversity and inclusion throughout the business. Whether it’s through recruitment, retention, career progression or training and development, we are committed to improving opportunities for people regardless of their background or circumstances.

Name: Business Analyst, Supply Chain
Description: Roland Foods cultivates, facilitates, and honors relationships that inspire passion and support success in the specialty food industry. Founded in 1934, Roland Foods imports more than 1,500 products from across Asia, South America, Africa, Europe, and the Middle East. At Roland Foods, we believe in the power of food to open minds, spark adventure, and bring diverse people together. We are passionate about food, and dedicated to those who grow, make, serve, and eat it.  Roland Foods is seeking a Business Analyst, International Logistics who will be responsible for delivering value-added analytical insights and business-critical reporting to meet the needs of the International Logistics team. The successful candidate will be someone who is eager to learn, thrives in a fast-paced environment, and is extremely attentive to detail.  In this role, you will: Compile data from a variety of sources to analyze logistics-related costs and other quantitative issuesCreate and maintain Key Performance Indictor dashboards; develop and communicate actionable recommendations to improve these KPIs over timeLead analytical efforts and development of tools, documents, and other resources for reportingAssess current state processes and provide process improvement recommendations and actionable insights to managementPerform ad hoc Excel analyses as well as support ad-hoc special projectsPartner with internal teams such as Replenishment, Sales, QA, and Finance to troubleshoot and problem solve daily issuesRequirementsQualificationsBachelor’s degree; Business, Supply Chain or related field strongly desiredMinimum 2 years of relevant experience (supply chain, logistics, import, export, etc.) with evidence of progressing responsibilities, proven track record of innovating process and problem solvingStrong analytical skills, ability to summarize data and identify important trends within a short timelineHigh level of skill in accuracy and attention to detailDemonstrated ability to collaborate with others and work cross-functionallyAbility to multi-task, prioritize and in a dynamic and highly changing environmentStrong organizational and time management skills, driving towards work efficienciesStrong oral and written communication skillsDemonstrated track record of identifying problems and developing solutionsProficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) required. Intermediate Excel skills a must, advanced skills in Excel a plus.Experience with ERP systems (specifically Microsoft AX) a plus Roland Foods is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Business Analyst

You will enjoy working with one of the richest data sets in the world, cutting edge technology, and the ability to see your insights drive the creation of real tools and features for our customers and thousands of merchants participating in our Marketplace on a regular basis. Name: Associate Digital Investment Analyst
Description: Business Title Associate Digital Investment Analyst  24-Sep-2018 Agency Location (ie GroupM - New York) Mindshare - New York, NY Job DescriptionJob Overview: The Associate Digital Investment Analyst will work within a planning team to accomplish marketing and promotional objectives. Name: Business Data Analyst
Description: Assignment Details: Core Requirements: Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings Advanced knowledge of and experience with databases (Oracle, SQL Server, SQL, etc.) and MS Excel/Access Familiar with SQL Server and Oracle database development: tables, stored procedures, indexes, packages etc. Ability to work in an agile quick paced environment Read and edit XML files for testing Familiar using Linux to drop XML files and traverse through directories. SSIS as well as non-standard ETL development (bcp, command line). Ad-hoc business requested data extracts. Expertise in dealing with large volumes of data and data optimization Must be able to triage, diagnose and perform root cause analysis on production issues arising from the interaction of multiple AMI systems. Ability to communicate and document complex technical concepts, both formally and informally, to a technical and non-technical audience Skills & Requirements: Summary Our client is looking for an IT Business/Data Analyst with strong analytical skills who can identify and lead complex problems and situations, often involving cross system issues, to successful resolution. Must be able to query multiple data sources, look at the numbers, trends, data, and come to conclusions based on the findings. Looking for a team player who needs minimal direction and can handle multiple assignments at one time. This is a "hands-on " position requiring solid technical skills, as well as excellent interpersonal and communication skills. The person in this position must be capable of working independently and collaboratively. The following are not required for this position but would be considered as a valuable asset in a potential candidate: Core Responsibilities Must be able to work with large amounts of data from multiple systems. You will need to see through the data and analyze it to find conclusions. Query, manipulate & troubleshoot data. Locate and define new process improvement opportunities Work with management to prioritize business and information needs Perform other related tasks and assignments as required. Ability to work with the business to understand issues and develop a plan forward Understand existing processes and recommend new approaches or best practice - provided by Dice(ORACLE over 2 year(s) OR SQL SERVER OR DATABASE ) AND(SQL over 2 year(s) ) AND (XML over 2 year(s) ) AND (SSIS over 2 year(s) ) AND (DATA ANALYSIS over 5 year(s) OR DATA ANALYST )

Name: Lead Business Analyst
Description: Get the kind of challenge you loveFascinating clients on the one hand. Passionate software developers looking for problems to solve on the other. You'll be the bridge between the two. It'll involve a lot of open and honest communication. It'll mean getting to know businesses inside out. Finding out what their software must achieve, how it will be used and then generating the ideas our developers draw on to create custom applications. Work with clients across a variety of sectors and make sure the business-critical software solutions we develop delivers real business value every time. Our Senior/Lead Business Analysts play a key role in project success.As a Business Analyst, here's what you can do at ThoughtWorks:Facilitate and lead workshops that generate ideas and content for solutionsBe part of custom software teams helping to disrupt industriesHelp companies achieve true, differentiating outcomesBe instrumental in the analysis and design of complex business applications in the latest technologiesBe an expert in agile and continuous delivery principles and practices, and facilitate organizational transformationsMentor and evangelize Agile, Lean, and Continuous Development analysis best practicesThink through hard problems, and work with a team to make them reality.Travel the worldLearn something new everydaySpeak at conferences; write blogs and booksWork in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchical, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role titleDevelop your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path by focusing on what you're passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all planHere's what you'll bring:Demonstrated experience working successfully with teams to deliver software; ideally as part of a consulting organizationExperience unearthing the root cause(s) of a client's pain points and validating a business opportunity or problemHave an understanding of business processes and drivers in medium or large scale organizationsExperience with Agile delivery methodologies (e.g. Scrum and XP) Demonstrable experience or aptitude in agile analysis approachesStrong workshop and session facilitation experience Experience with modeling business processes using a variety of tools and techniquesAble to define key objectives and 'to-be" state, identify success factors, and comprehend constraints, challenges and risksAn understanding of how the roles of product, SME, experience design, analysis, development and quality assurance work together to build great software. Orchestrate collaboration by removing roadblocks and fostering communicationExperience as a trusted and valued partner of the product owner and business stakeholders Experience prioritizing competing demands and obtaining buy-in from stakeholdersDemonstrated ability to manage and resolve conflict with stakeholder(s)Ability to articulate the "big picture" of the solution to delivery and client teams to understand cross functional inter-dependencies and impactDemonstrated ability to understand and explain issues from both a technical and a business functional point of viewOpenness to contradictory opinions and flexible in your thinkingA willingness to jump into projects and situations and make sense of ambiguous details in multiple domainsAn understanding of traditional development approaches, and the ability to compare and contrast benefits of eachChampion the processes and practices of the Agile and Lean methodologyExperience in mentoring and executing Agile, Lean, and Continuous Delivery best practicesA genuine passion for quality software - and the know-how to get from sketch to codeAnd here are some of the perks of being part of a unique organization like ThoughtWorks.A real commitment to "changing the face of IT" -- our way of thinking about diversity and inclusion. Over the past ten years, we've implemented a lot of initiatives to make ThoughtWorks a place that reflects the world around us, and to make this a welcoming home to technologists of all stripes. We're not perfect, but we're actively working towards true gender balance for our business and our industry, and you'll see that diversity reflected on our project teams and in our offices. Continuous learning. You'll be constantly exposed to new approaches and ideas from your peers and as you work on different projects -- challenging you to stay at the top of your game.No pigeon-holing: at ThoughtWorks, there's no applying to new roles. With time, you'll build trust and credibility and move easily into new roles if you're inclined, like trying out life in a QA or XD's shoes.Miles on miles. As consultants, we travel to the client sites every week. At first, you'll likely travel domestically, but with time, you'll find opportunities to travel around the world (and rack up some major points along the way.)Support to grow as an analyst outside of your role at ThoughtWorks. This is why ThoughtWorkers have written over 100 books and can be found speaking at (and keynoting) tech conferences all over the world. We love to learn and share knowledge, and you'll find a community of passionate technologists eager to back your endeavors, whatever they may be. You'll also receive financial support to attend conferences every year.An organizational commitment to social responsibility. ThoughtWorkers challenge each other to be just a little more thoughtful about the world around us, and we believe in using our profits for good. All around the world, you'll find ThoughtWorks supporting great causes and organizations in both official and unofficial capacities.Projects are almost exclusively on customer site, so ThoughtWorkers should be flexible and open to extensive travel.Not quite ready to apply? Or maybe this isn't the right role for you? That's OK, you can stay in touch with AccessThoughtWorks, our learning community (click "contact me about recruitment opportunities" to hear about jobs in the future).It is the policy of ThoughtWorks, Inc. to provide a work environment free of discrimination. The Company will take affirmative action to ensure applicants and ThoughtWorks employees are treated without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ethnic origin, veteran status, family status, disability, sexual orientation, gender expression or gender identity. This also includes individuals who are perceived to have any of the aforementioned attributes. ThoughtWorks will adhere to all federal, state, and municipal laws and regulations governing employment. #LI-NA

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Role: Business System Analyst  Location: Newark, NJ 07105  Duration: 6 Month (Potential temp to hire conversion after 3 months) Job Description: We are seeking a dynamic and energetic individual with a strong technology and financial management background to help operationalize a Technology Business Management solution (Apptio)  This position has oversight for the analysis and translation of business needs into business/technical requirements. Leads teams and other resources to ensure alignment of technical solutions with business requirements for complex issues (quantity and magnitude). Apptio experience is a Must. Responsibilities: Works on analysis of complex issues and coordinates the documentation of business needs  Participates in the creation of technical documents and high level solution designs  Participates in the development, testing and implementation of system specifications.  Recommends best practices for delivering business solutions  Acts as Subject Matter Expert in systems and technologies Apptio Specific Requirements: Collaborate with IT Finance on IT Total Cost of Ownership, financial metrics, and cost transparency initiatives.  Import, transform, rationalize and automate data flow from systems of record such as General  Ledger, Fixed Assets, ClearQuest, ServiceNow, LeanIX, Planview, Centralized Application Repository, Asset Manager, etc. Qualifications/Education: Bachelors Degree required (equivalent work experience may be considered)  Graduate studies or professional development activities preferred Work Experience: 5+ years of related IT work experience preferably in the health insurance industry  Demonstrated experience in a lead role in major company initiatives and demonstrated leadership experience  Demonstrated progression of professional responsibility  Advanced analytical and big data analysis skills  Ability to work efficiently and effectively with multiple levels of management and staff across the organization  Understanding of IT infrastructure domains including data centers, network/communications, server utilization, virtual environments, storage, and application development  Knowledge of IT services and financial management processes and best practices such as budgeting, cost allocations, capital & operating expense handling, program portfolio management, and application/infrastructure support  2 years of Apptio experience. Special Licensing or certifications: Have or work towards achieving a TBMA certification  Strong ITIL or Service Management background preferred Knowledge: Requires knowledge of system development life cycle and implementation methodologies  Demonstrates understanding of core business functions Skills: Previous experience with Apptio required  Strong skills and experience in formulaic logic such as MS Excel if statements, VLOOKUP, pivot tables, macros, etc.  Experience in data transformation using MS Excel or Access  Knowledge and application of relational database concepts  Requires excellent verbal and written communication skills  Good with data analytics and data mining.  Previous experience working with scripting, report building, etc.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: DescriptionBusiness AnalystMust be able to interview in-person*candidates must complete a background check and drug screen upon offer*Description: We are seeking a highly motivated Senior Business Analyst, that will work to build the next generation of robust platforms that lay the foundation for our agent and broker product lines. As a member of the Brand Digital Marketing team the Business Analyst will be responsible for one or more business products and expected to collaborate with the other business analysts to coordinate across product. We are looking for an individual with a strong understanding of Business Analysis who has a demonstrated track record of defining and driving technology-based solutions to implement strategic solutions while bridging the divide between business and technical knowledge. This resource must be a clear articulate communicator, proficient in presenting to all levels.  The Business Analyst is responsible for developing solutions that support business ideas and product concepts through gathering and translating testable requirements into application software solutions. They must be a critical thinker capable of contributing independently and collaborating to drive sound solutions with a diverse team including product managers, software developers, testers, program managers, scrum masters and teams across the organization. They will serve as a liaison between the customer/business community and the software development team, working with them to obtain requirements through various avenues both Agile and Waterfall using interviews, document analysis, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, road maps, workflow analysis and use cases etc. They will need to leverage excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to mentor, coach, lead as well as direct the work of others. Responsibilities:Create and maintain standard processes, templates, workflows and proceduresConduct interviews, requirements workshops with a cross-discipline team to elicit understanding of business needsCollaborate with key stakeholders to help design and drive the functional definition of a solution that meets the program level objectives and visionWrite unambiguous, testable user stories with clear acceptance criteria; an integrated scrum team member to assure requirements are understood fully; & define non-functional requirementsWork with Product Management to write business cases and acceptance criteriaWork with Business Product Owners to facilitate creation and maintenance of product roadmaps and backlogs.Assist team to troubleshoot issues; evaluate existing application products which could address client requirements and develops recommendations where appropriatePartner with cross-functional teams to analyze, decompose and map current state processes and pain points, then determine improvement opportunities including creation of target operating modelsTake ownership to lead solutions from concept to implementation by partnering with Technology and Business to ensure requirements are satisfied and delivered on timeBuild and develop business relationships vital to the success of the projectDeliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholdersRequirements: Bachelor's degree; advanced degree, Computer Science, Information Technology, Science5+ years of experience in Business AnalysisHands-on experience in an Agile development environment, ideally Scrum.Proven experience in eliciting requirements, creating user stories, test cases, and wireframesExperience in facilitating the elicitation and evaluation of business requirements for delivering new or enhanced software systems, and measuring the success of the associated initiativesAbility to independently and quickly ramp up on new business and technical conceptsExperienced in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions using data visualization techniques and tools. Documenting systems design, creating specifications, flow charts, and other related diagrams based on user or system design specifications.Advanced knowledge in generating process documentationExcellent verbal, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills; is a team player.Very strong written skills showing the ability to convey details accurately in a well-structured and precise manner that describe end user problems and solutions.Solid experience in and understanding of Scrum Agile development or Scaled Agile Framework, Waterfall, and SDLC processesExperience with Balsamiq or similar toolJIRA knowledgeProven problem-solving skills, is logical and analytical.Experience in working with distributed, offshore teams.Experience in managing and mentoring team.Preferred CBAP (Certified Business Analyst Professional) or PMI-PBA (PMI Professional in Business Analysis)Preferred previous experience in Content Management Systems (CMS) and specifically Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)Proficient in Visio, MS Excel, PowerPoint and other Office applications to build process flows and presentations #Low  #LI-PT1Horizontal Integration is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We seek to provide employment opportunities to talented, qualified candidates regardless of race, color, sex/gender including gender identity and/or expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under federal, state or local law. In addition, Horizontal Integration will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need to request a reasonable accommodation in order to complete the application or interview process, please contact hr@horizontalintegration.com. All applicants applying must be legally authorized to work in the country of employment.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: The Business Systems Analyst (BSA) team within Digital Technology plays a pivotal role in the success of the organization, bridging the gap between the development, design and product management teams. The Business Systems Analyst (BSA) is the face of the BSA team, working closely with our business and technology partners to produce meaningful stories for our development teams to execute. The BSA is a relationship builder, negotiator and a problem solver.The BSA typically (but is not limited to) performs the following:Translates requirements into meaningful stories that the scrum team(s) can deliver against.Work with developers, user experience designers, subject matter experts, legal and compliance teams to obtain a well-rounded understanding of what is being asked for and our ability to deliver it within the constraints of our banking environment.Assesses potential impacts and changes to our core UI, middleware services and frameworks.Maintain a living evergreen repository so that we always have an understanding of our current state.Juggle multiple projects and initiatives at any given time, all with aggressive delivery expectations.QualificationsStrong hands-on experience as a Business Systems Analyst, Systems Analyst, Technical Analyst or a related discipline with an emphasis on delivering cutting edge technology within finance.Proven strong analytical and problem solving skills.Superior verbal and written communication and negotiation skills with the ability to forge lasting relationships at all levels of seniority.Experience working in an Agile environment.SOAP, XML, JSON and other similar web service protocols/technologies.Bachelor’s Degree within a technical field.Preferred Knowledge and ExperienceRetail/Consumer banking and investment products.Web service and database technologies.Appreciation of responsive web design.Appreciation of web service design.Behavioral Driven Development (BDD).Experience of working with JIRA.Experience of working with Requirements gathering tools, like Blueprint.Our Consumer & Community Banking Group depends on innovators like you to serve nearly 66 million consumers and over 4 million small businesses, municipalities and non-profits. You’ll support the delivery of award winning tools and services that cover everything from personal and small business banking as well as lending, mortgages, credit cards, payments, auto finance and investment advice. This group is also focused on developing and delivering cutting edged mobile applications, digital experiences and next generation banking technology solutions to better serve our clients and customers.When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Company, you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.At JPMorgan Chase & Company we value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you're looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies around the world, we want to meet you.

Name: Associate Director - Business Analyst
Description: Associate Director - Business Analyst New York - West 33rd StreetJob Description Position Summary The role requires the candidate to have excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong organizational / coordination skills, and strong business analysis acumen. The successful candidate will be process oriented and have a thorough understanding of the entire software and product development lifecycle along with its corresponding delivery methodologies/frameworks used (Agile, Waterfall, BDD). The candidate must have prior experience within the Fixed Income pricing domain and must be exposed to large system projects, system changes (BAU). The candidate should be comfortable working with data at a granular level be able to run complex SQL queries to analyze and extract system data. Name: Senior Technical Business Analyst - Capital Markets Technology
Description: Primary Location: United States,New York,New YorkEducation: Bachelor's DegreeJob Function: TechnologySchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: NoJob ID: 18069101 DescriptionAbout CitiCiti, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.Citis Mission and Value Proposition explain what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients and the publics trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.Job Purpose:Sr. Business Analyst on the team to work in technology group dealing with capital, collateral and liquidity management, involving extensive business and data analysis, process analysis, ad-hoc reporting. Preferably experienced in banking and financial industry. Candidates with good skills from other industry could also be considered. This is a multi-year initiative.Key Responsibilities:Ability to collaborate between multiple front, middle and back office applications, documenting trends and tying the operations view to the finance books and records view. The successful candidate will need to be a polite and warm with hands-on experience, capable of working directly with business users in the regions. The role will need work with the core technical team in New York, Pune and Shanghai teams to ensure requirements and needs of the regions are successfully incorporated in the global solutions. Name: Salesforce Business Analyst
Description: About Trilogy: Powered by big dreams and small egos, Trilogy is re-imagining how skills-based learning can close the gap between the skills of today's workforce and the needs of tomorrow's jobs. We work with experienced instructors, innovative employers, and top universities to create boot camps that prepare students for careers in the Digital Economy. Although we've successfully graduated hundreds of students, this is truly Day 1 for us. Driven by a one-team mentality, we're looking for those with the hunger, talent, and passion to ride this wave with us. Our Values: 1. We put students first  We put students first because they deserve nothing less - and our university and employer partners expect nothing less. Every aspect of Trilogy's success depends on this. We never stop improving We believe that continuous improvement is the source of innovation. We lend an ear to both our fans and our critics in an effort to deliver better programs, better service, better communication, and better value. We bring a "can do" attitude We are a team of entrepreneurs who confront challenges head-on and figure things out. We value action, effort, commitment, and learning. We succeed only as a team Teamwork is critical to our success, and we place a tremendous value on how we work together in our immediate teams, between our business units, and across the entire company. Job Description: This Business Analyst position will help lead or assist in conducting requirements sessions with end users and central operations. Responsibilities include documenting, designing and testing system implementations and launch support of solutions in Salesforce.com environment. As a Business Analyst, you will interface with business to ensure timely and effective delivery of Salesforce solutions for the business requirements. Escalates important issues to the attention of Management so that decisions can be made promptly.Responds and communicates efficiently between the business, tech and QA team on projects and to facilitate resolution of user issues as and when necessary.Communicates in written, oral and presentation formats to best represent and express user and organizational requirements to audiences up to mid-level management.Forms productive relationships with internal customers by listening, clarifying, and responding effectively.Assists the business in defining scope and priorities for system initiatives (new projects and ongoing maintenance)Basic QualificationsExceptional communication skills written, presentation skills, etc.Exceptional client handling skills able to work with all levels within the client portfolioDemonstrated ability to deliver business-oriented solutions, across a portfolio of projectsAble to successfully manage a varied workload with minimal intervention from ManagementThorough understanding of the AGILE development lifecycleAbility to conceptualize current requirements against future plansPossesses the aptitude to quickly understand work processes and flows in various business units and recognize those that could benefit from technologyProven ability to support Business Process Re-engineering (BPR) and Change ManagementPossesses an understanding of current business analysis and project management methodologies, tools and techniquesEstablished project management skills including familiarity with project scheduling and tracking documents2+ years in Business AnalysisSalesforce Knowledge is desired IND1  IND 1  #ZR

Name: Business Analyst – Fixed Income –
Description: Title Business Analyst – Fixed IncomeSalary DOELocation New York City, NYJob InformationBusinessanalyst with knowledge with the FixedIncomebusiness within the IT department in charge of Front office pricing risk and market access technologies.  Our main clients are Traders, sales and e-business.  The position will be in the FIC team, working on various fixedincometrading applications.  The Client Trading and Technology (CTT) FixedIncome team develops software for price/inventory publication, inquiry management and straight through processing of electronic trades with various external electronic trading systems such as Bloomberg, Tradeweb, BrokerTec, Trad-X, MarketAxess, etc. The position involves working closely with both the front office and trading system development teams to provide solutions to sales and trading desks. Candidates will be exposed to e-trading functions including streaming prices, trade STP, electronic trade execution, order management, and market depth aggregation. The candidate might also be exposed to advanced trading techniques such as intelligent auto-quoting and order routing, automatic hedging and automated trading strategies. Responsibilities Works with business partners within one business function to align technology solutions with business strategies. Demonstrates an informed knowledge of a business area to resolve problems on an ongoing basis.  Responsible for the collection, analysis and documentation of a client’sbusiness requirements.  Responsibilities include, but may not be limited to, the following: Planning sessions with a client to implement process improvement within an assigned client area. Generally involves using and improving information systems. Documents discussion and agreements.Establishes liaison relationship with business partners in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs.Understands client’s priorities of projects and requests. Assesses client needs utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes) to prioritize immediate business needs and recommends options, risks and cost vs. benefits.Conducts feasibility studies and drafts proposals for evaluation by appropriate users and managers. Develops and assists in the presentation of business cases.Develops, writes, and communicates business requirements for the implementation of business solutions. Procures technical assistance to help in problem resolution.Develops user test cases and validates test results during user acceptance testing.Investigates, resolves and escalates problems.Promotes an understanding of IT roles, processes and activities to thebusiness units.Supports formal reporting of project status. Typical requirements could be the enhancement of the e-trading platform to support a new type of security, or the expansion of the platform to support a new electronic market or internal trading desk. Capabilities – Required Qualification CompetenciesRequired:Good written and verbal communication skills, ability to communicate to a wide range of clients.Rigorous, Dynamic, detail oriented, fast learning capacity and able to work in a high pressure environmentKnowledge of Interest Rate derivative product lifecycle workflowKnowledge of FixedIncome products and markets including UST, When Issue securities, Agency Debt, TIPS, and Corporate Bonds, IRSKnowledge in Commercial and/or Investment Banking such as commercial credit facility, capital markets (fixedincome, derivatives and foreign exchange)Must be able to interact with a variety of clients and support staff – traders, middle office, development, infrastructure, etc.Must be a self-starter who is comfortable working in a very dynamic environment, with rapidly changing priorities.Analytics skillsDesired/ Plus:Project management skillsAlgorithmic skillsKnowledge of trading and brokerage operations – front to backKnowledge of derivative product lifecycle workflowAbility to analyze complex workflow methodologies and make process re-engineering automation recommendations.Able to provide accurate estimation of work effort, and effective status to management as well as clientsTechnical skillsRequired:Advanced Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)Software development lifecycle knowledgeBasic SQL KnowledgeWorking knowledge of one or more of the following:Financial Repository experienceRegulatory reporting knowledgeDesired/ Plus:VBAMS Office Suite, Project Management toolVisioXML KnowledgeKnowledge of Agile development methodologies Apply Here

Name: Consultant/Senior Consultant - Contract Accountancy & Finance
Description: Job DescriptionJob Title: ConsultantMarket: Finance & AccountancyLocation:575 5th Ave. 22nd floor, New York 10017Oliver James Associates: We are an ambitious, entrepreneurial and privately-owned Recruitment Consultancy with a $135 million turnover operating out of 11 international offices. Established in 2002, we have grown organically and consistently over the past 16 years to become a renowned financial services search & selection organisation, with a current head count of circa 350 employees.  We opened 4 new offices last year and currently have a physical presence in Manchester, London, Dublin, Amsterdam, Brussels, Milan, Frankfurt, Zurich, New York, Hong Kong and Singapore. 2017 was an incredible and record-breaking year for us, with 103 promotions and 118 new hires. The New York office: Oliver James Associates have been working the USA market placing senior professionals across our core disciplines for around 4 years setting up physically in October 2015. We place senior professionals on both a contract and permanent basis across IT, Data & Analytics, Change Management, Finance & Accountancy, Actuarial and Underwriting, Claims and Broking into the financial services, consultancy, fintech and technology businesses.  The office is performing extremely well, in the first 18 months in the USA we saw 4 of the team finishing in the top 15 globally and this success has continued with the USA. In 2017, New York produced the top perm biller globally and saw 6 in the top 20 for perm and contract billers across the global business.  This really is an incredible opportunity to join a company with a start-up culture and close-knit team without the usual funding problems of a start-up. You will have full backing from a $135 million company, invested into our systems, offices, networking events, your professional/personal development and entertainment.  It's a relaxed yet high performing working environment and an extremely fun team! Quarterly lunch clubs and incentives. Free drinks on Friday's. Holiday incentives. 1hr 30 minutes for the gym at lunch time. The Role: You will be joining an established team of 5 across both contract and permanent Finance and Accountancy markets in New York. This division launched 18 months ago and has quickly developed into a lucrative market, with expected billings from the top biller surpassing $250K in the first 9 months! Average salaries worked are $100K although placements have gone to above $200K annual salaries. The team dynamic is very fun and close knit, boasting a wealth of knowledge within this discipline. We are looking for someone commercially minded and energetic to join as Consultant or Senior Consultant to work on the contract team covering Finance & Accountancy across New York, with clearly defined targets and career progression path. Job Description:Proactively create, maintain, and develop a network of candidates via sales focused telephone activityProactively promote Oliver James Associates business and services to new and existing clientsIdentify new sales leads, network and meet with new and exisiting clientsKeep up with current and anticipated demand of candidates with a clearly outlined skillset, maximising efficiency through the effective use of LinkedIn and internal databasesActively mapping a candidate pool in response to client's hiring requirementsScreen, interview and assess candidates in line with company standards to ensure a thorough understanding of their job and career requirementsWhat we can offer you;Global relocation is actively encouraged within Oliver James Associates once proven - either to existing offices or to set up your own.On top of a competitive basic salary we boast a lucrative commission scheme; it is all transparent and uncapped rather than team based - so you are in control of your own income and know exactly what your take home is.Culture - Our culture is unique and maintaining this is of the up-most importance to Oliver and James as well as all Global Directors and Senior Stakeholders. Annually we spend $1 million on company entertainment so you can get to know your counterparts around the world. This consists of quarterly lunch clubs, quarterly team events, Spring & Christmas parties and a VIP Summer trip!Award-winning in-house learning and development team - for every stage of your career (on recruitment and management).Fast track progression, Oliver James Associates provide you with the right tools to propel your career with case studies of entry level candidates progressing to Director within 3,4,5 years!https://www.glassdoor.co.uk/Reviews/Oliver-James-Associates-Reviews-E795860.htm- OJ's reviewsfrom past and presentemployeeshttps://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVGgRExzuqIMu2F5ESSRAxg- Our YouTube channel so you can check out our company parties, client networking events, new office launches and more! Please apply for a confidential conversation with our internal recruitment team about the opportunity
