Name: Business Consultant – Business Analyst/Project Lead (Bethesda, MD or Remote)
Description: The Company: The Educe Group is dedicated to helping organizations evaluate, implement, and optimize talent management technologies that enable them to realize the full potential of their employees. We are partnered with innovative, industry-leading software providers such as Saba and Cornerstone to offer our clients comprehensive talent management solutions.At Educe, we offer our employees the opportunity to continually learn and develop as consultants, contribute to our growing firm and make an impact on our clients. We recognize and appreciate the unique strengths of each member of the Educe team and encourage employees to challenge themselves and hone skills based on their individual strengths and interests. We believe that by consistently offering our employees opportunities to take on new responsibilities we empower them to drive our firm’s growth. Ultimately though, we work hard here because as individuals we find personal satisfaction in making a difference. This culture is a priority for us and we intend to continue improving the ways this firm can interest, challenge, and reward us all. We think this is an important component of why Washingtonian Magazine has awarded us “Best Places to Work” four consecutive times!The Role:We are looking for driven, innovative Consultants who are eager to embrace the dynamic field of talent management technology and provide recognized, exceptional client service. You will be responsible for requirements analysis, business process mapping, training, solution design, and implementation of learning, performance, succession planning, recruiting, and compensation management systems such as Saba, Cornerstone, and SuccessFactors. You will work closely with Educe clients to help them transition to new cloud-based software, helping them optimize the return on their technology investment. You will serve as the liaison between the client business teams, the technical resources assigned to the project and the software vendor(s). You will be responsible for system configuration based on specific client requirements as well as ensuring that the solution is properly tested and the client is prepared to successfully adopt it at launch.The Responsibilities:The position involves working closely with clients and colleagues to do the following:Gather requirements and define and map current processes in order to create "to be" business processes for the client based on current best practices.Develop comprehensive project plans to be shared with clients, stakeholders and all staff members.Track project performance, specifically to analyze the successful completion of short and long-term goals and provide weekly/monthly status reporting of project metrics to the Program Manager.Implement application design by working closely with both the client and Educe technical team.Create/delegate/maintain comprehensive project documentation including business requirements, project plans, meeting minutes, risk registrar and test scripts.Assist in user acceptance testing efforts and act as the liaison between the client and the system implementation team in troubleshooting product issues as they apply to the client's business.Participate in end-user training by providing both product knowledge and insight on the client's business processes and solution design.Additionally, the position involves helping to develop and improve the Educe internal infrastructure as a whole and contributing to organizational objectives.The Requirements:Qualified Candidates will possess the following:Demonstrable ability to resolve complex system or business issues, often thinking on their feet, and offering multiple creative solutions or options.Proven project management experience with background in Succession, Performance, and/or Compensation using HR-based software.Excellent written and oral communication skills. Must be comfortable with public speaking and facilitating group discussions with senior executives.Ability to work closely and build relationships with client executives and external stakeholders.Ability to work independently, as well contribute significantly in coordination with a team.Strong interpersonal skills and an outgoing, positive attitude.A passion for service, pride in the quality of their work, and the instinct to follow-through until a job is properly done well.Attention to detail and solution-oriented with strong organizational skills.Entrepreneurial spirit and ability to be resourceful and take initiative.Strong problem solving, analytical and MS Office skills.Strong documentation skills.Ability to manage, prioritize, and multi-task on multiple projects.Ability to be flexible to and adapt to the dynamic nature of consulting engagements.Knowledge of MS Project, SQL, Oracle applications.Basic Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree equivalent required from an accredited institution.Ability to travel up to 50% to multiple client locations.U.S. citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time.This job may entail travel to client sites. The job also entails sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Should be able to communicate by telephone, email, and face to face.Please note this description does not cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst

Working with senior leadership in the school and Departments, the analyst will play an important role in the following activities: interpreting and analyzing complicated large-scale data sets from disparate systems, mapping business processes to identify improvement opportunities, developing metrics and dashboards, designing and building prototypes for new reports and analytic tools, and developing the communications to socialize, refine, and gain acceptance of recommendations, as well as monitor results. Name: Business Insights Analyst
Description: About the Position: TodayTix is seeking a business analyst (junior, mid-level) to join our Accounts, Marketing or Product team. The Accounts team is charged with managing all aspects of partner relationships (B2B) and tracking by show sales trends to unlock incremental partner and enterprise value.The Marketing team is charged with growing awareness of the TodayTix brand and acquiring and retaining users to build up the demand side of the platform (B2C).The Product Team is charged with building, maintaining and optimizing all elements of the TodayTix platform including native iOS and Android apps, a transactional website and various behind the scenes tools used to track, power and populate the consumer facing products (online and offline). As a key member of these teams, you will work closely with Senior Leadership to uncover insights using available data and make recommendations in collaboration with stakeholders to unlock opportunities for the respective teams or company at large. This is not a silo-ed workplace, but rather a dynamic non-hierarchical environment with active cross-team communication and collaborative problem solving focused on building tools for improving company-wide effectiveness with data.  We believe in using the right tool for the job our BI platforms are Looker and Amplitude. We use Python, R and excel for business analysis. Our data warehouse is hosted in AWS Redshift & S3. We also constantly use external vendor tools such as google analytics, Facebook Analytics, Tune etc. Responsibilities will include:Provide strategic insights derived from financial/operational, channel event and/or sales data that drive impact and increases in yield of new customers, sales or operational efficiency.Operate as a member of business teams and build relationships with stakeholders and subject matter experts to identify opportunities for deep analytics on customer behavior and platform performanceIdentify opportunities and make specific recommendations based on advanced analytics to develop new strategies and improve business performanceAct as a thought leader in the design, tracking and implementation of A/B tests to improve yield or throughput funnels.Build compelling visualizations and reports in Looker, Amplitude or any other data manipulation tools that enable us to democratize our data across all levels of the organizationWork with the data team to build analytical models that will predict business trends and systems to help appropriately track and attribute activities and eventsThe role will be comprised of 60% self-directed/team-directed analysis and recommendation generation, 30% analysis directed by subject-matter-experts (Marketing, Accounts, Product/Engineering) and 10% executive ad-hoc analytics supportAbout you: 1-3 years of experience working in data analytics and comfort with reporting/BI tools such as LookerExperience in building SQL queries across complex relational databaseCan leverage customer, digital, online and offline data together to aid yield optimization or operational efficiencyInterpersonal and communication skills, with a track record of working well with business stakeholdersInquisitive and a self-starterYou thrive in a startup environment, and are willing to wear many hatsKey Tools/SkillsSQLLookerAmplitudeData manipulation toolsA/B testingPythonRExcel for business analysisAWS Redshift & S3Google analytics, Facebook Analytics, Tune etc.Preferred but not requiredBachelors Degree in Math, Finance, Economics, Computer Science or other relevant degreesPassion for theater/ performing arts (Preferred for Business Analyst: Accounts role)Previous work on a business insights team (or similar)About TodayTix Were on a mission to redefine the way people experience theater. Launched in 2013, our international ticketing platform connects global audiences in 13 cities to the $50 billion live entertainment business. Through effortless access to the best shows, insightful guidance to the world of theater, and thoughtful service at each moment along the way, we enable people to discover the best that their city has to offer.  We have quickly grown to a team of more than 80 full-time employees in four offices in three cities across the country and the world. Weve completed two successful rounds of funding, and were seeking highly motivated team members to join us in disrupting an old supply chain model, creating greater access to theater, and expanding the theatergoing audience. We are actively working on hiring people from different and diverse backgrounds, educational experiences, abilities/disabilities, etc. We are supportive of accommodations needed to interview and do your job the best of your ability!

Name: Cubist Senior Business Analyst
Description: About Cubist  Cubist Systematic Strategies is one of the world’s premier investment firms. The firm deploys systematic, computer-driven trading strategies across multiple liquid asset classes, including equities, futures and foreign exchange. The core of our effort is rigorous research into a wide range of market anomalies, fueled by our unparalleled access to a wide range of publicly available data sources. Job Description The Cubist Business team manages all aspects of onboarding new quant trading teams and deployments of new trading strategies. The team also represents all Cubist Portfolio Managers (PMs) with external counterparties and is responsible for rates negotiations, and, quant research and trading relationship management. The person in this role must have a strong technical background as well strong project management skills and experience with day-to-day trading operations. He/she should have a good understanding of global market structure and electronic trading systems and have familiarity with trading rules and regulations. In addition to strong technical skills, the candidate must have excellent communication/interpersonal skills and the ability to work as a team member or independently and to work with external and internal counter parties. Familiarity with research and market data sources is a strong plus.  Desirable Candidates This is a highly selective position. The ideal candidates will have a combination of software development and communication skills with some experience working in a financial services organization, specifically with futures and FX.A BS or MS in finance, statistics, math, and engineering or computer science is strongly desired along with preferably 5 years of relevant work experience.Must have the ability to independently manage multiple long-term and short-term projects under very tight project deadlines.Strong written and oral communication skillsWorking experience of one of the Linux/Unix scripts. Additional experience with database design is a plus.Our trading focuses on systematic trading in liquid instruments (to wit: global equities, futures and FX). Name: Technical Business Systems Analyst
Description: As a Technical Business Systems Analyst, you will analyze business requirements and review/produce documented and approved specifications for any new/change to technology applications. You will analyze the impact of proposed solutions holistically, develop use cases to explain business requirements to Development teams, and contribute a business or process perspective during design reviews. In addition, you will analyze data of our third party partners to find patterns and trends, then work with Development, Product, and Support teams to create stories for additional functionality, advanced reporting, and enhanced monitoring. Finally, you will assist the Quality Management Team to ensure that documented requirements and corresponding use cases / process flows can be easily translated into test plans and test cases, and ensure that the testing process covers all identified scenarios and use cases. You will triage defects and bugs related to assigned projects in a timely manner considering project timelines. Key Responsibilities:• Analyze business requirements to understand the business needs and to determine how systems and applications can best functionally fulfill those needs• Combine business and systems knowledge to create a functional design and write user stories for a given application• Analyze data lake Production logs for trends, patterns, and anomalies• Use machine learning to automate detection of new behavior of our third party partners• Conduct in-depth research to determine if solutions to business requirements currently exist within or outside the business unit, and if not, whether new effective solutions are feasible• Analyze impact of proposed solution to develop use cases to demonstrate the business requirements to the Development team and Quality Assurance teamQualifications:• BS/BA degree or equivalent experience• 2-5 years of experience as a Technical Business Systems Analyst on enterprise wide projects• Understanding of business modelling concepts and business application development• Strong experience in Agile SDLC, and TDD and BDD environment• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including the ability to write clear and concise functional and technical specifications and detailed user stories• Strong ability to multi-task effectively, working on several projects simultaneously• Excellent analytical skills with ability to analyze complex system requirements and present findings to both internal and external stakeholders• Experience with data analyticsPreferred Skills:• Knowledge / experience using JIRA and Blueprint• Good understanding of the defect management and resolution process using defect management tools like HP ALM• Experience with Splunk or Kibana• Knowledge of machine learning and data mining• Ability to easily assimilate information and learn new applications and processes• Experience in financial / banking industryOur Consumer & Community Banking Group depends on innovators like you to serve nearly 66 million consumers and over 4 million small businesses, municipalities and non-profits. You’ll support the delivery of award winning tools and services that cover everything from personal and small business banking as well as lending, mortgages, credit cards, payments, auto finance and investment advice. This group is also focused on developing and delivering cutting edged mobile applications, digital experiences and next generation banking technology solutions to better serve our clients and customersWhen you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world. At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

Name: Business Implementation Analyst
Description: AXA  is a leading financial protection company, committed to fostering and  maintaining a diverse, multicultural and inclusive environment, and one of the  nation’s premier providers of life insurance and annuity products.  We currently have an opening for a Business Implementation Analyst (BIA).  The BIA is part of the newly formed Implementation Management Office (IMO),  within the Chief Operating Office (COO). The  IMO manages multiple strategic programs to support and enhance our value of as  a newly listed Public Company. This role will assist in managing Company  projects such as preparing to transition our brand and driving growth and  efficiencies to meet goals we’ve communicated to the market. Job Description: This position will play a critical role in supporting the implementation of an  appropriate cadence and coordination with all critical business partners – ultimately  creating the plan for “stand-alone” business readiness and ensuring execution  of strategic initiatives.  The Business Implementation Analyst role  activities will include, but not be limited to: Work closely with business area leaders to  identify all key functional processes across the firm: Assist in the planning and the target state  design of the future operating modelWork closely with business area leaders to  identify all key functional processes across the firmManage and assist in the direction of  consultant relationshipsIdentify issues, structure problems and  generate actionable recommendations using formal problem-solving frameworks and  critical thinkingDevelop and manage weekly status reports, create  executive-level reports and interact with global colleaguesParticipate in the creation and delivery of  presentations to senior management, including the Executive Committee, in very  clear, structured formatsUnderstand broad project planning  requirements; lay out a project plan with direction from appropriate business  area stakeholders, as necessary Develop and write executive-level memos and  research papersManage ambiguity, complex subject matters  and concurrent deliverablesSupport multiple work streams and assist in  meeting stated goalsIntegral knowledge of how to manage  multiple work stream schedules is a highly critical aspect of this roleDeliver data extracted from the work  schedule to proactively manage issues/risks along with the critical pathDraw conclusions based on independent  evaluation of data and project schedules for review by the project teamWork seamlessly with team members,  leadership committee to achieve outcomesBasic Requirements:BA / BS in Business, Accounting or FinanceAdvanced Excel experience in creating pivot tables and macrosMinimum of one-year experience implementing projects for business unit across a large organizationPreferred:Master’s Degree in related disciplineExperience with budget forecasting and analysisStrong PowerPoint and presentation skillsKnowledge/Experience with Mergers and AcquisitionsBusiness process consulting (Six Sigma, Lean etc.)Experience facilitating meetingsExperience collaborating with and speaking/presenting to senior management ABOUT AXA:  We have been providing stability and reliability to our clients since 1859 to help them live their lives with confidence, to give them peace of mind, and enable them to realize their dreams for their loved ones and their legacy.  As an employer AXA is committed to creating an environment where everyone feels completely comfortable bringing their true selves to work every day. AXA US has been recognized and certified as a great place to work by the Great Place to Work Institute.  We provide our employees opportunities to move within our organization, so they can grow their career and skills without ever having to leave AXA. Almost 40% of our open jobs are filled with current employees.  NOTE: AXA participates in the E-Verify program.  In addition to competitive compensation and an outstanding benefits package including 401 (k) and medical programs, we offer the opportunity for continued professional development in a congenial corporate environment.  AXA is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to our employees, applicants and candidates based on individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, mental or physical disabilities, sexual orientation, veteran status, genetic information or any other class protected by federal, state and local laws.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst Location: Parsippany, NJReports To:Director of MarketingRole:SalariedSCOPE OF POSITION Work collaboratively with Business Managers to ensure the efficient operations of the business thorough analytical insights. Provide price analysis support for the assigned Marketing group ensuring all pricing is up to date. Develop bidding process and implement improvement over current process. RESPONSIBILITIESProvide ad hoc analytical support to Business Managers and Business Director.Maintain data integrity of pricing database and use data to enhance analysis.Ensure optimal sourcing decisions are made, considering freight economics, product quality, plant requirements, and supply capabilities.Responsible for obtaining all bid results and documenting those in appropriate computer software/systems (SAP).Serve as the link between the Business and functional support to get new customers setup and product is supplied on-time.Manage data integrity of pricing and bid database.Prepare periodic reports for business area evaluation or for customers.Provide price/competitive analysis for Business Managers as required.Manage day to day operations for assigned buy/resale product line.Support bid group.Automate analytics and reporting processes in Excel.Conduct ongoing research to monitor relevant industry data and market indices.Other duties as assigned.REQUIREMENTSPost-Secondary completed in Business.Minimum 3-5 years of experience in an analytical or analyst role.Ability analyze and generate reports via excel.Working knowledge of plant chemical processes (preferred), as well as safety and environmental regulations.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, etc.).Strong interpersonal and communication skills.Ability to meet tight deadlines.Ability to effectively multitask.Excellent problem solving and strong presentation skills are also required.COMPANY OVERVIEW People First!  By joining our team, you will have the chance to be part of a vibrant and growing company. We offer an exciting work atmosphere and opportunities for professional development. At Chemtrade, we take pride in rewarding our employees for their commitment, performance and hard work by offering a variety of programs and services. We offer a comprehensive and very competitive health and wellness program, including medical, dental, paid vacation and a fitness activity subsidy. Our unique culture enables employees to thrive in a supportive and engaging workplace. Employee engagement is not just something we talk about at Chemtrade, but fulfilled through exciting programs like Employee Recognition and Rewards (CHEers!), and Chemtrade University.  Our friendly work environment fosters positive interaction amongst employees within and throughout different departments and locations. We treat our employees with fairness and equity. We value diversity, recognize the benefits of an inclusive work environment and pride ourselves on our commitment to the Health and Safety of our employees and the communities we work in through Responsible Care®. Chemtrade is an Equal Opportunity EmployerChemtrade is committed to fair and accessible employment practices and will, where possible, provide accommodations for persons with disabilities.#Chemtrade123 #ZR

Name: Treasury Business Analyst & Program Manager
Description: The Corporate Platforms and Initiatives group at Two Sigma works with functional groups to design and implement scalable business processes and technology solutions to support the firm’s growth. We are looking to add an experienced business analyst / project manager who is passionate about taking our Treasury platform to the next level of excellence. In this capacity, you will be responsible for – Business analysis – conducting current state assessments, developing future state processes, syndicating approach with engineering and functional teams, documenting business requirements, converting requirements to functional specifications for engineering teams, coordinating testing, and be responsible for overall solution delivery.Project management – managing stakeholders with diverse agendas, driving meetings, developing consensus, managing project schedules, and applying best practices of project management.Program management – managing the project portfolio, helping drive prioritization, support development of business and technical architecture, developing relationships with engineering and functional teams, and helping in bidirectional translation between groups. Background and Skills: This role straddles both business and technology groups, including; execution, trading, business development and operations as well as their respective engineering teams and requires both “big-picture” thinking and “in-the-weeds” analysis/delivery skills.You will have 10+ years of experience in full lifecycle of project management – designing, developing and implementing business processes and supporting implementation of technology solutions.Ideal candidates would have worked at financing groups at prime brokers, treasury functions, consulting organizations, or in FinTech firms focusing on Treasury or portfolio financing.You will have excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities, attention to detail, a strong work ethic, and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.You will also have proficiency in SQL, MS Office (including Excel, PowerPoint), and be comfortable presenting to senior stakeholders.

Name: Business Analyst – Business Consultant
Description: GreySpark’s Business Practice is focused on assisting our capital markets clients address key business challenges by delivering tactical or strategic change projects, conducting targeted business reviews and defining target operating models. GreySpark promotes industry best practices and adds value by working collaboratively with our clients to provide deliverables bespoke to their needs.  As a Business Consultant you will have the opportunity to collaborate with clients across a range of engagements. You will be expected to understand the key industry drivers including regulatory change and the evolving market structure and be able to articulate how these changes are impacting market participants.  You will be expected to demonstrate experience of using a range of analytical tools, producing high quality documentation and working with a diverse teams. Critical to your success will be the ability to build strong relationships and rapidly develop your capital markets knowledge.  Within the Business Practice you will participate in regular industry focused workshops, contribute to GreySpark Capital Markets Intelligence research, identify opportunities and grow your specialist knowledgeWhat are we looking for in youEntrepreneurial spirit, personal and professional integrity and a desire to obtain excellenceStrong interest in financial marketsTrack record of consistent client focused deliveryHistory of learning and self-improvementFlexibility to work on client site and work on a variety of projects of varying scaleResponsibilitiesInvolved in any phase of the project life cycle, from initiation to closure.Running of business transformation projects or IT change projectsBuilding and developing business casesGathering and analysing requirementsOwning and delivering business and functional requirementsManaging stakeholders on different levels and in various business areasSkills & QualitiesProven business analysis experience with evidence of logical/progressive thinkingUnderstanding of project delivery methodologiesExperience of dealing with diverse stakeholdersExcellent communication skills and ability to distil complex data or situations into simple messagesPrevious consulting experience is desirablePrevious Capital Markets experience is preferred though exceptional candidates from other sectors will be consideredQualificationsMinimum bachelor degree or equivalentPrince2 or comparable project management methodology experience is desirableApplyTo find out more about the role please contact our Talent Acquisition TeamEmail: careers-us@greyspark.com Share this job or follow us on Linkedin & Twitter inShare

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Current employees and contingent workers click here at https://wd5.myworkday.com/iheartmedia/d/task/3005$4482.htmld to apply and search by the Job Posting Title.  iHeartMedia *Job Summary:** With over a quarter of a billion monthly listeners in the U.S., iHeartMedia has the largest reach of any radio or television outlet in America. The company owns and operates 858 broadcast radio stations, serving more than 150 markets throughout the U.S. Plus, iHeartRadio - a free, industry-leading, digital music service - gives users instant access to more than 2,000 live radio stations and allows them to create custom stations inspired by favorite artists or songs, anywhere they are.  As a member of the IT Business Value team, the Business Process Analyst will work with various levels of our organization to provide detailed process mapping of value streams (people, product and process). The goal of this work it to identify opportunities for maximum improvement, provide recommendations based on findings and support discussions and decisions against future state product delivery. This role will work in concert with the business and technical arms of our organization, communicating effectively with both entities and ensuring approved recommendations come to fruition. *As Business Process Analyst, you will:** + Collaborate with business stakeholders and associated working teams to understand key business strategy and drivers.  + Document as-is business and system processes and work with business leaders to develop improved & streamlined solutions (product, process, organizational) to complex business challenges.  + Lead requirements gathering/investigative sessions to evaluate and document existing business processes and future business needs.  + Partner with all areas of the business to publish said opportunities, business processes, functions and procedures that can be enhanced, streamlined or eliminated.  + Develop specific recommendations based on quantitative and qualitative evidence  + Collaborates and knowledge shares with tech teams to determine proper course of action and recommendation.  + Follows best practices initiated and tools used by our architecture partners  + Leads and facilitates meetings and process workshops with clear agendas, action items, and outcomes  + Conducts business friendly reviews of work and findings  + Collaborates with colleagues in a variety of roles across company to support ongoing initiatives and strategic projects  + Understand and incorporate complex business, operational, technical and security requirements.  + Become a domain expert in the assigned product or functional area, and support development of standards, policy and procedures.  + Advocate BPA outcomes and recommendations to cross-functional audiences through written reports, oral presentations and business interactions  + Educate business users responsible for managing and operating business processes *Requirements:** + BA/BS degree in information technology/systems or related technical field/equivalent practical experience.  + 5+ years of relevant work experience in an operational environment, including consulting experience, running JAD sessions, Unified Modeling Language (UML), Business Process Modeling (BPM, BPMN), and development of requirements.  + LEAN/Six Sigma Green Belt certification required  + BPM certification preferred  + 5+ years of experience in documenting current state process maps, identifying root causes and escalating to relevant group for appropriate solution  + Experience writing detailed requirements of user needs, business impacts, and system functionality that are actionable, definable, relevant, measurable, and testable.  + Superior communication and presentation skills; capable of interfacing effectively with multiple levels of management across our business units.  + Ability to quickly develop new approaches/creative solutions to complex problems and convey ideas in a tangible form  + Works both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.  + Thrives and quickly executes in an environment of rapid change, minimal structure, and high expectations  + Team player with leadership skills, abilities and desire to interact with people at all levels  + Excellent organizational skills, with an attention to detail and ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously under tight deadlines  + Proficiency in MS Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint).  + Experience working in an Agile environment. *Location** New York, NY: 125 West 55th Street, 10019  Position Type  Regular  The Company is an equal opportunity employer and will not tolerate discrimination in employment on the basis of race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, ethnicity, national origin, marital status, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected classification or status.  Our organization participates in E-Verify. Click here at http://iheartmediacareers.com/Pages/EEO.aspx to learn about E-Verify.  Current employees and contingent workers click here at https://wd5.myworkday.com/iheartmedia/d/task/3005$1999.htmld to apply and search by the Job Posting Title.  iHeartMedia, Inc. is one of the leading global media and entertainment companies specializing in radio, digital, outdoor, mobile, live events, and on-demand entertainment and information services across the nation and providing premier opportunities for advertisers.  _Click Here To Learn More About Us:_  www.iheartmedia.com at http://www.iheartmedia.com/Pages/Home.aspx

Name: Business Analyst - Capital Markets
Description: This Business Analyst position will support business process transformation initiatives for our Capital Markets - Finance and Operations groups. This includes developing the definition of future processes, understanding and documenting the business requirements for the automation, and facilitating any needed organizational change management. The successful candidate will be highly analytical with good attention to detail, possess excellent oral and written communication skills, and be a collaborative team member, plus experienced in developing rapid prototyping frameworks.  The Analyst will work with senior leaders to assess opportunities for process re-engineering / automation, and regularly present status updates to functional managers. The role reports to the Program Manager for the Finance and Operations group. Leading of process re-engineering and process transformative activities to aid the orchestration and automation of business processes and tasks within Finance using automation technologies.Leading of business process mapping for automation projects, including identification of change impacts and needed business controlsLeading of requirements gathering, process and business analysisMay need to manage the organizational change management activities (e.g. communications, stakeholder impacts, training, etc.) for automation projectsCreating and maintaining functional documentation for already automated or ‘to be’ automation candidate processesAnalyze incidents and conduct functional analysis and functional resolution of needed break-fix/de-bugging issues (e.g., analyze, design and test activities) in conjunction with the technical support resourcesPartnering with external resources to implement new task automationsFacilitating meetings and workshops with business and technology stakeholdersManaging dialogue with new vendors, evaluating new technologies.Other activities as assignedBachelor's Degree with 3-5 years of relevant experience in Financial Services industry (Computer technologiesProject management experience in a Business Analyst role, including requirements gathering and building functional specs to articulate business needsExperience with business process re-engineering of financial processesDeveloping and participating in design thinking workshops for future-state processes and solutionsAnalytical skills necessary to make solid decisions: define problem or process improvement opportunity, identify and analyze options, propose solutionExperience with organizational change management activities (e.g., communications, stakeholder impact, Name: Senior Business Analyst, Marketing
Description: As part of the Global Business Performance team and as the first Senior Business Analyst, Marketing here in Yotpo's NYC office, you will play a key part in supporting our sales and marketing teams as we continue to grow. Through your expert analytical ability to provide key insights and recognize opportunities, you will help drive our most strategic initiatives forward and make a huge impact on Yotpo! Responsibilities:Work closely with our marketing leadership teams to define and measure business key performance indicators.Build and maintain data analyses and reporting dashboards.Provide actionable recommendations and insights to our major business units.Stay updated on new tool features and functionalities, initiating recommendations for process improvements.Work closely with marketing, sales, operations, and senior management in a fun, dynamic, and lively startup environment.Requirements:At least three years of relevant work experience as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, or similar role.At least two-three years of experience working at a SaaS company, B2B and/or B2C.Strong analytical, communication, and organizational skills.Advanced Excel and SQL skills.Experience with Tableau, Qlikview or a similar tool.Ability to multitask and handle various priorities in a fast-paced environmentStrong communication and interpersonal skillsBA/BS degree Information Systems Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or other related fields.Must have a valid U.S. work authorization to apply.Why Yotpo:The best technology: Yotpo has set the industry standard with the most cutting-edge solutions for user-generated content, visual marketing, loyalty programs and referrals. Our platform runs on an A.I. engine that dramatically revs up efficiencies and conversions across every application. We innovate in-house or we acquire. No matter how we need to get it done, we're going to give brands everything they need to win in a customer centric-world.The best brands: We work with some of the most disruptive, progressive and beloved brands in commerce today, from digital-native darlings like Away Travel, Glossier and UNTUCKit to enterprises like Bob's Discount Furniture and the 1-800-Flowers family of brands.The best partners: The Yotpo platform offers the most integrations in the commerce ecosystem. Official partnerships with the likes of Google, Facebook, Shopify Plus and Magento, an Adobe company, empower eCommerce and marketing pros to do their jobs more efficiently and effectively.The best people: As Crain's New York Business put it: Yotpo is a Best Place to Work. We earned this honor for our focus on diversity and inclusion; individualized attention, rewards and recognition; and beefed up benefits including monthly catered lunches, stocked kitchen and bar, 401k matching, summer flex days, commuter benefits, generous PTO, dental/vision/health insurance, life insurance, referral program, company outings and happy hours, puppies, and so much more!About Yotpo: Yotpo provides brands with everything they need to win in a customer-centric world. Yotpo's suite of integrated solutions for user-generated content marketing, loyalty, and referrals helps commerce companies accelerate growth by enabling advocacy and maximizing customer lifetime value.With Yotpo, brands can effectively leverage social proof to increase trust and sales, cultivate loyal customer advocates, and make better business decisions based on customer feedback. Yotpo proudly serves thousands of brands including Away Travel, Glossier, and MVMT. An official partner to Google, Facebook and Shopify, Yotpo has raised $101 million in funding and employs over 300 employees globally.

Name: Business System Analyst
Description: Description: An immediate need for an experienced Business Analyst Consultant to support the Distribution sales of the Information Technology department. The ideal candidate will have 5-8 years of Business Analysis experience (prior experience with billing and subscriber tracking systems and in areas of financial accounting in the TV and Media industry is desirable). Roles and Responsibilities: Interact and Liaise with the business units, including Distribution Operations, Finance (A/R), Distribution Sales, and Legal, to understand their system needs Gather requirements and write BRDs based on the requirements Articulate requirements to the development team, and create corresponding functional specifications Support the business in the day to day use of systems Maintain list of enhancements and prioritize enhancements and slot them into releases Develop use cases and test cases for testing Work with QA team to ensure stringent and complete testing of functionality Conduct UAT sessions with the business, including writing UAT test scripts, to ensure functionality is built per requirements Provide frequent status updates to business and upper management Understand the business and proactively suggest process and systems improvements Establish a strong client relationship with the business and become a partner in their process Provide excellent customer service to the business Available off hours and weekends for production deployments and as needed for month-end support Required Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Ability to gather requirements effectively and convert them into BRDs Excellent analytical skills and ability to work with development team to design a viable and cost-effective solution Ability to document design in functional specifications Minimum 5 years of technical business analysis experience Ability to capture and document issues and capture effective meeting notes 3+ years of experience in MS Office Suite of tools (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, Project) - provided by DiceBRDs,Visio, Technical Business Analysis

Name: Agile Business Analyst
Description: Location: New York, New York  AQUENT is looking for a Business Analyst with financial services background, 7-10 yrs experience and eligible to work as W2 for all employer (AQUENT is not in a position to sponsor talent at this time). This is a long term assignment in New York City. Selected talent must work onsite, at least 40hrs per week. No remote talent or C2C will be considered.  The Agile Business Analysis involves understanding user needs, breaking those needs out into constituent parts, analyzing multiple solutions and supporting the communication and delivery of a solution to meet the user needs. Roles that might draw skills from this area include: Business Analyst, User Researcher, Performance Analyst, Designer, Developer. Responsibilities include:Deconstruct user needs and problem statements into constituent parts for analysis and reconstruction. Separate out what is critical, analyze component parts from all sides and 'reassemble' in order to lead to viable solutions.Listen to user needs and ask probing questions until the real need is drawn out and understood through root cause analysis. Evaluate multiple options before helping the team to settle on one solution.Facilitate working meetings effectively, using techniques such as active listening and negotiation. Tailor communication style to suit both face-to-face and virtual settings, including TP and conference calls.Ensure that the wider impact of changes is understood by parallel work streams.Work with the development team to ensure they have a complete understanding of the business and user needs. Make sure end user perspectives are fully considered by the content and technical design team.Facilitate in the continuous review and iteration of development work to ensure the business and user needs continue to be met by the proposed solution.Understand organizational and wider strategic objectives, and ensure that solutions are aligned with key priorities. Be alert to changes in strategic direction and assess the impact of change.Design and plan with stakeholders the process to be used to gather user needs and other relevant data.Perform analysis of user stories and make amendments where necessary. Facilitate and give input into prioritization of user stories.Interpret data from a range of sources (E.g. user research and performance metrics). Work with designers and developers to ensure solutions are based on data.Create user flows, wireframes, and map business processes, which represent the current structure and future design of a product or service.Analyze the existing landscape with an innovative mindset. Identify opportunities and generate ideas for continuous improvement or new solutions to meet user needsUnderstand end-to-end requirements lifecycle (elicitation, analysis, documentation and validation), techniques and tools to assist business areas to understand their business requirements and ensuring these are documented, prioritized, and agreed as the project scope. The final output being a business-approved requirement document (BRD). Analysis strategies Awareness of available analysis strategies/tools and understanding their application to the relevant business scenarios. Some examples below (not exhaustive): o SWOT (Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats)  o Cause and Effect diagrams (aka Fishbone)  o 5 Whys  o Event Tree Analysis  o Pareto analysis (80/20 rule)  Business feasibility planning and  measurement techniques Work with business and project sponsors to prepare business cases demonstrating clear ROI for new projects (E.g. perform cost benefit analysis, gap analysis, stakeholder analysis, BCG matrix, 6-sigma, Activity-Based Costing (ABC), Porter's Five Forces). Modeling techniques Understand industry standard tools/techniques and facilitate modeling of the target organization to make recommendations to improve procedures and working practices. Some modeling techniques include data flow diagrams, entity relationship (ER) model, UML diagrams, BPMN basics (aka swimlanes), mind maps, AS-IS, and TO-Be analysis. Conceptual and functional design Provide conceptual solutions to complicated business problems/needs by working with UX specialists to convert customer requirements into technical solutions that are both feasible and cost effective ensuring that the quality of the product experience meets business needs Acceptance testing Assist business stakeholders in ensuring appropriate levels of test coverage during acceptance test phase by working with the test team to map business requirements to testing scenarios (please refer to Quality Assurance & Testing worksheet). Quality reviews and best practice Provide advice and guidance on best practice business analysis methodologies and techniques. Identify areas for process improvement to ensure full use of best practice and review documents (E.g. requirements definitions, business cases, interface specifications, test scripts/scenarios) for completeness and consistency. Project support Support project managers in project planning, initiation, tracking, and delivery activities. Contribute to the identification and impact assessment of program and project issues and risks to proactively identify and resolve issues and mitigate risks. Interested applicant(s) are encouraged to send their resume in MS Word format to Rdavenport@aquent.com for immediate consideration now! (No Phone Calls Please)PI105677181

Name: Data Analyst
Description: At Fareportal, we create the technology that is driving innovation in the travel industry one of the worlds fastest-growing sectors. Our employees are the core of our organization and together were revolutionizing the way people book travel.  Our portfolio of brands including CheapOair and OneTravel receive over 100 million visitors annually and drive over $4 billion in revenue.  In addition to competitive pay and benefits, generous time off, and frequent company-wide social events, Fareportal provides employees with an environment that nurtures diversity creativity, and success. Our open and Agile workspace gives our employees the time and space for collaboration, brainstorming, and research and development. At Fareportal, youll be challenged, rewarded, and motivated to work effectively day in and day out.  We are seeking a Data Analyst to help lead analysis on pricing opportunities, customer behavior, and competitive positioning to build a long-term pricing strategy for the firm. This person will be part of the Pricing team, giving them unique access to make impactful decisions on Fareportals revenue. The right candidate should be high-performing, driven, willing to learn and excited about travel. Responsibilities:Work collaboratively with departmental managers to identify areas of potential revenue growth (e.g. brand teams, marketing teams)Perform analysis of highest growth opportunity areas to identify and recommend new ways to improve revenue (e.g. analyses around pricing opportunities, competitive positioning, and customer behavior)Use statistical methods to analyze data and generate useful business reports outlining pricing recommendationsDesign a strategy to test pricing recommendations including a reasonable hypothesis, implementation, and key metrics for determining successTrack test performance against key performance indicators (KPIs) and launch successive testsClearly communicate results visually and verbally to stakeholders and senior managementSupport executive leaders in mobilizing and execution of long-term plans (e.g., program management, setting/tracking metrics, developing roadmaps, creating process maps)Requirements:Bachelors Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or similar quantitative disciplineMasters Degree preferred2+ years of experience working in a data analyst roleResults-oriented, self-driven individual with the ability to manage complex projectsSQL experience and advanced Excel skills required; Python, R, PowerBI preferredExcellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to create an effective presentation to drive actionAbility to collaborate effectively and work as part of a teamDetail-oriented individualBasic understanding of Agile methodologyWhat we offer:Unique opportunity to work with and learn from senior executivesOpportunity to move vertically and horizontally across the organizationFlexible work hoursMedical, dental and vision benefitsFlexible spending accountsTravel benefitsTeam outingsCorporate discountsBreakfast bar

Name: Senior Analyst - Business Intelligence
Description: Here at 1stdibs one of our core values is 'Say It With Data' and we are looking for an exceptional Senior Analyst - Business Intelligence to join our Business Intelligence team. Our Google Analytics implementation is a complex and exciting challenge to take on. Our core business has aligned itself around Google Analytics segmentation and the success of these teams come from the strength of our Google Analytics implementation.  In this role, you will have the opportunity to learn and develop expertise around how a luxury e-commerce marketplace leverages web analytics to drive decisions. To succeed, you will have an intimate familiarity with Google Analytics and you will be an expert in translating new product features into tracking requirements. You will develop and refine your business acumen by constantly balancing the needs of technical implementation, feature optimization and analytical measurement.  This is an exciting role with lots of room for development as we haven't yet reached our full potential with Google Analytics. This role and the wider Business Intelligence team is the mechanism for how we 'Say It With Data' within our company and as such, this is a high visibility and high impact position, with regular exposure to top management What you'll doTake ownership over tagging, implementation and reporting of Google AnalyticsDevelop best practices for ongoing application of tag management solutionsWork closely with various cross-functional stakeholders such as ecommerce, performance marketing, content, technology, product and advertising to capture the data needed to drive business decisions.Validate accuracy and completeness of data captured, and maintain technical documentationPartner with Analytics team to ensure captured data meet the reporting/dashboarding requirementsReview data trends post-implementation to confirm accuracy and identify anomaliesAssist Analytics in automating reporting and data requestsWhat you'll bringB.A. in computer science, business analytics or a quantitative field2-5 years of experience with Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, tracking data etcAbility to translate and document business requirements into site tracking and reporting guidelinesAbility to identify | interpret trends and anomalies in data and troubleshoot accordinglyAbility to think critically about problems to identify root causeStrong organizational skills | attention to detail and capacity to manage multiple projects simultaneouslyExceptional verbal and written communication skillsFront-end development experience (HTML | Javascript | DOM)Nice to haves:Experience with debugging tools such as Chrome Debugger, Fiddler, HTTPWatch, etc.Experience with querying languages (SQL) and some flavor of database (relational or otherwise)Experience with version control (Github) 1stdibs is the world's largest online luxury marketplace for rare and desirable objects. It has become the go-to source for the world's leading interior designers and consumers to find antiques, furniture, jewelry, vintage fashion and fine art.  Backed by Benchmark Capital, Insight Venture Partners, Index Ventures, Spark Capital and Alibaba, 1stdibs is a unique blend of expert curators and seasoned Internet executives from companies including eBay, Gilt, Google, FreshDirect, Mlb.com, Shutterfly, and Twitter. 1stdibs is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Name: Business Analyst - Senior
Description: JobDescription :TheRole: Business Analyst - Senior The Location: London, New York or Denver The Team: With over 20,000 employees working across 95 offices all around the world, the diverse and vibrant community at S&P Global is unlike one you’ll find anywhere else. This is an opportunity to join the Technology Product Management Team working closely with business stakeholders to define and deliver IT solutions to a variety of business problems in a highly collaborative, agile environment. The Impact: We are in search of a highly motivated individual who is ready to take their career to the next level in a fast-growing company. Do you love defining solutions to complex business problems as well as getting in the trenches and working with the team to get the work done? Do you like working with state of the art technology? What’s in it for you: You will be a leading member of an Agile Scrum team accountable for delivering high quality software to internal and external customers. The chance to dig in to complicated technical details surrounding product requirements and specifications. Work with and guide our Product Owners, Software Architects and others to fill in technical gaps in requirements. Contribute to the full project lifecycle from concept through build to adoption and digital engagement. Build and improve your skills by working with new technologies whilst driving lean and agile processes. Responsibilities:Work with Champion, Technology Product Owner and Technology Leads to propose solutions and work with their Scrum team to define MVP for delivery within the time constraints provided.Build knowledge and expertise of products, services, or technologies and content and methodologies offered by S&P Ratings.Work independently with little or no supervision on Agile activities. Monitoring team members on Agile best practices. Conduct all Scrum activities with the established framework of Agile.Build knowledge of business requirements, data models, user interfaces and navigation specifications that bridge business need with systems design/deliverables.Tailor presentations/communications to varied audiences (i.e. business vs. technical and working group), negotiate and/or build consensus with partners/support organizations.Play the role of Scrum Master for their Scrum team, drive creation of backlog of scope in alignment to overall project goals, facilitate Scrum activities, driving towards highly optimized collaboration by promoting self-organization.Lead solution design and estimation activities as a SME representative of the scrum team.Manage roll out and adoption of technical products to internal and external consumers, contribute to the continuous improvement of those processes and artifacts. Manage execution of digital engagement strategies. Provide white glove customer facing support. Support the measurement of user sentiment, and value realization data and KPI's to feed into product roadmaps and backlogs.Act as a regional subject matter expert analyzing regional jurisdiction business and control differences to ensure solutions designs meet our global user base.What We’re Looking For: Candidate should have familiarity and foundational understanding of the below concepts: Use Judgment based on practice and precedence to accurately define problems by trying to understand underlying factors/causes.Proposing, implementing, and evaluating technical solutions to business problemsStrong writing, conceptualization, and analytic skillsStrong interpersonal skills – Well developed communication and diplomacy skills to exchange complex informationAbility to form questions and hypothesis about long-term strategy of business and follow through with technical solutionsManaging the Scrum processAgile story writingData Analysis / Basic SQLIt is beneficial is the candidate has experience with the below:Workflow/BPMCommercial customer facing productsBig Data, Data Science, Data Governance, Content ManagementRisk & RegulatoryChange ManagementDigital customer engagement and outreachDigital Training Development/DesignBasic Qualifications:BA/BS degree in a related area such as finance, economics, information technology, or businessRequired 3+ years of related professional experience (BA, QA or management consulting)Preferred Qualifications:Preferred 3+ years’ experience in a financial industry/financial servicesScrum Master or Agile certificationLean Management / Six Sigma CertificationDemonstrated understanding of the following: Equity and Corporate Credit Analysis; Structured Finance; Ratings Process; Finance/AccountingAbout S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide.  S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. Name: Business Analyst (World Trade Center)
Description: We are seeking a qualified candidate for the position of WTC Business Analyst for a 6-month contract to permanent opportunity. The candidate must have a strong background capturing and analyzing requirements gathered from end users and other stakeholders, creating BRDs, functional specifications, paper mock ups and flowcharts or other relevant documents and materials as requested for the World Trade Center initiative or other projects. Strong written and spoken language skills are a must and a strong background in clinical healthcare technologies and processes is strongly preferred. The BA will partner with business users, project managers and developers. Along with the Project Manager, the BA will serve as the primary intermediary between the business and the development team. Engagement Location, Hours and Duration: The engagement will take place at our NYC location. Consultant during this engagement may be expected to travel 10% within the 5 boroughs of NYC. Principal Duties and ResponsibilitiesInterview users, stakeholders, and sponsors to assess departmental needs to create Business, functional and technical requirements documents.Develop documentation of test plans, technical documentation, release notes, end-user guides, training programs and/or other materials as necessary.Analyze and document client's business requirements and processes; communicate requirements to technical personnel by constructing basic conceptual data and process models, including process flowcharts and technical specifications.Decompose information gathered into details including sources of data, data types, users, user types, interface components, interface navigation needs, reporting needs, and administrative system needs.Presenting concepts in a concise and focused manner, including narrative, process diagrams, role and accountability diagrams and business-focused story boards.Research industry practices; collect and analyze data; draw appropriate conclusions and recommendations; present results in written reports or through oral presentations using visual aids.Coordinate user groups and project teams, convening conference calls and meetings and maintaining minutes and follow-up logs.Work collaboratively with the development team to develop designs, mockups and prototypes.Communicate technical design issues to non-technical people.Ability to work independently and as part of a fast moving team.Work within timeline and resource constraints provided by the Project Manager.Provide ongoing communication with users, managers, corporate directors and vendors to assure support and current initiatives.Performs other duties as assigned/required.Qualifications / Required Skill:A Baccalaureate Degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, Information systems, business administration or equivalent experience or education is required. At least 4 years of clinical healthcare systems experience. Experience documenting system architecture design and clinical system workflow. Detailed knowledge of general phases of SDLC, project management methodsExcellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.Must be well organized, detail oriented, highly analytical, possess strong problem solving skills and must have a desire to be accountable for project success.

Name: Salesforce Business Analyst
Description: Wolters Kluwer is a global leader in professional information services. Professionals in the areas of legal, business, tax, accounting, finance, audit, risk, compliance and healthcare rely on Wolters Kluwer's market leading information-enabled tools and software solutions to manage their business efficiently, deliver results to their clients, and succeed in an ever more dynamic world. Wolters Kluwer combines deep domain knowledge with specialized technology. Our portfolio offers software tools coupled with content and services that customers need to make decisions with confidence. Every day, our customers make critical decisions to help save lives, improve the way we do business, build better judicial and regulatory systems. We help them get it right. This is a remote location role and does not require a daily presence within a Wolters Kluwer office. Ideally, candidates are located within a 2 hour commute to a major airport. Preferred cities are New York, Chicago, Dallas, Houston, Madison (WI) or St. Louis area. Anticipated travel to WK offices is once per quarter. Responsibilities: * Lead and play an integral role in efforts related to Salesforce enhancements, operational efficiencies, and systems improvements * Work closely with key stakeholders to map business processes, gather and validate business needs, and translate business needs into functional Salesforce requirements * Conduct analysis on the existing Salesforce functionality in relation to new requirements to understand and include any related considerations in requirements, testing and training * Document system configuration and administrative processes and keep abreast of Salesforce releases, features and best practices * Collaborate closely with the Salesforce technical team on translation of the functional requirements to technical requirements, with testing, and on release management * Support new and existing Salesforce user base with questions and issues in Sales Cloud and Service Cloud * Prepare users by conducting training, providing information and resolving problems * Maintain, prioritize and report on user request backlog * Keep current with system advances, technologies and best practices * Participate in analyzing and reporting on department metrics by identifying measurements and strategies for evaluating success Qualifications: * A minimum of four years of business analyst, consulting, operations, sales, product development and/or other related experience with at least two years of Salesforce.com administration or analyst experience * Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university or equivalent work experience * Experience with Lightning, Service Cloud, Communities, and Salesforce CPQ preferred * Ability to work on multiple Salesforce and related projects simultaneously * Strong requirements gathering skills and creation of user stories * Prior Agile experience strongly preferred. Scrum Master Certification highly desirable * Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and Outlook; Access experience preferred * Ability to travel up to 20% ABOUT WOLTERS KLUWER Wolters Kluwer reported 2017 annual revenues of €4.4billion. The company, headquartered in Alphen aan den Rijn, the Netherlands, serves customers in over 180 countries, maintains operations in over 40 countries and employs 19,000 people worldwide. Wolters Kluwer shares are listed on Euronext Amsterdam (WKL) and are included in the AEX and Euronext 100 indices. EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY Wolters Kluwer U. S. Corporation and all of its subsidiaries, divisions and customer/business units is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. For more information about our solutions and organization, visit www.wolterskluwer.com, follow us on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn INFORMATION For any assistance with your application for this job opening, please call the HR Source at (888) 495-4772 or email HRSource@WoltersKluwer.com. TTY is also available at (888) 495-4771. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled - provided by DiceAccounting, Agile, Analysis, Analyst, Business Analyst, Consulting, Development, Excel, Management, Metrics, Outlook, PowerPoint, Release, Sales, SalesForce, Scrum, Testing

Name: Fedwire Business Analyst
Description: About our company - Accolite is a cutting-edge technology consulting services company with offices in North America, Europe, Asia Pac and Delivery Centres in India. We are trusted partners for our Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Aviation, Logistics, and Product Engineering clients delivering Digital and Transformation Programmes for them. We have rapidly grown over the last few years to 850 + people across the globe and continue to hire the top technical minds for our expanding customer base. Accolite is seeking strong technologists who are innovators and problem solvers for projects with our client, a global investment bank. The scope of work is within the Commercial Banking space to build scalable solutions for cash management and provide excellence in the bank's customer experience "Looking for FEDWIRE EXPERTS" The scope of the project: The specific project is to build a payments platform which will be a “High availability- Low latency” cloud based platform which can help the banks corporate clients grow their business. The scope also involves building a Liquidity Analytics data platform which will be the golden source that powers all the analytics and reporting involving complex models for cash flow analysis. To build a robust integration platform for the Banks clients to communicate with the bank regarding payment instructions and receive statuses. The platform will have integrations to various payment gateways such as SWIFT, ACH, CHAPS, SEPA etc. Role: Manage multiple tasks and use sound judgment when prioritizing. Collaborate with global cross functional team in building customer-centric products. Update and maintain documentation for team processes, best practices and software runbooks Skills: 7+ years of relevant industry experience as a business analyst on payment platforms. Understanding of US and International wire payment/transfer systems including, ACH, SWIFT, CHAPS, SEPA, etc. Solid understanding of payments systems and payments market infrastructure specially for Fedwire. Formulate, define systems scope and objectives based on user needs and a thorough understanding of business, systems and industry requirements. Ability to document business requirements to ensure applicability to business areas, ensuring that requirements/user stories are in a consumable state. Experience with leading Agile development projects, with experience being active participant through all phases in an Agile development environment. - provided by DiceFedwire, SWIFT, CHAPS, SEPA

communicating complex benefit configuration requirements in a simple and easy to understand manner to other staff. Name: Business Analyst - Cash Equities
Description: Business Analyst - Equities Trading Technology  Client is a global hedge fund company with more than 1200 employees and offices in North America, Europe and Asia. The talent and dedication of our people are critical to our success. This requires a working knowledge of accounting principles, budgeting and forecasting experience and general business acumen. This position plays an active role in the company’s month end close process duties include: expense accruals, report preparation and variance analysis. Responsible for financial analysis and reporting of assigned departments. Name: Business Analyst for Financial Wellness Access
Description: Prudential’s Workplace Solutions Group (WSG) Financial Wellness team is seeking a Business Analyst for Financial Wellness Access to help support WSG’s access to the participants it serves to address their holistic set of financial wellness needs. Prudential’s WSG includes Prudential’s Retirement and Group Insurance businesses; the Group serves over 20 million individuals across a wide range of institutional clients. The mission of the WSG Financial Wellness team is to lead the development and delivery of capabilities and services that improve the financial wellness of individuals, strengthen the value proposition of and to the institutional businesses, and facilitate the development of deeper consumer relationships. The Business Analyst for Financial Wellness Access will support the Financial Wellness Access Business Lead on a range of analytical projects as well as strategic and tactical items with the ultimate goal of enabling WSG to reach worksite participants with a broad range of financial wellness solutions. Support the Financial Wellness Access Business Lead in executing regular and ad hoc analytical projects and generating business insight toward decision-making Develop, maintain, and update key end-to-end process artifacts depicting Financial Wellness Access business scenarios Conduct fact-based, data-driven business analysis to provide business perspectives and generate recommendations Showcase problem-solving and critical thinking skills on a range of business process improvement and root cause analysis initiatives Develop, maintain, and update executive reporting and metrics scorecards to track operational performance indicators Perform data synthesis and analysis to support business decisions, analyze outcomes, and/or examine trends Conduct due diligence on FW solution deployment plans and identify/analyze any gaps or exceptions Maintain a range of standard operating procedures and resolve exceptions (and/or fold into SOP as needed) Perform research on key legal/regulatory/compliance issues and communicate findings to various stakeholders Bachelor’s degree required Previous experience as a successful Business Analyst highly desirable Minimum of 2 - 4 years of Product or Project support experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint proficiency required Process design / process mapping skills (Microsoft Visio) Excellent planning and organization skills Ability to conduct independent research on key trends and generate insights (e.g. product, legal, technology, etc.). Comfort with ambiguity and abstract concepts Exceptional interpersonal skills, including teamwork and facilitation Ability to travel on occasion (within Northeast corridor WSG offices, Newark NJ, Roseland, NJ, Hartford, CT)
