Name: Data Analyst
Description: Who we are Cityblock Health is a new type of healthcare company, operating out of Brooklyn and backed by Alphabet's Sidewalk Labs, along with some of the top healthcare investors in the country.  Our mission is to radically improve the health of urban communities, one block at a time. Importantly, our solutions are designed specifically for Medicaid and lower-income Medicare beneficiaries, and we bring the capability to deliver care in the home and neighborhood with our field-based teams.  In close collaboration with community based organizations and a leading commercial partner, we are reorganizing the health system to focus on what matters to our members. We deliver personalized primary care, behavioral health, and social services through a network of neighborhood hubs with deep community-based partnerships and world-class technology.  We partner with payers and at-risk providers, taking capitated financial risk to care for their most vulnerable, high and rising risk members. Additionally, we invest in strategic partnerships with community-based and social services organizations, in some instances bringing them into the value equation through sub-capitation and performance-based compensation.  Over the next year we'll grow quickly, including entering new markets, each with their own commercial relationships and field-based teams. This role will be a key contributor to the success of our business. The role We are seeking a curious, precise data analyst to design and build analytic solutions that will inform business decisions, drive operations, measure our performance and demonstrate our value as a company.  Healthcare data is complex and vast, so you must be excited about sinking your teeth into complex problems, untangling them and communicating your findings to the team. Behind every data element is a real person, with real problems that Cityblock is working hard to address, and the Data team is responsible for delivering accurate and timely information to steer these efforts.  If you like hard problems, have experience pulling insight out of complex structured and unstructured data sources, and are an amazing teammate, we want to hear from you! You will:Work with clinical, operational and research leaders to identify levers for broad system change, pull them, and measure the resultsPerform complex descriptive analyses over production-scale data sets to drive business decisionsBuild-out our real-time reporting dashboards and own early data tooling across Clinical, Product, and Customer Success verticalsDesign reports to steer our value-driven business lines, including traditional and non-traditional success metrics. Work with our clinical operations team to design robust evaluation modelsWork with our Chief Health Officer, Chief Product Officer, and Engineering teams dailyYou'd be a good fit if:You enjoy doing whatever it takes to execute on complex projects, whether it's researching a new technology you haven't worked with before, or building out complex data transformations in order to fuel a dashboardYou have 2+ years of experience in a highly operational data science or data analysis roleYou are a strong SQL programmer, with experience navigating and cleaning messy data at scaleExperience in a high growth technology companyYou have exposure to healthcare data in at least one domain (claims processing, EHR data pulls, HIE feeds, prescriptions, etc)Nice to have:Experience building data products using Looker/LookMLExperience with Jupyter notebook and related datavis packagesComfort across a range of data analysis toolsets (Python, R, SAS, SPSS)Exposure to standard clinical metrics and taxonomies (HEDIS, STARS, HCC, etc)You should include these in your application:A resume and/or LinkedIn profile.A short cover letter and link to any public portfolio or previous data analyses and visualization work. Cityblock values diversity as a core tenet of the work we do and populations we serve. We are an equal opportunity employer, indiscriminate of race, religion, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic.

Name: Senior Business Analyst, Marketing
Description: As part of the Global Business Performance team and as the first Senior Business Analyst, Marketing here in Yotpo's NYC office, you will play a key part in supporting our sales and marketing teams as we continue to grow. Through your expert analytical ability to provide key insights and recognize opportunities, you will help drive our most strategic initiatives forward and make a huge impact on Yotpo! Responsibilities:Work closely with our marketing leadership teams to define and measure business key performance indicators.Build and maintain data analyses and reporting dashboards.Provide actionable recommendations and insights to our major business units.Stay updated on new tool features and functionalities, initiating recommendations for process improvements.Work closely with marketing, sales, operations, and senior management in a fun, dynamic, and lively startup environment.Requirements:At least three years of relevant work experience as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, or similar role.At least two-three years of experience working at a SaaS company, B2B and/or B2C.Strong analytical, communication, and organizational skills.Advanced Excel and SQL skills.Experience with Tableau, Qlikview or a similar tool.Ability to multitask and handle various priorities in a fast-paced environmentStrong communication and interpersonal skillsBA/BS degree Information Systems Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or other related fields.Must have a valid U.S. work authorization to apply.Why Yotpo:The best technology: Yotpo has set the industry standard with the most cutting-edge solutions for user-generated content, visual marketing, loyalty programs and referrals. Our platform runs on an A.I. engine that dramatically revs up efficiencies and conversions across every application. We innovate in-house or we acquire. No matter how we need to get it done, we're going to give brands everything they need to win in a customer centric-world.The best brands: We work with some of the most disruptive, progressive and beloved brands in commerce today, from digital-native darlings like Away Travel, Glossier and UNTUCKit to enterprises like Bob's Discount Furniture and the 1-800-Flowers family of brands.The best partners: The Yotpo platform offers the most integrations in the commerce ecosystem. Official partnerships with the likes of Google, Facebook, Shopify Plus and Magento, an Adobe company, empower eCommerce and marketing pros to do their jobs more efficiently and effectively.The best people: As Crain's New York Business put it: Yotpo is a Best Place to Work. We earned this honor for our focus on diversity and inclusion; individualized attention, rewards and recognition; and beefed up benefits including monthly catered lunches, stocked kitchen and bar, 401k matching, summer flex days, commuter benefits, generous PTO, dental/vision/health insurance, life insurance, referral program, company outings and happy hours, puppies, and so much more!About Yotpo: Yotpo provides brands with everything they need to win in a customer-centric world. Yotpo's suite of integrated solutions for user-generated content marketing, loyalty, and referrals helps commerce companies accelerate growth by enabling advocacy and maximizing customer lifetime value.With Yotpo, brands can effectively leverage social proof to increase trust and sales, cultivate loyal customer advocates, and make better business decisions based on customer feedback. Yotpo proudly serves thousands of brands including Away Travel, Glossier, and MVMT. An official partner to Google, Facebook and Shopify, Yotpo has raised $101 million in funding and employs over 300 employees globally.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Company Overview: Our client is a fun, cool and sophisticated company with a whole new take on men’s underwear. Using high-quality fabrics, creating the best fit and guaranteeing comfortable function – these are the perfect ingredients for the perfect pair of underwear. Name: Business Analyst, Reporting
Description: GENERAL PURPOSE:As a member of the Business Information team, the Business Analyst will play an important business facing role. In this role, he/she will work directly with our business partners gathering data/reporting requirements, working with our IT partners in determining the best solution and supporting the testing and delivery process. The Business Analyst will also support the full BI Request Management process and will follow the requests from submission to delivery. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: • Information Management  Gain a solid understanding of the business reports and tools.  Develop an understanding of the strengths/limitations of the various tools and technologies available. Suggest alternate methods of data presentation.  Gather and document business requirements for report and data requests.  Leverage the available reporting tools; confirm the data integrity via thorough testing.  Lead creation and review of all test-related deliverables including test approach, test scenarios, test cases/conditions, scripts and results.  Routinely manage user acceptance testing for moderately complex projects and obtain sign-off from the business.  Develop training materials and job aides to support reporting rollouts.  Identify and mitigate any project related risks.  • Relationship Management  Develop partnerships acting as a liaison between the technical and business teams to understand, troubleshoot, interpret and provide guidance on reporting and data needs.  Facilitate meetings; issue tracking/resolution, escalation etc. as you follow a report/data request from submission through to delivery.  Lead training classes, collect user feedback, and support the users as needed.  Lead post deployment validation as instructed by project leadership or management. COMPETENCIES: • Analysis and Judgment  • Results Driven  • Business Acumen  • Interpersonal Effectiveness  • Communication  • Technical Competence with data gathering  • Customer Service  • Presentation and training abilities QUALIFICATIONS AND SPECIAL SKILLS REQUIRED: • Bachelors degree with a concentration in Business, Economics, Finance or Computer Science, or an equivalent diploma  • 3 years of retail experience in the business, business support or equivalent work experience  • Commensurate level of working business knowledge preferred  • Hands on experience with BI tools (i.e. MicroStrategy, Microsoft SSAS, etc.)  • High degree of proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)  • Experience with merchandise planning processes and tools is a plus  • Visio skills is a plus  • Ability to understand and apply instructions or suggest alternate proven methods to move projects forward  • Ability to follow established practices, policies and procedures  • Ability to build and maintain stable working relationships  • Strong communication skills  • Strong analytical skills  • Able to create simple to complex analytical solutions  • Ability to take an abstract analytical problem and break it down into actionable tasks PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/ADA: • Job requires ability to work in an office environment, primarily on a computer.  • The job also requires sitting, standing, walking, talking on the telephone, attending in-person meetings, typing, and working with paper/files, etc.  • Job occasionally requires bending, kneeling, reaching, and lifting up to 10 pounds.  • May also require occasional driving and/or traveling overnight for business functions or site visits.  • Vision requirements: Ability to see information in print and/or electronically.  • Consistent timeliness and regular attendance. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: None DISCLAIMER This position description is a summary of the primary duties and responsibilities of the job and position. It is not intended to be a comprehensive or all-inclusive listing of duties and responsibilities. Contents are subject to change at managements discretion. Name: Cubist Senior Business Analyst
Description: About Cubist  Cubist Systematic Strategies is one of the world’s premier investment firms. The firm deploys systematic, computer-driven trading strategies across multiple liquid asset classes, including equities, futures and foreign exchange. The core of our effort is rigorous research into a wide range of market anomalies, fueled by our unparalleled access to a wide range of publicly available data sources. Job Description The Cubist Business team manages all aspects of onboarding new quant trading teams and deployments of new trading strategies. The team also represents all Cubist Portfolio Managers (PMs) with external counterparties and is responsible for rates negotiations, and, quant research and trading relationship management. General responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Complete project lifecycle management shortening new PM Teams’ time to marketDesign PM research and trading solutions that adhere to firm standardsEducate PM Teams on Point72 operating procedures and technology integrationLead new strategy rollout projects working internally with Point72 Technology, Operations, Legal, Compliance and Risk groups, and externally with Brokers, Exchanges and Vendors.Provide day-to-day support for various operational procedures such as broker data management, compliance monitoring, trading, and business continuity. The person in this role must have a strong technical background as well strong project management skills and experience with day-to-day trading operations. He/she should have a good understanding of global market structure and electronic trading systems and have familiarity with trading rules and regulations. In addition to strong technical skills, the candidate must have excellent communication/interpersonal skills and the ability to work as a team member or independently and to work with external and internal counter parties. Familiarity with research and market data sources is a strong plus.  Desirable Candidates This is a highly selective position. The ideal candidates will have a combination of software development and communication skills with some experience working in a financial services organization, specifically with futures and FX.A BS or MS in finance, statistics, math, and engineering or computer science is strongly desired along with preferably 5 years of relevant work experience.Must have the ability to independently manage multiple long-term and short-term projects under very tight project deadlines.Strong written and oral communication skillsWorking experience of one of the Linux/Unix scripts. Perl, bash, and etc.Working experience with Linux/Windows Operating Systems and distributed storage solutions preferred. Familiarity with industry standards of server and storage hardware preferred.Working experience with Python programmingWorking experience of either C++, C#, or Java programmingStrong knowledge of SQL. Additional experience with database design is a plus.Our trading focuses on systematic trading in liquid instruments (to wit: global equities, futures and FX). Candidates with specific work experience and knowledge of market regulations in these areas will be strongly preferred.

Name: Benefit Configuration Analyst/Design Analyst
Description: DescriptionThe Benefits Configuration Analyst/Design Analyst is responsible for assisting in the evaluation, design, testing, and implementation of required health plan benefits and payment structure changes. The incumbent of this position must possess strong analytical skills, with the ability to perform complex business and product set up requirement analysis in a fast-pace environment. This role serves as a subject matter expert (SME) on both corporate projects and departmental business initiatives that require PowerMHS benefits configuration modifications.Duties & Responsibilities:Assist in the on-going evaluation of benefits configuration for new and existing benefit plans within Power MHS.Analyze explanation of coverage documents to assist with determining best approach for loading benefits offered including member cost share and out-of-pocket maximums.Assist in the setup of code sets and defining pre-authorization guidelines used in benefits configuration and provider reimbursement.Liaison with applicable departments to gather benefits configuration requirements and provide feedback to stakeholders regarding feasibility of change implementation.Collect and analyze data to assess and resolve operational obstacles to benefits design optimization.Perform root-cause analysis on benefit set up issues across all products, document results and present business impact analysis for proposed benefits set up changes.Develop explanatory information for other departments to better understand benefits configuration across products.Identify ways to enhance performance management and operational reports related to new business implementation processes.Monitor existing system functionality and make benefits set up recommendations, where appropriate, to maintain acceptable levels of automation in claims adjudication and accurate provider reimbursement.Aid in the creation test scripts, including regression testing cases, to validate system configuration against source documentation.Assist with organizing the release of benefits configuration changes to production to reduce the potential for migration conflict.Ensure the quality and integrity of implementation of benefits change requests through the use of production validation and audit strategies.Provide project and informational updates to management as available and/or assigned.Collaborate with business units to understand strategic goals and promote an environment conducive to creativity, change and information exchange.Additional duties as assignedMinimum Qualifications:Associate’s degree from an accredited institution.Previous managed care/health plan experience in an operations department where you have been responsible for implementing new products or benefits into plan systems.Experience delivering benefit implementation processes within a Claims Operations or Product Management environment.Experience gathering and communicating complex benefit configuration requirements in a simple and easy to understand manner to other staff. Name: Senior Sales Analyst
Description: About The Position  The role of Senior Sales Analyst will work in conjunction with the Director of Sales Operations to drive the development and activation of effective tools and procedures to optimize management and execution of core Sales management areas... General Description of the RoleThe role of Senior Sales Analyst will work in conjunction with the Director of Sales Operations to drive the development and activation of effective tools and procedures to optimize management and execution of core Sales management areas: planning, reconciling, programming, development and tracking of goals, budgets, allocations, new items, etc. Focus will be leading the monthly depletion forecasting process with Sales and maintenance of the SQL system. This role heavily relies on being ingrained with multiple touchpoints across the organization and external providers while being able to provide reporting & ways of working knowledgeable solutions on demand. As the subject matter expert for the in s & outs of our internal & third-party data service flows & reporting systems this role is critical in providing the organization with accurate and timely reporting. yearly meetingsPartner with Sales to achieve a forecast & budget consensus with improvements in MAPE forecast accuracyOwn all aspects of the Sales Forecasting Tool (SFT) monthly maintenanceLiaise with Demand Planning & Finance to ensure depletion forecasting is accurately incorporated into the shipment & gross margin processesProvide key insights into market & brand depletions & gross margin performance by highlighting risk & opportunities, trends affecting local markets, and brand updatesEnsuring data integrity between all reporting systems by researching & reconciling discrepancies and ownership of quarterly depletion auditsTake the lead with the Business Intelligence (BI) team & third-party data service providers to create & elevate reporting to the needs of key stakeholders and implement new technologies as they become availableWork with IT and Global BI/BW team to manage issues & bring Change Requests to conclusionContinuous Improvement:Lead and/or contribute to the development of tools, systems & reports that enhance the efficiency of work processes and/or improved data insights leading to better business decisionsProactively seek to understand the needs of Field Sales in general and develop recommendations and improved tools, reports etc.Work with vendors/partners to ensure the accuracy and timely receipt of data downloads, system updates and/or customized tools for use at Campari.Manage monthly product and market master data updatesProvide ad-hoc analysis of entire portfolio performance, national incentives, KPI achievements, scorecards, Name: Microsoft Dynamics Business Analyst
Description: MS Dynamics CRM Business Analyst - Job Description Position requires an individual with knowledge and experience working with business processes and Customer Relationship (CRM) cloud-based and mobile applications, The Analyst will work closely with business units, the IT group and the CRM Steering Committee to assist in building an enterprise CRM program. The CRM Analyst will participate in systems design and implementation and support for building processes and requirements, configuration, development, testing, documentation, and user support for CRM applications. Required Experience • Minimum of five (5) years of business experience with good analytical skills • Familiar with Customer Relationship Management (CRM) applications i.e. Microsoft Dynamics, Salesforce.com • Ability to do Experience communicating with multiple teams: i.e. senior management, project management and IT Governance and third party implementation partner • Experience documenting the current (as-is) processes and preparing the future (to-be) state diagrams • Out of the box thinker with the ability to create detailed functional and technical requirements • Familiar with UX design principles • Hands-on experience with the ability to create reports using SQL query language • Knowledge of the testing lifecycle with the ability to create test plans, test case scenarios • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to provide post-implementation support for our implemented solutions Required Skills • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience • Previous experience with CRM and ERP systems • Good understanding of Marketing, Sales, and Customer Service processes • Demonstrated organizational skills in terms of project management, meeting facilitation and definition of solutions with the business. • Strong interpersonal communication skills (verbal and written), including the ability to articulate business solutions. Person must also have the ability to communicate with technical teams to develop and configure solutions. • Power user for Microsoft office applications i.e. Microsoft Word, Excel, Visio, SQL and JavaScript Job responsibilities include: • Elicit detailed functional / business requirements from users and sponsors. • Create and communicate detailed requirements, solution proposals, business process designs (BPD) and business system designs (BSD) that meet the business needs • Work with developers to understand the designs and validate that the software solution will satisfy the business needs. • Conduct functional testing of implemented applications, and provide the initial support of these applications when moved to production. • Create and deliver documentation as necessary to ensure proper use of changed and newly implemented processes. • Ability to make software configuration changes to support business processes. • Assist CRM Project Manager in status reporting and project milestone tracking. • Assist in coordinating project activities and deliverables across other team members. • Effectively plan and conduct transition activities of newly implemented functionality to appropriate teams • Provide post-implementation support. - provided by DiceAnalyst, Analytical Skills, Business Analyst, Business Requirements, CASE, CRM, Customer Service, Development, ERP, Excel, JavaScript, Lifecycle, Manager, Management, Microsoft Word, Project, Project Management, Project Manager, Sales, SalesForce, SQL, Testing, UX

Name: Analyst - Marketing Strategy & Analysis
Description: PURPOSE OF THE POSITION: To provide expert technical support and assure thorough, high quality analysis, planning and development of projects and programs in support of the Sales and Retention Division. To ensure that procedures and systems affecting the Sales & Retention Division business functions are effectively designed tested, implemented and documented for optimal performance. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Conduct quantitative and qualitative evaluations of sales programs and processes by extracting data, identifying and interpreting trends, developing conclusions and recommendations and reporting on the results of these evaluations. This includes conceptualization, design and conduct of studies that evaluate Sales & Retention Division’s performance, effectiveness and efficiency. Assist with the re-engineering of programs and/or business processes as necessary.Evaluate and report on Sales & Retention Division’s initiatives based on team’s performanceActs in a liaison capacity between the Sales & Retention Division and other Affinity Health Plan departments (i.e. TSG, OSG, Analytics, Membership Accounting, Customer Service, CCU, etc.) when developing new or revising existing methods and procedures to ensure cost effective solutions to user needs.Work with the appropriate teams at Affinity Health Plan to assist with the validation of the integrity of the data to ensure the timely maintenance and updates of the data that support various processing environments.Preparing and reviewing Sales & Retention Division reporting for budgets, enrollment/ member service projections and analysis, market demographic studies, competitive evaluation and other analyses.Assist in developing and implementing appropriate, effective performance, quality, productivity, and marketing data integrity measurement tools.Develop and manage project work plans which prioritize objectives and tasks, establish timelines and due dates, identify resources and effective methods to accomplish project goals, and track project completion. Share the responsibility of managing the transition of activities from planning/development to operational status with Managers/Directors.Conduct analytical and technical orientation and training sessions, as needed, to ensure Sales Department staff self-sufficiency and the effective utilization of computer systems, operating procedures and policies as it relates to the Sales & Retention Division.Attend and participate in in various external forums, including committees, conferences, research projects, and related activities to remain current with new methodologies in order to facilitate the improvement of current/future processes.Create and maintain FE Productivity Report, CAC Integrity Reports and Queries/Tables in Access for Productivity Reports. Interact with CAC’s and Supervisors on any Productivity issues.Demonstrates proficiency with the principles and methodologies of process improvement. Applies these in the execution of responsibilities in support of a process focused approach.Perform other duties as necessary or assigned.QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor’s degree in Business, Health Care Administration or related field or equivalent knowledge.Minimum five (5) years of work experience in planning, analysis, and implementation of operating programs, preferably in a managed care or health care setting, which must include experience in an analytical or systems capacity.Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong analytical skills and detail orientation.Special interpersonal skills required to establish and maintain constructive and collaborative relationships that support the sharing of information.Ability to work and think independently, and to exercise independent judgement guided by policies, goals and objectives.Ability to effectively organize, manage and perform multi-dimensional projects and work assignments.Highly developed organizational, problem solving and prioritization skills as demonstrated by the successful and timely completion of assignments.

Name: Business Process Management Analyst [18-01864]
Description: Job DescriptionWe are seeking a Business Process Management Analyst to perform business process modeling and business analysis and assist the current contract across all agencies. This will assist in creating business process models for all impacted agencies that have gaps in their information requirements including business processes, operating procedures, storyboards, etc. This information is required to develop the future state implementation & design for all agencies for implementation. The resources will also develop specifications and operational procedure documentation in compliance with standards and procedures, using the standard BPMN modeling method. RESPONSIBILITIES a. Perform analysis of business processes, model requirements and detail with specific division SMEs during workshops.  b. Client and develop business process models with specific division SMEs to document (as-is) and/or Future State process models in BPMN modeling notation.  c. Create and Produce Standard Operational Procedures for various division specific processes  d. Create and Produce system flow documentation for various division specific processes  e. Perform detailed review of process models and organizational charts prior to review in alignment with project requirements.  f. Facilitate remediation of modeling issues/procedure documentation with SMEs. ATS specializes in providing full-service staffing solutions by providing technical and business personnel through staff supplementation and project engagements. The company has extensive contacts within its Fortune 500 client base and is able to access a large pool of talented and responsive professionals with proven records of accomplishment in both the technical and business fields.

Name: Healthcare Analyst
Description: DescriptionJob Description Summary  The Healthcare Analyst – Programming in Finance Analysis will support the department in performing functions that enable key business processes and practices. The incumbent of this position will have the ability to create and own processes to meet and exceed departmental goals as well as New York State (NYSDOH) and Center for Medicare Services (CMS) regulatory expectations. The Healthcare Analyst –Programming will work with other departments such as claims, enrollment, network management and IT to ensure timely error remediation and accurate data submission. This position requires an individual with a strong technical background with an interest in finance and healthcare. Support the production of encounter data submissions to NYSDOH/CMS as required by the respective reporting schedules. Document development requirements, reviewing specifications, creating test plans, and reviewing user-acceptance test data.Take ownership of cross departmental relationships such as Information Systems, Claims, Enrollment and other departments to enhance the quality of data submission.Liaison with NYSDOH/CMS and other regulatory agencies to maintain the organizations adherence to health plan data submission.Reconcile between large data sources and research/correct discrepancies.Assist, train and educate team members on data and encounters submissions.Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Practical experience, healthcare industry knowledge and technical expertise may be considered in lieu of a Bachelor’s degree.Work experience with SAS and/or SQL where you have created complex queries, pulled large data sets, performed data manipulations/analysis, performed direct programming functions.Ability to reconcile and analyze large data sets and assist in the documentation of processes for change control purposes.Experience with MS Excel functions that include working with large data sets, creating standardized reports, utilizing vLookups and advanced functions/ formulas; creating, using and interpreting pivot tables, filtering and formatting.Ability to communicate effectively, and work well in a team oriented environment.Preferred Qualifications:Master's degree or higher from an accredited institution with a concentration in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or Healthcare Administration.Analytical work experience within the healthcare industry (i.e. hospitals, network, ancillary, medical facilities, healthcare vendor, commercial health insurance company, large physician practices, managed care organization, pharmaceutical, behavioral health organization, etc.).Experience with encounter data/submissions and risk adjustment.Work experience with Visual Basic for Applications (VBA).Understanding of Medicaid and Medicare programs.WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Current employees and contingent workers click here at https://wd5.myworkday.com/iheartmedia/d/task/3005$4482.htmld to apply and search by the Job Posting Title.  iHeartMedia *Job Summary:** With over a quarter of a billion monthly listeners in the U.S., iHeartMedia has the largest reach of any radio or television outlet in America. The company owns and operates 858 broadcast radio stations, serving more than 150 markets throughout the U.S. Plus, iHeartRadio - a free, industry-leading, digital music service - gives users instant access to more than 2,000 live radio stations and allows them to create custom stations inspired by favorite artists or songs, anywhere they are.  As a member of the IT Business Value team, the Business Process Analyst will work with various levels of our organization to provide detailed process mapping of value streams (people, product and process). The goal of this work it to identify opportunities for maximum improvement, provide recommendations based on findings and support discussions and decisions against future state product delivery. This role will work in concert with the business and technical arms of our organization, communicating effectively with both entities and ensuring approved recommendations come to fruition. *As Business Process Analyst, you will:** + Collaborate with business stakeholders and associated working teams to understand key business strategy and drivers.  + Document as-is business and system processes and work with business leaders to develop improved & streamlined solutions (product, process, organizational) to complex business challenges.  + Lead requirements gathering/investigative sessions to evaluate and document existing business processes and future business needs.  + Partner with all areas of the business to publish said opportunities, business processes, functions and procedures that can be enhanced, streamlined or eliminated.  + Develop specific recommendations based on quantitative and qualitative evidence  + Collaborates and knowledge shares with tech teams to determine proper course of action and recommendation.  + Follows best practices initiated and tools used by our architecture partners  + Leads and facilitates meetings and process workshops with clear agendas, action items, and outcomes  + Conducts business friendly reviews of work and findings  + Collaborates with colleagues in a variety of roles across company to support ongoing initiatives and strategic projects  + Understand and incorporate complex business, operational, technical and security requirements.  + Become a domain expert in the assigned product or functional area, and support development of standards, policy and procedures.  + Advocate BPA outcomes and recommendations to cross-functional audiences through written reports, oral presentations and business interactions  + Educate business users responsible for managing and operating business processes *Requirements:** + BA/BS degree in information technology/systems or related technical field/equivalent practical experience.  + 5+ years of relevant work experience in an operational environment, including consulting experience, running JAD sessions, Unified Modeling Language (UML), Business Process Modeling (BPM, BPMN), and development of requirements.  + LEAN/Six Sigma Green Belt certification required  + BPM certification preferred  + 5+ years of experience in documenting current state process maps, identifying root causes and escalating to relevant group for appropriate solution  + Experience writing detailed requirements of user needs, business impacts, and system functionality that are actionable, definable, relevant, measurable, and testable.  + Superior communication and presentation skills; capable of interfacing effectively with multiple levels of management across our business units.  + Ability to quickly develop new approaches/creative solutions to complex problems and convey ideas in a tangible form  + Works both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.  + Thrives and quickly executes in an environment of rapid change, minimal structure, and high expectations  + Team player with leadership skills, abilities and desire to interact with people at all levels  + Excellent organizational skills, with an attention to detail and ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously under tight deadlines  + Proficiency in MS Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint).  + Experience working in an Agile environment. *Location** New York, NY: 125 West 55th Street, 10019  Position Type  Regular  The Company is an equal opportunity employer and will not tolerate discrimination in employment on the basis of race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, ethnicity, national origin, marital status, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected classification or status. Name: Data Analyst
Description: At Fareportal, we create the technology that is driving innovation in the travel industry one of the worlds fastest-growing sectors. Our employees are the core of our organization and together were revolutionizing the way people book travel.  Our portfolio of brands including CheapOair and OneTravel receive over 100 million visitors annually and drive over $4 billion in revenue.  In addition to competitive pay and benefits, generous time off, and frequent company-wide social events, Fareportal provides employees with an environment that nurtures diversity creativity, and success. Our open and Agile workspace gives our employees the time and space for collaboration, brainstorming, and research and development. At Fareportal, youll be challenged, rewarded, and motivated to work effectively day in and day out.  We are seeking a Data Analyst to help lead analysis on pricing opportunities, customer behavior, and competitive positioning to build a long-term pricing strategy for the firm. This person will be part of the Pricing team, giving them unique access to make impactful decisions on Fareportals revenue. The right candidate should be high-performing, driven, willing to learn and excited about travel. Responsibilities:Work collaboratively with departmental managers to identify areas of potential revenue growth (e.g. brand teams, marketing teams)Perform analysis of highest growth opportunity areas to identify and recommend new ways to improve revenue (e.g. analyses around pricing opportunities, competitive positioning, and customer behavior)Use statistical methods to analyze data and generate useful business reports outlining pricing recommendationsDesign a strategy to test pricing recommendations including a reasonable hypothesis, implementation, and key metrics for determining successTrack test performance against key performance indicators (KPIs) and launch successive testsClearly communicate results visually and verbally to stakeholders and senior managementSupport executive leaders in mobilizing and execution of long-term plans (e.g., program management, setting/tracking metrics, developing roadmaps, creating process maps)Requirements:Bachelors Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or similar quantitative disciplineMasters Degree preferred2+ years of experience working in a data analyst roleResults-oriented, self-driven individual with the ability to manage complex projectsSQL experience and advanced Excel skills required; Python, R, PowerBI preferredExcellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to create an effective presentation to drive actionAbility to collaborate effectively and work as part of a teamDetail-oriented individualBasic understanding of Agile methodologyWhat we offer:Unique opportunity to work with and learn from senior executivesOpportunity to move vertically and horizontally across the organizationFlexible work hoursMedical, dental and vision benefitsFlexible spending accountsTravel benefitsTeam outingsCorporate discountsBreakfast bar

Name: Senior Analyst - Business Intelligence
Description: Here at 1stdibs one of our core values is 'Say It With Data' and we are looking for an exceptional Senior Analyst - Business Intelligence to join our Business Intelligence team. Our Google Analytics implementation is a complex and exciting challenge to take on. Our core business has aligned itself around Google Analytics segmentation and the success of these teams come from the strength of our Google Analytics implementation.  In this role, you will have the opportunity to learn and develop expertise around how a luxury e-commerce marketplace leverages web analytics to drive decisions. To succeed, you will have an intimate familiarity with Google Analytics and you will be an expert in translating new product features into tracking requirements. You will develop and refine your business acumen by constantly balancing the needs of technical implementation, feature optimization and analytical measurement.  This is an exciting role with lots of room for development as we haven't yet reached our full potential with Google Analytics. This role and the wider Business Intelligence team is the mechanism for how we 'Say It With Data' within our company and as such, this is a high visibility and high impact position, with regular exposure to top management What you'll doTake ownership over tagging, implementation and reporting of Google AnalyticsDevelop best practices for ongoing application of tag management solutionsWork closely with various cross-functional stakeholders such as ecommerce, performance marketing, content, technology, product and advertising to capture the data needed to drive business decisions.Validate accuracy and completeness of data captured, and maintain technical documentationPartner with Analytics team to ensure captured data meet the reporting/dashboarding requirementsReview data trends post-implementation to confirm accuracy and identify anomaliesAssist Analytics in automating reporting and data requestsWhat you'll bringB.A. in computer science, business analytics or a quantitative field2-5 years of experience with Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, tracking data etcAbility to translate and document business requirements into site tracking and reporting guidelinesAbility to identify | interpret trends and anomalies in data and troubleshoot accordinglyAbility to think critically about problems to identify root causeStrong organizational skills | attention to detail and capacity to manage multiple projects simultaneouslyExceptional verbal and written communication skillsFront-end development experience (HTML | Javascript | DOM)Nice to haves:Experience with debugging tools such as Chrome Debugger, Fiddler, HTTPWatch, etc.Experience with querying languages (SQL) and some flavor of database (relational or otherwise)Experience with version control (Github) 1stdibs is the world's largest online luxury marketplace for rare and desirable objects. It has become the go-to source for the world's leading interior designers and consumers to find antiques, furniture, jewelry, vintage fashion and fine art.  Backed by Benchmark Capital, Insight Venture Partners, Index Ventures, Spark Capital and Alibaba, 1stdibs is a unique blend of expert curators and seasoned Internet executives from companies including eBay, Gilt, Google, FreshDirect, Mlb.com, Shutterfly, and Twitter. 1stdibs is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Description: A leading global investment firm, managing a wide range of investment funds worldwide across multiple asset classes is seeking a Business Analyst to join their team in New York. Name: Salesforce Business Analyst
Description: Wolters Kluwer is a global leader in professional information services. Professionals in the areas of legal, business, tax, accounting, finance, audit, risk, compliance and healthcare rely on Wolters Kluwer's market leading information-enabled tools and software solutions to manage their business efficiently, deliver results to their clients, and succeed in an ever more dynamic world. Wolters Kluwer combines deep domain knowledge with specialized technology. Our portfolio offers software tools coupled with content and services that customers need to make decisions with confidence. Every day, our customers make critical decisions to help save lives, improve the way we do business, build better judicial and regulatory systems. We help them get it right. This is a remote location role and does not require a daily presence within a Wolters Kluwer office. Ideally, candidates are located within a 2 hour commute to a major airport. Preferred cities are New York, Chicago, Dallas, Houston, Madison (WI) or St. Louis area. Anticipated travel to WK offices is once per quarter. Responsibilities: * Lead and play an integral role in efforts related to Salesforce enhancements, operational efficiencies, and systems improvements * Work closely with key stakeholders to map business processes, gather and validate business needs, and translate business needs into functional Salesforce requirements * Conduct analysis on the existing Salesforce functionality in relation to new requirements to understand and include any related considerations in requirements, testing and training * Document system configuration and administrative processes and keep abreast of Salesforce releases, features and best practices * Collaborate closely with the Salesforce technical team on translation of the functional requirements to technical requirements, with testing, and on release management * Support new and existing Salesforce user base with questions and issues in Sales Cloud and Service Cloud * Prepare users by conducting training, providing information and resolving problems * Maintain, prioritize and report on user request backlog * Keep current with system advances, technologies and best practices * Participate in analyzing and reporting on department metrics by identifying measurements and strategies for evaluating success Qualifications: * A minimum of four years of business analyst, consulting, operations, sales, product development and/or other related experience with at least two years of Salesforce.com administration or analyst experience * Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university or equivalent work experience * Experience with Lightning, Service Cloud, Communities, and Salesforce CPQ preferred * Ability to work on multiple Salesforce and related projects simultaneously * Strong requirements gathering skills and creation of user stories * Prior Agile experience strongly preferred. Scrum Master Certification highly desirable * Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and Outlook; Access experience preferred * Ability to travel up to 20% ABOUT WOLTERS KLUWER Wolters Kluwer reported 2017 annual revenues of €4.4billion. The company, headquartered in Alphen aan den Rijn, the Netherlands, serves customers in over 180 countries, maintains operations in over 40 countries and employs 19,000 people worldwide. Wolters Kluwer shares are listed on Euronext Amsterdam (WKL) and are included in the AEX and Euronext 100 indices. EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY Wolters Kluwer U. S. Corporation and all of its subsidiaries, divisions and customer/business units is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. For more information about our solutions and organization, visit www.wolterskluwer.com, follow us on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn INFORMATION For any assistance with your application for this job opening, please call the HR Source at (888) 495-4772 or email HRSource@WoltersKluwer.com. TTY is also available at (888) 495-4771. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled - provided by DiceAccounting, Agile, Analysis, Analyst, Business Analyst, Consulting, Development, Excel, Management, Metrics, Outlook, PowerPoint, Release, Sales, SalesForce, Scrum, Testing

Name: ERP Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job Information:Job ID: 223061 Location: Orangeburg, New York 10962 Industry: Professional Services Occupational Category: Information Technology Position Level: Professional Education: Some college, no degree Employment Type: Full TimeDescription:The Business Systems Analyst supports the software critical to the company’s operations. As part of the IT team, this person’s key responsibilities include supporting the developing the software applications critical to the business operations, inclusive of Sage X3 ERP, CRM, eCommerce/EDI, warehouse management, and transportation.  Must be strong in business operational workflows and processes, and be able to translate that from the user to the business software. Must be knowledgeable of business operations to support accounting, purchasing, sales, warehouse operations, distribution, and marketing. Must be proficient in looking across all business systems that support the operations, designing and implementing enhancements to improve operational efficiency, and making changes to the applications as needed. Must be able to support information flows between business applications. Should have experience in master data management concepts, data analysis, reporting, business intelligence, and data storage.  Must be able to work with third party vendors that provide support to the various business systems throughout the organization.  Should have experience in a distribution environment, and be familiar with transportation/carrier concepts and systems.Experience Requirements: Must have working knowledge of a current ERP business software, and experience in the technical support is such as environment. Looking for more of a programmer analyst than a power user.Must have experience with ERP data structures, processes, application framework, meta data, user interfaces, execution environment (4GL), workflow engine, security and administration, service oriented architecture, web oriented architecture, and visual processes.Must be proficient in SQL. Should be relatively proficient in supporting programming tools such as Java, XML, and other similar applications.Experience with Crystal Reports highly desirable. Experience with Business Intelligence (such as Sage Enterprise Intelligence) is a plus.Experience with carrier systems highly desirable, in particular with FedEx and UPS.Experience with warehouse management, inventory, distribution, marketing, CRM, product data, eCommerce, and website support strongly desirable.Experience in supporting EDI preferred, in particular with external programming of EDI records to support customer requirements. EDI 850, 855, 856, 865.Experience supporting wireless infrastructures, barcode scanning, label printing, document management, and security infrastructures is a plus!Experience with FDA and PCI compliance is an added plus.Ability to interact with network engineering is a strong plus, although does not need to be proficient in network engineering environment.Responsibilities:Daily support of critical business applications (ERP and other).Troubleshooting of issues with and between business applications (ERP and other).Identifying opportunities to improve business applications, business processes, and business intelligence.Develop and support workflows and processes within and between business applications (ERP and other).End user training on business applications.Automation and enhancements to business applications as needed.Keep business applications current and relevant to business operations.Perform updates/upgrades to business applications as needed.Drive initiatives within the business applications, inclusive of making sure end users fully utilize the supported business applications and transact within those applications as much as possible. Make sure the business applications remain relevant to the business operations, support the strategic direction of the company, and minimize workarounds outside of supported applications.Adapt the business applications to the business operations (not forcing the operations to conform to software applications). Name: Fedwire Business Analyst
Description: About our company - Accolite is a cutting-edge technology consulting services company with offices in North America, Europe, Asia Pac and Delivery Centres in India. We are trusted partners for our Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Aviation, Logistics, and Product Engineering clients delivering Digital and Transformation Programmes for them. We have rapidly grown over the last few years to 850 + people across the globe and continue to hire the top technical minds for our expanding customer base. Accolite is seeking strong technologists who are innovators and problem solvers for projects with our client, a global investment bank. The scope of work is within the Commercial Banking space to build scalable solutions for cash management and provide excellence in the bank's customer experience "Looking for FEDWIRE EXPERTS" The scope of the project: The specific project is to build a payments platform which will be a “High availability- Low latency” cloud based platform which can help the banks corporate clients grow their business. The scope also involves building a Liquidity Analytics data platform which will be the golden source that powers all the analytics and reporting involving complex models for cash flow analysis. To build a robust integration platform for the Banks clients to communicate with the bank regarding payment instructions and receive statuses. The platform will have integrations to various payment gateways such as SWIFT, ACH, CHAPS, SEPA etc. Role: Manage multiple tasks and use sound judgment when prioritizing. Collaborate with global cross functional team in building customer-centric products. Update and maintain documentation for team processes, best practices and software runbooks Skills: 7+ years of relevant industry experience as a business analyst on payment platforms. Understanding of US and International wire payment/transfer systems including, ACH, SWIFT, CHAPS, SEPA, etc. Solid understanding of payments systems and payments market infrastructure specially for Fedwire. Formulate, define systems scope and objectives based on user needs and a thorough understanding of business, systems and industry requirements. Ability to document business requirements to ensure applicability to business areas, ensuring that requirements/user stories are in a consumable state. Experience with leading Agile development projects, with experience being active participant through all phases in an Agile development environment. - provided by DiceFedwire, SWIFT, CHAPS, SEPA

Name: Benefit Configuration Analyst/Design Analyst
Description: DescriptionThe Benefits Configuration Analyst/Design Analyst is responsible for assisting in the evaluation, design, testing, and implementation of required health plan benefits and payment structure changes. The incumbent of this position must possess strong analytical skills, with the ability to perform complex business and product set up requirement analysis in a fast-pace environment. This role serves as a subject matter expert (SME) on both corporate projects and departmental business initiatives that require PowerMHS benefits configuration modifications.Duties & Responsibilities:Assist in the on-going evaluation of benefits configuration for new and existing benefit plans within Power MHS.Analyze explanation of coverage documents to assist with determining best approach for loading benefits offered including member cost share and out-of-pocket maximums.Assist in the setup of code sets and defining pre-authorization guidelines used in benefits configuration and provider reimbursement.Liaison with applicable departments to gather benefits configuration requirements and provide feedback to stakeholders regarding feasibility of change implementation.Collect and analyze data to assess and resolve operational obstacles to benefits design optimization.Perform root-cause analysis on benefit set up issues across all products, document results and present business impact analysis for proposed benefits set up changes.Develop explanatory information for other departments to better understand benefits configuration across products.Identify ways to enhance performance management and operational reports related to new business implementation processes.Monitor existing system functionality and make benefits set up recommendations, where appropriate, to maintain acceptable levels of automation in claims adjudication and accurate provider reimbursement.Aid in the creation test scripts, including regression testing cases, to validate system configuration against source documentation.Assist with organizing the release of benefits configuration changes to production to reduce the potential for migration conflict.Ensure the quality and integrity of implementation of benefits change requests through the use of production validation and audit strategies.Provide project and informational updates to management as available and/or assigned.Collaborate with business units to understand strategic goals and promote an environment conducive to creativity, change and information exchange.Additional duties as assignedMinimum Qualifications:Associate’s degree from an accredited institution.Previous managed care/health plan experience in an operations department where you have been responsible for implementing new products or benefits into plan systems.Experience delivering benefit implementation processes within a Claims Operations or Product Management environment.Experience gathering and communicating complex benefit configuration requirements in a simple and easy to understand manner to other staff. As the SME, the Benefits Design Analyst will need to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization, including technical staff, internal non-technical staff, testing teams, and business stakeholders.Experience gathering and converting data into written narratives that will be used for updating benefit implementation project stakeholders and to make recommendations on benefit configuration system changes needed.Hands-on experience with rules based table driven claims and eligibility administration systems (i.e. Power-MHS or any other claims processing systems).Proficiency in medical terminology, medical coding (CPT4, ICD9 or ICD10, and HCPCS), provider contract concepts and common claims processing/resolution practices.Experience using project tracking, testing and requirement tools (i.e. MS Project, SharePoint or any other time management system).Experience with MS Excel functions that include creating standardized reports, utilizing v-Lookups, pivot tables, filtering and formulas to generate desired results.Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree or higher from an accredited institutionDemonstrate consistent multi-tasking skills and planning for prioritizing workload within tight deadlines.Experience troubleshooting and solving benefits configuration related issues.Experience with MS Access functions that include to running queries, Macros and building tables for reporting purposes.WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. Name: Senior Sector Analyst / Sector Analyst
Description: The Organization: JUST Capital, an independent, nonprofit research organization, makes it easier for people and companies to do right by their stakeholders by tracking the business behaviors Americans care about most. Our research, rankings, and data-driven tools help Americans make informed decisions about where to invest, work, and buy to direct capital towards companies advancing a more just future. The list of Americas Most JUST Companies, including the groundbreaking JUST 100 and Industry Leaders, is published annually in Forbes and on JUSTCapital.com.  Eminent hedge fund manager and philanthropist Paul Tudor Jones co-founded JUST Capital, and it counts Deepak Chopra, Arianna Huffington, Ray Chambers, Steve Schmidt, and many others among its Board. The organization is supported by some of the country's premier philanthropies, including the Ford Foundation and The Robert Wood Johnson Foundation, and has forged partnerships with an array of elite research institutions, including MIT, Stanford, and NORC at the University of Chicago. The Opportunities: JUST Capital seeks to fill several opportunities on its thematic research team at both the Senior Sector Analyst and Sector Analyst levels. The differentiation between the two levels will be based on years of relevant experience, depth and breadth of analytical skills and subject matter expertise. The priority areas requiring subject matter expertise are as follows: EnvironmentWages and Workers treatment, including fair pay practices and benefits among other factorsCommunities & Human RightsThe key responsibilities include but are not limited to:(Senior Sector Analyst) Design and execute an analytically-based, rigorous assessment of corporate behavior in the respective area of expertise which includes choosing, sourcing and analyzing relevant external data sources,(Both roles) Contribute to/refine our analytical and research modeling methodologies and capabilitiesSector Analyst) Support Senior Sector Analysts with varying analytical and research assignments on an as needed basis(Both roles) Using internal platforms document and organize all conducted research work(Senior Sector Analyst) Write articles and blogs and/or contribute as an expert to external information requests to further inform the public and increase the stature of JUST Capitals work and missionThe ideal candidates will at a minimum - possess:Passion for JUST Capitals mission and be a role model for what we as an organization are measuring in corporate behaviorStrong research and data science/analytical skills which are detailed in the resumeExcellent written and verbal communication skills writing samples may be requiredExperience interacting with a wide range of stakeholders and in some cases steward or forge relationships - across sectors and levels; can adapt communication style to the audienceOperate at the highest level of integrity and ethical standardsA minimum of five years relevant experience is required at the sector analyst levelA minimum of 10 years relevant experience is required at the senior sector analyst levelThe JUST Capital Work Environment: JUST Capital is a small organization staff-wise and operates with a nimble, entrepreneurial early-stage mindset. As such, in addition to the above responsibilities, candidates should have professional work approaches, be self-starters and possess well developed organizational skills honed to allow him/her to be effective and resourceful in a fast-paced workplace. Further, adaptability, good colleagueship, working with cross-functional teams to deliver projects on tight deadlines, and internal community building are important attributes of the JUST Capital culture. To apply: Due to the pace of these searches, candidates are strongly encouraged to apply as soon as possible. Applications should include a thoughtful cover letter describing your interest and qualifications and your resume.  Submit your resume and cover letter to: http://justcapital.com/careers. Resumes without a cover letter will not be considered. Due to volume, only those candidates considered for an interview will be contacted. JUST Capital is an Equal Opportunity Employer; people with disabilities are encouraged to apply

Name: Jr. Business System Analyst
Description: Title: Jr. Business System Analyst Location: Newark, NJ Right to hire: 4+ month RTH - Yes Client: Prudential Insurance Scope of Work: The Business Analyst in Financial Application Support—Business Integration is a team member in the area responsible for business analysis and project management for financial systems interfaces and extracts. The Business Integration team develops strategies and implements solutions to link the company's business systems to the corporate financial systems. A focus of Business Integration over the past three years is around designing solutions to streamline and build controls around actuarial infrastructure throughout the company. The consultant will participate in projects that support the design and implementation of actuarial processes within our architecture. The ideal candidate would have strong written and oral communication skills, well-developed analytic reasoning and curiosity, and an established track record working in a team-based environment. At a minimum, the candidate should have experience with Microsoft Office Word Excel, and SQL Job Responsibilities: The consultant will be brought on to one of our current inflight projects that support the integration of actuarial processes into the liability warehouse. The focus of the job responsibilities will be around supporting our rigorous systems testing process. The consultant will be called upon to aid in the development of test scripts and perform those test scripts in our testing environments. The consultant will also need to supply superior documentation of those tests which is crucial for our successful migration to production. The consultant will also be asked to present any findings during testing to the team concisely so that action plans can be developed to remediate the issue quickly. Skills/Qualifications: College degree in Math, Accounting, Finance, Business or Management Information Systems preferred but not required Excellent analytical skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to work both independently and as part of a team Proficiency with Microsoft desktop Applications Proficiency in SQL Knowledge of SQL express, DB2, etc is a plus - provided by DiceSQL express, DB2,

Name: Business Transformation Associate
Description: Business Unit: Chief Financial OfficeDepartment: Business Transformation OfficeJob Family: Finance Job Title: BTO AssociateCorporate Title: AssociateFLSA Code (US Only): ExemptBusiness Unit Description:The Business Transformation Office (BTO) is a centralized consultant team that drives initiatives enabling DTCC’s strategic business priorities and leveraging leading program and change management capabilities. The team develops operating model strategies, generally focused on organization design and location strategy; process improvement; and technology use. We strive to design and deliver innovative recommendations that focus on cost containment, client value creation, and risk mitigation.The BTO is comprised of three major functions:Enterprise Planning and Performance Management – drives and governs our planning processes and aligns DTCC’s performance management framework.Advisory Services – partners with internal clients to develop and design strategic operating models and build internal capabilities by optimizing performance across people, processes and technology.Program Management – supports DTCC’s major growth and implementation initiatives. Key capabilities include program planning, organization, governance, tracking and reporting.Position Summary:The BTO Associate position offers candidates an unparalleled opportunity to gain a broad set of business experiences, coupled with exposure to senior leadership, and the opportunity to impact operations within a leading financial services institution.Specific Responsibilities:Work closely with business stakeholders and SMEs to develop deep understanding of current state models, needs and challenges facing the business we supportLead data analyses, hypotheses development and testing, operating model designProvide thought leadership on approaches to problem solving and future state recommendationsLeads business case development (i.e. ROI, value prop, expense/revenue/volume modeling where applicable) Development and execution of project plans, approach, key deliverables and timelinesConducts tracking and reporting of progress against each initiativeProvides guidance and input on Analyst and Sr. Analyst level workActs as a mentor/advisor to Analyst and Sr. Analyst resourcesAligns risk and control processes into day to day responsibilities to monitor and mitigate risk; escalates appropriatelyLeadership Competencies for this level include:Accountability: Demonstrates reliability by taking necessary actions to continuously meet required deadlines and goals.Global Collaboration: Applies global perspective when working within a team by being aware of own style and ensuring all relevant parties are involved in key team tasks and decisions.Communication: Articulates information clearly and presents information effectively and confidently when working with others.Influencing: Convinces others by making a strong case, bringing others along to their viewpoint; maintains strong, trusting relationships while at the same time is comfortable challenging ideas.Innovation and Creativity: Thinks boldly and out of the box, generates new ideas and processes, and confidently pursues challenges as new avenues of opportunity.Qualifications:Minimum of 5 years of related experienceExperience driving a change agenda or supporting business transformation program, cost reduction, process and org. design and/or financial modelingBachelor's degree preferred with Masters or equivalent experienceAbout DTCC:With over 40 years of experience, DTCC is the premier post-trade market infrastructure for the global financial services industry. From operating facilities and data centers around the world, DTCC automates, centralizes, and standardizes the processing of financial transactions across the trade lifecycle and mitigates risk for thousands of institutions worldwide.At DTCC we value on our clients' interests and partner to deliver superior results with excellence and innovation and lead with integrity. We proactively develop your potential and invest in your career.

Name: Agile Business Analyst
Description: Location: New York, New York  AQUENT is looking for a Business Analyst with financial services background, 7-10 yrs experience and eligible to work as W2 for all employer (AQUENT is not in a position to sponsor talent at this time). This is a long term assignment in New York City. Selected talent must work onsite, at least 40hrs per week. No remote talent or C2C will be considered.  The Agile Business Analysis involves understanding user needs, breaking those needs out into constituent parts, analyzing multiple solutions and supporting the communication and delivery of a solution to meet the user needs. Roles that might draw skills from this area include: Business Analyst, User Researcher, Performance Analyst, Designer, Developer. Responsibilities include:Deconstruct user needs and problem statements into constituent parts for analysis and reconstruction. Separate out what is critical, analyze component parts from all sides and 'reassemble' in order to lead to viable solutions.Listen to user needs and ask probing questions until the real need is drawn out and understood through root cause analysis. Evaluate multiple options before helping the team to settle on one solution.Facilitate working meetings effectively, using techniques such as active listening and negotiation. Tailor communication style to suit both face-to-face and virtual settings, including TP and conference calls.Ensure that the wider impact of changes is understood by parallel work streams.Work with the development team to ensure they have a complete understanding of the business and user needs. Make sure end user perspectives are fully considered by the content and technical design team.Facilitate in the continuous review and iteration of development work to ensure the business and user needs continue to be met by the proposed solution.Understand organizational and wider strategic objectives, and ensure that solutions are aligned with key priorities. Be alert to changes in strategic direction and assess the impact of change.Design and plan with stakeholders the process to be used to gather user needs and other relevant data.Perform analysis of user stories and make amendments where necessary. Facilitate and give input into prioritization of user stories.Interpret data from a range of sources (E.g. user research and performance metrics). Work with designers and developers to ensure solutions are based on data.Create user flows, wireframes, and map business processes, which represent the current structure and future design of a product or service.Analyze the existing landscape with an innovative mindset. Identify opportunities and generate ideas for continuous improvement or new solutions to meet user needsUnderstand end-to-end requirements lifecycle (elicitation, analysis, documentation and validation), techniques and tools to assist business areas to understand their business requirements and ensuring these are documented, prioritized, and agreed as the project scope. The final output being a business-approved requirement document (BRD). Analysis strategies Awareness of available analysis strategies/tools and understanding their application to the relevant business scenarios. Some examples below (not exhaustive): o SWOT (Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats)  o Cause and Effect diagrams (aka Fishbone)  o 5 Whys  o Event Tree Analysis  o Pareto analysis (80/20 rule)  Business feasibility planning and  measurement techniques Work with business and project sponsors to prepare business cases demonstrating clear ROI for new projects (E.g. perform cost benefit analysis, gap analysis, stakeholder analysis, BCG matrix, 6-sigma, Activity-Based Costing (ABC), Porter's Five Forces). Modeling techniques Understand industry standard tools/techniques and facilitate modeling of the target organization to make recommendations to improve procedures and working practices. Some modeling techniques include data flow diagrams, entity relationship (ER) model, UML diagrams, BPMN basics (aka swimlanes), mind maps, AS-IS, and TO-Be analysis. Conceptual and functional design Provide conceptual solutions to complicated business problems/needs by working with UX specialists to convert customer requirements into technical solutions that are both feasible and cost effective ensuring that the quality of the product experience meets business needs Acceptance testing Assist business stakeholders in ensuring appropriate levels of test coverage during acceptance test phase by working with the test team to map business requirements to testing scenarios (please refer to Quality Assurance & Testing worksheet). Quality reviews and best practice Provide advice and guidance on best practice business analysis methodologies and techniques. Identify areas for process improvement to ensure full use of best practice and review documents (E.g. requirements definitions, business cases, interface specifications, test scripts/scenarios) for completeness and consistency. Project support Support project managers in project planning, initiation, tracking, and delivery activities. Contribute to the identification and impact assessment of program and project issues and risks to proactively identify and resolve issues and mitigate risks. Interested applicant(s) are encouraged to send their resume in MS Word format to Rdavenport@aquent.com for immediate consideration now! (No Phone Calls Please)PI105677181
