Name: Performance Analyst - FUTURE OPPORTUNITY
Description: We’re here to ensure the advertising industry and the people in it are healthy and engaging positively and effectively with those around them. We’re here, ultimately, to improve the lives of people working in the media industry. And we take our responsibility seriously.  PERFORMANCE ANALYST ABOUT THE ROLE The Campaign Performance Analyst will be responsible for working with internal teams on specific accounts to align campaign objectives and KPIs, develop performance measurement plans, and recommendations for campaign optimization. This position is responsible for developing and delivering insightful and actionable reports that tell a performance story. It will have a strong focus on insights vs. observations with responsibility for driving performance outcomes and optimized media investment priorities. The priority for this position is working across the internal team to deliver optimal performance to drive client growth, retention and high levels of client satisfaction. ABOUT THE TEAM The Performance Analytics team has a passion for analytics and a common vision for improvement and growth. As trusted advisors to both our internal teams and clients, our time is split between diving deep into rows of data, showing off our reporting dashboards, and educating our clients on KPIs, tools and evolving methodologies. Among our supportive team network you can often find us showing off the creative reporting templates and custom dashboards that make us proud. CORE RESPONSIBILITIESAlign campaign objectives and KPIs and develop performance measurement plans and recommendations for campaign optimization.Develop and deliver insightful and actionable reports that tell the performance story of the campaign.Partner with Client and Media Services, Search, and Social team members to develop forward-looking campaigns based on historical performance insights.Present reports, optimization recommendations, and insights to both client and internal audiencesUnderstand Centro solutions related to analytics and reporting such as ad verification, attribution, brand studies, viewability, etc.Mentor Associate level performance analysts.QUALIFICATIONS2+ years digital media experience, especially in client facing buying or media measurement departmentsBachelor’s degree in Advertising, Marketing, Business, Statistics or Economics preferredStrong independent thinking and problem solving abilitiesExcellent organization and communication skillsHighly motivated with a strong record of project or process managementStrong qualitative skills with ability to demonstrate quality data organization and analysis techniquesUnderstanding of media buying and ad serving landscapeStrong knowledge of MS Office, especially ExcelAbility to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment, under tight deadlinesExceptional customer service and communication skillsAdaptable and flexibleA fun, positive attitude that embodies the Centro’s culture Centro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, gender, age, disability or any other basis protected under the law. Centro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, gender, age, disability or any other basis protected under the law.

Name: Analyst - Business
Description: Business AnalystWiley - HobokenThe Company: We may have been founded over two centuries ago, but our secret to success remains the same: change with the times and adapt to meet the ever-evolving needs of our customers. As a learning business, our mission is to help people and organizations to develop the skills and knowledge they need to succeed. With new products and services driving our global expansion, we’re looking towards a digital future. It’s resulted in a period of true cultural change here at Wiley, which means even more career and development opportunities for our talented people.  Reporting to a Senior Content Platform Capability Manager, a Business Analyst (BA) is responsible for fleshing out application requirements within the end to end vision and roadmap of Platform Capabilities. The BA works closely with the business owners of the capabilities to understand the needs of individual businesses; collates the requirements into a single set; and determines commonalities and differences; and translates requirements to a form that can be developed, usually user stories. The BA also plays a key role in User Acceptance Testing of the requirements that they helped to capture.  Combining the Wiley business needs, the industry and the vendor landscape, plus the advances in technology, the BA develops the domain expertise for the Content capabilities he/she is working on.  Partnering with the Business, Enterprise Architecture, Information Modelling, Developer and QA teams, the BA contributes to the elaboration of detailed requirements, UAT and delivery of the capabilities. Business Requirements Elaboration: Work closely with the colleagues in Wiley Technology and Wiley Content Management teams to understand pain points and develop the best approaches addressing themUnderstand the existing capabilities within Wiley content workflows to ensure the business is taking full advantage of what has been implemented and integratedResponsibility for Quality of Delivery:Working with developers and Quality Assurance colleagues to prioritize any bugs that are found through the QA processWriting user acceptance test cases and acting as an expert tester and reference for business testers during user acceptance procedures for newly developed capabilities and featuresWorking with colleagues in Quality Assurance to triage user acceptance feedback, and working with the business to characterise and prioritize improvements raised through this processRequirements:College degreeWork in the position of system/business analyst for an IT company during last two years;Technical education;Basic knowledge of software development lifecycle and processes (experience in Agile development approach);Broad experience in MS Office, Jira, Confluence or analogs.Strong skills and broad experience in UML to process description;Desire to grow in system/business analysis as a professional;Experience in creation of technical specifications, business requirements and other documentation required in software developmentGood understanding of technology and ability to translate the business needs into concrete capabilitiesGrace under pressure; clear and unbiased thinkingWillingness and ability to embrace change and to adapt new strategies on the flyAbility to influence without authority, gather inputDesired Experience:Education in e-publishing or technologyStrong understanding of the Wiley businessesAbility to speak to audiences with different backgrounds and at different levels of organizationsStrong understanding of the publishing domainExperience working in a large and high-pressure operation undergoing changeProven experience working effectively to deadlines Wiley is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis on race, color, creed, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability or other legally protected status. Employment is contingent upon the successful completion of a background check and employment review.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client seeking a Senior Business Analyst in New York, NY.  Summary:  The Technology Unit has built a .NET application to serve as the primary system used by program units to deliver workforce and business development services. The application supports customer service delivery and total business operations with functionalities that include case management and assessment tools, management reporting capabilities, and performance monitoring. The current release contains several case management modules that are streamlined to support workflow. These enhancements will require upgrades to provide robust, modern and flexible IT infrastructure and tools, improve user experience, improved application security, and provide more robust reporting functionality for the staff. Name: Lead Business Analyst
Description: Summary  DISH is a Fortune 200 company with more than $15 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the first live, internet-delivered TV service Sling TV that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.  Now we have our sights set on upending the wireless industry and unseating the entrenched incumbent carriers.  We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win it's in our DNA. We're looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need to achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.  Opportunity is here. We are DISH.  Job Duties and Responsibilities  The Data & Analytics team combines powerful household level television viewership with analytics and insights to help DISH Media Sales succeed in a rapidly evolving, data driven environment. Understanding the business needs of our National & Digital Sales teams, constructing automated processes through scripting languages, using data to identify and create predictive models of an advertiser's target audience, measuring the success of an advertiser's campaign and providing visualizations through self-service tools are just a few of the day to day tasks this team is responsible for.  We are now seeking a Lead Business Analyst within our New York City office, reporting to the Senior Manager of the Data & Analytics team, that will: Run a small team of business analysts to support our National and Digital Sales divisions with any data inquiries needed to execute our ad campaigns.Use the DISH Set Top Box and Sling Viewership data to speak to ad campaign performance metrics (reach, frequency and lift) and provide key insights on how people consume content.Establish relationships within our 3rdparty data and measurement partners to discuss campaign needs and new business dev efforts.Maintain ongoing communication with leads on the Addressable and Sling teams to understand consistent business challenges and offer solutions.Work with the Senior Manager to design operational workflows for the Lead Data Engineer or Lead Data Scientist to implement.Own all post campaign and agreed upon ad-hoc analytics delivered to our clients.Attend industry conferences and accompany the Media Sales team in face to face meetings to represent data operations.Extract and analyze large datasets in databases like Netezza, Teradata, Hadoop and Redshift/AWS using SQL, Python, VBA and custom-built tools. Skills - Experience and Requirements  A successful Lead Business Analyst will have the following: Bachelor's Degree from a four-year college or university; advanced degree in a STEM field a plus.Minimum 2 years of experience in an analytical role such as Data Analyst OR a degree in numerical fields (engineering, finance, math) in lieu of experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Intermediate to Expert knowledge in SQL required. Familiarity with R, Python or any scripting languages a plus.Comfortable working in Unix environment with a basic knowledge of shell scripting and secure file transfer protocols.Experience in OTT trafficking through FreeWheel or knowledge of digital advertising best practices a plus.Basic data visualization skills using Excel. Experience in Tableau preferred.Ability to successfully work and partner across various departments.SDL2017

Name: Business Analyst- Regulatory Delivery
Description: Our client, a large global Investment Bank, is looking to hire Business analyst-Regulatory Delivery.  Business Analyst- Regulatory Delivery  Role: Business Analyst- Regulatory Delivery  Location: New York  Duration: 6 months  Rate: up to $62 /Hour  Your New Company  An established global Investment Bank with presence in New York. You will be working with global teams, with the chance to add a prestigious, known name to your resume.  Your New Role  Analysis of regulation and understanding the impact from a business process, controls, data and systems perspective, Capture business requirements, analyzing, simplifying, and challenging where required to ensure that the true business need is captured, Design business process and controls , Contribute to functional and data requirements, Ensure traceability of Business requirements from inception through implementation and control, Drive the design or review of test cases, process change requests, and support the organization through acceptance, installation and deployment, Development of test scenarios and test cases; and where necessary performing test execution and support, Assist in developing and delivering the user training  What You'll Need to Succeed  5+ years of business analysis experience, preferably in asset management or another area of financial services  A good understanding of the core financial instruments in equities, fixed income, forex and managed accounts  Experience creating business requirements specifications and target operating models, using tools such as SIPOCs, process flows, use cases and context diagrams  Strong data analysis background with excellent skills in Excel  Experience in the software development lifecycle, particularly in developing test cases and managing user acceptance testing  Strong written and verbal communication skills, the ability to direct the efforts of diverse groups of stakeholders to build a common understanding and come to a consensus  Excellent English language skills  What You'll get in Return  You will get the chance to work for a very well respected global brand as well as start a contract position with a chance of extension.  Interested?  If you're available and interested in this role, please apply directly as soon as you can attaching your updated resume and hourly rate requirement.

Name: healthcare systems Business Analyst
Description: CTG has an immediate opening for a Healthcare Business Analyst. This is an approximate 6 month contract with a possibility for extension. The location is New York City.  Principal Duties and Responsibilities Interview users, stakeholders, and sponsors to assess departmental needs to create Business, functional and technical requirements documents. Develop documentation of test plans, technical documentation, release notes, end-user guides, training programs and/or other materials as necessary. Analyze and document client's business requirements and processes; communicate requirements to technical personnel by constructing basic conceptual data and process models, including process  flowcharts and technical specifications. Decompose information gathered into details including sources of data, data types, users, user types, interface components, interface navigation needs, reporting needs, and administrative  system needs. Presenting concepts in a concise and focused manner, including narrative, process diagrams, role and accountability diagrams and business-focused story boards. Research industry practices; collect and analyze data; draw appropriate conclusions and recommendations; present results in written reports or through oral presentations using visual aids.  Request for Statement of Work Coordinate user groups and project teams, convening conference calls and meetings and maintaining minutes and follow-up logs. Work collaboratively with the development team to develop designs, mockups and prototypes.Communicate technical design issues to non-technical people.Ability to work independently and as part of a fast moving team.Work within timeline and resource constraints provided by the Project Manager.Provide ongoing communication with users, managers, corporate directors and vendors to assure support and current initiatives. Performs other duties as assigned/required.Qualifications / Required Skill: A Baccalaureate Degree from an accredited college or university in computer science,  Information systems, business administration or equivalent experience or education is required.  At least 3 years of clinical healthcare systems experience.  Experience documenting system architecture design and clinical system workflow.  Detailed knowledge of general phases of SDLC, project management methods  Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a  diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.  Must be well organized, detail oriented, highly analytical, possess strong problem solving skills  and must have a desire to be accountable for project success.  CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).  CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.  CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran.SDL2017

Name: Analyst
Description: AnalystOverview OUR STORY We are a company with integrated luxury and lifestyle offerings centered on Movement, Nutrition and Regeneration. In addition to Equinox, our other brands, Blink, Pure Yoga, SoulCycle, Furthermore, and Equinox Hotels are all recognized for inspiring and motivating members and employees to maximize life. Within our portfolio of brands, we have more than 200 locations within every major city across the United States in addition to London, Toronto, & Vancouver. OUR CODE We are passionate about high performance living and we practice what we preach – investing time in our own health and fitness. We believe that everyone has untapped potential within them and it takes a disruptive approach to unleash it. We dream big and don’t settle for the status quo. We sweat the details. We never accept less than 110% to help each other deliver the Equinox experience and enable our members to get great results. We are obsessed with what’s new, what’s now, what’s next. Never following, always leading, living ahead of the moment in fashion, culture and consumer behavior. We aren’t just a company; we’re a community vested in each other’s success. We value humility and a team approach at every level of the company.  If you are a high performing individual who is passionate about winning and inspiring others, then we are excited to discuss career opportunities with you.  Job Description  Equinox is seeking an Analyst with strong numerical and communication skills to support the Business Analytics Team, playing an essential role in prospect, sales, member and revenue analytics. You will enjoy working on a ground-breaking team in the fitness industry with rich data sets, a robust analytics capability within a growing and innovative brand, and turning your insights into actionable business strategy. We are seeking candidates with a minimum of 2-3 years of experience and who can start full time in the next month.  The Business Analytics team works cross functionally to align business goals and discover opportunities using strong analytics and data insights. The role reports into our Director of Analytics and sits at our headquarters in Flatiron. If interested and qualified, please apply directly to the role online to ensure your resume is reviewed. RESPONSIBILITIESPrepare and distribute reports on a recurring basisGather, analyze, and interpret data to support business strategy by providing actionable recommendationsProvide general analytical support to the Business Analytics TeamPrepare presentations to the Board, Executive Team and other internal committeesCollaborate with business partners across Marketing, Sales, Technology, Ancillary teamsVarious other projects / tasks as they arise Qualifications Strong analytical skills, plus ability to develop and clearly articulate insights from large, complex datasets2-3 years of experienceExcellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skillsMust be able to work independentlyAbility to multi-task and work simultaneously with different Managers, as well as different parts of the businessDetailed knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, and Microsoft PowerPointKnowledge of programming languages a plus (eg: SQL, SAS) Additional Information AS A MEMBER OF THE EQUINOX TEAM YOU WILL RECEIVE:We offer competitive salary and benefitsComplimentary Club membership30- 50% discounts on all Equinox products and services including Personal Training, Private Pilates, Spa and Café’ services and Shop items This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department. Equinox is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website athttps://careers.equinox.com/ All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Must have a legal right to work in the United States

Name: Business Development Analyst
Description: Marketing - Business Development SpecialistThe Business Development Specialist will report to the Global Pitch Manager within the Core Services team serving as a central resource for the firm. Key objectives are to generate revenues through a focused and coordinated approach to business development activities including profile raising, pitching, and market research in support of the firm’s efforts. Name: Insurance Financial Analyst
Description: We’re searching for an accomplished finance/accounting professional to join Lemonade’s Finance Team. The ideal candidate is a business thinker and problem solver, and an experienced numbers guru who is also a multitasker. This means overseeing a broad range of tasks, from day to day accounting functions of an insurance company to complex financial reporting, all in a hyper-growth startup environment. Among your responsibilities: maintaining a general ledger and related reporting, overseeing developments in statutory, GAAP and IFRS accounting principles, ensuring state level premium tax compliance, and implementing a new ERP system  The Insurance Financial Analyst will work closely with the Finance Manager and Insurance CFO. RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Accounting or FinancePublic accounting experience preferredExperience with Property & Casualty insurance is a mustA+ communication, written and verbal skillsAdept relationship builder, across internal/external teams with a proven ability to make an impactExperience with technology based, hyper-growth, early stage companies a plusBenefits Lemonade is a licensed insurance carrier offering renters and homeowners insurance powered by artificial intelligence and behavioral economics and driven by social good. Instead of brokers and bureaucracy, we use bots and machine learning to create an insurance experience that is instant (90 seconds to get insured!), affordable (policies start at $5/month), and paperless.  Founded by Shai Wininger and Daniel Schreiber and backed by SoftBank, GV, Sequoia, General Catalyst and others, we’re transforming insurance from a necessary evil into a social good by injecting technology and transparency into an industry that often lacks both.  We believe in doing things differently, pushing boundaries, and questioning everything. And as a Certified B-Corp insurance, we incorporate our values of doing good into everything we do – from our business model to our office culture.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: About World Business Lenders (www.wbl.com): At World Business Lenders (WBL), our motto, "We Lend - You Grow." is simple, yet powerful. We are a direct lender specializing in providing real estate-secured business loans and access to capital to support the growth and development of underserved small-to-medium sized businesses that lack access to traditional bank funding. We broker out and syndicate MCA, cash advance, leasing, SBA and other naturally related business loan products. WBL is led by a strong management team with extensive experience in the financial services industry and employs a disciplined approach to credit analysis and risk management. Ranked by Selling Power in the 50 Best Companies to Sell For 2016 and 2017http://www.sellingpower.com/2016/50-best-companies-to-sell-for/#.V7SlvXCCg-M.emailhttp://www.sellingpower.com/2017/50-best-companies-to-sell-for/Background Our recently established Business Intelligence department has an opening for an analyst position reporting to the VP of Business Intelligence. This is a key position that will enable the successful candidate to join a nationwide financial institution in a growing industry. World Business Lenders is a rapidly growing company that provides room for growth for its employees. About the Job The Business Intelligence analyst will be responsible for delivering management reports and ensuring data integrity of the company’s customer relationship management (CRM) database. The goal of the position is to enable executive management to have actionable insights into the company’s sales processes, loan production, operational efficiency and financial performance.  Job responsibilities will include a variety of tasks including: Obtain a strong understanding of the company’s loan production and sales processes;Create and deliver weekly, biweekly, monthly and annual reports to executive management related to sales, production and operations;Maintain data integrity of the company’s CRM database;Interface with a variety of departments on a regular basis, including production, operations and finance;Provide administrative support for the VP of Business Intelligence;Special projects and other duties as assigned.RequirementsDesired Skills and QualificationsUndergraduate Degree in a STEM field;0 to 2 years work experience;Effective communication skills – the Analyst will interface with a variety of departments and executive management; effective and concise communication skills are key;Strong Microsoft Excel skills.Knowledge of VBA, SQL and/or QuickBase a plus;Attention to detail – this position will include working with large amounts of data;Ability to handle confidential information in a discreet, professional manner;Excellent organizational and analytical skills;Ability to prioritize and multi-task in a fast-paced environment;High energy, positive attitude, proactive problem solver; Must be able to satisfactorily complete a background check  Must be authorized to work in the United States  Effective English communication skills, both written and oral BenefitsCompensation and Benefits:Compensation package - DOEVacation/holiday pay and benefit package after 3 months (Medical/Dental/Vision/Life & Disability/Commuter Plan/401(k) with company match)EOE M/F/D/V/SOWorld Business Lenders does not sponsor work visas for this position. World Business Lenders participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the United States.

Name: Business Analyst – Associate
Description: JobDescription :TheRole: Business Analyst – Associate The Location: London, New York or Denver The Team: With over 20,000 employees working across 95 offices all around the world, the diverse and vibrant community at S&P Global is unlike one you’ll find anywhere else. This is an opportunity to join the Technology Product Management Team working closely with business stakeholders to define and deliver IT solutions to a variety of business problems in a highly collaborative, agile environment. The Impact: We are in search of a highly motivated Business Analyst who is ready to take their career to the next level in a fast-growing company. Do you love leading technical projects as well as getting in the trenches and working with the team to get the work done? Do you like working with state of the art technology? You will contribute to large complex interdependent project streams, taking a hands-on leadership role within a specific scrum team. You will lead continuous development and improvement of standardized processes within the Agile construct. Coaching, mentoring and leading both IT and business stakeholders on these delivery methods. What’s in it for you: You will be the most senior member of an Agile Scrum team leading them delivering high quality software to internal and external customers. The chance to dig in to complicated technical details surrounding product requirements and specifications. Work with and guide our Product Owners, Software Architects and others to fill in technical gaps in requirements. Contribute to the full project lifecycle from concept through build, to adoption and digital engagement. Build and improve your skills by working with new technologies whilst driving lean and agile processes. Responsibilities:Drive discussions with Champion, Technology Product Owner and Technology Leads to design solutions. Support Product Owner working with multiple Scrum teams to define MVP for delivery within the time constraints provided.Build deep subject matter expertise of products, services, or technologies and content and methodologies offered by S&P Ratings.Lead Agile activities that help drive strategy. Coaching, mentoring and supervising team members on Agile best practices. Utilizing agile metrics data and the ability to provide insight and guidance. Conduct all Scrum activities with the established framework of Agile. Work with multiple teams and promote self-organization.Manages the identification and escalation of risks for Scrum Teams to stakeholders. Facilitates and drives effective Scrum team risk mitigation using formal problem-solving techniques. Manages the effects and impacts of requested changes to established projects, systems and applications.Tailor presentations/communications to varied audiences (i.e. business vs. technical and working group), negotiate and/or build consensus with partners/support organizations.Supports the establishment of new projects by facilitating visioning sessions with business users and producing associated Vision documents. Works with project leadership to support establishment of success metrics for quantifying associated business value for assigned projects. Review final results and recommendations, providing input as needed.Manage roll out and adoption of technical products to internal and external consumers, contribute to the continuous improvement of those processes and artifacts. Manage execution of digital engagement strategies. Provide white glove customer facing support. Support the measurement of user sentiment, and value realization data and KPI's to feed into product roadmaps and backlogs.Act as a regional subject matter expert and advocate analyzing regional jurisdiction business and control differences to ensure solutions designs meet our global user base. Build and develop a regional stakeholder network at all levels, be recognized as a figure head for regional representation on IT matters.What We’re Looking For: Candidate should have familiarity and foundational understanding of the below concepts: Use Judgment based on practice and precedence to accurately define problems by trying to understand underlying factors/causes.Proposing, implementing, and evaluating technical solutions to business problemsStrong writing, conceptualization, and analytic skillsStrong interpersonal skills – Well developed communication and diplomacy skills to exchange complex informationAbility to form questions and hypothesis about long-term strategy of business and follow through with technical solutionsManaging the Scrum processAgile story writingData Analysis / Basic SQLIt is beneficial is the candidate has experience with the below:Workflow/BPMCommercial customer facing productsBig Data, Data Science, Data Governance, Content ManagementRisk & RegulatoryChange ManagementDigital customer engagement and outreachDigital Training Development/DesignBasic Qualifications:BA/BS degree in a related area such as finance, economics, information technology, or businessRequired 3+ years of related professional experience (BA, QA or management consulting)Preferred Qualifications:Preferred 3+ years’ experience in a financial industry/financial servicesScrum Master or Agile certificationLean Management / Six Sigma CertificationStrong understanding of the following:  Equity and Corporate Credit Analysis; Structured Finance; Ratings Process; Finance/AccountingAbout S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide.  S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings  S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.  If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person. designing modificationsRecommend controls by identifying problems; writing improved proceduresPerform daily, weekly and monthly reviews and analyses of current processes using operational metrics and reportsUnderstand and communicate the financial and operational impact of any changesCreate informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement Basic Qualifications 5+ years of experience demonstrating project management and driving results in process improvement capacity or equivalentExperience working with JIRA/Workfront/ConfluenceStrong analytical background operating with large data sets to identify trends and actionable insights3+ years experience using process improvement/Lean methodologiesExcellent communication skills, collaborating with cross-functional teamEntrepreneurial spirit or prior experience in a high performance, fast-paced industryExcellent analytical, strategic conceptual thinking, strategic planning and execution skillsStrong business acumen, including industry, domain-specific knowledge of the enterprise and its business units Additional Qualifications Bachelor's degree in discipline such as: engineering, technology, or business discipline preferredProficiency in Excel & Tableau required, or other data processing and analytics tools preferredUnderstanding of Lean, Six Sigma Black Belt or Master Black Belt preferred Options

Name: Business Performance Analyst
Description: Who we areAt Criteo, we are building the advertising platform of choice for the open Internet, an ecosystem that favors neutrality, transparency and inclusiveness. With more than 1.4 billion active shoppers and $600 billion in annual commerce sales, we deliver performance at scale. Founded in a Paris start-up incubator, Criteo now carries out our entrepreneurial spirit across 30+ global offices. Do you want to have an impact on more than half of the worlds internet users? Join us and be part of something big. Criteo is looking for a Business Performance Analyst to join our Americas Sales Operations Team. The ideal candidate will be highly data driven, process-oriented and an exceptional team player. The Business Performance Analyst will report directly to the Head of Sales Operations & Strategy for the Americas and will partner with the Regional Sales Operations Business Partners in order to provide a detailed and comprehensive view of the revenue team performance from which he/she could draw strategic insights and recommendations to improve the revenue growth and efficiencies of the commercial Teams. The role will be covering the Americas as a whole, including North America and LATAM. Automate as much as possible this framework using the Criteo online solutions and tool stack: Tableau, Salesforce, proprietary and Office 365.Understand the short and long term performance drivers at various granularity levels (Teams and Accounts) to craft comprehensive reporting allowing in-depths analysis of our business. (including but not limited to demand, supply, client health, commercial outlook, market dynamics).Run strategic analysis and provide recommendationsProvide relevant deep-dives on identified important issues.Focus primarily where SalesOps can bring unique value: Optimizing commercial processes for teams on the field and their management. Deliverables to include analysis as well as recommendations and implementation plan.Participate in cross-regional summits to share knowledge with counterparts and utilize analyses that have run in other teams.Support Implementation and Monitor UsageInterview local stakeholders to surface reporting challenges.Coordinate with Sales Ops teams to understand their local needsWork with them to design the specifications of new reports .Measure utilization of our self-serving reporting and iterate to improve adoption.Who you areBS / MS Degree or equivalent experience.3-5+ years experience in Business Intelligence, FP&A, Sales Operations, Consulting or Investment BankingAdvanced Analytical, Excel and SQL skills Tableau is a plus. Expertise in Salesforce & Sales Effectiveness is a plus.Good presentation skills.Demonstrated track record of cross-functional facilitation and partnering in a matrix organization.Ability to maintain positive relationships to accomplish organizational goals in a multicultural environment.Expertise in developing and implementing streamlined processes.Ability to work autonomously, under pressure with strong attention to detail and a high sense of prioritization.Why you'll love us 100% premium coverage of Healthcare Plan. When apples arent enoughCompetitive compensation. Be fancyCareer advancement with global mobility opportunities. A little bit of Je ne sais quoiVacation policy. Because your mom misses youHappy hour, snacks, arcade/game rooms. Eat. Drink. Be merryTravel & reimbursement options. Until jetpacks are a thing401(k) fully vested matching. Basically free $$$At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard and feel a sense of belonging.Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. Strong work ethic.Analytical and data management skills.Ability to multi-task and remain flexible in fast paced environment.Results-orientation - takes initiative to identify areas to add value and executes quickly and accurately.Detailed oriented allowing for fully complete analysis and designs. Name: HR Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionAt j2 we believe it takes great people to make a great company. Are you an HR Business Analyst who is looking to make an immediate impact? Do you want to be a member of a collaborative, forward-thinking team? Are you passionate and intellectually curious? If this aligns with your career direction, please keep reading about our open role:  The HR Business Analyst will assist with the provision of key analytics and metrics and other data gathering initiatives to capture, analyze, and report HR trends. Required QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Information Systems, Statistics or related field or equivalent work experience2+ years of working experience in HR systemsStrong analytical skills and organizational skills utilizing Microsoft Office product suite, in particular Excel to advanced standardExperience with gathering data requirements and documentation with basic understanding of business process mapping is requiredMust possess a high level of integrity with understanding of the need for confidentiality in maintaining integrity internally and externally with HR dataExperience working in a global environment, supporting multiple time zonesExposure to HR processes and projects desirableEssential DutiesDevelop standard and ad hoc reports, templates, dashboards, scorecards, and metrics from ATS and other HR systemsAssist in reporting, due diligence and auditingPerform testing and process workflow validation for new systems, processes, and toolsUse critical judgment in the evaluation of data and to concisely and coherently articulate recommendationsCreate custom reports and develop system knowledge to make process & system changesSupport in creating and maintaining project plans and developing presentations Company DescriptionZiff Davis is the leading global digital-media company operating in the technology, gaming, entertainment, men’s lifestyle and health verticals. The Ziff Davis portfolio of web properties includes PCMag.com, IGN.com, Speedtest.net, AskMen.com, TechBargains.com, Offers.com and Everydayhealth.com, among many others. Our web properties attract approximately 5 billion visits and 18 billion page views annually. Our brands produce and distribute premium content across multiple platforms and devices, delivering advertising, performance marketing and licensing solutions to thousands of clients worldwide.

Name: Business Consultant – Business Analyst/Project Lead (Bethesda, MD or Remote)
Description: The Company: The Educe Group is dedicated to helping organizations evaluate, implement, and optimize talent management technologies that enable them to realize the full potential of their employees. We are partnered with innovative, industry-leading software providers such as Saba and Cornerstone to offer our clients comprehensive talent management solutions.At Educe, we offer our employees the opportunity to continually learn and develop as consultants, contribute to our growing firm and make an impact on our clients. We recognize and appreciate the unique strengths of each member of the Educe team and encourage employees to challenge themselves and hone skills based on their individual strengths and interests. We believe that by consistently offering our employees opportunities to take on new responsibilities we empower them to drive our firm’s growth. Ultimately though, we work hard here because as individuals we find personal satisfaction in making a difference. This culture is a priority for us and we intend to continue improving the ways this firm can interest, challenge, and reward us all. We think this is an important component of why Washingtonian Magazine has awarded us “Best Places to Work” four consecutive times!The Role:We are looking for driven, innovative Consultants who are eager to embrace the dynamic field of talent management technology and provide recognized, exceptional client service. You will be responsible for requirements analysis, business process mapping, training, solution design, and implementation of learning, performance, succession planning, recruiting, and compensation management systems such as Saba, Cornerstone, and SuccessFactors. You will work closely with Educe clients to help them transition to new cloud-based software, helping them optimize the return on their technology investment. You will serve as the liaison between the client business teams, the technical resources assigned to the project and the software vendor(s). You will be responsible for system configuration based on specific client requirements as well as ensuring that the solution is properly tested and the client is prepared to successfully adopt it at launch.The Responsibilities:The position involves working closely with clients and colleagues to do the following:Gather requirements and define and map current processes in order to create "to be" business processes for the client based on current best practices.Develop comprehensive project plans to be shared with clients, stakeholders and all staff members.Track project performance, specifically to analyze the successful completion of short and long-term goals and provide weekly/monthly status reporting of project metrics to the Program Manager.Implement application design by working closely with both the client and Educe technical team.Create/delegate/maintain comprehensive project documentation including business requirements, project plans, meeting minutes, risk registrar and test scripts.Assist in user acceptance testing efforts and act as the liaison between the client and the system implementation team in troubleshooting product issues as they apply to the client's business.Participate in end-user training by providing both product knowledge and insight on the client's business processes and solution design.Additionally, the position involves helping to develop and improve the Educe internal infrastructure as a whole and contributing to organizational objectives.The Requirements:Qualified Candidates will possess the following:Demonstrable ability to resolve complex system or business issues, often thinking on their feet, and offering multiple creative solutions or options.Proven project management experience with background in Succession, Performance, and/or Compensation using HR-based software.Excellent written and oral communication skills. Must be comfortable with public speaking and facilitating group discussions with senior executives.Ability to work closely and build relationships with client executives and external stakeholders.Ability to work independently, as well contribute significantly in coordination with a team.Strong interpersonal skills and an outgoing, positive attitude.A passion for service, pride in the quality of their work, and the instinct to follow-through until a job is properly done well.Attention to detail and solution-oriented with strong organizational skills.Entrepreneurial spirit and ability to be resourceful and take initiative.Strong problem solving, analytical and MS Office skills.Strong documentation skills.Ability to manage, prioritize, and multi-task on multiple projects.Ability to be flexible to and adapt to the dynamic nature of consulting engagements.Knowledge of MS Project, SQL, Oracle applications.Basic Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree equivalent required from an accredited institution.Ability to travel up to 50% to multiple client locations.U.S. citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time.This job may entail travel to client sites. The job also entails sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Should be able to communicate by telephone, email, and face to face.Please note this description does not cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee.

Name: Business Analyst Analytics Hub
Description: This position is for a Business Analysis/Project Manager for the 3D Program team within clients Wealth Management – Technology Delivery Team at clients New York offices. The charter of this team is to provide business analysis and project management support for the 3D Workstation to help drive the execution of the technical redesign and strategy of the existing FA Platforms team and meet the goals of the business. Furthermore, this position will work with the PMs and business/data analysts in the team and work with other platform teams, driving issue analysis & resolution, educating peers, and drive the project throughout the SDLC process until execution. This job can also call for the position to be able to lead the team (as PM) on situations where project management is required and heeds the flexibility of the person to operate on dual role capacity. The candidate should be flexible, highly adaptable and excellent team player. The candidate should expect to work in a global virtual team along with NY and India team members, sometimes across multiple time zones. The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated team player committed to delivering on time and should be able to work under minimal supervision. Required Skills: * Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written * Selfmotivated individual that will dig deep to uncover facts and not rely on assumptions or hearsay * Ability to manage requirements and definition of the overall platform, keeping focus on technical requirements for users to be able to successfully use and navigate through the platform on their day to day activities. * Liaison between Business Users and Technical team in analysis & design * Well defined and structured individual who can document, track and work on Functional, Data requirements seamlessly with minimum supervision * Identifies opportunities for improving business processes through information systems * Plans, organizes and conduct walk through with Business Units and Technical team for common understanding across teams of requirements and sign off * Provides technical assistance to peers, mentoring where ever applicable * Participates in User Acceptance Testing and Deployment * Ability to assists in project management activity and delivery in case the need arises Plusses: Experience in Agile & Waterfall and transition between the two (2) SDLC methodology \NTT DATA Services is a leading IT services provider and global innovation partner with 130,000 professionals based in over 50 countries. NTT DATA recently acquired Dell Services. NTT DATA Services emphasizes long-term commitment and combines global reach and local intimacy to provide premier professional services, including consulting, application services, business process, IT outsourcing, and cloud-based solutions. We are a part of NTT Group, one of the world's largest technology services companies, generating more than $100 billion in annual revenues and partner to 80% of the Fortune 100. Visit www.nttdataservices.com to learn how our consultants, projects, managed services, and outsourcing engagements deliver value for a wide range of businesses and government agencies. The Company is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without r egard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result. - provided by DicePlease refer to Job Description

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Company: Visiting Nurse Service of New York
Description: Overview The Visiting Nurse Service of New York (VNSNY) is the nation's largest not-for-profit home- and community-based health care organization, serving the five boroughs of New York City, and Nassau, Suffolk, and Westchester Counties. For 125 years, VNSNY has been committed to meeting the health care needs of New Yorkers with compassionate, high-quality home health care. We offer a wide range of services, programs, and health plans to meet the diverse needs of our patients, members, and clients from before birth to the end of life. Each day, more than 13,000 VNSNY employees- including nurses, rehabilitation therapists, social workers, other allied professionals, and paraprofessionals- deliver compassionate care, unparalleled medical expertise, and 24/7 solutions and resources to more than 48,000 patients and members, helping them to live the best lives possible in their homes and communities. Responsibilities Responsible for developing, designing and implementing workflows and procedures that support the day-to-day management of VNS Patient Accounts. Conducts detailed audits and analyses, prepares reports, and makes preliminary recommendations based on findings. Determines project scope and collaborates with Manager to develop and implement best approach to resolve operational and regulatory discrepancies. Works under general direction. Education: Bachelors Degree in Accounting, Business Administration or the equivalent work experience required. Experience: Minimum three years business experience preferably in Managed Care or Health Care Management (Hospital or Home Care) setting required. Effective oral/written communication skills required. Personal Computer skills including Microsoft Word and Excel required. Strong analytical skills, including analysis of data and recommendations based on findings required. CA2018

Name: Lead Business Analyst - Marketing Technology
Description: A career at New York Life offers many opportunities. To be part of a growing and successful business. To reach your full potential, whatever your specialty. Above all, to make a difference in the world by helping people achieve financial security. It’s a career journey you can be proud of, and you’ll find plenty of support along the way. Our development programs range from skill-building to management training, and we value our diverse and inclusive workplace where all voices can be heard. Recognized as one of Fortune’s World’s Most Admired Companies, New York Life is committed to improving local communities through a culture of employee giving and service, supported by our Foundation. It all adds up to a rewarding career at a company where doing right by our customers is part of who we are, as a mutual company without outside shareholders. We invite you to bring your talents to New York Life, so we can continue to help families and businesses “Be Good At Life.” To learn more, please visit LinkedIn, our Newsroom and the Careers page of www.NewYorkLife.com. Primary ResponsibilitiesWe are seeking an experienced technology Business Analyst with a minimum of 10 years of business analysis (or related) experience to join our Marketing Technology team. The Business Analyst will work closely with our business partners, architects, and technology resources to lead multiple complex projects at the same time. This role will be responsible and accountable for the analysis, discovery, and quality development of business and technical requirements across a variety of workstreams. We are looking for an individual with demonstrated experience solving complex business problems, demonstrating strong attention to detail, and driving delivery projects which span across multiple teams. While this position will manage the development, detailed analysis, and documentation of requirements from New York Life’s Marketing business teams, the role will also partner with architecture and delivery teams to define optimal technology solutions.Functional Responsibilities Serve as a lead business analysts for marketing technology implementation projects and drive delivery against the marketing technology roadmapCollaborate and lead workshops with business partners and delivery teams (internal and external) to elicit, develop, document, and manage business and technical requirementsDirectly author supplemental requirement artifacts such as process flows, context diagrams, use cases, and wireframesEstablish meaningful traceability between business requirements, technical requirements, and architecture design which illustrates a deep understanding of business processes and the technology ecosystemMap and illustrate how applications are connected and how data flows throughout the technology ecosystemResponsible for documenting and illustrating all analysis in an effective, informative and executive appropriate mannerIdentify opportunities and required areas of focus to support and execute against business strategiesAct as a liaison between the business and IT architecture and delivery teamsInterface with business partners, technology resources, architecture, and quality assurance teams to translate and streamline requirements; this role will also ensure requirements are met throughout the entire TDLC or Scaled Agile frameworksPartner with business partners and quality assurance teams to ensure adequate test coverage; this role will also be responsible for working with the business partners to prioritize functional and regression defects during testing cyclesExperienceExperience implementing content management and/or digital marketing platforms, Adobe Marketing Cloud and Adobe Analytics Cloud a plusApplied experience with establishing, managing, driving, and delivering large scale, complex IT projects which involve multiple delivery teams, platforms, and data integrationsExperience in working on large scale initiatives with third party delivery partners (including onsite/offshore execution models)Management consulting experience a plusDemonstrated experience managing a business analyst team (direct and/or matrixed management)Proven ability to learn and adapt quickly and easily to change; proven ability to navigate a complex environmentRequired Skills:Minimum 10 years of Business Analysis or related experienceFamiliarity with multiple software development methodologiesStrong critical thinking and analytical skills and attention to detailAbility to frame, analyze, and summarize complex problemsProficient in MS Word, Excel; excellent PowerPoint skills, ability to concisely convey complex strategies and findings in a well-structured, illustrative and effective mannerExcellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills to bridge / facilitate efforts between technical and business teamsAbility to partner with development teams that support various technology platformsProven leadership, negotiation, and relationship management skillsQuickly learns new businesses and complex processes, and can demonstrate executive communicationHighly motivated self-starter demonstrating integrity, initiative and innovation qualitiesDemonstrated ability to work across multiple business domains in support of projectsEducationBachelor’s degree in a related fieldAdvanced degree and industry certifications encouragedSF:LI-KV1EOE M/F/D/V If you have difficulty using or interacting with any portions of this Web site due to incompatibility with an Assistive Technology, if you need the information in an alternative format, or if you have suggestions on how we can make this site more accessible, please contact us at: (212) 576-5811.

Name: Business Process Analyst, SoX, Optimization
Description: Job DescriptionJob Description  The Business Process Analyst, Optomization has specific responsibility for reviewing, maintaining and documenting processes across the Group, and in conjunction with business owners. Ensuring the documentation and related internal controls documentation is of a standard compliant with SOx/COSO 2013 guidance and facilitating an efficient annual audit and SOx testing process. Together with the Business Process Manager this person will also be responsible for proactively identifying process improvement opportunities and driving enhancements throughout the group. The intention of the role is to effectively train and transition process documentation processes to process owners and thereafter operate in a review/consultation mode with a focus on enhancements rather than documentation. Accountabilities:Ensuring current and up to date review of all process flow documentationReview and update related control documentation (especially SOx related controls key for Financial Reporting purposes)Point person for Internal Audit / SOx Testing and External Auditors; Monitor developing audit expectations, including the related Standards / Rules; liaise with functions and business unitsManage central location holding all process documentation and ensure maintenance solution (e.g. SharePoint or another suitable system) is user friendly and efficientProvide ongoing training to business owners of documentation and embed ownership and responsibility across the businessFollow SOx compliance integration and onboarding process for new acquisitions and overtime ensure that the business are taking ownership for same, providing assistance where required (for example risk-based testing of controls and ensuring evidence maintained by the business is adequate to support operational effectiveness)Regularly engage with the business to gain and maintain ongoing and in-depth understanding of the business processesOn-going review of changing processes and ensure process change updates are documented in accordance with SOx requirementsConsider Systems Solutions where possibleMeasure and evaluate the effectiveness of processes, procedures and controls in achieving agreed objectivesProvide support, guidance and information on control issues to teams across the Group In addition to the above key responsibilities, the role may be required to undertake other duties from time to time as the Company may reasonably require. Regulatory: Group Wide COSO 2013 Expectations  The Group has adopted the COSO 2013 Internal Control Framework for the purposes of complying with Sarbanes Oxley legislation. This role should assist the business in ensuring that the business is: Designing effective control activities to mitigate the relevant risks owned by the relevant FunctionOperating those control activities effectivelyRemediating control gaps and deficiencies relating to controls / processes on a timely basisAll staff must:Act with integrityAct with due skill, care and diligenceBe open and co-operative with regulators globallyTake reasonable steps to ensure that the business is controlled effectivelyTake reasonable steps to ensure that the business of the Company/Group for which you are responsible complies with the relevant requirements and standards of the regulatory systemTake reasonable steps to ensure that any delegation of your responsibilities is to an appropriate person and that you oversee the discharge of the delegated responsibility effectivelyDisclose appropriately any information of which a regulator would reasonably expect to have noticeWhen exercising your responsibilities, you must pay due regard to the interests of current and potential future policyholders in ensuring the provision by the Company/Group of an appropriate degree of protection for their insured benefits Job Type: Full-time

Name: Senior Business Development Analyst
Description: KJM Staffing Solutions has a great opportunity for an experienced Senior Business Development Analyst, PDF Americas. Our client is a top ranked global law firm and this role will be based in the New York office. This role offers a high base, excellent benefits and growth opportunities within a prominent law firm.  The Senior Business Development Analyst, PDF Americas will work closely with the Senior BD Specialist, Senior BD Manager PDF, Practice Group Leader, senior partners from other assigned practice groups and client teams to develop, execute and promote marketing and business development programs for the assigned practice groups and coverage areas. Key objectives are to generate revenues through a focused and coordinated approach to business development activities including profile raising, pitching, client team coverage and industry coverage. The position also will coordinate closely with international colleagues and other marketing team members on global cross-selling efforts, including support for client teams, industry groups and other firm-wide BD efforts and initiatives. Responsibilities:Supporting practice groups efforts to develop and implement their business plans and marketing budgets, individual partner plans and targeted business development effortsDesigning and executing new business initiatives for the practices including thought leadership, events, client seminars and / or training programs with communications, core BD and other admin teams and departmentsMonitoring various marketing publications and other sources for potential opportunities and communicating intelligence gathered to partners on a regular basisAnalyzing markets and conducting research into industries, sectors, clients and competition in order to inform strategic planningPitches, legal directories and marketing collateralDrafting custom pitches and RFPs and tracking success rates in the client relationship management database; collaborating with core BD team in advocating best practicesPreparing all relevant directory submissions; scheduling interview calls; preparing specific talking points; identifying and tracking practice specific awards / submissionsDeveloping and maintaining marketing collateral (brochures, capability presentations, web content) in conjunction with core BD team; ensuring all information are kept up-to-date in the relevant databasesSupporting the various existing client initiatives (Corporate Client Program, Global Financial Institution Coverage, Global Industry Initiative, etc.) including producing / monitoring client action plans and researching targeted clients / sectorsCoordinating contact and activity information input into InterAction and other internal and external relationship management toolsCoordinating with the PR/Communications team to identify media opportunities , including speaking and by-lined articles; facilitating publication of articles and other writingsQualifications:Bachelors degree required; advanced degree such as a JD or MBA preferred3-4 years in progressively responsible business development roles in legal marketing or other professional services firmsSignificant experience managing pitches, legal directory submissions and the full range of legal marketing and business development servicesExperience working in an international environment and across time zones Credible understanding of business and legal landscape and how it impacts the firms client baseExceptional and creative problem-solving skills; Name: Apttus CPQ Business Analyst - 6-12 Month Contract
Description: I am looking for an Apttus CPQ consultant in the New York City area to work with an exciting client of our located in the finacial district. My client is a top ratings company and has a fun company environment. The ideal CPQ consultant should have strong experience with all Salesforce administrative duties, business analyst experience and at least 1 year of Apttus CPQ experience. Perform business process modelling, user experience modeling, and basic technical architecture diagramming. Interpret technical and business strategy roadmaps and apply a detailed technical solution. Experience with Sales Cloud, Partner Communities, and Force.com platform functionality required. Strong presentation and communication skills. Comfortable building and demonstrating Salesforce CPQ prototypes in Salesforce. - provided by DiceApttus/ CPQ/ Consultant? New York/ Business Analyst/ Salesforce/ Salesforce.com/

Name: Associate Business Analyst
Description: THE OPPORTUNITY The Associate Business Analyst (BA) serves at the intersection of the Business and Engineering teams. In this role, you will be working on critical projects for our businesses, helping to translate requirements into user stories for technical development. The BA will help ensure that the needs of the business and customers are being met by testing new development features and assessing the impact of those features. The ideal candidate for this role requires strong communication skills, the ability to manage project scope and deadlines, and a commitment to deliver the highest quality in all projects. Being analytically minded, detail oriented, and passionate about making a difference is a must for this role. YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES • Proactively seeks to understand each division’s business objectives and the value they provide • Understands how the business objectives intersect with technology, and helps translate those objectives into functional requirements • Serves as a contributing member of agile scrum teams, helping to build exciting new software and technical capabilities • Analyzes and understands requirements following software development lifecycle methodologies • Coordinates projects and initiatives • Communicates requirements to tech teams and vendors and with meticulous attention to detail • Supports the product owner or product managers in the businesses by helping to manage the backlog of requirements in the form of user stories • Builds domain expertise by learning core fundamental business analysts skills and processes • Facilitates business and technology discussions regarding schedule and priority • Facilitates the implementation of operational and business requirements • Communicates how requirements fit into milestones and software releases as part of managing a larger roadmap • Monitors post-production processes to ensure accurate completion of all deployments • Apprises supervisor of status, schedule variances and outstanding issues HOW YOU CAN FIT • A self-starter that enjoys owning an effort and driving it to completion • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, including strong presentation skills • Enthusiastic team-player • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills • Ability to establish goals and set clear expectations, prioritize activities, and follow through to completion • Excellent interpersonal skills including negotiation, problem resolution, and customer service • Flexibility and adaptability to adjust and alter approach promptly and efficiently, when needed • Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies and programs • Ability to quickly understand the scope of the project and identify key success and risk factors • Must be able to clearly and regularly communicate status, issues and risks to project stakeholders • Must be highly organized and have the ability to manage competing priorities • Bachelor’s Degree or better (focus as an MBA, MIS, computer science, digital media, mathematics, engineering, science, or other quantitative field a plus) Preferred Skills and Knowledge:• Experience in structured SDLC methodology, such as Agile • Experience with Adobe Experience Manager and other front-end web and eCommerce technologies and tools • Experience working with third party vendors with an understanding of systems integration • Understanding of how back-end and web-based systems interface with each other • Experience with project tracking tools such as Jira, Rally, etc. • Experience with web analytics tools (ie, Adobe Analytics, Coremetrics, Google Analytics, etc.) • Familiarity with SEO and UX best practices • Familiarity with regulatory and compliance needs relevant to our company - COPPA, can-spam, and regulatory issues • Knowledge of publishing industry or multi-channel product management ABOUT SCHOLASTIC Scholastic Corporation (NASDAQ: SCHL) is the world's largest publisher and distributor of children's books, a leading provider of print and digital instructional materials for pre-K to grade 12, and a producer of educational and entertaining children's media. The Company creates quality books and ebooks, print and technology-based learning programs, classroom magazines and other products that, in combination, offer schools customized solutions to support children's learning both at school and at home. The Company also makes quality, affordable books available to all children through school-based book clubs and book fairs. With a 98-year history of service to schools and families, Scholastic continues to carry out its commitment to "Open a World of Possible" for all children. Learn more at Scholastic.com/AboutScholastic. About the Associate ProgramScholastic’s Technology Associate Program is designed to identify, train, and promote the next generation of leaders. Each new-hire class receives comprehensive training and is quickly given responsibility to deliver on business goals using industry-leading tools, partners, and technology – all while working in an agile, iterative model that emphasizes collaboration, transparency, and goal-oriented development.

Name: Product Analyst
