Name: Retail Systems Business Analyst
Description: Prestigious Cultural Institution - Manhattan  Manager, Retail Systems is a new position, reflecting the our Retail Stores' commitment to developing a robust and sustainable approach to its Retail operations. The business has an annual revenue of approximately $60m, multiple revenue channels, a complex systems architecture and approximately 200 staff.  Retail is being re-envisioned and revitalized to provide the best possible experience for audiences / customers in the future.  The new role will play a key part in delivering this success.  Reporting to the Senior Manager of eCommerce & Systems, and working closely with the Institution's IT department and with teams across Retail, the aim of the new role is to leverage current systems solutionsidentify new systems solutions to current business problems andmanage the successful delivery of systems changes and upgrades from the Retail side. The Manager, Retail Systems will also lead in the identification, management and QA of Retail Systems operational issues. Primary Responsibilities and Duties: : Work closely and collaboratively with the Institution's IS&T department on all aspects of Retail Systems technology and be the point-person for IS&T on all Retail Systems projects and issues.  : Oversee the day to day performance of all Stores' systems. Work with IS&T partners to ensure that uptime and performance are optimal, especially during peak trading. : Liaise with systems users, and provide the main point of user contact for all Retail Systems issues. Lead or coordinate user training where appropriate.  : Work with Retail Systems users to trouble shoot issues, and to explore new systems change requests. Centrally manage Applications Service Requests (ASRs) and work with Senior Manager, Ecommerce and Systems to approve such requests and set departmental priorities. Lead the support and troubleshooting efforts from the Retail side, working closely with IS&T.  : Communicate and prioritize Retail Systems fixes and changes with IS&T. Manage the timeframe for the delivery of fixes.  : Investigate identified business problems and perform analysis of potential systems solutions, working closely with the Senior Manager, eCommerce & Systems to present viable options to the business.  : Develop new user requirements and use cases for Retail and communicate these to IS&T stakeholders. Attend sprint planning meetings to represent Retail in development of new functionality by IS&T.  : Incorporate best practices into Retail Systems setup and planning to better address business needs.  : Project manage all Retail Systems initiatives from the Retail side, working closely with IS&T and with third party providers to ensure that projects are delivered on time and to budget.  : Lead cross-departmental teams in the delivery of systems initiatives, setting and managing accountabilities for deliverables.  : Lead the Retail QA process for all projects, upgrades, bug fixes, and new feature development; create new test plans as required, ensure that test scripts are up to date, that all aspects of the changes are tested, that bugs are prioritized and fixed in a timely manner and that work goes live on schedule.  : Coordinates deployment of new solutions, both applications and hardware to the Retail environment.  : Facilitate the maintenance of data standards across all Retail Systems.  : Manage third-party providers as required.  : Learn new systems and tools as required.  : Any other duties and responsibilities as required. Requirements and Qualifications:Experience and Skills: : Five years' plus experience with Retail Systems operations in a mid-sized business environment  : Experience with a variety of different Retail Systems applications, including some of the following: point of sale, order management, product management, inventory management and warehouse management. Experience with a variety of different solutions desirable but not required.  : Detail-oriented, with excellent initiative, execution and follow-through.  : Innate problem-solving and analytical thinking.  : Strong communication and interpersonal skills; good at collaboration.  : Demonstrated leadership, project management skills, and ability to handle multiple tasks and direct cross-functional teams.  : Adept at learning new technology, systems and functionality.  : Understanding of business requirements for profitability.  : Experience with some of the following systems desirable: CW Direct, JDA MMS, Retail Ideas, WinDSS, Manhattan Associates Scale, FDMS and FileMaker. Knowledge and Education: : BA or BS required; MA or MS preferred  : Project management training and certification  : Business analysis training desirable  : Expertise in Microsoft applications, Excel, Outlook and Word required. Name: Management Consultant
Description: When we ask someone to join The Berkeley Partnership, it’s a big decision, for us and for them. We work with big, high profile clients, shaping and delivering complex and transformational change. Our partners and consultants help these organisations tackle their most critical challenges, often by working as an integral part of their leadership teams. Our focus is always on making change happen, making it successful and making it last.Our people focus on building trusting, long term client relationships and only selling work that clients need and want. We truly believe this is key to our success, and our repeat/referral business supports this. That’s why we can’t afford to compromise on the quality of people we hire. At Berkeley we develop talented consultants rather than hire in at the most senior levels, so it is important to us that we hire people at the right point in their career. We look for high achievers with 7 – 12 years consulting experience working in high quality, often large consulting firms. Joiners will have a proven project leadership track record, and the ability to build strong relationships with blue-chip clients.  But meeting our requirements is only part of the story. Life at The Berkeley Partnership is very different from larger firms. With freedom, trust and autonomy comes a high level of accountability. This is by no means a soft option. There’s a strong focus on personal and professional development, with a partner to consultant ratio of 1:4. We don’t do hierarchy. There are just two levels, Partner and Consultant and if the offer of Partnership comes, you’ll know it means something.  Being owner-managed, we can shape the kind of firm we want to work in. We offer our consultants the chance to develop themselves professionally and to work towards success for our clients and for the firm. Our trusting and open culture makes Berkeley both a professional and sociable place to work, with high levels of autonomy and little bureaucracy. You’ll need to be adaptable and open minded about different ways of working and projects/industry sectors that are outside of your comfort zone. Sometimes you’ll be leading, sometimes supporting. Sometimes you’ll be on your own, although there’s always support from your colleagues when you need it. The pressure can be every bit as high as you’ve experienced before but most of our people find it easier to balance their work and personal interests in a smaller, more flexible firm.  You’ll find our recruitment process thorough and demanding but friendly too. We know it’s a big time commitment, so we urge you to read our website carefully before taking the next step. If you are the right person for us and are ready for a significant career move, it’s time well spent.  If you’d like to find out more about management consultancy careers at Berkeley, please visit our website.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: RBC Capital Markets LLC seeks a Senior Business Analyst in Jersey City, NJ to collaborate with senior business and technology leaders and associated teams in implementing Futures & OTC Clearing and Execution strategy. The prime deliverable of the role covers aspects such as requirement analysis, new client onboarding, new product implementation, new SEF onboarding, back office support, client reporting and regulatory reporting (EMIR, CFTC). The role requires performing data coverage/gap analysis, functional testing & data optimization, EOD reporting of positions and banked cash as well as running bespoke projects for complex client needs.  MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: Master’s degree in Information Systems, Engineering, or a related field, and 18 months of experience using Oracle and RDBMS, developing SQL scripts, stored procedures, functions, Triggers, database optimization and business Intelligence reporting, experience with reporting tools. 18 months of experience working as Business Analyst in OTC Client Clearing domain with responsibilities in Business Analysis/writing stories in an Agile environment, backlog grooming, product owner responsibilities, data analysis, SQL, and functional requirements writing. 18 months of experience working on fixed income products especially Interest Rates (Swaps, Forwards, Futures and Options), pre trade and post trade clearing flow, EOD positions, cash and collateral reporting (ISDA Clearing Connectivity Standards), EOD reconciliation (IMATCH Isuite, Duco), EOD risk reporting (MSCI Risk manager, Global Risk), Back office reporting (Rolfe Nolan). 18 months of experience understanding and implementing new regulatory product enhancements requirements. 18 months of experience is also required with static set up for OTC clients across external platforms like swap execution facilities (Trade Web, Bloomberg, Trueex), Affirmation platforms (Markitwire and VCon) and on Exchanges using CME Rav Manager and LCH Onboarding Portal. Learn more about RBC Tech JobsAbout RBC Royal Bank of Canada is Canadas largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North Americas leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com. Join our Talent Community Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.  Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Name: Digital Product Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionZeus Associates Recruiting and Staffing is recruiting for a Digital Product Business Analyst. The Digital Product Business Analyst will work within the Digital Product team and will primarily be focused on the development of the new website.  The Digital Product Business Analyst serves as the intermediary between our stakeholders and the technical teams. Through collaboration with various internal stakeholders, the analyst will collect, refine, and document requirements in accordance with project needs. Job Responsibilities:Gather, analyze, and define business requirements for the website.Elicit functional requirements from cross functional stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle.Work with stakeholders to collect detailed requirements and maintain projects throughout the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).Communicate requirements to development teams and track follow-through.Translate business objectives into functional requirements.Support the Project Manager and Product Manager in managing the product backlog.Interact with the project manager in planning and scoping requirements.Collaborate and communicate with stakeholders, developers, and designers.Create acceptance criteria for user stories to define features and expectations for deliverables.Work with Quality Assurance team to review test cases to validate enhancements, updates or bug fixes.As a member of a cross-functional team, maintain technical knowledge of the content management, entitlement, authentication, ecommerce, and other other services underpinning the website and act as product expert.Compile information into recommendations and analyses.Work closely with the product management team in their efforts to document, train, and support the website.Participate and prepare for backlog grooming and sprint planning sessions.Participate in weekly and monthly review meetings with external vendors, business stakeholders, developers, and internal IT staff.Job Requirements:Web Analytics and/or Ecommerce Business Analyst experience preferred; experience in tracking web analytics, assessing ecommerce customer needs, and designing ecommerce solutionsAbility to understand and communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical colleaguesOrganized with strong multi-tasking and time management skillsExcellent analytical and problem solving skillsAttention to detailExperience with or knowledge of agile development methodologyAbility to work with cross-functional teamsAbility to organize and work under strict timelines while producing quality deliverablesAbility to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies and programsKnowledge of web analytics, ecommerce platforms and/or publishing industry is preferred.Employment eligibility to work in the US is requiredMust be able to work full business hours from NY office, it is not a remote positionExcellent verbal and written communication skillsMinimum of 5 years of relevant work experienceBachelor's degree It's a great company to work for. Zeus Associates is based out of NYC and Long Island with satellite offices in the New York metropolitan area.

Name: Product Analyst
Description: Want to help people get the financial protection they need and feel confident in their choices? Policygenius is a NYC-based tech startup that makes it easy to compare and buy insurance online. Since 2014, we've raised over $52 million of venture capital, established ourselves as a pioneer in Fintech and helped more than 4.5 million people get vital coverage for their families.  We're rapidly growing and looking for people with grit, great attitudes and creative problem-solving skills to join our powerhouse team. Come see why we were voted one of INC's best workplaces of 2018! About the role... At Policygenius, we apply a rigorous data-driven approach to solving problems. Analytics is not just a buzzword but a tangible and proven way to measure performance and conduct experiments to improve all aspects of our business.  Reporting to the Head of Business Intelligence and working cross-functionally across Marketing, Product, Design, and Engineering, this Product Analyst will have countless opportunities to drive insights into action and ultimately impact a consumer product that is fundamentally transforming the insurance industry! You will...Provide in-depth analyses and reports to key stakeholders across Marketing, Product, and Design to help understand how users interact with various site features and extract insights around performanceContribute to the product roadmap to define and implement success metrics that will evaluate performanceIncorporate data and insights from adjacent functions, e.g. customer profiles, marketing activities, website design & development, downstream conversion, etc.Design & execute AB testing and multivariate testing plans to boost product performanceCarry out ad hoc analyses from data acquisition to insightsResearch leading practices in product analytics to enhance and expand our analysis and reporting capabilitiesYou have...3+ years experience analyzing product performance with clear, demonstrable resultsAn ability to work cross-functionally across departments to prioritize and build products that delight customers, and deliver business impactA strong analytical mindset, driven by curiosity with a focus on data-driven analytics and the ability to measure successComfort and desire to take the wheel and tackle complex and ambiguous problemsThe ability to synthesize, visualize and communicate ideas to stakeholders across different functions and levelsProficiency in Google Analytics, Segment and other similar measurement toolsFluency in SQL with experience in data visualization in Tableau or similar toolsSTEM undergraduate and/or master's degree preferred; background in computer science / software engineering a plusExperience analyzing mobile app performance a plusYou'll get...Company-paid health, dental, vision, life & disability insurance401(k) plan, FSA & commuter benefitsFlexible PTOTraining, mentorship and coaching from leadershipThe opportunity to grow alongside a company shaking up a big, old-fashioned industryFun, diverse, open-minded coworkersDog companionshipSome fun surprises when you join (Shhh It's a secret!)

Name: Business Analyst - Product Team
Description: Business Analyst, Product Management  MediaRadar is a cloud-based ad sales information service. We help websites, magazines, television networks, newspapers and agencies dramatically improve ad sales and client management. MediaRadar provides its clients with detailed brand analysis and prospecting reports on over 3 million brands, culling advertising and editorial insights from thousands of media properties. We help to give our more than 1,600 clients a competitive edge by empowering their sales teams to enhance and streamline their sales processes using our unique SaaS platform service.  We are looking for a strong Business Analyst to join our Product team. You'll be a critical part of our team and the development process, working on the new product features and major initiatives that will help us continue to grow! What You'll Do:Collaborate on new feature requirements, working with MediaRadar's product managers and user experience designer, and then translate those business requirements into detailed technical requirements.Conduct quantitative analysis to validate those requirements, and map out the steps required to implement and monitor any new processes.Work directly with developers, our QA team and the product managers during the development and testing process.Help prepare the documentation that we need to effectively train our sales and service teams before features launch.Monitor site performance, including inbound bugs reported by customer-facing teams.RequirementsWho You Are:You have a BA/BS degreeYou have 3+ years of experience as a business analyst, or in a customer-facing role where analysis and/or process improvement is a big part of your job.You're a proactive self-starter who takes initiative and ownership of the projects you work on, and will do what it takes to make them a success.You're technically savvy and detail oriented. The ideal candidate would have experience building requirements in a data-driven product environment.You have strong problem-solving skills. You're a whiz with Excel and have enough SQL experience that you could validate and help test data-driven features. You can draw conclusions from your analysis, not just present data.You don't need to have direct experience in the media or advertising space, but that would be a plus!You're eager to grow professionally and learn every dayBenefits At MediaRadar, employees are encouraged to have fun and develop strong relationships with their peers. Employees love to spend their free time playing ping-pong and socializing with co-workers in and out of the office, whether at happy hours or volunteer events. Team members also strengthen their bonds at holiday functions and monthly office parties, and they enjoy great perks like Bagel Wednesdays and early release on Fridays during the summer. We also offer fantastic career progression, training and development, and a great benefits package that includes a competitive salary, first-rate health insurance, 401K, and transit discounts.  Check out what it's like to work with our awesome team here: http://muse.cm/1Mt0NCgSDL2017

Name: Business Intelligence and Reporting Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob DutiesUnder the supervision of the Executive Director of Institutional Research and Effectiveness, the Business Intelligence and Reporting Analyst will play an important role in managing institutional data and technologies, providing reports and statistical analyses in support of institutional research, planning and assessment activities. The analyst will be responsible for developing and managing the institutional research data warehouse, building dashboards, extracting data and writing reports from student information system, web-based software applications, and other external platforms. The key focus will be on data mining, analytics and visualization. He/she will also assist with data collection for all aspects of external data reporting (IPEDS, state reports, college guidebooks, consortium exchange, etc.), and internal reports for academic and administrative units, such as the weekly enrollment census report, the annual benchmarking report and other historical data analysis. Additional job responsibilities may include managing institutional technologies for office and campus users; and performing other IR-related duties as assigned.QualificationsBachelor's degree in business, computer science, social sciences, statistics, or a related field.Two years of professional experience working with enterprise data systems, analytics, and/or research in a higher education setting or in a role involving data analysis.Business intelligence and analytics experience working with relational databases, creation and maintenance of data warehouse.Experience with Tableau, SAS VA or other data visualization tools.Proficiency with Excel and with a statistical package or programming language, such as SPSS, SAS, Python.Reliable, detail oriented and accepting of the confidential nature of the assignmentsAbility to work independently in a multi-project, fast-paced office environment and able to meet deadlinesStrong interpersonal skills and the ability to work with a diverse group of people in an academic settingDepartmentInstitutional ResearchGeneral Submission Guidelines:In order to be considered a candidate for any job at Stevens, you must submit an online application. Please attach a cover letter and resume with each application. Other requirements for consideration may depend on the job.Still Have Questions?If you have any questions regarding your application, please contact Jobs@Stevens.eduEEO Statement:Stevens Institute of Technology is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Stevens is a federal contractor under the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA) and the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as well as other federal statutes.Jeanne Clery Disclosure:In accordance with the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act (Clery Act), the Department of Public Safety is required to publish an annual security report which includes statistics mandated by the Clery Act. Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Senior Business AnalystREF#: 32584 CBS BUSINESS UNIT: CBS Corporate JOB TYPE: Full-Time Staff JOB SCHEDULE: Full-Time JOB LOCATION: New York, NY ABOUT US: CBS was established in 1928, when founder William Paley purchased 16 independent radio stations and christened them the Columbia Broadcast System. Today, with more than 200 television stations and affiliates reaching virtually every home in the United States, CBS's total network lineup was watched by more than 110 million people a week during the 2017/2018 season. CBS has been the #1 network in primetime for 10 consecutive seasons. The network has the #1 comedy/scripted program, THE BIG BANG THEORY; #1 newsmagazine, 60 MINUTES; #l late night program, THE LATE SHOW WITH STEPHEN COLBERT and #1 daytime drama, THE YOUNG AND THE RESTLESS. Its programming arms include CBS Entertainment, CBS News and CBS Sports. DESCRIPTION: The Sr. Business Analyst will be responsible for defining, analyzing and documenting, user requirements, procedures, problems and leading joint design efforts to offer a new solution or value proposition to customers, automate processing or to improve existing business processes and associated information systems. The Sr. Business Analyst will also be responsible for defining the appropriate methodologies and best practices for performing business analysis and design in the support of core organizational functions and business processes.  Responsibilities: Solicits client requirements through interviews, workshops and/or existing systems documentation or procedures.Evaluates business requirements for applications and systems integration and service activation, while delivering new or modified software systems enhancements and/or integration solutions.Conducts reviews of and analyzes business and information technology processes and prepares essential groundwork for the development of systems.Participates in the definition, testing, training, implementation and support of system requirements.Identifies customer requirements, develops test schedules, reviews testing plans, tracks and documents the development and results of these plans.Alerts manager to potential risks and issues of importance.Uncovers client requirements via industry standard analysis techniques such as Data Flow and Object Modeling, Case Analysis, Workflow Analysis, and Functional Decomposition AnalysisEnsures requirements are understood, agreed to and signed off at the appropriate early stages in a project.Provides analysis of processes and workflows with suggestions for improvement. Identifies areas where technology can lead to increased efficiency and productivity.Understands the functions supported by the current systems. Understand and accommodate the requirement constraints imposed by the current systems.Provides detailed analysis resulting in clear, concise and unambiguous system requirements. Requirements analysis will undergo multiple iterations and refinements. Documents detailed use cases that cover all alternate and exception flows. Supplements use cases with real world scenarios.Provides UI mock-ups. Leads design discussions and identifies design options.Provides user documentation and training for the system.Must be available for on call support nights and weekends.Interacts with others in the business and IT organization.Works with providers of software and hardware products as well as consulting vendor service providersPrioritize assignments in a high visibility mission critical systemEstablish and oversee the customer's initial adoption, training and development of best practices to build a strong foundation before and during initial roll outsTroubleshoot issues quickly and appropriately by identifying immediate remediation, determining root cause, and coordinating long term solution.QUALIFICATIONS: Required: A minimum of five years of business analysis experience with previous supervision or project management experience a strong plusDemonstrated track record of defining systems that lead to increased efficiency and productivity through the use of technologyDocumented experience with SDLC methodology and process related to Business AnalysisExcellent analytical, communication (both verbal and written), facilitation/organizational skillsStrategic, innovative thinking and visionStrong persuasion skillsStrong business acumenExcellent analytical and communication (both verbal and written) skillsSolid understanding of technologyComfortable learning, using and explaining new technologyStrong organization and time management skills Experience with BOX, Slack and Salesforce required #DICE  #LI-PS1  Preferred: EEO STATEMENT: Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

Name: Financial Analyst

The team provides critical analytical support to Brookfield Renewable's project financing, business development and growth initiatives. The Financial Analyst is responsible for building and reviewing financial models, and assists with drafting presentations, preparing term sheets, analyzing proposals, and reviewing legal documentation. ResponsibilitiesDevelop financial models for project financings, development projects and strategic initiatives;Assist in the development and negotiation of project financing / tax equity documentation;Review and prepare term sheets for financing and business development activities;Assist in project credit rating and maintenance activities;Assist with the execution of business development initiatives;Assist in M&A due diligence activities;Assist in the preparation of business plans for strategic initiatives;Collaborate with a broad range of cross-functional resident experts to assess opportunities;Assist in strategy development in key growth areas; and,Prepare PowerPoint presentations targeted at senior management.QualificationsSolid analytical and financial modelling skills with strong attention to detail;Well organized and ability to synthesize and conceptualize complex ideas;Self-motivated with demonstrated initiative;Excellent written and oral communications skills;Heightened interpersonal and influencing skills;Able to meet multiple objectives in a dynamic, fast-paced, team environment; and,Able to travel (lender presentations, management meetings and site visits).RequirementsUndergraduate/Graduate degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, Economics or Mathematics;Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in project/corporate finance or investment banking;Experience in power & utilities and with tax equity investments would be an asset;Strong financial modelling skills required, including advanced knowledge of Excel (financial modelling) and PowerPoint (presentations); andWorking towards a recognized professional designation (CFA, CPA) would be an asset.SDL2017

Name: Sr Business Analyst
Description: Job TitleSr Business AnalystJob Description The business intelligence team seeks an analyst to specialize on our owned and operated digital brands. The business intelligence analyst role is a multi-talented and driven analytics lead that is passionate about media and data. The role requires fluency in the language of both business and technology (SQL, D3, data visualization etc).  The position will play an instrumental role in analyzing, exposing, and connecting the dots with data; namely, surfacing insights from our internal data of owned and operated digital properties that drive impact to our business and improves consumer experiences. Working closely with digital business leads at Meredith, the business intelligence analyst will work directly with product, editorial, growth and general management leads for a group of Meredith brands.  She/he will be the primary reporting specialist and a key contributor in providing data and actionable insights that ensures digital success. It’s important that this candidate have the technical ability to mine and retrieve data and implement technical solutions while having the business acumen and social skills to communicate with executives in the company. Essential Job Functions25% Work within the BI + analytics team, while in continuous communication with GMs, product, editorial and growth leads to help synthesize questions, understand our customer data, and query for answers in way that addresses business needs and is easily understood. 25% Deliver analyses such as: customer feature/retention correlation, content performance analysis, website analytics, customer segmentation, lifetime value analysis, and cross channel analysis. 25% Become an expert in the Meredith digital audience and their behavior across our properties. 25% Proactively identify insights that help stakeholders achieve their objectives and improve products and services. Minimum Qualifications and Job Requirements | All must be met to be considered.  Education:  Degree in a quantitative field, such as computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, data science or other sciences, such as psychology or physics or equivalent experience.  Experience: 2-3 years of experience working as an analyst, statistical analyst, report writer or other technical capacity understanding, documenting, interpreting and communicating business data.Proven ability to understand business needs and translate those needs to technical requirements and technical solutions.Proven ability to evolve a strategy to a set of objectives and a tactical execution plan. Specific Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: ESSENTIAL:Strong interest in digital analytics & experience working for a digital media companyCustomer data based data query and visualization experience (data from web, iOS and Android environments).Hands on experience with SQL queries and popular data warehouses like Google BigQuery, Snowflake and AWSStrong analytical and written communication skills.Experience working with popular query writing tools like Looker, Tableau or Mode Analytics.Strong experience with online user behavior and familiarity with the types of events generally tracked.A desire to prove the correct answer to yourself via multiple angles or queries on the hypothesis. % Travel Required (Approximate): N/A#NMG#

Name: Senior Business/ Solutions Analyst
Description: Description: Position: Senior Business/ Solutions Analyst  Location: New YorkAbout Vitech Vitech Systems Group is a leading provider of group administration software to the insurance, retirement and investment industries. The V3 System serves many of the worlds premier investment organizations with a combined $1 trillion in assets under management, and benefits clients servicing over 13,000,000 members.  Our mission is to help organizations improve the efficiency and effectiveness of their operations while increasing service levels and broadening service offerings. We do this via the V3 System, our enterprise software platform that addresses a broad array of administration requirements and includes native workflow, imaging, CRM and self-service capabilities.  Our clients are seeking out a competitive edge through technology and solutions, and they rely on our team of industry domain and technical experts to design and deliver it. Heres your chance to join a dynamic, global team of technology and domain subject matter experts, developers, quality assurance experts and business analysts who are helping shape the future of technology.  Vitech currently has over 950 employees with offices and clients throughout the world. We are proud to share that Vitech has been in continuous, profitable operations for over 20 years. We offer a competitive compensation package and a comprehensive benefits program to ensure employees' health, well-being and financial security.  Visit us on the web at: www.vitechinc.com Essential Functions General: Are you a highly motivated individual who thrives on meeting deadlines, hitting project deliverables and collaborating with internal teams and external clients? Do you have the ability to successfully lead and manage complex enterprise software implementations? If this is you, Vitech wants you to join our team as a Solutions Manager-, and be a part of our management team at an industry leading company. At Vitech, you will be part of a company with a 20+ year legacy, but operates with the energy and pace of a start-up.  The Senior Solutions Analyst is responsible for managing complex software implementations at some of our premier investment clients, including fund administrators, institutional investors, and fund sponsors. You will communicate with the client's senior business and technology managers, and ensure the successful delivery or our V3 solution, in addition to managing, mentoring, and working with all Vitech solutions team members. Name: IT Business Lead Analyst
Description: Primary Location: United States,New York,New YorkEducation: Master's DegreeJob Function: TechnologySchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: NoJob ID: 18072410 DescriptionCitigroup Technology, Inc. seeks an IT Business Lead Analyst for its New York, New York location.Duties: Identify and analyze complex data sets to develop behavior-based models for detecting complex trade behaviors that meet business requirements. At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is importantsome of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction. Name: Senior Technical Business Analyst
Description: The Data Center of Excellence department is recruiting for an enthusiastic and delivery focused technical business analyst who will partner with other technology and business departments to develop and execute on a data strategy and deliver improvements to data quality. The team vision is a multi-year effort to simplify the firm's data architecture front-to-back with the goals of reducing infrastructure and manpower costs, improving the ability to demonstrate control for data, empowering developers by providing consistent means of handling data and providing a platform to implement future change initiatives faster, cheaper and easier. We are a relatively small, lean team of around 40 people, globally distributed between London, New York, Montreal and Shanghai and are engaged in a wide array of projects touching virtually every single vertical asset class and horizontal function within the Institutional Securities Technology and Corporate and Funding Technology groups.  Job Duties: Be embedded within any number of technology teams supporting different business lines or functions, with the goal of understanding and documenting their front-to-back architecture and processes, identifying gaps and problems, developing a roadmap for the evolution of that architecture and executing on the roadmap. (Equity Structured Products and Derivatives is the current key focus area) Develop and maintain relationships with stakeholders in both Technology and the Business outside your immediate area of expertise, and affect real change in both business process and technical architecture. Leverage deep business and systems knowledge in a particular area to realize tangible business benefit through adopting the data strategy and architecture principles. Leverage your strong technical focus and demonstrable experience of architecting technology solutions. Design, development and delivery of computer applications for business units like Collateral, Liquidity & Treasury, Finance, Commodities, Firm Risk, Loans, Sales and Trading, Operations. Be resilient to setbacks and relentless in the pursuit of the real business problem. Additional responsibilities will be to engage in a number of division-wide front-to-back business problems, understand and document the impact, and propose and gain support for solutions The role offers many opportunities to build a wide and diverse network and have a broad and deep impact across departments. Requirements:Master's degree or equivalent in Computer Science or Computational Mathematics or a related field, and five (5) years of relevant experience developing applications for a global financial services institution; or Bachelor's degree in same fields and eight (8) years of relevant experience.Excellent understanding of Equity Structured Products and Derivatives - Pre-trade and trade capture functions as well as front-to-back Lifecycle management.Understanding of various front, middle and back office functions including but not limited to Pricing, Trade Booking, RFQ,Position, Risk and PnL ManagementTerm sheet and Confirmations, Cash flow management, physical settlement, Upsize, Redemption, Retirement, Autocall, Novations.Experience working with various front-to-back functions like Sales and Trading, Quants, Operations, Finance, Treasury, Settlements, Documentation, Market Risk, Credit Risk, Liquidity Risk, Collateral and MarginsExcellent track record of business analysis, application product development and delivery of complex global projects in Financial services domainExperience in designing and delivering computer applications via established software project development lifecycle models like AgileExperience with SQL for Sybase/DB2 databasesExcellent communication and problem solving skillsProject and Program management experience, ability to work with senior stakeholders, bringing different teams together to execute on a plan towards a common goal.Desired Skills:Experience with Agile Software Development Lifecycle methodology and related tooling. For example - Agile plug-ins for JIRA, Scrum and Product backlog management, BDD using tools like JBehave or Cucumber etc.Technical background with emphasis on data flows & data architecture.Experience with analysis, design, development and support of multi-tier desktop or server side distributed applications written using technologies like Java, C#, Perl, Python, Sybase/DB2, and Object Oriented Programming principles.Experience with front to back functions across multiple asset classesFixed Income, Commodities, FX, Credit etc.Experience with data-centric strategies, tools and technologies around data lineage, enterprise dictionaries, common access layer, golden source identification / master data management, ontology management, Data DevOps

Name: Associate Business Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY The purpose of this position is to provide analytical support through research, data collection and data management of information for the organization. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Responsible for data collection, data input and/or aggregation and data auditing to support accurate key metric reporting and analysis performed by the organization.  Reviews accuracy of information provided and responds to requests from management and vendors.  Assists in generating Business As Usual (BAU) reports. Supports ad-hoc presentation/analysis development and responds to information requests from management.  This will be a help desk hybrid role. The individual will be analyzing data, and then making reports based on the data. They will be dispatching the tickets for the entire Americas area. This person will need to think independently, be able to identify trends, etc. They need to be customer service focused because they are interacting with clients. They will need to have the ability to manage a fast-paced environment. They will be working with Facilities Management, Property Management, and Critical Systems. They will be at a desk for the most part doing this job.  Other duties may be assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.  \n\nQUALIFICATIONS  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE  Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from 4-year college or university. Master's degree preferred. 0-2 years of related experience.  CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES  None. COMMUNICATION SKILLS Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information. FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis. REASONING ABILITY Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.  OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES  Experience in the use of Microsoft applications with emphasis on Excel and PowerPoint. SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

Name: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description: Senior Analyst, Business IntelligenceWhat's next in music is first on SoundCloud. As the world’s largest open audio platform, SoundCloud is powered by a connected community of creators, listeners and curators who share, discover and influence what’s new, now and next in music and audio.  At SoundCloud, as an open platform with millions of creators and listeners and several revenue models, we deal with complex questions everyday. To make better informed business decisions, we are looking for a exceptional Business Intelligence Senior Analyst who combines data science excellence with strong business acumen to distill relevant insight from the SC data asset. The role will be based in SoundCloud's New York Office and will be a core part of the Strategy & Research team. The Role: You will be an integral part in SoundCloud’s Business Intelligence function to enable a deeper, data-based understanding of the development, trending and dynamics of the company’s Creator and Listener business. You will drive sophistication of data-based decision making within the business units. Your work will directly inform strategic thinking across the company and impact, important short, mid-term decisions at middle and senior leadership level. As Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence you will:Act as a central expert function at the company by designing and implementing our Creator and Listener analysis and reporting frameworksContribute as expert to strategic projects alongside Strategy and Business teams. Such contributions may include behavioral analyses, designing, running and analyzing experimentsIndependently run ad-hoc projects to analyze and understand business implications of proposed decisionsBuild sustainable cross functional relationships across the organization, especially Creator, Listener, Marketing leads, Data Science/Data Platform and Audience ResearchFeel comfortable using SQL, and occasionally Python, to access data when conducting analyses and building Tableau dashboardsWhat you'll bring to the team:Degree in quantitative field (strong academic track record preferred)5+ years of experience in leading tech firms, ideally with streaming, subscription and/or advertising backgroundExceptional analytical skills paired with excellent business judgementAbility to work with large data sets from multiple data sources with excellent SQL skills and some knowledge of PythonExperience with Data Warehouse infrastructure BigQuery and concepts as well designing and deploying ETLs in order to transform big data into meaningful business informationStrong sense of urgency, attention to detail paired with hands-on approach; Ability to handle complex situations with clarity and confidence and thorough analysis (you do the work!)Strong resiliency and ambition to get things done despite an often-changing market and competitive situationStrong communication/presentation skills with a track record of presenting complex analysis to senior managementExcellent ability to build relationships and networks with multiple functions, regions, and at all levels of the organizationExcellent stakeholder management skills with both technical and business audiencesMust strive to deliver excellent work quality If this sounds like you, then we look forward to reviewing your application. Diversity at SoundCloud SoundCloud is for everyone. Diversity and open expression are fundamental to our organization they help us build a social platform and global community where anyone can create, discover, and share sounds. We acknowledge the challenges in our industry and strive to develop an inclusive culture where everyone can contribute.  We want to  hear from you. Apply now! Like it? Share it!  Facebook  Twitter  LinkedIn  Email

Name: Sales Operations/Deal Desk Analyst
Description: What do we do: Using neuroscience-based assessments and machine learning algorithms, pymetrics is reinventing the recruiting industry by matching candidates to jobs and companies where they are most likely to succeed. We are leading the charge in an evolving industry and growing our amazing team to support the mission of using data to unleash one's full potential and remove bias from hiring. What you will do: This Sales Operations/Deal Desk Analyst will play pivotal role in initially building out, and then managing the pymetrics deal desk, impacting overall sales operational efficiency and efficacy. The Analyst is responsible for reviewing and approving pricing and deal structure, accelerating sales cycles, and working with internal partners to maximize efficiency in Sales’ interactions with them. Through that process, they will standardize/streamline process to support ongoing efficiency Sales and their key partners. The Sales Operations/Deal Desk analyst will also act as the initial point of contact for opportunities requiring non-standard deal structure review/approval, and ensure compliance to agreed-upon price and deal structure. This position requires very strong analytical & communication skills, as well as demonstrated results in identifying and refining process inefficiencies cross functionally. In addition to managing the Deal Desk ongoing, this role will own Sales analytics, reporting and dashboards more broadly, and help with us to refine and elevate our pipeline analytics, commission plan modeling and performance measurement, revenue forecasting, etc. Responsibilities:Build on existing processes and procedures to roll out a formalized, efficient deal desk structure, partnering closely with Finance, Legal and InfoSec, as well as other internal partners key to structuring complex deals.Provide quality, informed advice on pricing, and value of deals that ensures Sales has what they need to close large, complex, and often non-standard transactions.Maintain a holistic view of a deal during contract negotiations; driving internal stakeholder discussions and alignment on customer concerns or key business issues that arise during negotiations.Manage and prioritize company-wide pipeline of client-signed sales deals in final stages of contract executionMake specific recommendations to Sales for alternative contract options, and/or on value propositions to help drive deal closure.Develop analysis around trends in customer requests, pricing, and bookings trends.Measure and analyze the data of the complex deals, including win/loss ratio, discounts, deal erosion, etc. to identify trends and process improvements on a regular basis.Own internal pricing analytics and be a key stakeholder in ongoing pricing/packaging discussions.Assist in the development and implementation of pricing standards for large customers.Own competitive intelligence and analytics and direct insights back to wider sales org.Partner with finance team to review or address revenue recognition concerns for non-standard deal structures.Help train new sales reps relating to opportunity (deal) management and workflow.Partner with Sales to forecast deal status and communicate to management.Manage training and Standard Operating Procedure documentation that outlines the Deal Desk process and requirements.Requirements5+ years work experience (Sales Operations, Pricing or Deal Desk experience a plus)3+ years of SalesOps experience at a B2B software (SaaS) company, ideally with some experience with Enterprise clientsStrong understanding of Salesforce.comStrong analytical and advanced Excel skillsExperience with contracts and the contracting process strongly desiredAbility to work independently in a fast paced environmentDesire to build, and then run these processesExcellent oral/written communication skillsExcitement for pymetrics and our mission!BenefitsHealth, Dental, Vision coverageCommuter benefitsFun, diverse work cultureTeam happy hours and retreatsCompany athletic teamsFlexible vacationStock option plan

Name: SaaS Implementation Business Analyst (New York)

Does working for an award-winning organization sound enticing to you? If you are looking for a career move that will give you all of these things, then look no further as we have a fantastic opportunity to join e-Builder as a Business Analyst. About e-Builder: Founded in 1995 and based in Plantation, Florida, e-Builder, a Trimble Company, is the pioneer of a fully integrated, cloud-based construction management software. Our client list reads as the "who's, who" in all our vertical markets: Facebook, CalTech, INOVA Healthcare, and Chicago Transit Authority to name just a few - . As one of the fastest growing companies in South Florida, we are proud to be named a 'Florida Company to Watch,' to be nominated as one of South Florida's best places to work and have our CEO named South Florida Business Journal's Ultimate CEO. We're excited to find innovative ways to combine technology with construction with a fun work environment. To learn more about our award-winning organization and corporate culture visit www.e-builder.net  In this role you will be responsible for implementing e-Builder and guaranteeing product adoption for our clients by working closely with them throughout the entire implementation lifecycle. This includes but is not limited to: Analyze client business process/requirements and develop corresponding process and data flowsPerform gap analysis activities to identify and document any possible requirement gaps as well as provide creative solutions to ambiguous business problemsDevelop materials and deliver training required for each client assigned implementationConfigure based on requirements and business rules for new/existing implementationsAssist with UAT strategies, conditions and evaluation of expected resultsCreate and distribute meeting minutes, status reports, and required documentationAttributes/Skills Required:SaaS Software implementation experienceAbility to effectively present and communication information to customers, strategic business partners, and company managementPrior experience with writing and analyzing business and system requirement documents that convey complex business analysis and technology solutionsExperience with SaaS software testing strategies, conditions and evaluation of expected resultsHistory of recommending and implementing process improvementsGeneral understanding of financial reporting (Cash flows, G.L. Accounts, etc.)Proficient experience with MS Office Suite, Visio and web technologiesCollege degree preferred If you have the ability to travel around the country up to 75% of the time and can accomplish the above then you will make you an excellent match for this position and will have what it takes to be a successful Business Analyst here at e-Builder! We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug-Free Workplacewww.e-builder.net

Name: Senior Product Analyst, Growth
Description: MongoDB is one of the fastest growing technologies of all time, and MongoDB Atlas is our global cloud database service. Launched 2 years ago and available in over 50 regions across AWS, Azure, and GCP, Atlas is is the fastest growing part of the business and strategic to the company's future.  We are seeking a Senior Product Analyst for the Growth team. At the intersection of analytics, product management, and marketing, this role will analyze data to identify what behaviors our best customers exhibit, how we optimize the web and product experience, and what to build next in order to drive growth. ResponsibilitiesUncover user behaviors and opportunities to improve our web site and products through quantitative analysis e.g., comparing cohort behavior, running regressions and classificationsInform, design, and analyze the results of A/B tests and other experimentsCreate user personae based on activity breadth, volume, and relative frequencyConduct quantitative research that informs what our product team should build nextEmbed yourself with other teams in the company so you understand the relevant questions and needs of the business, and use that to inform your analysisUse data to get in the mind of the user and understand how we can make life as easy and frictionless as possible for themRequirements2-5 years experience in product analytics at a SaaS or e-commerce companyExperience with web and product analytics tools like Google Analytics, Amplitude, and SegmentDesire to proactively poke around the data and surface insights for the teamAbility to move quickly and iterate on analysesConfidence using SQL for fetching and manipulating dataComfort with ambiguity and the ability to work in a self-guided mannerExperience with a scripting language such as R, Python, or others is a plus but not requiredSuccess MeasuresWithin 1 month, get up to speed on a) the analytics tools and data we use b) the basic structure of our web site and productWithin 2 months, support 2 experiments and conduct 5 self-initiated ad hoc analyses that reveal something new about user behaviorWithin 3 months, define roadmap for further analyses and experimentation, with input from Growth, Product and Marketing teams

Name: Technology Business Management Analyst
Description: The Technology Business Analyst role is an exciting opportunity for an applicant with a strong foundation in financial analysis and reporting to move into an influential position where they will gain exposure to and work in, an operational and financial role serving the Hearst Corporation’s Technology Division. Reporting to the Director of Technology Business Management, this role is central to the division’s financial governance and provides a platform in which to partner with the technology department heads and the broader Hearst businesses. The Technology Business Analyst will support day-to-day business activities that complement and enhance the business strategy, goals and objectives of Hearst Technology. Duties will include:Configure and maintain the IT financial management platform (Apptio) to support the TBM office processes:IT service chargeback for Hearst business units and Hearst Technology senior management (monthly report)Internal service recovery for Hearst Technology senior management (quarterly report)Work closely with technology, finance, and business teams to identify and facilitate ongoing cost model maintenance and data quality improvementSupport administrative set-up and management of the Apptio platformPerform data loads and exportsDesign and maintain cost models and TBM reportsServe as a single point of contact and product owner for the Apptio platform:Utilize available insights for analysisDemonstrate knowledge of the underlying data, where it comes from, and the ability to reconcile and check data quality, including financial and consumption recordsInteract, respond and reconcile service charges with the broader Hearst businesses’ Technology and Finance LeadsPrepare monthly variance analyses of actual results for Hearst Technology senior management including budgeting, forecasting, and recommendations for remediation where neededWork with the Asset Management team to validate and reconcile differences in Hearst’s asset reporting platform and technology consumption dataCollect requirements around cost modeling and reporting with business and technology partners and execute changes in the Apptio platformDrive discussions with data owners and technology partners for data quality improvement and data load automationAdditional responsibilities include:Apply industry standards from the Technology Business Management Council around IT cost analysis, modeling, and reporting at HearstPerform ROI analysis and present business cases on technology projects and related Hearst ventures (including acquisitions and divestments) where technology is involvedWork closely with Department Heads to understand business needs and requirements and assist in the development of new services and pricing modelsSupport the preparation of Global Technology’s monthly performance metrics, and presentation materials for the Global Technology Leadership TeamDesired Skills and ExperienceMinimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Technology or other closely related business discipline.Proven experience administrating Apptio or similar IT Financial Management platform – Apptio certification is a plus but can be provided as part of the onboarding processKnowledge of overall business strategy and operations including business processes, cost components and drivers of these measures, cost modeling as well as an understanding of accounting principlesExperience and demonstrated success serving as an effective business partner in a client service oriented environment dealing with a wide range of business units and departmentsAbility to anticipate risks, make adjustments and inform appropriatelyExcellent listening and communication skills, ability to deliver clear well-organized presentations and written correspondenceExcellent personal time management to coordinate several projects simultaneouslyWorking knowledge of Cognos, Oracle ERP, CloudHealth, ServiceNow and Hyperion, a plusAbout HearstHearst is one of the nation’s largest diversified media, information and services companies with more than 360 businesses. Its major interests include ownership in cable television networks such as A&E, HISTORY, Lifetime and ESPN; majority ownership of global ratings agency Fitch Group; Hearst Health, a group of medical information and services businesses; 30 television stations such as WCVB-TV in Boston and KCRA-TV in Sacramento, Calif., which reach a combined 19 percent of U.S. viewers; newspapers such as the Houston Chronicle, San Francisco Chronicle and Albany Times Union; more than 300 magazines around the world including Cosmopolitan, ELLE, Harper’s BAZAAR and Car and Driver; digital services businesses such as iCrossing and KUBRA; and investments in emerging digital and video companies such as Complex, BuzzFeed, VICE and AwesomenessTV. Follow us on Twitter @HearstCorp and subscribe to Hearstlink.About Hearst TechnologyHearst Technology, Inc. is a shared services technology provider for Hearst, operating within the TBM (Technology Business Management) framework and principles. We work to develop platforms and solutions to power the next phase of Hearst’s digital growth, technology product development, and to solidify it as a leader in the industry. Hearst Technology continues to push the boundaries of how technology can propel the company forward. Lead by Hearst CTO Phil Wiser, the Hearst Technology team ideates daily on groundbreaking ways to expand the connection between Hearst’s 300-plus companies and the growing audiences and clients they serve. Hearst Technology’s team is leading the digital media industry with the following initiatives: Hearst Audience Platform - Building a holistic audience approach across all of Hearst's digital properties and audience of 220M monthly unique visitors; Enterprise Technology - Implementing high-performing, cloud-based IT solutions; Video - Getting to 1B annual video views; Native & Emerging Technology Team - Accelerating high-growth, multi-screen digital media offerings; Hearst Data Warehouse - Leveraging Hearst's Big Data brain; and Hearst Machine Learning – developing new product offerings in the area of Artificial Intelligence. Follow us on Twitter @HearstTech.

Name: Business Resource Optimisation Analyst
Description: JOB DESCRIPTION Job title: Business Resource Optimisation  Corporate Title: Analyst  Department: Operations  Global Operations Middle Office  Location: Angel Lane, London Company overview Nomura is a leading financial services  group and the preeminent Asian-based investment bank with worldwide reach.  Nomura provides a broad range of innovative solutions tailored to the specific  requirements of individual, institutional, corporate and government clients  through an international network in over 30 countries. Based in Tokyo and with  regional headquarters in Hong Kong, London, and New York, Nomura employs over  27,000 staff worldwide. Nomuras unique understanding of Asia enables the company  to make a difference for clients through three business divisions: retail,  asset management, and wholesale (global markets and investment banking). Department overview: The EMEA Business Resource Optimisation  team works closely alongside the Business Resource Management (BRM) trading  desk in reducing Nomuras various balance sheet resources, risk exposures &  capital requirements. The EMEA Business Resource Optimisation team provide the  BRM desk with an operational processing and control service, performing  numerous risk reducing exercises such as CCP backloading, novations and  compression. The successful candidate will work within a dynamic, fast paced  team working with multiple senior Front Office stakeholders globally on a daily  basis in order to meet the Business demanding objectives. Role description: n EMEA  Business Resource Optimisation Analyst  n Work  closely with the Business Resource Management (CVA & FVA) to process  Portfolio Optimisation exercises across Credit and Rates on an ad-hoc basis  including:  -  CCP Coupon Blending  -  CCP Portfolio Transfers  -  CCP backloading  -  TriOptima / Quantile / CapitaLab vendor led compressions  -  Bilateral/Internal compressions  -  ICE Clear Europe compression cycle  -  Internal novations  -  Book Optimisation  n Manage  multiple deadlines on a daily basis, and be able to react to the BRM desks  changing strategy and priorities intra-week in a controlled manner  n Lead  across teams with Internal stakeholders to implement new types of Portfolio  Optimisation, and continuously build out additional controls and efficiency  changes  n Co-ordinate  Portfolio Optimisation processes across multiple trading desks across the globe  n Ensure  Nomura are globally compliant with EMIR, Dodd-Frank & JSCC regulation for  trades impacted by Portfolio Optimisation processes  n Self-identify  Operational Risk and ensure these are escalated and documented internally,  tracking any mitigating actions through the internal frameworks to closure  n Provide  daily support for the BRM desk consisting of 14 traders, including trade  verification, daily PnL, adhoc query resolution  Skills, experience, qualifications and knowledge required n Strong  interpersonal skills, the role will require daily interaction with senior Front  Office stakeholders globally  n Must  be a team player  n Organised,  with a strong ability to prioritise multiple deadlines  n Aware  of core control concepts and how they apply to Operations on a daily basis  n Attention  to detail and a proven high level of accuracy  n Experience  in working with Rates derivatives, Credit preferable  n Proven  experience in pro-actively using initiative to improve processes and systems  n Informal  leadership skills including delegation Desirable: n Advanced  Microsoft Excel skills  n Experience  in performing Portfolio Optimisation processes  n Experience  in performing compression cycles  n Experience  in Risk & control management/oversight  n Understanding  of Basel III leverage ratio and Balance sheet risk measures Right to  Work The  UK Government have taken steps to reduce net migration to the UK by limiting  the number of overseas workers from outside the EEA coming to the UK for  employment. Please note that whilst we are able to consider applications from  overseas workers from outside the EEA (who require a Tier 2 (General) visa) we  can only employ them if we can provide  evidence that there are no other suitable candidates for this vacancy from  inside the EEA.  Please  contact us if you are visiting our offices and require any form of  personal assistance or physical adaptations to be provided for your  appointment. A member of staff will be happy to help.

Name: Senior Business Analyst, Process Improvement
Description: Play a pivotal role in the advancement and improvement of the University's Alumni Relations and Finance business processes. Work collaboratively with central and departmental administrative users to analyze business requirements and identify solutions that measurably serve to maximize resources (people, money, time) and improve the client experience. Maintain working functional knowledge of business needs and practices for the University's Alumni Relations and Finance business processes, serving as process consultant and change agent. Conduct complex analyses and lead cross-functional teams using appropriate process improvement methodologies that further organizational and strategic goals, identify and analyze current-state processes and issues, and recommend and implement measurable process improvements. Required Education: Bachelor's degree Preferred Education: Master's degree in business, operations management, or related field. Required Experience: 7+ years' relevant business process improvement experience in HR, Payroll and Financial Operations. Required Skills, Knowledge and Abilities: Proven knowledge and application of process excellence, lean six sigma methodology, business analysis, reengineering, and process modeling. Must be a hands-on resource who has demonstrated the ability to (1) apply lean six sigma methodology; (2) analyze and document processes using tools like process mapping, in-process metrics and other process measurement techniques; (3) use these results to recommend process improvements and operations metrics dashboard based on the sponsor's goals and objectives; (4) work with the project sponsor, champion and team members to identify and implement improvements; and (5) deliver results handling multiple priorities. Strong collaborative, change management, coaching and analytical skills. Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively handle multiple projects. Ability to develop effective business relationships and build consensus. Strong team player. Excellent writing and communication skills. Demonstrated competency with Microsoft Visio or other business process modeling and analytical tools. Preferred Skills, Knowledge and Abilities: Experience working in Higher Education or a complex global organization. Six Sigma Black Belt or Master Black Belt certification strongly recommended.  EOE/AA/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity
