Name: Sr. Deal Desk Analyst
Description: Job Title: Sr. Deal Desk Analyst Location: East Coast, US We are seeking a Commercial Expert to join our fast-growing, Global Deal Desk team. The Deal Desk Senior Analyst role is viewed as a trusted and recognized business partner to the Sales Field and Customer Success Organization. The Deal Desk Senior Analyst will support all commercial related activities including, but not limited to, deal structuring, contract creation, review and approval for offers, and providing support to the Sales Field on Anaplan's quoting tools. What you'll be doing:Provide expert guidance to the Sales field and Customer Success in the areas of deal structuring, pricing, and contract management.Ensure deals are structured and processed efficiently and align to company policiesReview, interpret and confirm contract terms and condition; work closely with finance and legal teams to ensure all contracts are accurate. Verify compliance with internal policies (and external regulations)Responsible for drafting, modifying and finalizing contracts including new and add-on business for Cloud Subscription Services.Deal with day-to-day queries from Sales, Sales Development and Account Management teams on Anaplan's quoting tools and/or CRM system.Support Sales enablement through new hire training initiatives and ad hoc training requests as needed.Resolves problems through research, consulting with internal support teams, to identify the appropriate tools for success.Review and Approve Deals for Anaplan Customers and Prospects.Anticipate issues and initiate actions to resolve them using professional judgment and concepts, company policies and procedures.Independently drive efficiency and process improvements. Support commercial projects on an as-needed basis. More about you:A "Customer First" perspective and ethosOutstanding business partnering skills able to interact positively with the Sales Field and influence business outcomes.Excellent understanding of most Deal Support/Commercial topics (pricing, deal structuring, contracting etc.); familiarity with basic revenue recognition policies a plusExcellent understanding of legal terms and conditionsThe ability to acquire knowledge of our products and the value they provide to Anaplan's Customers.The ability to acquire a thorough understanding of Anaplan's corporate goals and objectives and consider these goals/objectives within the design of Renewal offers.Ability to organize, prioritize, complete activities and meet deadlines on a daily basis.Requires strong oral and written communication skillsRequires a 4-year college degreeA minimum of 4 years professional experience with at least two years' experience in Deal Desk, Sales Operations or Finance within the High-Tech or Software IndustryProficiency in a second language would be highly valuable; French or German a plusRequires proficiency with computer applications, such as Windows, Excel, and Word and CRM systems SFDC experience a plus.Do you align with Anaplan's Values?Creative: We see every moment as a chance to learn Explore all of our Values on Anaplan.com/careers #AnaplanLOVE About Anaplan We're building a truly unique technology. From our calculation engine and in-memory data store, to apps and predictive analytics; amazing technology is being developed every day.  We're addressing a $100B/year problem that all global businesses face. Our mission is to break the traditional business planning mold, currently performed through spreadsheets or legacy systems. Anaplan's Connected Planning platform is enabling customers to improve decision-making by turning response time into real time.  With 1,000+ customers and 175+ partners globally, Anaplan's platform is solving some of the most complex challenges in business. CEOs, analysts, and the press agreeAnaplan is changing the way the world does business.  Learn about our history, see our recognitions and achievements, and take a look at what it's like to work at Anaplan.  Get to know more about working at Anaplan by checking out our social channels.  Facebook  Twitter  Instagram  YouTube CAN'T FIND THE PERFECT ROLE FOR YOU? NEW OPPORTUNITIES ARE OPENING UP DAILY:ANAPLAN.COM/CAREERS #LI-RB1

Name: GSAM, Americas Client Business – Corporate Pensions Team (Analyst)
Description: MORE ABOUT THIS JOBINVESTMENT MANAGEMENTWe’re a team of trusted advisors who provide innovative investment solutions to help our clients meet their financial goals. From private wealth to asset management, we work with specialists and groups from around the firm to help high-net-worth individuals and institutions across various industries navigate changing markets and make smart investments. We value self-starters with an entrepreneurial spirit, but still provide the support and resources to ensure your success.OUR IMPACTGoldman Sachs Asset Management (GSAM) is one of the world’s leading investment managers. With more than 2,000 professionals across 31 offices worldwide, GSAM provides institutional and individual investors with investment and advisory solutions, with strategies spanning asset classes, industries and geographies. Our investment teams represent over 700 investment professionals, capitalizing on the market insights, risk management expertise and technology of Goldman Sachs. We extend these global capabilities to the world’s leading pension plans, sovereign wealth funds, central banks, insurance companies, financial institutions, endowments, foundations, individuals and family offices, for whom we invest or advise on more than $1 trillion of assets.Americas Client Business (ACB) markets GSAM’s investment products and services to institutions, financial intermediaries and advisors. The focus is on building and maintaining long-term client relationships and communicating key themes from the firm’s leading investment professionals. Americas Client Business provides investment solutions across all major asset classes (e.g., fixed income, equities and alternatives) and products including mutual funds, ETFs, separate accounts and alternative investments.The Corporates Team works primarily with defined benefit and defined contribution pension plans for US corporations. The team is responsible for selling a broad spectrum of products across all asset classes, including fixed income, equities, hedge funds and private equity. In addition, the team collaborates with clients by providing thought leadership on relevant topics, including asset allocation and portfolio risk analysis. In addition to covering US Corporate pension plans, the team covers GSAM’s Institutional LatAm and Canadian client base. YOUR IMPACTWe are seeking a highly motivated team player for an analyst role within the Goldman Sachs Asset Management (GSAM) Americas Client Business which is part of our Investment Management Division (IMD). In this role, you will support the day-to-day needs of an Institutional sales team to win new business and retain existing assets. RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONSHOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIALResponsibilitiesWork closely with senior team members to manage, enhance and develop existing client relationshipsWork with senior team members to ensure all recurring and bespoke client requests are met on a timely basisAssist with the coordination of all client account maintenance items (e.g., account updates, guideline changes, client organizational changes, etc.)Work with Portfolio / Product Manager(s) to prepare and review materials for portfolio review meetingsIdentify and escalate any sensitive client issues to senior team members; coordinate a timely response to the clientCoordinate with key stakeholders across the Division, including Portfolio Managers, Operations, Compliance, Legal, Technology and Product Managers with a common goal of ensuring clients’ needs are metWork closely with senior team members to execute new business development efforts by coordinating prospect pitches, presentations and identifying new business opportunitiesBuild and manage an industry knowledge base by researching new business opportunities and staying current on industry publications and newspapers, client web sites, conference materials, consultant and other databases, etc.Respond to informational requests from various sources including clients, prospects and consultants. These requests include: requests for proposals (RFPs) and requests for information (RFIs), consultant requests and client inquiries and updatesWork with senior team members to develop and execute a strategic plan for each client, which outlines cross selling opportunities, a service plan and specific deliverablesSKILLS & EXPERIENCE WE’RE LOOKING FORBasic Qualifications1 -3 years of work experience at an asset management firm or other financial services organizationBasic knowledge of, and passion for, the asset management business and capital marketsHighly organized with exceptional attention to detail and excellent follow-through Positive attitude and strong work ethicStrong interpersonal skills: Ability to build trust and confidence of colleagues, strengthen relationships through ongoing dialogue and interactions and collaborate well with others internally to meet client needsStrong written and oral communication skillsAbility to work well in a fast-paced team environment, including with colleagues based in different regional officesStrong proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Powerpoint and Word)Series 7, 63 and 3 licensed or obtained within 3 months of joining Preferred Qualifications Undergraduate degree in business or finance related studies preferred ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHSThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2018. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.

Name: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence- NY -
Description: About AgencyPublicis Health Media (PHM) is the strategic media planning and buying agency within PHCG, and the only global media agency solely dedicated to the health and wellness space. Our mission is to define moments along the health journey, and equip people with the tools and communications they need to make healthy decisions.PHM’s core is made up of franchise and enterprise AOR relationships with some of the largest clients in the world. We also partner with PHCG and Groupe creative agencies to support large client brand assignments in health and wellness. By leveraging a centralized pool of health and wellness cross channel experts, we have the ability to drive business results for our clients worldwide.Our core capabilities include:Connections PlanningBusiness Intelligence and PerformanceCross-channel planning and buyingPaid and Organic SearchProgrammatic BuyingMobileRole SummaryThe Sr. Analyst of Business Intelligence (hereafter “BI”) will apply their experience in data analysis to support the BI Associate Director and/or BI Senior Leadership on any of our myriad of enterprise clients within the health and wellness industry. The Sr. Analyst must have the ability to utilize the many data sources at the disposal of the BI team to not only measure the media/marketing campaigns in the marketplace, but also translate those learnings into realistic business implications for our clients.While every engagement is unique, typical engagements require execution against the following tasks and deliverables:As we execute on the behalf of the client, manage and ensure the accuracy of the many internal data sources and (where applicable) third-party vendors/data streams that comprise our custom measurement platform while keeping workstreams on task within the established timelines and delivery datesSynthesize the data available into insights/recommendations about the success of our programs in transforming the behavior of our target audience (most likely healthcare professionals, patients/prospects, or a combination of the two)Work with the BI Associate Director and/or BI Senior Leadership to utilize the aforementioned insights/recommendations as the foundation for presentations, reports, and assorted client deliverablesMaintain professional relationships with internal (PHM) stakeholders by communicating effectively and delivering on all data needs for which BI is responsibleRole Requirements:Bachelor’s Degree (preferably a BS in a related field) is required2 to 3 years of work experience in data/analytics consulting and/or quantitative marketing/analysis (healthcare, pharmaceuticals and life sciences experience a plus)Understanding of how clients use all aspects of their multi-channel marketing mix in reaching their customersSuperior skills with the following core competencies: Time ManagementProblem SolvingQuantitative SkillsEffective CommunicationIntellectual CuriosityPower User of MS Excel; Proficiency in Word and PowerPoint is requiredExperience tagging websites and paid media a plusPublicis Health is the premier global health and wellness communications network. We are one of the four solutions hubs of Publicis Groupe, the third-largest advertising and media company in the world, giving us unparalleled global reach.We manage top-tier agencies specializing in promoting innovative solutions in advertising, medical education, clinical trial program development, sales and marketing, digital, market access, and medical and scientific affairs. Our nearly 6,500 employees work at 15 agency brands across 60 offices located in 10 countries.We are a connected solutions hub, equipped for continual business transformation in today’s world. We integrate services across our global offices and brands to deliver on our clients’ needs. Each of our agencies brings a unique approach to business, which makes us even stronger together. Name: Sr. Business Analyst - Strategy & Analytics
Description: 114 5th Ave (22114), United States of America, New York, New York  At Capital One, were building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.  Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.  Sr. Business Analyst - Strategy & Analytics  As a Senior Business Analyst at Capital One, you will apply your strategic and analytical skills to major company challenges. You will team with world-class professionals to develop and test strategies that ultimately impact the bottom line. And you will do it all in a collaborative environment that values your insight, encourages you to take on new responsibility, promotes continuous learning, and rewards innovation.  Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  - Analysis: Identify business challenges and opportunities for improvement and solve for them using analysis to make strategic or tactical recommendations  - Product: Perform modeling/analytics to assist new product and pricing strategies for various lending products  - Marketing: Support direct-to-consumer marketing efforts for select products, and strategic intent for products distributed through the retail channel. Help build targeted insights to inform the design and development of new customer experiences, as well as breakthrough technology and concepts designed to deliver on new go to market strategies  - Credit Risk: Support step-change improvements in credit performance by connecting drivers of future consumer credit trends to historical behavior, creating risk models, and testing hypotheses using rigorous monitoring and analysis  - Execution: Involve problem frame-works, develop hypotheses, test and analysis, solution development, scope operational feasibility, lead implementation efforts and develop a monitoring plan  - Partnership: Work closely with colleagues across Capital One including: IT, Sales, Operations, Finance and others to drive improvement in quality, volume, service, and profitability Basic Qualifications:- Bachelors Degree in any quantitative field (Business, Math, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Science, Engineering) 1 year of experience in analysisPreferred Qualifications:- Masters Degree in Business or quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Physical Sciences, Math, Statistics, Engineering CFA, SQL, SAS, FRM certifications1 year of experience in Statistical model building, market research, SQL querying  - 2 years of experience in business analysis in a corporate setting1 year of experience in consulting Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.

Name: FINANCIAL ANALYST - BUSINESS DINING
Description: We have an opening for a FINANCIAL ANALYST position.Location: New York City midtown Note: online applications accepted only. If you have a positive attitude and a love for learning, you may be interested in joining our team.  At FLIK, our operating philosophy is centered on three essential factors: great food, great service and great people. A FLIK Family-Then & Now. Great Food and Great Service are only possible with Great People behind the scenes. FLIK’s steadfast dedication to the training and support of our associates continues to nourish our vision and growth. Dedication, diligence, operational excellence and hands-on expertise are FLIK trademarks – only achievable through the work of our team of professionals. We embark on a relationship with every FLIK associate that provides, demonstrates and cherishes growth, education and ongoing mentoring – today and every day. Full time associates at FLIK are offered many fantastic benefits such as:MedicalDentalVisionFlexible Spending Accounts (FSAs)Commuter BenefitsWellness ProgramEmployee Assistance ProgramLife Insurance for Associates and Eligible DependentsShort Term Disability (STD) and Long Term Disability (LTD)Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) InsuranceDiscount MarketplaceAnd other voluntary benefits Job Summary  The Financial Analyst will be responsible for assessing the financial performance of the account, assists with all the accounting and control functions at the account including all revenue and expense reporting, accounts payable, accounts receivable and monthly financial reporting requirements. Key Responsibilities:Leads the financial planning & analysis function at the account, including the development of annual budgets linked to operational assumptions, rolling forecasts, and the supporting processes required to measure actual performance vs budgets and forecasts on a monthly basis.Improves financial performance by analyzing results, monitoring variances, and identifying trends; providing performance guidelines and recommendations to management as appropriate.Monitors operational metrics such as guest counts, average check, and product mix, developing client-facing analytical summaries and extracting insights to drive financial performance.Provides strategic financial support to the operations ensuring that all opportunities for revenue generation and cost containment are identified and fully exploited.Develops business cases to evaluate innovation and new product opportunities, including cashflow and ROI models when capital investments are required.Creates client-facing presentations summarizing financial performance, operational metrics, and financial forecasts.Ensures the accuracy of monthly financial statements by reconciling transactions and comparing and correcting data.Determines cost of operations by establishing standard costs; collecting operational data.Guides cost analysis process by establishing and enforcing policies and procedures; providing trends and forecasts; explaining processes and techniques; recommending actions.Recommends actions by analyzing and interpreting data and making comparative analyses; studying proposed changes in methods and materials.Develop forecasts and budgets; compiling and analyzing budgets and forecast, monitoring variances and identifying trends.Review of general ledger and balance sheet; resolving accounting/reconciliation issues; maintaining inventory and cost control procedures, and creation and design of reports and spreadsheets.Preferred Qualifications:Proactive, results oriented individual that can add value to the operation while maintaining and managing business processes to ensure efficient accounting and internal control.BA/BS in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration.3-5 years business experience in similar positionAbility to prepare monthly financial statements, key metric reports, budgets, forecasts, cash flow projections and analysesProficient in Microsoft Office applications, including buildin efficient Excel models to improve productivity & Powerpoint to create client-facing presentations on financial performance.Adept at planning, organizing and controlling complex processes as well as analyzing moderately complex financial informationPowerful communication and presentation skillsAbility to manage multiple task & priorities, have strong organizational skills, and produce consistently accurate work.Team Player and motivator, detail oriented, forward thinking, creative, ability to work under strict deadlines and maintain a consistently stable work environment.Conformity to the highest standards of personal integrity and ethical behavior  About Compass Group: Achieving leadership in the foodservice industry    Compass Group is an equal opportunity employer. At Compass, we are committed to treating all Applicants and Associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law.     Qualified candidates must be able to perform the essential functions of this position satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. Disclaimer: this job post is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all essential responsibilities, skills, tasks, or requirements associated with this position. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position posted, the Company reserves the right to modify or change the essential functions of the job based on business necessity. *Los Angeles applicants: Compass Group will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring (Ban the Box ordinance).    Req ID: 186491  SALARIED EXEMPT

Name: Finance Business Analyst II - JF
Description: POSITION SUMMARY The Finance Business Analyst II will support initiatives, projects, and day to day operational issues within the Finance department. The analyst will work with internal business and systems teams to analyze business processes, define product requirements and project plans, and create and execute UAT and implementation plans. The Finance Business Analyst II will serve as an escalation point within the Business Analysis team and will assist with the coaching and development of Business Analysis team members. As part of their role the Finance Business Analyst II will work closely with their peers in Finance and Systems to prioritize projects and initiatives and ensure alignment with overall LOB goals. The Finance Business Analyst II position requires an individual to operate independently and as part of a larger team. The Finance Business Analyst II will be responsible for overseeing multiple projects/initiatives while simultaneously serving as the lead on larger projects. The Finance Business Analyst II must be proficient at multi-tasking and prioritizing. Project ManagementRepresent Finance on departmental and firm-wide projectsDevelop and maintain business cases, business requirements documents, use cases, issue logs, project status documents, scope change documents, test plans, test cases, etc.Oversee and maintain project plans, budgets, implementations, etc.Collaborate, consult and negotiate with business and systems counterpartsAbility to foresee changing business needsMake decisions with consideration to cost and scheduleBalance resolution of daily operating/processing issues with ongoing management and oversight of longer term strategic projectsSupport daily ad-hoc inquiries and technical issues that arise within FinanceData AnalysisEvaluate impact of changing business needs on operational workflows and current product offeringsProactively identify gaps in current products or solutions and recommend or create new solutions to fill gapsInitiate discussions with end users to identify requirements related to product enhancementsRun daily, monthly, etc. reports and processes in support of the Finance department. Review reporting and analysis for accuracyManagementCommunicate professionally and constructivelyKeep up to date on firm wide system developments and new technologiesDevelop and maintain project metrics and budgets for reporting to the Finance Management teamReview project plans, business requirements, and implementation plans for directly owned projects and projects being managed by others in the Business Analysis teamParticipate in project oversight committeesMentor and direct project members who may or may not be direct reportsAssist with BA resource allocation across projects/initiativesQualificationsBS/BA degree or equivalent job experience5-8 yrs industry or project management experienceStrong organizational skills and ability to communicate effectivelyHighly motivated with ability to self manage and work independentlyWillingness to work flexible and/or extended hours while working on projects with tight deadlines or during implementations Creative and effective problem solving and analytical skills We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other protected status under federal, state or local law.Full timeNew York

Name: Financial Services Data Analyst
Description: EARNEST RESEARCHEarnest Research is a VC-backed data innovation startup driven to change the way professionals understand consumer and business behavior. Working with world-class data partners, we transform raw data into a source for business and investment professionals to ask better questions so they can make better decisions. We believe, in the right hands, data has the power to change the way we work.FINANCIAL SERVICES DATA ANALYSTThe Data Analyst team at Earnest is passionate about finding signals in the noise of large datasets, and has a strong interest in technology, consumer trends, and the private and public markets. Quantifying both macro and micro trends in the consumer economy is our primary focus. As a part of the group, you will be immersed in a fast-paced environment, with infinite opportunity to learn and grow. The ideal candidate will be a highly motivated problem solver capable of applying big picture thinking without losing sight of the details. RESPONSIBILITIESCreating content from billions of rows of electronic recordsCreating and maintaining insight products on private and publicly traded companiesCollaborating with product and engineering teams for collection of the *right* dataIdentifying and investigating trends within the consumer economyInterfacing directly with clients to present analyses, explain our product offerings and serve as a subject-matter expertSeeking out areas for operational improvement and taking initiative to address themQUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree in Finance, Economics or a related discipline from a top tier university1 to 3 years of finance experience, including (but not limited to) investment banking, equity research, private equity, consulting and/or quantitative marketingExceptional Excel and analytical skillsProactive and solutions-oriented; innovative and results-drivenMeticulous attention to detail and the ability to complete tasks with minimal oversightAbility to handle confidential/sensitive information and exercise exceptional judgmentExcellent communication skills (verbal and written)Must be able to handle multiple tasks daily and meet project deadlinesExtremely hard worker, ethical, and thoughtful team playerFamiliarity with Tableau software is a plus, but not requiredBenefits & Perks:100% company paid medical plan options (additional medical, dental and vision plans available too!)Health & fitness reimbursement program401K retirement plans with employer matchingFlexible and generous time offPre-tax savings plans for public transportation and parking expensesFully stocked kitchen and cold brew on tapRegular company happy hours, lunches & eventsEarnest Research is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.

Name: Senior Tech Services Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe Senior Technical Services Analyst is responsible for supporting servers, telecom, and UPS/environmental systems for the Merchant based offices in NY, LA, and Boston. This requires strong partnership with remote functional IT teams as well as thorough review of proposed changes, effective risk analysis, scheduling, coordinating resources, following validation processes, and communicating any afterhours activities as it pertains to these systems. This role will also require the initiation of production work while adhering to all established change control processes. In terms of daily support, the Senior Technical Services Analyst acts as an escalation for all telecom issues and coordinates with vendors to ensure adequate capacity and proper functioning of the system. This position is also responsible for coordinating with onshore and offshore support teams, architectural, and engineering teams to resolve issues impacting servers and the business facing services they provide. The Senior Technical Services Analyst is also expected to partner on complex projects and assignments which will require strong analytical capability, planning, procurement, service integration, and the ability to follow standard SDLC practices. Review, coordinate, schedule, communicate, and validate production change for servers, telecom, and environmental systems in all Merchant based offices • Follow production control processes and enter change orders to initiate any production impacting activityProvide telecom and server support through partnership with onshore/offshore support teams, engineering/architectural groups, and vendorsEnsure that all projects adhere to the project timeline, budget, and SDLC practices.• Set and effectively communicate project expectations to team members and stakeholders.Provide regular system metrics, document issues and process improvement areas, and drive resolutions to complex problems.Lead project meetings with the project team including outside vendorsProcure equipment and services per the bill of materialsEnsure that the environment is built per the build standards and compliance requirements Other Functions:Review detection and escalation activity and recommend improvement opportunities to management. Create standard practice for handling and resolving new events in the enterprise IT environment.Plan real time configuration and monitoring of components of an enterprise IT environment on a day-to-day basis.Resolve unique issues and define uniform approach for handling new IT service related issues and customer support requests.Resolve unique incidents and identify root causes of problems. Review incident and root cause reports.COMPETENCIES:ComposureLearn on the FlyWritten CommunicationsCustomer FocusVerbal CommunicationsApproachabilityListeningIntegrity and TrustQUALIFICATIONS AND SPECIAL SKILLS REQUIRED:Associates or Undergraduate degree in information systems or a related technical discipline preferredAt least 5 years of experience partnering with IT infrastructure support and project teamsExperience leading teams of internal and external peopleStrong analytical ability, business acumen, judgment and problem solving skillsStrong communication skills, both written and verbalStrong interpersonal skills with the ability to lead project teamsAbility to work with teams that are geographically distributedPeriodic travel (up to 15%) will be required

Name: IT Business Lead Analyst, VP
Description: Perform requirements Management for Cash Management applications with specific focus on large scale global cash management systems. Prepare detailed program specifications and Visio diagrams, and submit recommendations for solutions applying domain experience in Cash Management and Transaction Banking including SWIFT, ISO 20022. Enhance functionality and performance of system by creating patches, fixes, and replacements. Review business implications of the technology to the current cash management environment, identify and communicate risks, impacts. Collaborate with other transaction processing systems – Flex cube, RCX, DBII, reporting systems - Global Information Warehouse to improve user experience. Lead system change process from requirements through implementation. Devise User Experience Strategy, run User Experience surveys, design thinking sessions and formulate wireframes and visual designs of next generation product. Perform business analysis for integration of IT applications to achieve business objectives. Qualifications Requirements: Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Banking or closely related field and 8 years of progressive, post-baccalaureate experience as a Technical Specialist, Senior Business Analyst or related position involving domain experience in Cash Management and Transaction Banking including Payments, Direct Debits, Receivables. 7 years of experience must include: Cash Management applications; Identifying, analyzing and creating functional system specification; Requirement applications BluePrint, JIRA, Doors, HP Quality Center, Visual Modelling, Snagit; and Leading User Experience. At least 6 years of experience must include Core banking transaction processing systems including Temenos–T24 and Finacle. Qualified applicants submit resumes referencing job code EJ/ITBLA/SD to Citigroup Recruiting Dept., 3800 Citigroup Center Drive, Tampa, FL 33610. Citigroup is an EOE Employer. This position is eligible for incentives pursuant to Citigroup’s Employee Referral Program. Direct applicants only.

Name: Senior Medical Economics Analyst
Description: DescriptionThe Senior Medical Economics Analyst will support the Medical Economics team within the Finance department. The analyst will research and investigate business issues related to cost, utilization and revenue data for multiple Healthfirst products. Analyses and recommendations from the Senior Medical Economics Analyst will support business strategy and drive decision making across the organization. Identify/monitor cost and utilization trends and the root causes in health plan trend performance and provide recommendations for solutions.Provide data driven analysis to Finance, Claims, Medical Management, Network and other departments to enable critical decision making.Create financial models to evaluate the impact of provider reimbursement changes.Develop savings analyses for Medical Economics cost trend reduction initiatives, applying financial modeling expertise and using independent judgement to determine best valuation methods.Perform complex Return on Investment analyses for vendors to determine if their financial and clinical performance is achieving desired results.Develop dashboards to track Medical Economics initiatives and ensure their complete and successful implementation.Build quarterly membership forecast for use in financial projections and budgeting.Keep abreast of New York Medicaid and Medicare reforms and their impact on Healthfirst and their owner hospital performance.Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution.Analytical work experience within the healthcare industry (i.e. hospitals, network, ancillary, medical facilities, healthcare vendor, commercial health insurance company, large physician practices, managed care organization, etc.)Work experience with SAS and/or SQL where you have created queries, pulled large data sets and performed data manipulations/analysis.Experience with MS Excel functions that include working with large data sets, creating standardized reports, utilizing vLookups and advanced functions/ formulas; creating, using and interpreting pivot tables, filtering and formatting.Knowledge of healthcare financial terms such as cost, utilization, Per Member Per Month (PMPM) and revenue.Basic understanding of Medicaid and Medicare programs or other healthcare plans.Self-motivated, creative problem solver who can work independently and collaborate through strong communication and interpersonal skills.Preferred Qualifications:Strong project management experience and ability to handle multiple projects in a fast paced environment.Demonstrated understanding of key managed care concepts and provider reimbursement principles such as risk adjustment, capitation, FFS (Fee-for-Service), Diagnosis Related Groups (DRG’s), Ambulatory Patient Groups (APG’s), Ambulatory Payment Classifications (APC’s), and other payment mechanisms.Understanding of value based risk arrangements.Experience using Tableau.WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. Name: Client Business Support Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob Description  We are looking for a few strong Client Business Support Analysts with fashion apparel, footwear and accessories (AFA) industry experience, excellent communication, technology and problem-solving skills, a proven track record of delivering superior customer service and training to clients, and deep working knowledge of Microsoft applications (especially Excel) and the Internet. The position requires a highly organized, detail-oriented, innovative, and energetic person with a strong desire to work in a dynamic, entrepreneurial company. We are seeking a Software Support Analyst that has experience delivering highly professional technical support services and can continue to market and sell the benefits of 7thonline's technology & services to new and existing clients. Client relationship experience in the fashion AFA industry is desired. Some travel may be required.  Candidates with experience in direct client interaction and business problem solving, technical support, software implementation, sales engineering, and software training should apply.  Candidates should reside in the New York / New Jersey area.  Primary Responsibilities Serve as the primary interface with clients for daily relationship management and implementationAnalyze and document client requests for program changes and track requests through implementation at clientCreate documentation and maintain client specific business processes as they relate to 7thonlineAdminister and maintain the Customer Support Tracking SystemDeliver high-quality and timely responses to customer inquiriesOrganize and analyze data and information using Word, Excel or other tools as necessaryPlan and conduct training sessions for new and existing usersWrite and maintain documentation for user training sessionsConduct and record client meetingsConduct functional Quality Assurance testing to ensure client's needs are met through new developmentProvide market support at client locationsAssist in providing client phone support, including troubleshooting of 7thonline's programsProvide afterhours support and testing, when necessary, during production software releasesSupport sales department as needed, including building and maintaining demos Job Qualifications Ability to assess, document, and implement processes and proceduresMust be a self-starter with the ability to multi-task, manage workload, take accountability and deliver results to meet competing priorities in a fast-paced environmentMust possess a service-oriented attitude, and be able to communicate and coordinate well with team members and customersExcellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong research and follow-through skillsB.S. degree in Information Systems preferred or equivalent education and experienceOne to three years experience in a technical/software support capacityExperience in the Retail AFA industry is desired Company Information  7thonline provides comprehensive inventory and assortment planning solutions specifically targeted to the global apparel, footwear, and accessories community. 7thonline's solution suite encompasses visual and quantitative merchandising and assortment planning tools, powerful analytical and optimization engines, open-to-buy and mark-down management tools, and integrated business intelligence capabilities. 7thonline's collaborative capabilities enable real-time sharing of key business information, both internally between colleagues and externally with trading partners, resulting in better-matched supply and demand and higher profitability. 7thonline industry leading customers include Nautica, Eileen Fisher, Patagonia, Oakley, Tommy Hilfiger, VF, Jimmy Jazz, Calvin Klein, Bestseller, and others. 7thonline is a growing technology company that provides a highly entrepreneurial working environment where collaboration, creativity, commitment and teamwork are rewarded.  Website: www.7thonline.com  Company DescriptionSince our inception in 1999, 7thonline has specialized in demand-driven merchandise and assortment planning technology solutions for the apparel, footwear and accessories industries.  Our technology solutions enable soft goods and fashion companies to drive continuous margin growth through effective inventory optimization based on localized demand. We collaborate closely with leading industry players to provide our customers with a set of flexible solutions specially designed to address planning challenges unique to this industry. Our customers are able to gain complete inventory visibility, granular-level planning capabilities, and take advantage of our domain-specific forecasting and embedded BI reporting. Many customers choose us over other providers because of our industry specialization.  Our solution offerings span across all key channels: retail, wholesale and eCommerce. This makes us uniquely positioned to help progressive brands and retailers to meet todays omni-channel challenge, enabling them to make integrated merchandising decisions. Management can drive extra margin and lower inventory risks based on SKU-level demand insights by door. This complete visibility into global demand and the ability to manage down to the details provide an important competitive advantage to today's retailers.  Our team of ex-retailers continues to translate industry best-practices gained through years of customer collaboration into innovative features and functions for a growing list of global customers. Calvin Klein, Michael Kors, Nautica, Oakley, Under Armour, Jimmy Jazz and GRI (Hong Kong) are all able to drive tangible results including higher inventory turns, decreased markdowns, increased fill rate, and greater margins.

Name: Research Analyst
Description: Are you curious about the truth behind why people behave the way that they do? Does wondering about the cultural impact of trends (like reality TV or the local food movement) keep you up at night? Or, do you ever wish you could poll your peers to see if your opinion is mutually shared?  If so, Insight might be the right place for you. ABOUT THE COMPANY Insight Strategy Group (www.insightstrategygroup.com) is a research-driven strategy firm that inspires its clients to build innovative and impactful experiences for consumers. We work with leading brands in exciting industries, melding quantitative muscle with qualitative finesse to meet clients' strategic objectives growing brands, innovating products, and designing compelling consumer experiences. Our approach gets to the deeper truth of what drives people and their relationships to brands in order to open up inspiring possibilities for our clients' growth. POSITION OVERVIEW Insight seeks individuals who demonstrate the potential to become highly skilled researchers and strategists, with particular propensity for decoding people's underlying psychological and social motives in arriving at the truth. The responsibilities of the Analyst are to:  Be an idea contributor and an active voice in team brainstorming  Help translate brand, marketing, and business objectives into qualitative and quantitative research plans  Develop research instruments and thoughtful, clever approaches to data analysis  Conduct qualitative and quantitative research; experience in quantitative research (e.g., survey design and analysis) highly preferred  Gain a robust, textured understanding of who consumers are and how they connect to our clients' businesses through a variety of research methods  Analyze and synthesize research findings into key insights and implications for client's business  Be a nimble thinker who can balance both big picture and tactical ideas  Write reports that communicate key insights and strategic recommendations in a clear, creative, and compelling manner JOB REQUIREMENTSThe ideal candidate should: Have a graduate degree in the social sciences (e.g., psychology, anthropology) or marketing  Have 2-3 years of experience in market research, or in a brand/marketing consulting role that involves hands-on primary research; experience in quantitative research (e.g., survey design and analysis) highly preferred  Have experience in one or more of the following industries: retail, consumer goods, food and beverage, travel and hospitality  Be curious about people, what drives them, and why they do what they do  Be a creative thinker and a proactive problem solver  Have strong written and oral communication skills  Have the desire and willingness to work as part of a team  Be adept at working in a fast-paced environment and managing multiple priorities  Be enthusiastic and high energy  Salary commensurate with experience. HOW TO APPLY Please send your resume and cover letter to careers@insightstrategygroup.com  Thanks, and we look forward to hearing from you!Job Posted by ApplicantPro

Name: Global Spread Products Business Analytics Analyst
Description: Primary Location: United States,New York,New YorkEducation: Bachelor's DegreeJob Function: Institutional BankingSchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: Yes, 10 % of the TimeJob ID: 18069346 DescriptionAbout Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.  Citis Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients and the publics trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.  Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all. Role Global Spread Products is seeking an experienced Business Analytics professional. Reporting through the COO line, this person will work closely with the front office and technology on multiple fronts to help execute strategic goals. This team sits at the intersection of sales, trading, structuring, capital markets origination and technology and is responsible for implementing process improvements and realizing senior management's vision. Our team oversees a wide array of front office systems including pricing and risk, trade capture, inventory management, origination, securitization, sales dashboards, management reporting, electronic trading and database management. Background Global Spread Products is the primary source of capital for corporations, governments, and non-profits, providing liquidity and innovative solutions globally across the credit, municipal, and securitized markets. Name: HRIS Business Analyst
Description: The HCM Software Engineer is responsible for the strategy and implementation of the Human Capital Management (HCM) cloud platform. This role works across HR Technology, HR Service Delivery, and the entire HR community to ensure the correct solution is in place to support JPMCs 250,000 employees across the globe. This role is responsible for providing the leadership and expertise to drive solutions that meet HR business needs. The ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate proven leadership in enterprise application architecture, information architecture, functional knowledge, client engagement, and the application of emerging technologies. The candidate will support the transition for our Global Human Resources organization by ensuring we take advantage of the capabilities gained with the HCM platform and will partner closely with Global Business Process Owners, Process Leads, Regional Leads, and our implementation partner to configure the application for go-live. This includes new functionality, quarterly product releases, ongoing system configuration, and interface requirements. An understanding of the importance of end-to-end software development-such as Agile frameworks-is key. And best of all, youll be working with and sharing ideas, information and innovation with our global team of technologists from all over the world.The ideal candidate will possess strong operations, technology, and execution skills along with exceptional leadership, client and relationship management skills. The candidate must have proven successes in balancing long term visionary planning capabilities with the ability to create, practical, actionable plans that are coherent and understood by all stakeholders. Beyond excellent operations and technology skills, the ideal candidate will be an innovative, commercially inclined leader to create genuine business value through the alignment of technology, data and business interests.Key ResponsibilitiesPartner with Business Architects and Process Owners to ensure policy and processes are supported and sustainable in the HCM platform.Accountable for the system configuration, performance, and testing for one or more modules.Provide data conversion specifications and interface requirements to technical teams.Manage product enhancement requests with Oracle and partner with Oracle product leads on functional roadmapsEnsure the business is prepared for quarterly releases and new functionality driven by OracleDevelop automated testing for product and lead business partners through testing new functionalityOversee key 3rd party relationships that provide either direct employee service or tools/infrastructure used by internal service groups Work with delivery teams to offer additional solutions via mobile Work with various HR & JPMC functional groups to analyze business needs to provide appropriate, innovative, and cost effective solutionsEvaluate technologies for inclusion in forward-looking technology strategies Assist development teams with design and product architecture Analyze technology issues and propose short, mid and long-term solutions Work with other senior technology leaders to propose technical solutions and help craft architecture & technology roadmap 5+ years of experience in software development and design or large-scale, complex global operations Experience implementing payroll and/or timekeeping systems such as ADP or KronosOperational experience in payroll or timekeeping a plusStrong experience managing vendor platforms including system configuration, functional roadmaps, and testingData analysis skills and the ability to extract, analyze, and transform dataFunctional expertise and the ability to tie business requirements to system functionalityUnderstanding of the relationship between data, business requirements, and system functionalityExperience with test script creation, execution, and automation Experience deploying capabilities for large service-driven organizationsBackground in client relationships, especially in managing senior stakeholders and leading cross-functional teamsKnowledge of SDLC, Agile, and software engineering processes and toolsStrong communication skills along with a team-oriented attitude Bachelors Degree or equivalentExperience in working with both onshore and offshore teamsLeadership SkillsStrong strategic thought leadership skillsExcellent technical problem solving and technical writing skillsAble to establish new technical Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: PURPOSETo understand the needs of American Stock Transfers Print and Mail operations and technology stakeholders and to define the system and/or process changes required to deliver solutions that address those needs.RESPONSIBILITIES1. Business Analysis Planning and Monitoring§ Assess the size, complexity, constraints and dependencies of the project and plan the appropriate business analysis approach.§ Conduct stakeholder analysis to identify all stakeholders, determine their influence and relationship needs and build and manage stakeholder relationships.§ Plan and manage the requirements approval process and changes to requirements scope and/or solution.§ Identify and communicate risks and issues that may impact plans and/or scope.§ Manage the business analysis performance by upholding American Stock Transfers methodologies, BA best practices, SDLC (if applicable), and compliance requirements.§ Adapt the approach to respond to changing organizational priorities where required.2. Requirements Elicitation§ Effectively obtain information from the stakeholders to form requirements.§ Accurately capture the information provided in elicitation sessions in a format that stakeholders can understand, review and validate.§ Validate the captured requirements to match the intention of the stakeholders needs.§ Remotely liaise with stakeholders who are off site using tools such as teleconferencing and email.3. Requirements Management and Communication§ Obtain the required approvals on requirements and functional specifications.§ Identify and manage changes to requirements including impact assessment.§ Manage conflicts and issues to resolution.§ Manage requirements traceability from business case to implemented solution.§ Maintain requirements for reuse.§ Prepare requirements package(s) to present requirements in an understandable format.§ Communicate the requirements effectively with stakeholders to ensure common understanding.4. Requirements Analysis§ Understand the business needs from a big picture perspective and suggest prioritization in order to align with this perspective.§ Capture and enhance thinking from SMEs and stakeholders possible solution approaches.§ Identify and communicate constraints and assumptions that may impact the identified solution.§ Define the solution scope in terms of the new capabilities the project, iteration or work effort.§ Ensure that all requirements support the delivery of business value, fulfill the goals and objectives and meet stakeholder needs.5. Solution Assessment and Validation§ Facilitate reviews of solution proposals to capture best thinking as to which proposal will be most effective.§ Measure and evaluate solutions for value and opportunities based on input from SMEs and stakeholders.§ Allocate stakeholder and solution requirements to solution components to maximize business value and minimize costs.§ Define capabilities and requirements to support transition to new solutions.§ Determine the most appropriate response to identified defects.6. Solution Delivery§ Using a comprehensive perspective on gathered requirements, participate in solution design sessions with architects, process engineers or other SMEs and act as a go to person for clarification of requirements§ Produce functional specification documents outlining the system and/or process changes required to deliver the solution.§ Support the testing phases by working with the stakeholders to develop the UAT scope and plan.§ Support the implementation of the technology or business process solution(s), including the production of release notes (in the case of a technology deliverable) and/or verified changes to the business operational processes.REQUIRED SKILLS§ Excellent written and verbal communication skills§ A high level of logical thinking and problem solving skills§ Keen attention to detail§ Self-motivation and work ethic§ Ability to work independently§ Excellent time management/organizational skills§ Strong collaboration and personal interaction skills, particularly with respect to influencing and negotiating; quick to develop and maintain productive working relationships§ Experience with Microsoft Office suite including Visio and PowerPoint; preparation of process flow (e.g. swim lane) diagrams, use of Jira or similar tool(s) to track requirements§ Ability to develop good working relationships§ Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a fast-paced environmentESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE§ Experience working in a team-oriented and collaborative environment§ Experience with software development methodologies/life cycles and associated processes§ Demonstrated experience liaising with stakeholders to elicit requirements, propose solutions and translate these into functional specifications§ Prior experience performing a leading BA role on large and complex software development (or business process reengineering) projects as aligned to the primary function for the project.§ Understanding of system design concepts and SaaS software applications.QUALIFICATIONS§ College or university degree in an appropriate discipline. Equivalent experience in lieu of degree will be considered§ 7 to 10 years experience in a similar role§ Financial services industry experience§ Certification as a Business Analyst IIBA practitioner is desirable but not mandatoryJob Type: ContractExperience:Business Analyst: 3 years (Preferred)

Name: Business Analyst, Content Financials
Description: THE DIVISON’S STORYNamed in honor of our leader’s favorite car, GTO comprises a wide range of operations, production and technology roles. We are responsible for the whole value chain of content. This is where we produce, broadcast and distribute content, manage media assets and run the tech infrastructure for the whole company. We live on the forefront of technology, nurturing new solutions in tech incubators before improving the user experience of our customers, consumers and colleagues. Interested in Big Data? AR? VR? Or another emerging technology. If your idea helps grow our business, we are eager to work with you to test and learn. Join us as we set the standard for our industry.THE ROLE: Business Analyst, Content FinancialsWe want all members of the team to show up every day with a passion for their job and care that it gets done well. We will want you to partner with the business and fellow technologists to make sure we are delivering best-of-class solutions that can make a real impact on their day-to-day jobs. You should be able to work autonomously to manage your team and projects, while delivering on time and on budget. You will learn. You will not be alone. You’ll have an opportunity to build transformational technology solutions & supporting core areas of business. Also, you’ll be able to seek out new technologies and implement them where they make sense. In addition, you’ll be able to build & manage a strong team of Business Analysts that understand our business and are eager to push the envelope wherever possible. Finally, you’ll be exposed to various A+E departments and stakeholders to learn the goals, needs and direction so you can become a trusted partner.YOUR STORY: [+BEHAVIORS] (what you need to have)Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university, and relevant job experience7+ years technology team experience as a Business Analyst, working with vendor and custom applications/solutions, as well as experience with implementations of large scale projects5+ years of experience in Accounting or Finance solutions3+ years writing business requirements/functional specification documentationAbility to understand and analyze existing business processes and systems functionalityExcellent client-facing communication skillsExcellent planning and preparation skillsProblem solving skillsAbility to effectively manage project scope, risk and execution for technology projectsCuriosity – constantly be looking for new technologies or solutions on the marketplace that innovate how we do things and provide new value to our businessDesire to make things better and get it done, whatever it may takeAbility to independently manage projects and people, as well as the ability to influence and manage relationships where no direct line of report existsPreferable skills and experience:Experience in the Cable and Internet-Provider Television industryExperience with SAP ECC (GL, AP, AR, FA, Treasury) and BPCExperience with Accounting requirements at the Content Level (ie. Movie, Series, Episode)Supporting Interfacing and integration between applicationsExperience with Revenue/Expense Yearly Budgeting and Quarterly ReforecastsTHAT SOMETHING EXTRA: If you’ve read this far, you’re likely a great fit for us…and maybe you’re fluent in sign language, have studied the circus arts or are currently writing a screenplay. Name: Sr. Digital Business Analyst
Description: Job TitleSr. Digital Business AnalystJob DescriptionI. Job Summary | Major goals and objectives.  The business intelligence team seeks an analyst to specialize on our owned and operated digital brands. The business intelligence analyst role is a multi-talented and driven analytics lead that is passionate about media and data. The role requires fluency in the language of both business and technology (SQL, D3, data visualization etc).  The position will play an instrumental role in analyzing, exposing, and connecting the dots with data; namely, surfacing insights from our internal data of owned and operated digital properties that drive impact to our business and improves consumer experiences. Working closely with digital business leads at Meredith, the business intelligence analyst will work directly with product, editorial, growth and general management leads for a group of Meredith brands.  She/he will be the primary reporting specialist and a key contributor in providing data and actionable insights that ensures digital success. It’s important that this candidate have the technical ability to mine and retrieve data and implement technical solutions while having the business acumen and social skills to communicate with executives in the company. II. Essential Job FunctionsWeight % Accountabilities, Actions and Expected Measurable Results25% Work within the BI + analytics team, while in continuous communication with GMs, product, editorial and growth leads to help synthesize questions, understand our customer data, and query for answers in way that addresses business needs and is easily understood. 25% Deliver analyses such as: customer feature/retention correlation, content performance analysis, website analytics, customer segmentation, lifetime value analysis, and cross channel analysis. 25% Become an expert in the Meredith digital audience and their behavior across our properties. 25% Proactively identify insights that help stakeholders achieve their objectives and improve products and services. 100%III. Minimum Qualifications and Job Requirements | All must be met to be considered.  Education:  Degree in a quantitative field, such as computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, data science or other sciences, such as psychology or physics or equivalent experience.  Experience: 2-3 years of experience working as an analyst, statistical analyst, report writer or other technical capacity understanding, documenting, interpreting and communicating business data.Proven ability to understand business needs and translate those needs to technical requirements and technical solutions.Proven ability to evolve a strategy to a set of objectives and a tactical execution plan. Specific Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: ESSENTIAL:Strong interest in digital analytics & experience working for a digital media companyCustomer data based data query and visualization experience (data from web, iOS and Android environments).Hands on experience with SQL queries and popular data warehouses like Google BigQuery, Snowflake and AWSStrong analytical and written communication skills.Experience working with popular query writing tools like Looker, Tableau or Mode Analytics.Strong experience with online user behavior and familiarity with the types of events generally tracked.A desire to prove the correct answer to yourself via multiple angles or queries on the hypothesis. % Travel Required (Approximate): N/A#NMG#

Additionally, they will be the first point of contact for supporting these areas of Finance and assisting with troubleshooting issues that arise. Name: Retail Systems Business Analyst
Description: Prestigious Cultural Institution - Manhattan  Manager, Retail Systems is a new position, reflecting the our Retail Stores' commitment to developing a robust and sustainable approach to its Retail operations. The business has an annual revenue of approximately $60m, multiple revenue channels, a complex systems architecture and approximately 200 staff.  Retail is being re-envisioned and revitalized to provide the best possible experience for audiences / customers in the future.  The new role will play a key part in delivering this success.  Reporting to the Senior Manager of eCommerce & Systems, and working closely with the Institution's IT department and with teams across Retail, the aim of the new role is to leverage current systems solutionsidentify new systems solutions to current business problems andmanage the successful delivery of systems changes and upgrades from the Retail side. The Manager, Retail Systems will also lead in the identification, management and QA of Retail Systems operational issues. Primary Responsibilities and Duties: : Work closely and collaboratively with the Institution's IS&T department on all aspects of Retail Systems technology and be the point-person for IS&T on all Retail Systems projects and issues.  : Oversee the day to day performance of all Stores' systems. Work with IS&T partners to ensure that uptime and performance are optimal, especially during peak trading. : Liaise with systems users, and provide the main point of user contact for all Retail Systems issues. Lead or coordinate user training where appropriate.  : Work with Retail Systems users to trouble shoot issues, and to explore new systems change requests. Centrally manage Applications Service Requests (ASRs) and work with Senior Manager, Ecommerce and Systems to approve such requests and set departmental priorities. Lead the support and troubleshooting efforts from the Retail side, working closely with IS&T.  : Communicate and prioritize Retail Systems fixes and changes with IS&T. Manage the timeframe for the delivery of fixes.  : Investigate identified business problems and perform analysis of potential systems solutions, working closely with the Senior Manager, eCommerce & Systems to present viable options to the business.  : Develop new user requirements and use cases for Retail and communicate these to IS&T stakeholders. Attend sprint planning meetings to represent Retail in development of new functionality by IS&T.  : Incorporate best practices into Retail Systems setup and planning to better address business needs.  : Project manage all Retail Systems initiatives from the Retail side, working closely with IS&T and with third party providers to ensure that projects are delivered on time and to budget.  : Lead cross-departmental teams in the delivery of systems initiatives, setting and managing accountabilities for deliverables.  : Lead the Retail QA process for all projects, upgrades, bug fixes, and new feature development; create new test plans as required, ensure that test scripts are up to date, that all aspects of the changes are tested, that bugs are prioritized and fixed in a timely manner and that work goes live on schedule.  : Coordinates deployment of new solutions, both applications and hardware to the Retail environment.  : Facilitate the maintenance of data standards across all Retail Systems.  : Manage third-party providers as required.  : Learn new systems and tools as required.  : Any other duties and responsibilities as required. Requirements and Qualifications:Experience and Skills: : Five years' plus experience with Retail Systems operations in a mid-sized business environment  : Experience with a variety of different Retail Systems applications, including some of the following: point of sale, order management, product management, inventory management and warehouse management. Experience with a variety of different solutions desirable but not required.  : Detail-oriented, with excellent initiative, execution and follow-through.  : Innate problem-solving and analytical thinking.  : Strong communication and interpersonal skills; good at collaboration.  : Demonstrated leadership, project management skills, and ability to handle multiple tasks and direct cross-functional teams.  : Adept at learning new technology, systems and functionality.  : Understanding of business requirements for profitability.  : Experience with some of the following systems desirable: CW Direct, JDA MMS, Retail Ideas, WinDSS, Manhattan Associates Scale, FDMS and FileMaker. Knowledge and Education: : BA or BS required; MA or MS preferred  : Project management training and certification  : Business analysis training desirable  : Expertise in Microsoft applications, Excel, Outlook and Word required.  Why work with me? Your resume won't get lost in the "black hole" ; you will get feedback and follow through. I will provide a resume review, create relevancy for the position ; you will receive better information on the company culture and inside information on the hiring manager, team, the ideal profile, etc. ; and...the best Interview preparation you will ever experience!  Please check out my profile at http://www.linkedin.com/in/michaelmande/
